author: {'steamid': '76561197969489829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 325, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1629768116}
review:
Styx: Shard of Darkness is a Dirk simulator where you play as a staunchy little green man who eats insect eggs and stabs unsuspecting passerby. 

Set a few years after the events of Master of Shadow, Styx is doing Goblin things in the city who’s name I memorized but then forgot. I can’t really say whats going on because it spoils the other Styx game, but there’s a hunt going for Goblins across the kingdoms led by a group called CARNAGE, but after Styx is recruited by the CARNAGE leader to unravel some mysteries, Styx is caught in another conspiracy that will probably end in a few stabbings and probably war.

Shard of Darkness is a continuation of the last game in terms of gameplay. Sneaking is the way to go, since Styx is small and fragile like little baby. There are plenty of opportunities to just sneak around and feel cool while doing it with enough things in the way to stay behind and enough shadows to lurk in, since on any difficulty but Master you’re basically invisible in the Shadows.
A Master of Shadows if you will.
I accept Paypal. 

You go about from mission to mission in large, open world environments, achieving your objectives and stealing anything of use. The environments are a nice departure from Akenash from MOS, but the big problem is that, much like my trauma, you retread old ground a lot.
There are basically only six or so areas you go through in the game with some departures. And you revisit them from mission to mission. At the very least the environments are big enough and the challenge ramps up enough to keep me interested from start to finish.

Styx is still a nimble little bastard, capable of climbing and skulking around. Sometimes the game just doesn’t agree with you on where you want to go, which was a problem in MOS as well, but it only happened to me a few times throughout the game.
The combat is, uh, I don’t know, I played on Goblin, my choices for getting caught were to run or to die. Just like a real life dangerous encounter.
Please do not tease me, I am very squishy. 

There are several categories you are rated on ranging from how fast you complete your objective to how many people you do or do not kill in your missions. The better you do, the more experience you get to upgrade Styx’s skills.  Useful abilities like seeing footsteps through walls and vomiting out a naked, dumber version of yourself.
I feel like my friend conjured this game into existence or something. Ew. 

This time around you can also play Co-op! Hurray! As long as one of you is alive, you can spawn the other one at the cost of half your current health. It makes the game a bit easier, but you might be reloading anyway if you’re a perfectionist. 

Between SOD and MOS, which one do I like more? MOS, probably. I liked Shard of Darkness well enough, but there are some things that kind of irked me, at least story wise.
The game just kind of ends, there really isn’t a finale after the last boss. I might have to play Of Orcs And Men to get the full story, I’m not entirely sure. 
There’s also a part where a character is [spoiler] killed off. Only for them to just kind of decide against it and bring them back the very next mission, only for them to not matter for the rest of the story even though they were pretty important up until now. [/spoiler] 

Styx is also kind of just a template of his former self. He’s not as charming or funny as he was in the last game, but he’s still kind of a goofy idiot, so I did enjoy playing the game as him. 

The only reason it took me so long to play Shard of Darkness is because I actually forgot it existed. I got it on sale for about six dollars, which is a steal for a game like this. If you like stealth games with a bit of jank, you’ll probably like Shard of Darkness.
A lot of people were hard on it, but Master of Shadow was, like, Surprise of the year 2016, so its understandable. 
I hope I get to see Styx again in the future. I don’t want to say goodbye just yet. I still have Of Orcs And Men to go, which, depending on which way Cyanide Studios in the future, this might be my goodbyes to a character that I’ve kind of grown to love over the years. 

Goodbye Styx, you weird looking toilet creature. 

Styx: The Shard of Darkness gets 8 dead Elves out of 10. 

New Car smell is the scent of dozens of chemicals. Get a good whiff.

review:
Que decir... Este es un juego que puede dejar indiferentes a algunas personas, pero a mi me ha enganchado de principio a fin, la gente dice que tiene muchos bugs, en mi partida no me he encontrado ninguno (que yo recuerde) y la jugabilidad es mucho mejor cuando no matas a nadie, el juego empieza con la esencia del primer juego y la mejoría de los gráficos fueron cuanto menos muy satisfactorias, en cuanto a historia estoy satisfecho con todo menos el final. El sigilo me ha encantado y las mejoras de objetos son malas. Lo más destacable para mi es claramente la banda sonora y los efectos de sonido ya que te ponen tensos o son adecuados a la situación que se está viviendo dentro del juego.
Espero con ansias la secuela aunque dudo su existencia, una tercera parte le vendría bien a el universo Styx y nos dejaría con un mejor sabor de boca que el final de esta entrega.
P.S: Estoy pensando en lo bien que le vendría un spin-off a la saga Styx con la situación que nos deja ver al final del juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154689997', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 1435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1435, 'last_played': 1628933067}
review:
スピンオフ元（Of Orcs and Men）と前作（Master of Shadows）をプレイ済みです。
根性無しなので難易度はイージーです。

前作は日本語対応されていませんでしたが、今作は日本語対応してます。

…が、いい点でもあるんですが、アンバーに関わるメインストーリーが、
前作をプレイしているのが前提になっているので、
日本語対応していない前作をプレイしていないと話がよくわからないってのがよくない。

まあ、日本語化することはできるので、がんばって自前で日本語化して、
前作をプレイしてから今作をプレイしてほしい。

ストーリーに関しては、
上記の問題点以外に、展開が非常に雑。
ゴブリン駆除集団のリーダーが、ゴブリンのStyxに仕事を依頼をしにくるとか理由がよくわからない。

そのリーダーも途中でフェードアウトな感じで登場しなくなる。
最終的に、ラスボスを追っかけると思ったら、追っかけてる途中で中途半端に終わる、など、かなり微妙。

余談ですが、後日譚にあたるOf Orcs and Menで、StyxのパートナーになるArkailも一瞬でてきます。
（時系列は、Master of Shadows→今作→Of Orcs and Men）

システム的には、
敵を倒さないことによるポイント加点があるため、基本的に非殺ですすめることになるのだが、
ポイント消費で取得できるスキルが比較的攻撃寄りなものや、使い所が思いつかないようなものが多い。

武器と服が何種類かあるようだが、デメリットに対してメリットがあまり活かせないような物が多く、
結局、ほぼ初期装備のままクリアした。

ただ、ベースキャンプで、クリアしたステージを気軽に何度もリプレイできたり、
スキルの取得と削除が自由にできるため、
初回はバンバン敵を殲滅するジェノサイドプレイで進み、
リプレイする際に非殺プレイする、といったプレイをするのも手かもしれない。

マップについては、
使いまわしが多いというマイナスな意見もあるが、
それなりの大きいマップだし、シーンが変わると、敵の配置が変わったり、種類が変わっていたりする中、
自分の記憶を頼りに「今回は、こっちよりあっちのルートのほうがよさそうだ」的なことを考えて進むのは良かったかなと感じており、
あまりマイナスな感想は持たなかった。

全体的に”粗い”ってのが正直な感想ですが、
ゲーム自体は結構楽しくプレイできたので、
前作をプレイしたことある人には、ギリギリおすすめという感じです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198393727983', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 4161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3236, 'last_played': 1682884073}
review:
Resumen: Si te gustan los juegos de sigilo puro, ta muy bueno el juego.

Me encantan los juegos de sigilo y como tal está buenísimo. El gameplay y especialmente el tema de los clones está genial. Aunque a veces Styx sí se pone medio cringe, a mi me cayó bien así que me voy a comprar el otro juego y capaz Of Orcs and Men también.
El diseño de los niveles es impresionante, me jugué la campaña dos veces para terminar de ganar todas las insignias u objetivos que me pasé la primera vez y encontré caminos o áreas que no había visto antes y eso que me la pasé explorando y dando vueltas por todos lados la primera vez. El segundo nivel (Korrangar) es el que más me gustó, la primer zona es hermosa. Pero es cierto que la segunda mitad del juego son los mismos mapas que en la anterior, capaz con algunos cambios menores, obvio que es difícil crear y modelar un mapa tan grande y con tantas posibilidades, pero hubiera estado bueno seguir viendo nuevos mapas.

Y ahora lo malo:
Me pasó un par de veces que vi enemigos bugeados (mal posados, atravesando partes del mapa o que se olviden como patrullar), pero meh, fueron pocas y creo que el estudio que hizo el juego no es muy grande.
Lo que si me hizo doler los ojos fueron las animaciones en las cinemáticas, especialmente las vocales, apenas abren la boca y parecen títeres (El único que zafa medianamente es Styx, pero a todos los demás los animaron al mínimo y listo), te termina sacando de la inmersión ya que en esos momentos, por ser cinemática, lo único que te queda es ver la historia (igual se pueden skippear) pero ya después jugando están buenas.

author: {'steamid': '76561199036503764', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 378, 'playtime_forever': 1456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1456, 'last_played': 1628154736}
review:
Эх, как же хороша была [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/242640/Styx_Master_of_Shadows/]первая часть[/url]! Ох, какую же [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/zhareg/recommended/242640/]высокую планку[/url] авторы задали сами себе! И мне кажется, что сиквел в некотором роде справилась почти со всем кроме сюжета.

Твист первой части был очень крут: [spoiler]оказалось, что игрок управлял не самим Стиксом, а его клоном, который был максимально самостоятельным, что в итоге сыграло с оригиналом злую шутку, и он потерял память, а заодно стал прародителем целой расы гоблинов[/spoiler]. Во второй же части таких глобальных вопросов не поднималось, а главный твист легко разгадать, не дойдя даже до середины игры. Преподносят сюжет всё так же увлекательно и ещё более по-гайричевски. Но [b]Styx[/b] уже не тот...

Что ещё поменялось? Добавились новые навыки, ко многим из которых я не прибегал. Крафта стало больше, но им я тоже особо не пользовался. Кооперативный режим? Опять мимо. Разве что больше рас завезли.

Кажется, что ситуацию не спасти, но на самом деле игрушка всё ещё очень качественная. Тем более когда не с чем сравнивать, потому стелс-игры сейчас днём с огнём не сыщешь (слишком хорошо прячутся, гады). Так что я воспринимал это как DLC и наслаждался продолжением, в котором для меня особо ничего нового не появилось. Более того я даже наивно буду ждать следующей части, потому что потенциал у героя и вселенной очень большой. А пока 8 мерзких ракашей из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082560396', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 2348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2348, 'last_played': 1628063832}
review: Несмотря на дешивизну , очень неплохая игра. Очень качественные и крутые модельки доспехов у гномов особенно понравились. Сам Стикс и прорисовка бандитов и стражников с эльфами так же на хорошем юморе.  Про графен смысла говорить нет, он не топовый, но вы этого не заметите, да и смысл выглядывать графен В "АА" игре если не в "А". На удивление неплохо проработанный гг и сюжет вокруг него, для такой нишевой игры. Персонажей немного , но они не деревянные. Лвл дизайн имхо очень крутой, столько ходов и нычек, постарались ребята. Кстати по скринам новой игры про Голлума ощущается тот же стиль локаций. Музыка средняя, но она не надоедливая. В коопе в нее так же интересно играть как и соло, разве что труднее, ведь 1 косяк вашего нетерпеливого товарища может откатить на очень далекий момент. А косяков в игре предостаточно: от упирания башкой в препятствия во время прыжка , с дальнейшей отправкой в пропасть, до лагающих и дергающихся на месте стражников. Самым большим косяком , лично я считаю невозможность уработать стражников в тяжелых доспехах, ведь у оружием нашего гг служит кинжал , КИНЖАЛ!!! Еще есть по мелочи недостатки типо  отсутствия возможности подобрать предмет с пояса жертвы после убийства, иногда неписи не пьют отравленное бухло и не едят фрукты (или что там на столе). Или допустим на тебя идет стражник, ты прячешься за стеной, высвечивается "убить врага" а ничего не происходит, он тебя палит и снова загрузка.  И последнее , что вспомнил , это последний перк - на кой хер он нужен , после выбивания золота на всех картах и получения всех ачивок? Дайте возможность как то пораньше завладеть перком на реген Янтаря. Доработать эти мелочи и игра заиграет новыми красками.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026117293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1701622590}
review:
Как по мне, так это один из самых лучших стелсов, что есть вообще. Дротики, отравления, управление клонами, которые развязывают ловушки, отвлекашки, убийства. Игра не заковывает тебя в кандалы каких-то своих правил. Как хочешь, так и делай. В отличии от первой части, сюжет не сидит на месте и развивается от главе к главе. Вот вам персонаж, а вот он уже мёртв, завозите след-го, при этом мотивация ГГ меняется каждый раз. Что и является толчком всего сюжета: вводят персонажа, появляется цель, персонаж умирает, появляется другой, появляется другая цель. И так до финала. Геймплей приятен, загрузка быстрая, всё оптимизированно, багов вообще не помню. Единственное в финале (в 9-ой главе), они убрали сейвы, что после смерти ты загружался не там, где ожидаешь. О сейвах: когда угодно, кроме моментов когда тебя ищут, либо когда ты на верёвке.  Опять же, правила минимальны.
 О ГГ: он шикарен. По мне это лучше ваших дедпулов. Этот шутит не потому что поехваший баклан, а потому что остроумен в том виде, в каком можно представить именно остроумного персонажа. Напоминает Рафаэля из мульсериала 90-х.  Или Джинн из Алладина только с серьёзным лицом. 

Игру рекомендую не то слово. 

ДАЙТЕ 3-ЬЮ ЧАСТЬ !!!!!!!!

1998 yapımı thiefde bile daha çok npc dialoğu vardı. iki de bir onu bulamıyorum bu imkansız diyip duruyorlar yakalamaya çalışırken. bir de tedirgin olmadan önce konuştukları dialog var hiakye hakkında bilgi veriyor. o konuşma bitince yüzde yüz durdukları yerden kıpırdıyorlar o konuşmayı beklememiz lazım. her oyunda bu şey olmak zorunda sanırım.

çok fazla yükseğe zıplıyor önümdeki yere ileri doğru zıplamam lazım 10 metre tavşan gibi sıçrıyor.

helal olsun kapı kapatma olayı yok

saatte bilmem kaç km hızda havada gidiyoruz etrafta hayvan gibi rüzgar sesi var, yürüyorum diye benim nerde olduğumu anlayabilen askerler var. bunların eğitimini bizimkilere versek dünyayı fethetmiştik.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012374319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1626356763}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness is too frustrating for me to appreciate it. Even more than the first one, this game discourages killing every single living soul in each level, which would have been my main source of satisfaction. As it is, I am left having to find a harmless way to progress through the levels.
Unfortunately, Styx's controls can be quite finicky, and you can end up seeing the loading screen more than you have seen your own mom in your life, because Styx just won't grab that ledge, and often because of some unforeseeable circumstance that gets you spotted repeatedly.
The inventory, crafting and power system have become a burden that I'd rather avoid. The levels are bigger and more intricate, but I find the level design actually poorer. There are more ways to reach your objective, but less room for creativity to overcome obstacles.

I have pretty good memories of the first half of the first game, and hoped for improvements to build on the qualities of that first half, but I am now disappointed.

review:
First one was pretty janky but still a great time, and the second one improves in every way.
More tools, bigger levels and better mobility options, more weapons and outfits all of which have a bonus and a penalty. 
The platforming is still kind screwed up, leading to the vast majority of my deaths being in bottomless pits however it doesn't ruin my experience.
I can't speak for the combat, I've only played on Hard which disables combat completely which is pretty cool and based on the combat in the first game, Hard is probably a mercy more than anything.

review:
Pretty good sequel to Styx MoS.
Decent graphics and gameplay - although at times it feels stupid when two elves fight against each other and they should "something, something... goblin" as if they were fighting with you. It's also pretty stable as I had only one random death.

Story was... alright. It wasn't as interesting as in the prequel, but it was good enough I'd say. The ending is lacking and a bit disappointing.

Missions are also disappointing, the game reuses all the maps, so after midgame, you're basically going to do the same things a before but with more guards. Feels bland and cheap.

Overall 6,5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248822132', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1690057103}
review:
That's quite the interesting title to pick up if it's your first time playing stealth games. (It was a first time of mine for example). 
There is a lot of mechanics and abilities our dear, lovely Goblin can use to go unnoticed by foes. There is not just one path to take to complete the objective or reach the point so you're free to experiment with what works best for you! 
The story is simple enough to understand it without knowing much about the "Of Orcs and Men" universe and the previous game. 
And of course there is Styx, the character we are playing as, I'm sure you'll get to like him and his snarky dialogue for killing him multiple times or failing to be stealthy.
It might not be the youngest and the best title out there but it's definitely worth your time checking it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102935860', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1625081470}
review:
Um bom game a principio, perde bastante o ritmo ao passar do tempo, mas ainda assim é um game que vai divertir e frustrar ao mesmo tempo.

Styx: Master of shadows é sem 'shadow' de dúvidas um dos meus games stealth favoritos da geração passada, tal sentimento não se repetiu com o Styx: Shards of Darkness. 

Os inimigos são ok, mas tem uma coisa que me incomodou... elfos (um dos seres mais frescos que existem) adestrando bezouro embola bosta? PQP! Essa foi de fud*r. No quesito historia - Tô nem ai, mas o Styx MoS tem um plot mais interessante. houve pouca evolução na gameplay, Sinto que os devs poderiam ter trabalhado mais na 
mecanica de combate a distancia, seria interessante.

Diferente do Styx MoS, que tem um level design bem robusto, missões bem mais trabalhadas e cenarios variadissimos, o Styx SoD é literalmente um downgrade. Missões repetitivas, pouca variação de ambientes (embora continuem lindos) e se não fosse o bastante, o level design é morno e as vezes monotono.
Embora no geral eu tenha gostado, tinha momentos que eu dizia pra mim mesmo "PQP... só zera essa desgraç*", resalto que tudo que falei acima é opinião minha e não necessariamente vai refletir sua experiencia com o game.

review:
Ho da poco riscoperto questo titolo, davvero una perla nascosta, il prologo iniziale è un pò dispersivo e per chi non conosce le meccaniche può risultare difficile.

Ma una volta presa confidenza il gioco si lascia giocare e ti coinvolge molto, anche la profonda ironia di Styx con piccole battutine rende il tutto più godibile.

Inoltre lascia al giocatore piena libertà di muoversi nell'ambiente e potendo optare sia per un approccio totalmente stealth che diretto sfruttando anche gli oggetti presenti nell'ambientazione.

Titolo che consiglio assolutamente, molto ben bilanciato e divertente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042623464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2338, 'last_played': 1623825295}
review:
Much like the first game, Styx 2 meets all expectations one should have of a stealth game. A rewarding incentive for playing well and playing to stealth. Although options for any play-style are on the table (as far as the game's mechanics are concerned), playing to stealth will let you appreciate the detail and options given to you. There are many alternate paths and routes to consider, especially in regards to fulfilling mission objectives. While you can assassinate a target by your own hands, you're also given different hands-off methods that you would otherwise miss without exploring. 

Continuing on from the first, the fantasy set pieces are great. While they are a bit derivative of what you'd expect out of a Tolkein inspired novel, they're nonetheless fantastic eye-candy to see. Much of it is completely missable if one stays too on track to the objective without exploration, which only made me feel that it was made out of dedication if anything. 

Styx himself has been made into an annoying mascot character, but for some reason it feels like it's a throwback to early years of platformers where everyone was trying to make their game's main character the snarky, edgy teen-appealing badass that says a curse word. It's as charming as it is annoying. I'm not sure if that's a good or bad thing. 

Add in a few boss fights that are not very inspired, and a really disappointing ending, you've got Styx 2. If you liked the first, you'll enjoy the second no problem, and it's worth the price tag for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980167683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 353, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1623775242}
review:
Продолжение похождений скрытного убивца-гоблина по имени Стикс.
Прошлая игра была средним стелсом с не очень интересными повторяющимися уровнями, неплохими относительно механиками, не цепляющим сюжетом, но с шикарнешей неожиданной концовкой.
Во второй части... всё тоже самое. Только уровни стали намного более эффектными (которые всё так же повторяются, к сожалению), появилась пара интересных персонажей-напарников поневоле (но их "сюжеты" оканчиваются ничем). Шикарной концовки нет. Она тут вообще никакая, как будто ещё что-то должно быть, а нету.
Сам Стикс всё так же неплохо шутит и даже троллит игрока.
Короче, получилось хуже чем первая часть, но есть плюс! Эта игра в два раза короче первой. :))
6,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996087922', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1622535297}
review:
[h1] Стикс говорящий гоблин с говорящем именем... [/h1]
-----------------------------------------------------------
[i]Не самый лучший стелс экшен, но добротно склеенные механики устранения врагов. Хочешь столкни врага в пропасть, или скрытно убей его в тени, или с помощью ловушки, сбрось на него люстру, или своим клоном, все это конечно уже было в прошлых частях, однако не плохо развлекают игрока в течении часа, двух, а потом...потом это превращается в рутину, а когда после середины игры, тебя заставляют проходить предыдущие уровни - это явно вызывает отвращение. Халтура и малый бюджет видимо. Сюжет не цепляет, только под конец тебе немного хочется сопереживать гг. (про переработанный эмберит из гоблинов) Загадки посредственные, хотя и сбивают в ступор при первом прохождении, а оказывается все до безобразия просто. Сайд квесты не интересные. Как по мне игра искусственно под конец растянута, благодаря 4-5 повторяющимися уровнями. Под конец (бой с боссом) могли бы QTE миссию сделать, а так смотреть скудную кат сцену  попросту скучно. Ну и по традиции намек на продолжение. Кооп не щупал, слишком много времени потратил на полное прохождение.[/i]
-----------------------------------------------------------
[h1]Вывод:[/h1] 
[i]Играть можно и довольно весело провести пару часов, а дальше на сколько хватит терпения.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198128906545', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1622037877}
review:
I'd like to start by saying that while I'm not particularly good at stealth games, and therefore don't always enjoy them, Styx managed to work around that by being difficult enough to provide a challenge but not enough to ruin my experience. I'd also like to say that the game is fun, and I'm not recommending this game for storyline (for what I could play) or gameplay. Rather, I'm not recommending it for a massive gamebreaking bug that exists even now, 4 years after this game was published. 
(Minor spoilers)
In the 3rd mission, you need to find a letter in an area of the map. This area is located after listening to a couple conversations. Okay, easy. I did that no problem. The bug was found once I got to the area. The letter itself. Picking it up does not further the quest. In fact, the game will not even REGISTER that you've picked it up. Looking it up online shows that there is no clear solution to this bug, that it has to do with the conversations you need to listen to, and the bug means you need to start the mission all over again (or at the very least the start of the zone). Depending on how good you are, and how much you're looking for the collectible tokens, redoing this zone to that point and hoping that the bug isn't triggered can take varying amounts of time. For me, since again I'm not very good and trying to find tokens, just getting around to the letter takes about 30 minutes. 

This would be enough to annoy me and probably take a break for a while, at least. What has led me to this review occurred when I shared this experience with some friends online. In their attempts to help, it was found that there is a bug similar to this in the NEXT mission, where something unknowing(and apparently easily done) action makes the mission break to the point you cannot complete the game. 

I know patches, fixes, and general coding takes time, money, and energy, but I would have hoped that after 4 years Cyanide Studios would have fixed the bugs that prevent the game from being played. Or Focus Home Interactive would hire somebody else to fix it, or get Cyanide Studios to do it so that they don't have customers complaining about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018765004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1621126171}
review:
I wish there was a third option rather than just yes or no, but here we are. All in all, very good game, really enjoyed it for the most part. Graphics were fantastic, story was engaging, stealth was pretty spot on. If you enjoyed the first one, you'll most likely enjoy this one, too.

Here's why I wouldn't recommend. The character breaks the fourth wall constantly, and it's cute at first, but becomes pretty hamfisted later in the game. I had to turn off death cinematics in order to even want to continue, since the main character calls you an idiot every time you die. And in a game where a lot of the tactics are trial and error, you end up dying a lot and have to listen to styx call you a fucking loser. Like most stealth games, the mobility was hit and miss. I found I would be able to save myself from a fall maybe 70% of the time, and times where i died, went back, then went back through, I wouldn't be able to grab to wall in the same place, die, and have to listen to styx call me a fucking loser. I hated the ending so much, I'm not sure I'll be picking up the third instalment if there is one. But I'm not really one for cliffhangers.

BUT I enjoyed the game overall and don't feel like a wasted my money picking this up. I just would recommend it to a very specific group.

review:
It's better than the original in a lot of ways, but they added 2 boss fights which are absolute garbage. They apparently learned nothing from Deus Ex.

If any Cyanide Studios people read this, ADD AN AUTOSAVE TO THE BEGINNING OF THE LAST LEVEL. 
I HAD TO SIT THROUGH A LOADING SCREEN for the privilege OF SITTING THROUGH ANOTHER LOADING SCREEN I don't know how many times, because of disabling quicksaves and instant death BS. It is a stealth game sin to disable quicksaving when the entire rest of the game lets you. And what's worse, is that it's not just an oversight. They added at least one autosave point near the end of the level. They just refused to put one at the beginning.

I was so close to not recommending because of this **** that they serve you at the end of the game. And it's completely fixable if they wanted to. But here we are, I don't know how many years later, and apparently nobody cared.

author: {'steamid': '76561198403763300', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1675212506}
review:
Вторая часть Stix. Сама по-себе игра великолепна. Ее сюжет интересен и играть можно как за воина, который будет всех убивать, так и в скрытом режиме, так, чтобы тебя никто не заметил и найти все лазейки. При этом во втором мне кажется даже сложнее))
Но вот баги...Игра вылетает порой и у "мастера", а уж у клона вылетает еще чаще. Второй игрок по умолчанию клон и при переходе на новую миссию - ты теряешь ВСЕ свои очки для скиллов, ВСЕ свои вещи и даже сами скилы, если смог прокачать хоть один где-то на самом уровне...в общем клон и только, два игрока равноценно играть не могут, растет только основной игрок - это крайне печально.
Кроме такого облома, вас так же обломят по достижениям - бОльшая часть из них или не засчитывается или засчитывается основному персонажу, а ты бегаешь, делать и в счет не идет - потом переходить все в одного. Но вдвоем интереснее, брали специально играть вдвоем, но эти постоянные баги и отношение ко второму игроку, конечно, раздражают (((
Враги тоже иногда зависают и порой в крайне не удобной позе - считай не подойти. 
Но играть интересно, особенно когда скравтишь себе парочку дротиков и спасаешь напарника от бегущего к нему "красного" врага, красиво получается 😎👌
Возможно игра в одного не будет так вылетать, ну собственно и раздражать такими обломами не будет, хоть вдвоем и интереснее гораздо.

review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness
游戏时间 19.9小时

我是和我朋友一起玩的，也是他推荐这个游戏给我一开始我觉得这个画风不好看但是玩起来发现挺有意思的hhh特别是偷偷摸摸的偷袭别人就很爽！一开始的前面几章关卡都挺简单的但是到了后面就很难！总体来说动画都很好看，用词也很现代什么脏话嘲讽都有！心态不好的人可能就不适合了，动作有些地方会卡但是并不是什么问题，虽然没有中文但是也看得懂，我个人很喜欢这个游戏！我很推荐！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198202956510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1655088813}
review:
I have made reviews for the other Styx games (including of Orcs and Men), and now that I've finished Shards of Darkness, I can say it met and exceeded my expectations.  At least play Master of Shadows before this one so you get an idea of Styx's backstory, it'll make much more sense to you in the long run.

(Very Minor) SPOILER Comment
[spoiler] My only issue was with the ending of the game.  It was so abrupt that I had to check if the ending cutscene glitched out or something.  Maybe they overestimated their budget and left a chunk out, who knows.  Not the end of the world, but it was a bit surprising.[/spoiler] 

All in all the game was great in terms of graphics, story, and gameplay, it's just what I wanted to see after the first Styx game.  Reeeaally hoping Cyanide makes another Styx someday... if they do I'll certainly be looking forward to it :)

In the meantime, time to attempt goblin mode...

author: {'steamid': '76561198025654731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1618194643}
review:
이게임의 빡치는 점
1. 버그가 너무 많다. 특히 적에게 발각된 후 스틱스가 숨어있는 곳 앞을 영원히 떠나지 않는다던지 진행해야 하는 곳을 막은 채 안움직이는 버그 등 AI가 완전히 멈추는 버그로 인해 진행이 원활하지 못하다.
2. 위험 상황에서는 강제 저장이 안된다. 이건 로드 하자 마자 죽을 수도 있으니 막아논 거 같긴 한데 문제는 보스전에서 강제 저장이 안되서 죽으면 전 스테이지로 넘어간다. 즉, 사망>로딩>전스테이지>로딩>진행해야하는 스테이지>로딩>이벤트 스킵>보스전 이런 식으로 아주 쓸데 없이 불편한 시스템.
3. 점수가 너무 짜다. 클리어 후 점수로 기술을 구입할 수 있는데 쓸만한 기술은 뒤쪽에 있고 이전 기술을 (필요 없어도)배워야만 다음 기술을 살 수 있게 되어있다. 기껏 배웠더니 엔딩이 나오더라.
4. 필요 없는 곳과 못가는 곳이 너무 많다. 게임 특성 상 잠입이 90%인데 매달려서 가다 보면 막아둔 곳이 있는데 대체 왜 만든 것인지, 또한 당연히 길이 있어야 진행하기 쉬운 곳인데 매달릴 수도 없고 기어갈 수도 없게 만든 곳이 너무 많아서 일부러 떨어져 뒤지든지 걸려서 뒤지든지 하다보면 빡쳐서 때려칠 때가 많다.
5. 공격을 할 수 없다. 등 뒤에 당당히 칼이 빛나고 있지만 공격용이 아니다. 칼은 오로지 반격용 또는 암살용으로만 쓰이며 적들과 싸우면서 진행하는 것은 원천적으로 불가능하다. 암살 할 때 조차 소리가 나서 근처에 다른 적이 있으면 바로 걸린다. 적에게는 2~3대 맞으면 바로 죽으니 적이 1명 일 때만 싸우거나 피리침 쏘고 나머지를 상대하는 식으로 2명 까지만 싸울 수 있다. 소리를 내고 근처 은신처에 숨어봤자 적들이 검사해서 찾아 내므로 3명 이상 있는 곳은 아예 싸울 생각도 하지 말 것.

이 게임을 추천할지 비추 줄지 많이 고민 했는데 엔딩이 개허접해서 비추 줄 수 밖에 없었다.   10/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198364360563', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1617920003}
review:
What a good time I had playing this game. Styx is a really underrated stealth game with amazing mechanics. The stealth mechanics are spot on, even the slightest bit of noise alerts enemies including running or screaming outside doors/gates. Now with with every pro comes every con and there was quite a few I seen myself throughout the game.

- Enemies bodies are stuck in between platforms whilst they are walking/running
- Enemies walk into each other depending on how you distract/alert them
- Physical combat mechanics felt clunky and outdated
- Story was short and ended in a really abrupt manner

I wasn't particularly a fan of the ending at all since it ended on a cliffhanger and so abruptly. There was so much missing, it needed something big for the game to have ended ended well. Apart from that though, I really enjoyed my first experience with Styx.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052295754', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1617790060}
review:
Pozn.: Dohráno za 12 hodin (s nalezením všech předmětů).

Pokračování výborného a především originálního Styxe jde ve šlépějích svého předchůdce. Hra nabízí v podstatě totožný gameplay s tím, že dvojka poněkud pokulhává v AI a odpustí hráči víc než jednička. Pohyb ve skrytu - což je Styxova primární schopnost - je tak daleko jednodušší a vlastně celá hra se dá v pohodě projet bez spuštění mnoha alarmů. Někdo to může mít hře za zlé, ale mně takto plynulé hraní vlastně vyhovovalo. Ostatně pro milovníky challenge jsou k mání těžší obtížnosti.

Styx nás postupně provede několika zajímavými lokacemi a třeba elfí podzemní chrám, kde musí projít několika zkouškami, je opravdu velmi povedená pasáž. Dvakrát také dojde na souboje s bosy, ale ani  ty nepředstavují větší problém.

Za největší klad druhého dílu bych označil příběh, který je na rozdíl od těžkopádné jedničky příjemně jednoduchý a přímočarý. Trošku mě mrzelo, že zůstane nakonec nedopovězený a závěrečného vyvrcholení se hráč nedočká. Autoři zřejmě zamýšleli příběh dovyprávět v datadisku, případně třetím dílu, ale kvůli slabému prodeji nakonec zůstalo jen u plánů. Je to škoda - já bych si trojku určitě rád zahrál.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116100475', 'num_games_owned': 4782, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1617570371}
review:
The main con of this game to me is the penalty when players kill any enemies at all. If I stealthily assassinate 20 enemies using all the varieties of kill methods that was provided and cleverly designed, it ought to be an achievement, and not something that brings about penalty. So many kinds of fun and interesting traps and kill methods (complemented with body-hiding places) are scattered in all the levels for the players to use, so why should players be penalised for utilising all of the fun arsenal of features?

Players' exploration and utilisation of the game's interesting features ought to be rewarded, not penalised.

That said, Be warned : this is an Stealth Game. You don't like this type of game ? Go away. Important point to note however: the game is only voiced in English (but the texts are translated into several languages). Personally, it does not bother me (I even prefer that), but be warned that if you do not like English voices ... you will have no choice here. That is the price to pay when you can not afford to have voices for each country. So English only, but the voices are good anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169134361', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1617454821}
review:
This game is hard. One thing it won't do is make you feel like a badass. I feel like Styx is a strictly non lethal stealth game where you are made to feel powerless. But it is unique in that sense. You have the option to be lethal and kill people and go on a murderous rampage, but the game only rewards stealth and you sparing people. The "parkour" is really poorly done. You have to be VERY precise where you lead your character, or else he'll miss the rope or a platform and you'll fall to your doom. Boss battles are a bit unbalanced as well - they are relentless and it's near impossible to beat them without taking any damage. Because of the mentioned parkour and boss issues, I found myself quick-saving every 2 or so minutes. I'm not gonna get into the story, because it's just bad.

In conclusion - Styx is a very hard stealth game and it will punish you for taking risks. It has it's own issues and there's a learning curve of how to go around the levels, but overall a quite pleasant stealth game.    6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199024124339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1138, 'last_played': 1709583923}
review: Что ж вторая часть, честно говоря, получилась хуже первой в плане сюжета: он идёт линейно и не строится на важных сюжетных поворотах. Имеется острая нехватка ИНТЕРЕСНЫХ второстепенных персонажей как и в первой части, но там это объяснялось тем, что акцент был больше на противостоянии Стикса и его двойника. Во второй же части нет особых интриг между персонажами, чтобы они занимали всё экранное время, а первую половину игры (хоть и подводящуюю к основным событиям, но состоящуюю просто из похождений Стикса в поисках наживы) мы общаемся с одной лишь Хеледрин. В остальном второстепенные персонажи никакие, включая единственного внятного злодея. Как пример Баримен: в первой части мы наблюдали за тем, как он обозлился на Стикса, как пришёл к власти и как устроил массовые притеснения эльфов. Казалось бы, это точно должно повлиять на события второй части, теперь то на Баримена есть время. НЕТ. Его показали один раз мельком. Единственный интересный персонаж это Джарак, даже Стикс в итоге лишь помогал осуществить его план, просто потому что у него не было другого выхода, чтобы уйти от преследования. Но даже не смотря на то, что главный герой, по сути, Джарак, история про народ эльфов получилась более-менее интересной, учитывая и то, что мы изучили его вдоль и поперёк на протяжении всей игры и наблюдали за его изменениями. Геймплей получился разнообразным и хорошо дополнил основу первой части. ИИ сильно поумнел: противники теперь не теряют вас, стоит забежать за угол, если игрок нашумел на третьем этаже, то стражники с первого не поленятся подняться и проверить, что произошло и тд. Локации выше всяких похвал. Освещение, расцветка, общая стилистика  - всё на высшем уровне. Атмосфера окружающего мира хороша, диалоги левых неписей теперь прописаны заранее и постоянные комментарии Стикса насчёт всего происходящего делают прогулки по уровням куда интереснее чем в первой части, что подкрепляется шикарными катсценами и музыкой. В итоге можно сказать, что хоть сюжет сильно уступает Master of Shadows, однако атмосфера и разнообразный игровой процесс делают своё дело. Игра является скорее дополнением к первой части, и, наверное, по этому её и не объявили Styx Master of Shadows 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283402667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2187, 'last_played': 1617027749}
review:
一代当时是免费领的，玩得时候体验不是太好，所以虽然买了二代，也积了挺久的灰，这次捡起来玩，不得不说“我是sb”（steam梗），真挺香的！
1.关卡金牌的新ui挽救了一代打完关卡才发现阴影金牌没拿到的挫败感【旧时代的眼泪】
2.新开发的技能解锁了更多潜行的姿势，替身遁了解一下| ᴥ•́ )✧
3.任务也不再是单一的潜行偷窃暗杀，跑酷解谜boss战机制比重加大，且贴合剧情并不突兀
4.然后是喷的点，判定机制还是挺迷的，在纯潜入游戏里面算是比较大的败笔了；其次是地图的重复，十个关卡三章是重复地图；最后是美术相关，人物和物品的模组不太吸引人，走的是《暗黑血统》的风格，这个点还是要看人，我个人还是挺吃美术风格的
总结，纯潜入游戏本身偏小众，本作质量和完成度都是上乘的，一代值4分，这代游戏能给7.5分，全成就的友好度加0.5分，CGN 8/10分，以上！

author: {'steamid': '76561198367725631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2274, 'last_played': 1616860864}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness ist im Gegensatz zu seinem mittelmäßigen Vorgänger eine gewaltige Verbesserung. Das gute dabei ist, dass man den ersten Teil nicht zwingend gespielt haben muss um sich im zweiten Teil gut zurechtzufinden, ich würde Styx: Master of Shadows als Prolog betrachten. Unter anderem ist die Steuerung im Nachfolger jetzt auch viel besser.

Die Geschichte ist wahrlich nichts neues, aber dennoch weiß sie zu unterhalten, Hauptgrund hierfür ist natürlich Styx, der scheinbar familiär über viele Generationen mit Deadpool verbunden ist. Sieht man nicht die Ähnlichkeit zwischen den beiden!? Ist ja nicht so dass sich Styx ja auf viele verschiedene Arten bei dem Spieler beschwert wenn man mal wieder das Zeitliche gesegnet hat. Definitiv kann ich sagen dass ich meinen Spaß mit dem Spiel und Styx gehabt hatte, denn das ist denke ich die Hauptsache bei einem Spiel, es soll Spaß machen. :)

Im Gegensatz zum Vorgänger bietet der zweite Teil 9 statt 7 Missionen und fällt somit auch umfangreicher aus, doch auch hier werden leider im späteren Verlauf der Geschichte ein paar Level wiederverwendet. Es ist aber nicht so schlimm wie im Vorgänger, wo ab der Hälfte fast nichts neues kam was die Level anbelangt. 
Ich bin kein großer Freund davon da die Lust auf die Erkundung dadurch Richtung Null geht, da man die Level ja bereits schon kennt. Dennoch sind diese im Nachfolger wirklich sehr schön gestaltet, für das Auge und für das Gameplay. 

Auch das Gameplay fällt weitaus umfangreicher aus, man kann zum einem Gegenstände herstellen die einem sehr behilflich sein können, aber auch kein Muss sind, zum Beispiel Dufttränke, Giftpfeile, Säurefallen etc.. Ebenfalls ist auch der Fähigkeiten-Baum größer was mehr Variationen für den Spielstil fördert, es könnte zwar noch umfangreicher ausfallen, ist aber besser als im Vorgänger. Das was mir sehr gut gefallen hat waren die verschiedenen kosmetischen Erweiterungen für Styx, die gute Vorteile aber auch Nachteile einbringen. 

Meine Empfehlung ist der geschliffene Dolch und die Alchemistenkleidung, jede Tötung ist automatisch heimlich und erfolgt auch schnell, plus dass man überall Gegenstände anfertigen kann und nun nicht mehr auf eine "Werkbank" angewiesen ist. Im Gegensatz kann ich Angriffe nicht parieren wenn ich entdeckt und angegriffen werde. Durch die Kleidung verursacht man mehr Geräusche beim Rennen und Rollen.

Übrigens kann man es auch zu zweit bestreiten.

Auch wenn das Spiel gut ist werde ich es nicht ein zweites mal durchspielen da es keine wirkliche Motivation dazu gibt. Wenn man sehr aufmerksam unterwegs ist, kann man schon im ersten Durchlauf die Missionen "sehr umfangreich" abschließen und hat somit nichts wirklich neues zu entdecken. 

Aber wer sich für ein Stealth-Game im Fantasy-Setting interessiert, der noch dazu einen unterhaltsamen Hauptcharakter beinhaltet, da lohnt es sich alle Mal einen Blick auf Styx: Shards of Darkness zu werfen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983379992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1616515277}
review:
Pros: Great level design, better freedom of movement compared to the prequel, better graphical fidelity and also less bugs altough not entirely bug free. 

Cons: The last mission is horrible, the game ends in a cliffhanger, less levels than the precuel, the AI is not fully there yet (I should have been caught more times that I dare to admit on goblin mode) The level repetition is not as cohesive as the precuel, some gadgets like the lockpicks are kind of useless used maybe one or two during my full playthrough.

Overall thoughts: It´s still a solid stealth game, I only wish that for the thrid game they improve some of the little flaws the game has and also maybe add non lethal methods of taking down enemies? Granted, this game really has put a stop to my compulsive chocking of guards so I guess that is a plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143205230', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1616332379}
review:
没通关，但至少可以玩几个小时，还是给个推荐。

刚开始玩的时候还奇怪，游戏的核心玩法、关卡设计、场景、UI都不错，为啥没啥销量。后来玩了一下才发现，这游戏是个关卡制的游戏，但随关卡解锁的新玩法太少了，基本就是技能树里那些东西，一眼全看完，于是后面的关卡就是在不断重复第一关。想用剧情引导玩家玩下去？但是剧情也一般。加上这是个“硬核潜入”的游戏，难度较高，新鲜期过后，读档几次，基本就劝退了。

但话又说回来，头两个小时体验还是不错的，还是可以入一个试试（只是建议先做好半路弃坑的准备）。

review: Si la fin de The Master of Shadows m'avait déçu, celle-ci est une méga insulte à la communauté des fans. Par ailleurs, e niveau de difficulté, même en mode découverte, est atrocement élevé et l'IA est complètement détraquée. Les gardes arrivent même à repérér Styx invisible, derrière un mur. Au final j'ai du m'équiper d'astuces pour finir ce jeu, pour arriver sur une fin dénuée de sens, comme l'intégralité du script. Ou comment perdre 38h de sa vie. author: {'steamid': '76561198005594049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 3220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2296, 'last_played': 1642626851}
review:
Ранее я писал положительный отзыв на игру. Да в каком то смысле в неё действительно стоит поиграть, но на счет покупки её в стиме стоит серьёзно задуматься, особенно если вы захотите выбить все ачивки.
В игре много багов и недоработок... ....до сих пор! В 6й миссии например иногда не дают взять докозательство смерти одной из двух целей, а то и обеих, по непонятной причине (скорее всего если не взять сразу то потом багует. Недоработки в передвижении реально серьёзно влияют на геймплей, то Стикс не допрыгивет до уступа, до допрыгивает но не хватается и умирает, то бывает по стелсу бутылочку с пояса стыришь и ничего, то тебя сразу палят и убивают.
Есть в игре еще медали за прохождение уровней, как по мне очередной бред, именно то чего не хотелось бы видеть в игре которую я хочу пройти по своему и один раз, а не задрачивать к примеру на каждую миссию на спидран.
1 медаль за время и поверьте, расчет не на обычных игроков был а реально на спидранеров, этож надо додуматься было такие запросы выставить к примеру пройти миссию за 10 минут ( и ты ужет такой думаешь на 9й минуте что затащил, а там еще пол уровня проходить.
2 никого не убивая это как помне уродство играть в игру с возможностью устранять проблемы, а хер тебе играй по стелсу без килов!
3 Коллекционирование - как я ненавижу коллекционирование в играх, будто добавить больше нечего было ищи по всей локации 20 жетонов.
4 Единственная нормальная медаль как по мне за прохождение без поднятия тревоги.
На месте людей которые хотят просто поиграть в эту игру, я бы лучше просто скачал, тем более что она реально хуже первой части, даже меню в игре уе*банское получилось!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982898488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1613222674}
review:
This game is only decent but falls really badly towards the end. Some of the bugs that are happening in the first game still exist in this game. Looks to me like the devs have no intention of fixing these prominent bugs.

[b][u]Pros[/u][/b]:
1. Coop - Not a bad addition. Get to play this game with a friend.

2. Improved graphics.

[b][u]Cons[/u][/b]:
1. Also coop - The entire coop features felt unpolished.

2. Pathfinding bug - Just like the first game, the AI in this game can get stuck at certain area going on a never ending moon walking cycle. This can completely break your stealth because if they get stuck at an area (and they will) that you need to get past [b]AND[/b] you are trying to do a 0 kill run, you're pretty much fcked. This is the main reason why I gave this game a thumbs down.

3. Rope sliding bug - This game has a new feature that allows you to slide down ropes. There is a terrible bug with this. There are so many times when I press and hold the slide button, styx would not slide at all and because of that, I could not reach the end of the rope and got detected.

4. Ledge grabbing bug - Sometimes I fall to my death because somehow, styx would not grab the ledges that can be grabbed at all.

5. Worst ending in a video game - Finally, another reason why this game deserves a thumbs down. The ending in this game is a [b]CLIFFHANGER[/b] ending. Story is decent in the early to mid game and falls really badly towards the end, and to add salt to the wound, the devs gave you a cliffhanger.

If you wanna play this game, get it when its on 75%.
I'm giving this game a 2/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048166950', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1611710183}
review:
[h1] Вырвавшись из канализации. [/h1]

Cyanide Studio прямо постарались. Не особо, конечно, все хорошо получилось, но видно, что проведена огромная работа над ошибками первой части. 

[h1] Отличия от Styx Master of Shadows. [/h1]

Нас выпустили из чертовой канализации, где мы лазили половину первой части. Действие второй части происходит в каком-то странно построенном поселении. Но главное, что это уже не однотипные выбешивающие подземные тоннели. У игры даже появился свой уникальный визуальный стиль.

Локации «сжали». Теперь они не огромное пространство, где вообще ничего не происходит. Тут всё компактно и благодаря этому даже бэктрекинг не особо злит. 

Сценаристы всё таки разобрались чего хотят и прекратили «серьезные разговоры» и т. д. Да, весь сюжет: моноспектакль ругающегося гоблина.  И это прекрасно. 

[h1] Styx: Mankind Divided [/h1]

Styx:Shards of darkness чем-то напоминает Deus Ex Mankind Divided. Это хорошая игра, где сделано много правильных вещей, играть в нее приятно, но …. она банально недоделана. Это не целостное произведение, это как вступление к чему-то, что из-за плохих продаж уже отменили. Но вот можешь посмотреть на начало истории, которую тебе рассказывать дальше не будут. И как к этому относиться? 

Причем не сказать, что Styx крупнобюджетная игра. Да, переезд на новую версию Unreal пошел игре явно на пользу, она очень приятно выглядит, но и только. Это уже не супер бюджетная, как оригинал, но все еще бюджетненькая игра. И она не принесла прибыли, хотя тут больше заслуга издателя. На что делать упор при рекламе stealth action про гоблина? Правильно, на кооператив. Который еще и откровенно паршивый. 

Вот и получается довольно странный итог. Мне действительно было интересно проходить игру. Более того, она даже мне понравилась. Но вот как только я уже вошел во вкус, то сразу же последовало «продолжение следует»... И Styx из игры, про которую хочется рассказать, превращяется в стандартную игру на пару вечеров любителям жанра. 

Хотя были предпосылки к чему-то гораздо лучшему...

review: This is one of the best stealth games I played in an extremely long time. The first thing that hits hard is your character being something out of anything any other game tried and there would not be anything generic about Styx if they had not changed his personality for this sequel. That is the only downside, in my opinion. In the first game he was more collected, even though still rude, but here they went with a more edgy, cool and modern take which falls into being extremely forced most of the time in a story that also is also a strong point to the game. That is a minor detail because for gameplay everything that should work, for stealth, do and you can have so many approaches to each mission that it makes the replayability crazy. Would highly recommend this game to anyone who like genre!

Environments and detail are amazing. Game play is fun. Beat in 14 hours on Goblin difficulty. Has the same issues as Master of Shadows with easier  difficulties really being a delay in difficulty progression. 4th wall breaks were annoying and detracted from the overall experience as did the deviation from previous iteration of Styx personality and expression.

My only complaint is the lack of non-lethal takedowns.  This does mean make the missions more difficult to get "gold" all four areas at the same time: Speed, Loot, Deaths, Non-detection.  When I get "gold" on the Loot, Death, and Non-Detection, I always go over the time limit for even "bronze".

review:
Shards Of Darkness is a very good game, like its predecessor Master Of Shadows. But it's not a great game due to a couple of irritating boss fights, the latter forcing you to do scene reloading if you fail the first part. Strange that the elves are dumber this time around but dwarfs have taken on some of their former abilities.
The good parts? No relics to search for but tokens can be collected and skills built up such as cloning, stealth, etc. And i like the City Of Thieves as a level location, and there are some nice secret passages and hidey- holes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021396018', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 1683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1579, 'last_played': 1613403840}
review:
[h1]Un bac à sable d'infiltration réussi aux influences pertinentes[/h1]
[i]Après Styx : Master of Shadows, les français de Cyanide nous propose une suite peaufinant le jeu d'origine avec un moteur carburant à l'Unreal 4.[/i]

✅  L'influence de [b]Thief[/b] pour les accents anglais et l'univers médiéval (avec un background solide provenant de "Of Orcs and Men")

✅ Mais aussi [b]Assassin's Creed[/b] pour la grimpette en level design vertical (sauf qu'ici c'est très fluide et agréable)

✅ Quelques objectifs annexes qui vous inviteront à ne pas foncer tête baissée uniquement dans l'intrigue principale

⚠️ [b]Peu de zones différentes[/b] malgré leur taille impressionnante. Beaucoup de recyclage car le fil de l'aventure nous amènera à revisiter d'anciennes zones. [b]On s'y laisse conduire avec plaisir car le gameplay est efficace.[/b]

⚠️ Fin abrupte, on réalise avoir fini le jeu quand le générique de fin démarre. La révélation concernant l'origine de l'ambre est assez prévisible. Le scénario est dans l'ensemble trop léger et traîne en longueur. Beaucoup de répliques cyniques de Styx sont bien écrites.

[b]Même si on sent un manque de consistance dans le scénario et le contenu global, on constate que cela a servi à maximiser la qualité des autres points de ce jeu. Je n'ai pas vu défiler mes 26 heures de jeu et l'envie de boucler quelques objectifs secondaires m'incite à relancer Shards of Darkness.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198019942613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1611700009}
review:
I will compare Styx shards of darkness (or Styx 2) only to its predicessor Styx: master of shadows (styx 1) here. Both of these games are spirital successors of the grandfather of stealth games, Thief and are in my opinion the epidome of modern stealth games and should be played by every fan of the genre. Styx 2 does a few things better than Styx 1, however it also does a lot of things worse, so if you are not sure about buying styx 2, you should definitly wait for a sale.

CONS:
If you played the first styx game and you found the story to be interesting and the character engaging, then Styx 2 will probably disappoint you a lot. Not only is there nothing of interest the characters are way worse, with styx himself being basically a caricature of his former self, with constantly trying to be funny and 4th-wall breaking, to a point of annoyance. The overall variety of map design was also lacking in my opinion. Stxy 1 had this nice contrast of darker, more dirty places, with nice clean palaces. Styx 2 however seem to mostly consists of dirty looking towns and castles with only 1 exception (level 1, zone 2). Also the overall length of the game was reduced, with most levels only conisting of 2 zones (instead of styx 1s 4) and the level repitition is felt a little more in this game. In Styx 1 the level repedition mostly made logical sense from following the story (for example: you break into a prison and then you have to leave the same way… so levels were played the opposite way with different enemies). In Styx 2 the level repidition mostly comes out of nowhere and is not as niceley done as in styx 1. They also added bossfights in styx 2, which feel fresh and unique and add to the variety of gameplay, but since the game is otherwise not as diverse in levels I would have wished for more levels instead. Styx 2 also included a crafting mechanic which doesnt add a lot to the game. Because of this crafting mechanic they also had to add a bunch of items to pick up in each level which makes it a little harder to identify the collectable medallions. Also Styx 2 doesnt include the nicely drawn concept art designs for some cutscenes, maps and menu screans, which i found to be a pity.

PROS:
Styx 2 fixed some annoying mechanics in Styx 1 like the autoclimb of edges (as long as you didnt hold the jump key), which i found to be a utterly pointless annoyance. The level design allows for the worlds to be traversed in way more ways than in Styx 1 which also increases the replayablilty. This however was reduced through the fact that you have to replay nearly each level anyways before finishing the game. Styx 2 seem to focus way more on players choice, while in Styx 1 some abilities had to be used in order to procress (like invisibility or cloning) I dont remember a single instance where I had to use it in Styx 2. The challenges set in each level, such as collecting all medallions or completing the game in a certain time are better presented in Styx 2. I didnt even notice that such a thing was present in the first game until I went back and checked. They also added a skill which lets you see medallions from far away, which I think is necessary because finding all 10 medallions in a zone is more frustrating than anything else and I think the challenge should rather be to get those medalions without being seen than to find them. The enemy AI is also a lot better. Just simply hiding in a closet or a pot does not simply save you when the enemy has noticed a sound (orange alarm), while in Styx 1 they had to have already noticed you in order to search for you.


Neutral:
Styx 2 is arguable a lot easier than Styx 1 with the enemies detecting you a lot less, fewer enemies and more possibilies to traverse the worlds and to hide (both of these I compared the highest difficulty). This can be seen as better or worse. For one it reduces the challenge, but I found it nice to play a stealth game were I really felt advantaged over my oponents. It also opens up the possibility to artificually increase the difficulty by playing barehanded or completing a mission without ever being detected(and never reloading), which is way too much of an annoyance in Styx 1 (at least in goblin difficulty).

So overall, Styx 2 is a more refined stealth game as Styx 1 with some of the annoying things removed and better level design. However the story and level variety was reduced and some questionable new things were added, such as a crafting mechanic and boss fights. I would say that Styx 2 is a worse game than Styx 1, but it is still a very fine stealth game and I can only recommend it to any stealth fan. But maybe wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076164933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1612687548}
review:
Проходил в коопе с другом и первая треть игры понравилась, довольно весело. 
Ты проходишь по стелсу или носишься по всему уровню с ножом, вас бывает отбрасывает на чекпоинт в начало уровня, но пока в этом не чувствуется проблемы. 
Сейвиться тут нельзя, с чекпоинтами вообще какая-то странная ситуация, они то за каждым углом, то их тупо нет почти, либо они не срабатывают.

-А потом тебе говорят круто, тебе нравится, а давай теперь ты пройдёшь этот же уровень с не убиваемыми врагами.
-Всё ещё хорошо? А давай теперь, ты пройдёшь предыдущий уровень, только теперь нельзя попадаться на глаза никому. 
-А, а, а как тебе, прошёл? А пиздуй ка ты зелёный петушок теперь обратно в начало уровня, тем же путём, которым пришёл.
-Всё ещё играешь? Ну вот тебе тогда [b]ТОТ ЖЕ САМЫЙ[/b] уровень в третий раз, только теперь найди три сраных бомбы по следам. 
Это настоящее душнилово, они даже скайбокс на этих локациях не поменяли.
Сюжет ну он типо есть, противники просто тупые болванчики, которыe тупо ходят туда сюда. 
Боссы вообще слив и деградация в духе перекатывайся по таймингам от укрытия к укрытию. 

В итоге: Я рад, что прошёл это говнище и теперь могу спокойно его удалить и поставить палец вниз.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041588744', 'num_games_owned': 1311, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1672, 'last_played': 1612908020}
review:
The game is vast improvement over the the first iteration Styx: Master of Shadows (SMS).

It's biggest ones being Styx's move set like, having a dedicated "grab ledge" button, allowing faster ducking over the nearest one to avoid enemy sight. Styx also no longer auto-climbs when jumping to one leaving you completely exposed.
Still haven't got a roll+ grab ledge combo.

Medals now appear from the get-go in the options menu, allowing you clear knowledge of if you triggered an alert, or killed someone by accident. And now they're all tiered by gold ,silver and bronze, so even if you don't get perfect runs, you might get a bit of extra experience none the less.
   
Some levels have been reused, much like the old game. But this time it seems its mostly for story purposes, unlike the first where it was clear attempt at padding the game.

Played in Goblin mode, since it seems the way the devs would like you to play. So i have no idea if the parrying was improved since this time I NEVER ONCE NEEDED TO USE IT (unlike the last boss fight in SMS).

Most of the levels are quite open and don't seem to restrict any play style, unless there's a boss fight. Some are more stunning than others. BUT THE BEST PART is that few things you see in the game are just for decoration, they're actually climbable.

It was absolutely satisfying to jump from a ledge to a giant gate, thinking i'd just phase through and die since it had barely any textures, and to not only land on it, but use it to jump on and airship passing through it at the time.

If i had to say something negative, my biggest gripe would be the AI, its also improved a lot, but the problems of old still appear from time to time. Some enemies glitching in place and vibrating, some getting stuck with others and blocking doorways, etc. Its less noticeable but still present (good cheese for no kill runs though).

author: {'steamid': '76561198292640645', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1710, 'last_played': 1624562730}
review:
Tochas são sagradas, não as apague...
 Um presente quase perfeito para os amantes do stealth. Aqui você será forçado a usar todas as mecânicas disponíveis no jogo para avançar, isso é uma das melhores coisas nesse jogo, as várias maneiras de eliminar os inimigos ou simplesmente os distrair são muito grandes e vão depender de sua criatividade.
 Esse jogo não se limita apenas ao stealth padrão, ele traz levels realmente diferenciados uns dos outros e formas diferentes de avançar com escolhas em algumas missões. Existem até mesmo bosses para você enfrentar. 
 Não possui uma história grande ou forte, mas possui uma caracterização imensa no personagem do Styx que irá até mesmo te zoar durante o jogo e te acompanhar com um humor negro simplesmente cativante. Também possui inúmeras referências espalhadas em diálogos a outros jogos, filmes e aos dois jogos que fazem parte do universo do Styx. 
Espero muito pela sequência, dá muito para ver que o limite aqui é budget, pois o amor dado ao jogo é muito evidente.

review:
This game is NO COOP. It is a single player game that got a coop mode patched into with brute force.
Expected the typical bugs: Enemies that make a finishing move on player 1 are invicible taking 2-3 seconds for the animation, then idle a second or 2 and then directly go over into killing player 2, being invicible all the time.

So truly: This is NOT a coop game.
And the game mechanics are broken regarding all combat, so avoiding it is by far the easiest solution (even though it is supposedly more difficult according to the game experience reward. But actually, it's just plain boring. Standing, waiting, moving, repeat.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197990356425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 1608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1608, 'last_played': 1611963304}
review:
A step forward and a couple of steps tip-toed back.

Styx is once more after revenge, only this time it’s petty and poorly paced, and ends with an anticlimactic cliffhanger. The writing is a true downgrade, for though it builds upon the unique ending of the prequel and puts up a stellar backdrop, there’s no significant personal stake or growth. It managed to get a few chuckles out of me, either by witty dialogue or visual gags. The 4th wall breaking monologues are overused.

In contrast, there’s been an overall improvement to the green mischief’s limber limbs, much thanks to the ability to pass around corners and a button dedicated to latching onto ledges. No more slowly inching over the edge in hopes the goblin grabs onto it. Ropes are now a thing, allowing the player to skim over vast chasms or swing forth like a sickly midget Tarzan.

Crafting is a flawed but befitting addition for our persecuted protagonist. But a lot of Styx’s tools are focused on killing, or cleaning up thereafter, acts that the game discourages by penalizing the players score, so those tools are off the table. Thus you are swamped with material wealth, except Raw Amber, the one resource you’ll actively seek like a junkie, to fuel your magical goblin powers.

Level design is similar to the first game, but with more area to cover and sometimes without the excuses that made the locales work within its narrative. People live in ramshackle towns a hundred feet up in the air upon a foundation of rotten wood, for no rhyme or reason other than it conveniently serves as a boxed in playground. And it works, levels offer many paths, verticality and deadly gauntlets. Just don’t expect to be a gob-trotting sightseer.

It’s good stealth with some caveats. Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111648545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2045, 'last_played': 1611872814}
review:
A dispetto del suo predecessore, Styx Shard of Darkness non ce la fa. 
Non ce la fa perché non migliora nulla del primo Styx e, laddove può, piuttosto peggiora quanto invece andava migliorato.

Se Master of Shadows non brillava certo per intelligenza artificiale dei nemici, qui manco ti vedono se gli passi affianco, salvo poi avere dei colpi di vista d'aquila a chilometri di distanza che neanche ti immagineresti.

La trama non tiene minimamente conto delle vicende accadute prima ed è quanto di più forzatamente insulso si potesse ambire a costruire: nulla ha senso e manco finisce.
E purtroppo non aiutano neanche le battutine di Styx a risollevare una narrazione sterile.

L'ambientazione manca di mordente e da metà gioco si ripete insistentemente fino ad arrivare a noia.

Insomma, se il primo portava meccaniche stealth tutto sommato oneste, una trama che stava in piedi, un personaggio dissacrante e degli scenari ampi e ben progettati, questo seguito rappresenta un "more of the same" che sbaglia in tutto quello che poteva essere migliorato del primo.

6,5 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197961343276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1927, 'last_played': 1611594858}
review:
It's an "ok" game. Unfortunately the Developers recycled half of the maps in the game. You start playing and the first 50% of the game is good. Then, as you progrress to the second half of the game, you notice that every single map is the same as you played in the first half. They just positioned the enemies at different spots. Seems like lazyness to me. This goes on until you reach the endboss, who is insanely dfficult. You spend an entire game playing stealth and then when you reach the boss, you're suppose to play arcade. As I said earlier: lazyness on the developers part. Too bad, this game has great potential. 

All in all: not as good as the first Styckx game, but ok for the fans of the genre.

스틱스의 다음 이야기를  그려내어 주길 바랄 뿐이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993008418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1611246177}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness is a vastly improved sequel. Bigger, bolder and with more polish, Cyanide deftly hones in on nearly every mistake they made with Master of Shadows -- which is not to say that Shards of Darkness doesn't make any new missteps, just that none of them are as bad as Master of Shadow's.

Levels finally reflect their core game design -- where levels in Master of Shadows gave the impression they were open but were generally linear and only had a few paths, levels in Shards of Darkness are instead tightly packed and dense with routes and entry points. This also helps mitigate the fact that, once again, Shards of Darkness only has half a game's worth of levels and recycles them for its second half.

The binary light/darkness model is gone, replaced with a fully granular one that introduces the level of fuzziness that the first game was lacking, the lack of which would often get you accidentally spotted in unpredictable ways. Combined with the new puzzle-box level design and the freedom to move away during combat instead of being locked in place, Shards of Darkness is more fair, forgiving, and mechanically deep.

Climbing -- while still not perfect -- is far more consistent. You can now choose to drop and hang off ledges with a button, rather than Styx automatically gravitating towards them when you do not want him to. Wall fixtures work identically as before, but are better placed. The addition of cracks and grooves in walls gives Styx new options for moving around and helps climbing feel more natural. Hanging ropes for swinging and ziplines connecting gaps provide new avenues for bypassing enemy patrol routes below.

The addition of crafting tacks on busywork and tedious extra steps to what was simple and elegant in the first game -- finds items and use them. Though it grants freedom to spend the game's crafting resources on the tools you want to use, in practice it's hard not to be stocked up on tools and hording resources in a way that Master of Shadows smartly discouraged.

Invisibility now directly drains your amber meter while in use instead of using its own timer, massively crippling its usage but coinciding with the fact that you basically never need it anymore. The new level design also makes clones considerably less useful. Amber vision is now mapped to a new button and does not cost amber to activate, though now it doesn't help you see in the dark and the maps are consistently darker than Styx 1's, often to the point where it is impossible to see.

The game's weakest link, counter to its predecessor, is its meandering story and inconsistent tone. Styx now breaks the fourth wall and bombards the player with trite pop culture references as part of a shift away from the first game's somber dark fantasy towards something more action-packed and globe-trotting. The story throws in some loose excuses to recycle some earlier levels half-way through, bringing the pacing to a grinding halt. It lacks a strong overarching theme, and ends on an "amber = bad" note that attempts to weakly book-end the first game.

Given Shards of Darkness's lower sales numbers, it's unlikely it will receive a much needed sequel to tie up its numerous loose ends. Which is a shame, because Cyanide was on to something here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039045490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1610826094}
review:
Достойное продолжение отличной первой части.
Геймплей значительно расширен и отлажен. Стелс стал менее агрессивным, теперь можно без труда (ну, почти) пройти всю игру не убив своими руками ни одного НПС. Кроме положенных по сюжету. ИИ отладили - теперь стражники куда реже сбиваются с маршрута и застывают не в том месте. Но зато они стали куда глазастее и параноидальнее.
Сюжет... ну, до уровня первой части не дотянули, но в целом - неплохо. Разве что финал как-то уж внезапно  настал, да и остальное... Антагониста (Джарака) могли бы выписать рельефнее, а то реально не ясно с чего его Стикс так ненавидит; капитана МЯСОРУБКИ посреди повествования прост потеряли, хотя с неё всё началось; с верховную жрицу тёмных эльфов вообще толком не использовали. Но в целом, как уже сказал, неплохо.
Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992229015', 'num_games_owned': 1184, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1610664102}
review:
I've delayed playing this game for so long, because the predecessor "Master of Shadows" wasn't really to my liking too much. At least not in the end. It was too samey, too unforgiving at times and the clones were annoying, however it had a really good story.

To my surprise Shards of Darkness just "flows" so much better and has more varied locations as well as more freedom of movement, it feels like. No longer are you trapped in endless mazes trying to find "the" way, but you can pretty much go and approach most missions however you want.

The new skill trees were a bit disappoint for me personally, since they didn't offer me more options to actually improve stealth (the duration is the biggest problem...in the last game standing still you were actually not consuming amber when skilled correctly as far as I know). Here, even with skills, your amber gauge is drained almost instantly.

However, the skill trees can all be unlocked with 1 playthrough really, if you really want to. Stealth and Combat were the most important to me, then I went into alchemy and perception to craft more useful stuff and keep better track of enemies. I barely used the clones at all, only to trigger traps really, so I didn't invest into that skill tree until the end, but it can also be powerful. I did not really understand the stealth benefits for clones though...

Actual fighting is not advised and absolutely avoidable, but you can parry all "normal" enemies. Armored enemies need to be dispatched...differently. Once I got more into stealth which muffled my kills, I used the dagger that instantly liquefies bodies, but causes a louder death...you can breaze through most enemies. 

Quick save often, explore, have fun. My biggest gripe with the game are the bad ledge and jumping controls. I say "bad" in that you can easily mess up a jump or fall of a ledge without holding on, which is annoying.

The final mission also started extremely irritatingly...other than that it was a fun 11 hours! Story is not as good as in the first game though. In my opinion at least. It's just more...standard, and less personal. And also ends on a damn cliff hanger...

To sum it up: I think this series, and especially this game, is underrated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211708439', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1703547986}
review:
el juego está muy bien, teniendo en cuenta el tamaño del estudio que lo ha hecho.
gráficamente no destaca mucho, los diseños de los enemigos y personajes son bastante genéricos, pero el de styx está muy bien
de hecho, styx está bastante bien como personaje, tiene un carisma genial y los comentarios que suelta a cada rato son muy entretenidos.
la jugabilidad es de los puntos mas fuertes del juego, dándote una libertad para afrontar las situaciones con una cantidad decente de herramientas y sistemas, los mapas (aunque solo he jugado las primeras tres misiones) son amplios y llenos de diferentes rutas, estas características le dan un buen valor a la rejugabilidad del titulo, en especial por las diferentes insignias que te dan al terminar un nivel de cierta forma.
los sistemas de sigilo están bastante pulidos y funcionan muy bien, esto se complementa con el buen control del personaje, mi única queja con dicho movimiento es a la hora de utilizar cuerdas para balancearse.
la música no destaca mucho y la historia cumple con llamar la atención, pues lo principal del juego son las mecánicas de sigilo que tiene, (como los clones y los escondrijos) las cuales funcionan muy bien.
el modo coop está un poco roto debido a que reapareces con facilidad, aunque es muy divertido jugar con amigos
la ia de los enemigos es un tanto básica y a veces impredecible.
en general es una buena experiencia como juego de sigilo al darte distintas soluciones y herramientas para navegar por los entornos y enfrentarte a los problemas que se te presentan c:

author: {'steamid': '76561198195455357', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1062, 'last_played': 1610203795}
review:
《Styx: Shards of Darkness》作为Styx系列的续作，延续了初代哥布林潜行的玩法，同时在初代的基础上做了很多改进。游戏特点其实就在你是一个哥布林，没错你就是一个哥布林，非常脆弱的哥布林，这就注定了玩法上你没法和别人硬打，只能潜入和利用各种道具。
故事主要讲述了前作结束后哥布林冥河继续自己的盗贼生涯，在人类、精灵和矮人的夹缝中生存。
玩法上肯定是纯潜入类的玩法，结合魔法和分身，这点上有点类似《羞辱》，不过哥布林明显脆弱的很，这代还加入了几个谜题和BOSS战，设计上很有创意。

author: {'steamid': '76561198020231187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1610125825}
review:
Bel gioco, appassionante e coinvolgente. Specie dato che il protagonista abbatte la 4a dimensione e proprio come Dead Pool parla direttamente con il player, spesso inveendo contro di lui quando lo fa morire.
Meccanica simile a quella di Assassin's Creed per quanto riguarda i movimenti e le scalate.
Troppo difficili i 2 boss, assolutamente di livello nettamente superiore a qualsiasi livello decidiate di giocare.
Per questi 2 problemi armatevi di sacrosanta pazienza e non lesinate sulle abilità speciali di Styx, senza non potrete finire il gioco.

游戏是个好游戏，符合心中真正的潜行，盗贼嘛就是要悄无声息，而不是无脑的突突突突突。但是，没有汉化真的对中国玩家太不友好了，玩了几个小时就不想玩了，因为本着边欣赏剧情+地精吐槽边玩真的感觉很有意思，入坑是因为玩过盗版汉化的，买正版是纯粹了为了弥补以前没通完的遗憾。试想下点个天赋还要上网查下什么意思瞬间就不想玩了。

We need Chinese!
