review:
If your stealth pickle must be tickled, this is the game.

I finished the game with a friend and I must say, this is an amazing stealth coop experience that shouldn't work in theory but it amazingly does. Styx Shards of Darkness is a godsend if you have a trustworthy mortal to puke you out when needed.

Buy it with a friend and enjoy the misadventures of your favourite [b]drug-addicted[/b] witty goblin together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139182685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1609693005}
review:
Si te gustan los juegos de [b]sigilo[/b], en un [b]mundo semi-abierto[/b] este juego te va a gustar, pero el factor que para mí ha hecho que me lo pase increíblemente bien es que tiene [b]cooperativo[/b].

[h1] HISTORIA [/h1]
Al principio no apostaba nada por la historia de este juego, porque la razón por la que me lo compré fue porque estaba a 5€ y tenía cooperativo, pero resulta que la historia esta bastante bien, me ha parecido interesante la verdad. Lo que pasa es que ha ayudado enormemente el personaje que tiene esta saga [b]Styx[/b], es muy carismático y eso ha hecho que nos riamos con sus comentarios jocosos en la cámara de muerte, la actuación en las cinemáticas, los comentarios que hace mientras juegas e incluso te habla en ocasiones mientras estas jugando diciéndote cosas como: “Tenemos que hacer otra vez una misión sin que nos detecten, ¿te has enterado?” A mi me ha encantado este personaje y la interacción que tiene con nosotros.

[h1] JUGABILIDAD [/h1]
La jugabilidad esta bien, sin más creo que es un buen juego de sigilo, hemos tenido alguna experiencia rara de que nos detecten sin sentido alguno, pero tampoco nos ha sacado de la experiencia mucho. Hemos jugado en [b]Difícil[/b] porque me gusta que los juegos me hagan mejorar y siempre suelo jugarlos en la máxima dificultad o sino en una dificultad anterior, esto ha provocado que al principio nos costase un poco más las pantallas, pero conforme te gastas puntos en mejorar a [b]Styx[/b] te haces mejor y te va costando cada vez menos.

[h1] OPTIMIZACIÓN [/h1]
Este juego al no ser muy demandante creo que con un ordenador con componentes anteriores a los míos no tendría muchos problemas de moverlo en la máxima calidad. 

[b]Especificaciones PC:[/b] i7-6700 3.4 GHz, 16 GB de RAM, Nvidia GTX 2070, M.2
[u]Resolución[/u]: 2560x1440p 
[u]Calidad[/u]: Calidad Máxima 
[u]Fotogramas por segundo (fps)[/u]: Por encima de 60 fps

[h1] CONCLUSIÓN [/h1]
Si tienes a alguien como mi amigo [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/rieklivst] Rieklivst [/url] que le guste el sigilo y la infiltración o que le guste la ambientación medieval un poco gótica jugadlo, porque lo vais a disfrutar de verdad y lo más importante conoceréis a Styx uno de los personajes más carismáticos del mundo de los videojuegos.

review:
For those who are having trouble with the "fighting system" in this game, here's a few tips on how to get better at killing all the guards after they notice you.

1. Go to your Steam library.
2. Find "Styx: Shards of Darkness" 
3. Right-click -> Manage... -> Uninstall
4. Now left-click on the game in your library and go to the "Support" tab
5. Under "What problem are you having with this product?" select "I want to permanently remove this game from my account".
6. Select "Gameplay or technical issue". 
7. Select "I'm having another problem".
8. Select "I'd like to request a refund". 
9. Under "Tell us why" write "I suck so much at stealth games and I want to play a game that is easier on my delicate noob brain". 
10. Go to the search bar in the steam store.
11. Type "Assassin's Creed". 
12. Have fun with the cinematic trailing mission series and never play stealth games in your life ever again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052727017', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1636207569}
review:
После разрушения башни Акенаша, Стикс перекочевал в городок Тобен, где тихо мирно воровал и убивал.
Там его и нашла предводительница отряда охотников за гоблинами Хелледрин...

Сюжет продолжает развиваться вокруг темы янтаря и эльфов. Помимо основных целей, игра может подкинуть дополнительные задания, некоторые из которых можно выполнить разными способами. За каждое выполненное побочное задание в конце миссии начисляют очки навыков, которые можно потратить на изучение умений.

В графическом плане игра не сделала серьёзного шага вперёд с предыдущей части. Тем не менее изображение выглядит вполне приемлемым.

Что у разработчиков получается здорово, так это проработка локаций - многоуровневые, запутанные, интересные. К сожалению, как и в Master of Shadows, вторую половину сюжета вы будете перемещаться по уже посещённым местам, с небольшими отличиями: место входа с другой стороны, немного другая дислокация противников и предметов.
 
Приятно выглядит меню системы навыков. Переработали дизайн и частично изменили умения - что-то убрали из предыдущей части, другое добавили. 

Игра делает в основном упор на скрытность. Стикс никогда не был бойцом. Если вас заметили, то в открытом противостоянии вам крышка. Способы устранения противников присутствуют самые разнообразные: от кинжала в спину и люстры по башке, до отравленной еды и сброс в пропасть пинком ноги.

Музыкальный фон не особо заметен. Иногда он есть, иногда его нет.

Окончание игры оставляет пару не закрытых вопросов по персонажам. Есть вероятность продолжения приключений зелёного гоба.

П.С. Видеоролики с комментариями Стикса после его смерти - это отдельный шедевр :)

В общем и целом получилась не плохая стелс-игра.

8 из 10.

review:
Este juego es bastante entretenido, lo recomiendo el cooperativo con un amigo loco. No es un juego de batalla, es de infiltración, el personaje principal encarna la expresión puñalá trapera y si te ven ya puedes correr porque  hasta las ratas pueden contigo. 100% disfrutable si te gusta el genero, es muy sarcástico y con bastante comentarios jocosos que suelen romper la cuarta pared. 
Sobretodo fijaos en la mecánica de balancearse en cuerdas, si esa velocidad de balanceo fuera real es probable que pudieras poner al personaje en órbita.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220189021', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1609370032}
review:
I haven't finished the game yet but I can say it's pretty bad. 
Pros:
- Level design is nice, offers a lot of possibility to go places, not do things
- Music is pretty good
-  The game looks good too
- The skills are interesting 

Negative aspects:
- It's frustating af
- Controls are terrible
- There are three areas, and you trough them 3 times each, and it's not like a different part of the same city, it's the same exact area as one of the previous mission
- Voice actors are generally not good, some could be better
- Styx itself is annoying af, keeps talking to you, and when you die (you die a lot, with those messy controls), he says something to you, some of these lines are actually funny, but most of them are awkward
- The game doesn't really tell you about your abilities, like the one about being invisible, I just discovered it, after 10 hours of playtime
- This one is more personal, but I don't really like the medals and how they affect the skills that you can have, there are three, one based on the time it takes you to complete a mission, the other one is for the number of alerts triggered and the last one is for the number of people you killed. The last two are okay, it makes sense to have them in a stealth game, but for the time taken for a mission, I just find it ridiculous to put it in a game like this, it makes you want to rush things, at least for me, and that's not ideal for this game. 
- Lastly, there is nothing to explore in the maps, there is no lore to find, there is collectibles, which are used to craft things, that's it. Would've been more fun if you had pieces of lore like in Dishonored. 

So far, it's a 6/10, buy it on sale if you have nothing else to play.

EDIT: I finished the game, it's now a 5/10 for the non-existing ending, the games ends on a cliffhanger, which is, in my opinion, a terrible way to finish a terrible game. I also wanted to add a point to the negative aspects column, the boss fights, there are two, each are as frustrating as the rest of the game, and the second one is even worse than the first because you can't save at the start of the boss fight, making you go through two loading screens and a custscene (that you can fortunately skip) every time you die. A pleasant way to finish the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067949328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1609556665}
review:
DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU INTEND ON PLAYING IT SOLO: The game is filled with frustrating bugs and awful physics. Playing it solo would be more annoying than enjoyable because half of the time you're dying at no fault of your own, instead it is at fault of the games poor design. 

If you intend on playing it co-op then I think it's worth a purchase since it makes the games flaws way more forgiving. You died because of the janky climbing system? well just spawn on your friend. Playing co-op really delivers a really unique experience. Being able to coordinate stealth kills is thrilling and very unique as far as I'm aware since co-op stealth games don't seem to be all that common. The game is hilarious, although I admit mostly it is unintentional due to it's janky ass physics.

Bottom line: avoid at all costs if solo but worth a purchase if co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039040797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1763, 'last_played': 1609206133}
review:
If they make a third one, maybe they'll do better.

By far the worst thing about this game are the two boss fights, unavoidable action sequences that strip away the core stealth gameplay in favor of largely tedious dodging puzzles. On the bright side, the second is much less irritating than the first, with plenty of checkpoints scattered throughout a moderately sized gauntlet of deathtraps that make some token use of stealth mechanics, and in both cases the buggy game code will occasionally trivialize the encounter by rendering the bosses helpless.

There are plenty of other gripes, though. Many different controls are consolidated to the same key, which can prove bothersome in many cases where one wishes to do one thing and instead ends up doing another. The breaking of the fourth wall isn't as cute as the developers probably thought it was. Some game systems, particularly the poison mechanic, occasionally just don't seem to work as intended.

The ending caught me entirely by surprise - the way the story was heading I was sure I had at least a handful of missions left. I wonder if the developers ran out of funding or time? This could also explain the recycled levels throughout the second act. There are a few decisions you are invited to make over the course of the game, but none of them matter.

All these problems are a particular shame because there is potential here. The game has some solid stealth gameplay and a wonderfully unique artistic design. I hope Cyanide manage to put this setting and character to better use in the future, because it could definitely be something special.

author: {'steamid': '76561199012397783', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1609178413}
review:
Holt es euch nicht.

review:
Connaissez-vous la satisfaction d'achever un jeu et de terminer son histoire ? La joie d'atteindre le but qui vous a motivé tout au long de votre aventure ? 
Hé bien si le précédent opus, Master of Shadows, finissait avec cette sensation d'accomplissement, ce n'est pas du tout le cas de Shard of Darkness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186313123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4222, 'last_played': 1609076250}
review:
Es macht unglaublich viel Spaß und ist herausfordernd.
Man stirbt/ich sterbe häufig, aber finde es toll, auf wie viele Weisen sich Styx dabei beschwert :'D
Das Spiel lässt sich in unterschiedlichen Stilen spielen - ob nun viel auf Fallen/Klone/Unsichtbarkeit gesetzt wird oder einfach auf Schleichen/Töten/Verstecken, man ist dabei nicht festgelegt.
Die Kulissen finde ich auch sehr schön gestaltet und die Easter-Eggs machen auch Spaß.

An einigen Stellen sind die Speicherpunkte ungünstig (z.B. Anfänge Bosskampf), da muss man dann etwas länger warten.

Alles in Allem finde ich es sehr toll und werde es definitv wieder spielen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198148561699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1609007292}
review: Styx: Shards of Darkness unterscheidet sich nur in Kleinigkeiten von seinem Vorgänger. Aber diese Kleinigkeiten haben eine große Wirkung. Dank der Unreal Engine 4 sieht das Spiel sehr schick aus. Pro Level muss man nur noch 2 Areale absolvieren. Dadurch wirkt das Spiel nicht mehr künstlich gestreckt. Die Level sind gefühlt etwas kleiner, gewinnen aber an Komplexität hinzu. Es gibt mehr Fähigkeiten und die Amber Vision verbraucht kein Amber mehr. Die Story geht in Ordnung. Aber der wichtigste Grund warum Shards of Darkness mehr Spaß macht als Master of Shadows ist Styx selbt. Endlich ist er der Sprüche klopfende Goblin Assassine, der er schon im 1. Teil hätte sein sollen. Im 1. Teil hatte Styx Story bedingt eine Identitätskrise. Gepaart mit der Deadpool Fähigkeit die Fourth Wall zu durchbrechen, wird Styx zu einem klasse Charakter. Selbst die Gameover werden, in Batman Arkham Manier, nicht von Styx unkommentiert gelassen.  Wieder einmal leistet Saul Jephcott als englische Stimme von Styx 1-A Arbeit. Ein klasse Schleichspiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253028318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2423, 'last_played': 1707267476}
review:
Po spędzeniu w grze 40 godzin (kampania singleplayer + kampania multiplayer) jestem gotowy polecić tę produkcje wszystkim fanom skradanek. Możliwość gry z przyjacielem jest czymś wspaniałym, system nie jest w żaden sposób irytujący. Jednym minusem jest długość rozgrywki która wynosi ok 21 godzin, jednakże biorąc pod uwagę aktualną cenę bądź po przecenach jest warta kupna (gra w momencie premiery kosztowała 199zł co jest moim zdaniem trochę za dużo za tę produkcje).
GAMEPLAY:
W grze znajdują się różnego rodzaju znajdźki oraz wyzwania, co zachęca to ponownego przejścia misji albo ukończenia jej w specjalny sposób (np: bez zabijania kogokolwiek). W ciągu 40 godzin nie spotkałem się z żadnym bugiem albo innym problem który miałby choć minimalny wpływ na rozgrywkę. Mechanika gry jest przemyślana, a drzewko rozwoju postaci zawiera rzeczywiście przydatne umiejętności, anie jak w innych grach, gdzie połowę można pominąć bez zastanowienia.
GRAFIKA:
Grafika jest przyjemna dla oka, mroczna oraz sprawia, że niektóre lokacje zyskują na dużej tajemniczości. Poziomy są świetnie zaprojektowane, można naprawdę się wczuć w panujący tam klimat (np: wielki elficki port umieszczony w skale, miasteczko krasnoludów). 
PODSUMOWANIE: 
Gra jak na swoją obecną cenę robi wszystko aby z czystym sercem polecić ją fanom skradanek. Tryb coop potęguje przyjemności doznawane w czasie gry. Charakter, usposobienie głównego bohatera oraz jego łamanie konwencji trzeciej ściany sprawiają, że sami zaczniemy go darzyć ogromną sympatią.

W SKRÓCIE NIC TYLKO GRAĆ I SIĘ BAWIĆ :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198861184274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1662999418}

author: {'steamid': '76561198168815870', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1608731858}
review:
本来还想勉强给个好评的，但是最后的boss战恶心到我了，怀疑设计师脑袋是不是抽风了，这一代除了角色可以更深度的自定义以外，各方面全部倒退。

过于追求动作感的过场动画，动画质量差劲，还不如一代插图过场。恶心的配乐，过于吵闹，我只能说完全不适合这游戏，没有了一代的神秘感和安全感。bug和判定很恶心，有时候被敌人发现了也还是阴影金牌，攀爬有时候判定失误导致坠落，跟一代一样的臭毛病。奇怪的画风，大部分关卡都是暗精灵建筑，风格参考老滚冷港，完全没有一代城堡潜行的仪式感，画面只能用粗糙和廉价形容，没好好经过打磨的虚幻4游戏画面都是挺难看的。。。不如一代，虽然粗糙，但有特色。

还有每次死亡冥河都会吐槽你玩得咋这么菜，这设计我只能说见仁见智吧，我觉得挺讨厌的，本身游戏设计也不是特别好，再加上嘲讽，我只能说挫败感增加不少。

综合这些我认为，如果只想体验纯潜行游戏，那我勉强推荐，如果你是一代粉丝，喜欢它的风格和那种调调的话，恐怕二代不适合你，缺点已经盖过了优点，如果一代是欠打磨的宝石的话，那么这一代我感觉就是一块废铁。再批评一下最后的boss战，廉价的音效和音质，毫无人性化的boss。

author: {'steamid': '76561198015812910', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1607598197}
review:
В наличии: мистер "пни меня", пока я стою на краю пропасти, долго-долго изучая окрестности; товарищ "увлеченный работник", бесконечно чинящий деревянную балку молотком; господин "внимательный патрульный", чей маршрут обязательно проходит под свисающими с потолка офигенно тяжелыми предметами (а то и бочками с кислотой!) - все они плохо слышат и видят, слабо реагируют на исчезновения своих коллег, да сами жить судя по всему не особенно хотят. 

Да, всё по классике видеоигрового стелса, который толком не эволюционировал с самого своего появления на свет. Меняются декорации, чуть расширяется доступный игроку набор развлечений, а ядро этого жанра по прежнему строится на огромном количестве допущений и игре в поддавки. Иногда настолько, что нпс становится  почти жалко. Я сейчас не ругаюсь и не издеваюсь - мне и самому не понятно, как и во что должен развиваться стелс, чтобы не терять темп (и без того очень неторопливый) и не превратиться в многочасовое планирование по устранению одинокого охранника.

Но от некоторых его элементов, кочующих из игры в игру еще с, наверное, первого Thief и которых здесь тоже достаточно давно уже пора избавиться. Например отвлечение охраны при помощи хрупких предметов или камешков: "Ой, а что это за подозрительный шум там в темном углу... а подойду-ка я прямо к его источнику и буду секунд 10-15 смотреть на осколки, которых вроде не было на полу... хммм, похоже мне показалось, вернусь на пост" - глупо и неестественно. Надеюсь, что когда смогу приступить к раздвигающему, разрывающему все мыслимые границы всех жанров Киберпанку, то увижу хоть чуть более вменяемую картину.

Потому что Стикс даже не пытался исправлять никаких недостатков стелса, вместо этого предлагая избыточность во всём. Локации - внушительные и разветвленные. Каждый домик - это решето из  дверей, открытых окон на каждом этаже, балконов, чердака и подвала. На прохождение только одного уровня и попытку найти все спрятанные предметы на нем вполне может уйти вечер. Но если двигаться прямо к цели, то закончить можно минут за 15-20. Ролевая система? Такая же, как и в большинстве современных игр - треть навыков не нужна, треть забавна, но не практична, к последней трети вынуждает сюжет. Хотя по ощущениям эту игру можно закончить без особых проблем, не прокачивая вообще ничего даже на самой высокой сложности. Средства для достижения цели? То же самое: единственный стимул для использования ловушек и клонов (кроме пары моментов по сюжету) - ачивки.

Хорошо что в самоиронии авторам не откажешь. Они прекрасно осознавали что делали, поэтому постоянно шутят не только над и вместе с персонажами,  но и очень удачно высмеивают игровые условности и геймдизайнерские уловки. Здесь отдельное спасибо Стиксу за то, что он, при всем своём мрачном юморе, с постоянными громкими стуками в четвертую стену, не скатывается в пародию. Вместо этого показывая вполне добротный мир темного фэнтези с ксенофобией между расами, эльфами-наркoманами и крайне харизматичным протагонистом.


Суммируя: если хочется игру с хорошим дизайном уровней целиком посвященную стелсу,  рассказанную с необычного ракурса от лица гоблина,  смешную и очень на мой взгляд легкую, где на прохождение можно потратить от 5 до 30 часов (в зависимости от стиля), то... попробуйте Master of Shadows. Там всё то же самое, плюс хороший сюжет (по крайней мере его подача). 

А Shards of Darkness с его лучшей графикой и парой новых приёмов для старых знакомых  - это просто дополнительные охотничьи угодья для тех кому покажется мало первой части.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082289776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2141, 'last_played': 1607981416}
review: Controlando novamente Styx por bueiros, buracos, beiradas e esconderijos em modo stealth ou um assassino furtivo impiedoso. A história acontece após os eventos do primeiro game, mas é totalmente independente, além de personagens com um pouco mais de personalidade. O game continua exigindo precisão em vários momentos e continua a desejar com pulos desajeitados e até alguns pugs. Escalar degraus e quedas quando precisa se dependurar rapidamente foram corrigidos. Os loads são consideravelmente longos, porém os gráficos estão mais trabalhados. Recomendado a jogatina!

author: {'steamid': '76561198252770430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1509, 'last_played': 1665680364}
review:
Замечательный стелсер, пусть и проигрывающий в сюжетном плане первой части. Однако это с лихвой нивелируется интересным и более разнообразным геймплеем. Управление более отзывчивое, окружающий мир более масштабный, локации куда более приятные и не такие камерные, разнообразные и полезные навыки. И даже не подпортили впечатление вдруг сменившие облик эльфы - полагаю, что после событий первой части у них произошёл упадок расы)) Вся игра была пройдена по стелсу без поднятия тревоги - моё почтение, одно удовольствие находить разнообразные пути, прыгать по крышам. Е*анутые на голову эльфы, дворфы-нюхачи как заноза в заднице, Стикс, грубый и хамоватый, ломающий 24/7 четвертую стену - в моём сердечке)
Опечалила лишь только открытая концовка. Она нуждается в продолжении игры - а будет ли оно, не известно(

review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness  — компьютерная игра в жанре стелс, разработанная Cyanide Studio. Игра является продолжением Styx: Master of Shadows 2014 года.

От первой части тут унаследовали весь геймплей, кроме кувырков, но также добавили несколько крутых фишек. Например, более обширное дерево навыков и буст усилитель кварц, который сильнее янтаря.

Опять же во всех миссиях нам надо убить/украсть, а потом сбежать по-тихому. Сама игра стала сложнее немного. Сюжет правда непонятный и концовка тоже какая-то непонятная, недосказанность есть.

Всем любителям жанра стелс советую пройти, я прошел за 7 часов, но можно и быстрее.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977491608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1608767693}
review:
So far, this game has played very well and is quite enjoyable ... and the thing that makes it really enjoyable is the ability to play the entire campaign with a friend in TRUE coop mode! (Too many games say they have a coop mode, but then only offer "specific coop content", which, to our choice, would mean no coop game at all.)

THE GOOD POINTS
===============

As for the game-play itself, the areas are very well designed, great to explore, and offer the players multiple paths through them for great player agency. The controls take a little getting used to, especially when needing to jump from ledge to ledge, but overall, it performs well and one gets to grip as you play.

You get the normal stealth like feedback such as how noisy you are, or how much you are visible, and you also have many hiding places along the way - although the guards are quite good at finding you so do not rely on these.

My friend and I have not progressed too far yet, but it is good to see you can develop skills along the way after picking up skill points for completing quests and various tasks. There are around five key branches each with various skills you can take to improve your various abilities - these role-play aspects are most welcome.

You can also find crafting items along the way, which you can use to craft various useful items. The system is straightforward and fun to use.

The ability to save whenever you like (practically speaking) is also welcome.

THE BAD POINTS
==============

A) Use of profanity. Needless swearing. Why not make up a "goblin" expletive? E.g. Ah, skullbones! This game is not the only one that has been spoiled by such use of profanity.

B) Inability to pass items between players. E.g. It would be good to be able to pass craft items to one another in a coop game.

C) Coop: Hit point loss for both players when a player respawns or game reloaded. I understand why a penalty is useful, but in this case, it penalises both players. Why not just penalise the guy who "failed".

D) We would have liked a map.

CONCLUSION
===========

A recommend for those who like stealth games and/or coop with a friend ... preferably when in a sale.

UPDATE
=======

BUG REPORT: After playing some more, my friend and I hit the infamous MISSION 3 bug, and found we could not continue and had to reload an earlier game and retry. Try as we might, we could not continue UNLESS we went an alternative path that unlocked the "search for the body" as opposed to "search for the letter".

You can read more about this here: https://steamcommunity.com/app/355790/discussions/0/1368380934248944776/

author: {'steamid': '76561198019551114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1824, 'last_played': 1604513787}
review:
I would agree that there are some technical inconveniences, but all in all, the gameplay is fun, frustrating and somewhat varied. I was playing this as a Thief-like game, so more sneaking and less combat, to which the game was suitable. The game still looks good and is fairly responsive, but some minor inconveniences can happen every now and then. 

You can faceroll the game, or then 100% everything, or do both, the game isn't that long. 100% took around 30 hrs, you could achieve that much faster with a clear plan and a goal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198266700586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1685133891}
review:
Muy buen juego si te gustan los juegos de sigilo y plataformas a lo Prince of Persia, el carisma del personaje es insuperable, los comentarios cuando mueres son un punto. Supera a la primera parte en cuanto a escenarios más grandes y más abiertos aunque no esperes gran cosa con respecto a novedades o mecánicas de juego, es más Styx y ya está, tampoco había que innovar mucho ya que el primero está genial. 
El único punto negativo que puedo encontrarle es que se hace un poco repetitivo, es de esos juegos que o te enganchas y te encanta o lo odias profundamente. Es un juego para ir tranquilo, explorando y exprimiéndote el cerebro con el reto que supone cada fase, no esperes un Hack n´slash, te pillan y... has muerto!

author: {'steamid': '76561198288512024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1688906047}
review:
Stealth games have to be my favourites, this one has a nice twist, you get to play a rather loathsome rogue goblin. In a world where goblins are hated and hunted down, you play one who's cunning and skills are earning him good pay and reputation.

The gameplay is superb, wonderful fluid movements as Styx jumps, climbs and silently kills is way around the map. I'm not great at this games despite my love of them and this one takes a little bit of patience and a lot of reloading saved games but the real enjoyment in the stealth genre is always the planning and execution of a kill without being seen or heard. 

Then there's the cut scenes after you die where Styx comes out of the ether to berate you for not being a better player, once of the best touches I've seen in a game in a long time. I originally played this on XBOX but having moved over to Steam on PC enjoy it even more than the console version. 

If you like a good stealth game with a great sense of humour and an utterly horrible hero, try it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198157242596', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1605542785}
review:
Новые приключения Стикса начинаются через много лет после событий Master of Shadows и почти не связаны с оригинальной историей. На этот раз разработчики не стали чудить с композицией, как в первой части, где половина сюжета подавалась в нетривиальной манере от лица допрашиваемого гоблина. Здесь же сценарий линеен, и нельзя сказать, что это пошло игре на руку, ведь Master of Shadows создавала интригу ещё на уровне формы повествования.

Не осталось во второй части и намёка на проблематику самоидентификации, которой была посвящена оригинальная Styx. На этот раз всё намного прозаичнее: однажды гоблин заключает договор с дамой в доспехах Эледрин. Он обязуется украсть у летающего на воздушном корабле посла некий посох, а взамен получит десять бутылочек янтаря, местного наркотического лакомства. Но в планы Стикса вмешивается таинственный эльф, обладающий способностью перевоплощения. Гордость героя задета, эльф становится для него смертельным врагом, и теперь, чтобы отомстить, гоблин готов пуститься во все тяжкие и бросить вызов длинноухой расе.

Самое заметное улучшение Shards of Darkness по сравнению с Master of Shadows — смена графического движка на Unreal Engine 4. От этого выиграли не только декорации, но, что куда важнее, дизайн уровней. Локации в Shards of Darkness получились огромными: каждый уровень состоит из десятков комнат, коридоров и скрытых лазеек, и у игрока есть множество вариантов, как прокрасться мимо вражеского патруля незамеченным и добраться до цели задания.

+Хардкорный, классический стелс — в том числе, с возможностью пройти каждый уровень, не убивая и не оглушая никого, кроме «целевых» жертв.
+Короткие заставки после каждой смерти, на которых Стикс ругается на игрока, мол, вот криворукий, опять меня порешил!
+Яркий, запоминающийся, обаятельный  и не дающий скучать главный (анти)герой.
+Украл, выпил, F9

-Главный минус в Shards of Darkness — странноватый ИИ. Иногда противники отличаются просто соколиным зрением и не прощают Стиксу малейших ошибок даже на легком уровне сложности, а порой не видят гоблина в двух метрах от себя посреди освещенной комнаты.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050420192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1606249590}
review:
This is not a very well polished game.

The whole co-op experience feels like a last minute addition that haven't really been polished or tested well enough. They might as well have no multiplayer in this game whatsoever and you wouldn't miss anything good with it being gone. Not to say that you're being locked out of most of combat mechanics while playing co-op.

The only redeeming point of multiplayer is that you're practically immortal, as long as you have your co-op partner alive you can spawn from them in 10 seconds after you die. But, you can achieve that without having to suffer through multiplayer by simply upgrading some of skills in your clone skill tree.

Most of times multiplayer devolves into a buggy mess between AI behaviour breaking often, button input sometimes not registering properly and some desynchronisation between players. A few of the mission quests are bugged, with one particular locking the game with no way to complete it without having to reload and replay the whole mission.
Some later levels reuse level stages that were used in prior missions. You can call that lazy or not pay any attention since it's not that uncommon of a practice in current games.

Besides that, the atmosphere is pretty nice, Styx himself is a cheeky little bastard. If you want to play this game, you better do it alone unless you want to either laugh with your friends at all the bugs it have or be frustrated about the game breaking often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198441078903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 2019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2019, 'last_played': 1606310188}
review:
ДОСТОИНСТВА:
Локации. Кооператив.

НЕДОСТАТКИ:
Баги как и во многих играх, не доработка некоторых навыков.

Главный герой это самый старый гоблин. Стикс отличается от своих собратьев не только разумом и умением говорить, срать всё, умеет отравлять отличную пищу и питьё, взламывать замки, 
Это нечто среднее между Assassins Creed. Трупы нужно прятать по разным шкафам и скидывая их с обрыва, либо просто облить кислотой и не парится, один фиг только местность портят.
Локации довольно большие с множеством противников и секретов, так что есть на что уделить время.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993808130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 3488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3488, 'last_played': 1606280166}
review:
Always a great game. Ending was kind of...well..just there, but otherwise awesome game.  You certainly have room to play your own way with many options on how to complete your objectives. I have done 3 complete play-throughs prior to writing my review which really should have been done after the first. Hard to find good stealth games like this, adds a bit of a comic to it as well. Controls are great, most of the time.  Sometimes you manage to jump or do something you do not actually want to do...but you can save as you wish for the most part, so no fret when you fall off a cliff 10 times in a row.
Certainly a game that I hope they expand on or continue the series with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339735963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1606467201}
review:
Un très bon jeu d'infiltration, plein de charme, avec un peu de plateforme pour agrémenter le tout. Je n'ai pas aimé le premier volet (Master of Shadows) dont le level design était mal pensé, contrairement à cet opus qui est très agréable à jouer. En plus le personnage de Styx est sympa et attachant.

Vous aurez le choix entre une approche "pacifique" totalement furtive et une approche plus agressive en éliminant tous les ennemis, si vous le souhaitez. L'arbre de compétences offre d'ailleurs un vaste choix d'aptitudes plus ou moins adaptées à votre approche. 

Les maps sont très verticales et offrent plusieurs chemins pour parvenir à vos objectifs, ce qui contribue à une bonne rejouabilité. J'en suis à mon deuxième playthrough.

Si vous aimez l'infiltration, l'exploration avec un zest de plateforme alors foncez !

review:
Teljesen megéri az árát kiváló lopakodós játék  az egyik legjobb parkour rendszerrel. Nincs fölösleges crafting rendszer csak az van amire tényleg szükséged van az AI nem végtelenül buta és az akadálypályás részek is kellő kihívással bírnak. Van benne némi esztétikai bug de semmi olyasmi ami megakasztaná a játékot max megmosolyogtat. Ami hibája van ennek a játéknak az a story ugyanis nagyon gyenge és nincs is nagyon erőltetve az egész, szóval ha csak a story miatt vennéd meg ne tedd mert az nincs benne sok. Viszont ha egy jó lopakodós, stealth  játékot keresel akkor ez neked van kitalálva. De összességében mindenképpen megér egy végigjátszást.

ui.: Ha kiakarod teljesen achivmentezni a játékot  és a legutolsó achi nem ugrik fel (Goblin Master) akkor indítsd újra  a játékot majd töltsd be a legutolsó mentést és az meg kell oldja a problémát.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006594698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1348, 'last_played': 1605554350}
review:
After playing the first one, which in my opinion was a heaping pile of turds I was actually pleasantly surprised by this one.

Improvements

Roabies still exist which sucks but at least they arent as overpowered and hyper sensitive as the previous game.

You now have to hold a button to hang off of ledges which is a fantastic improvement if you want to drop down without being insta grabbed

the throwing knives of this game are bolts and you can now create them but the iron to make them is scarce and rare.

A small host of traps and utensils to use which aids the player on doing encounters.

The sniffing mechanics returns like the end of styx 1 BUT instead of instant alert and aggression they smell you and just sniff about unsure where exactly you are.
Cover kills are improved allowing you to grab people across cover instead of only allowing you to perform it when hanging on a empty space to grab which more often than not didnt work.
the overall mechanics of the game is improved, styx can now be the assassin we all want him to be, from daggers of instant quiet kills to melting bodies along with character upgrades.. 

The maps are more varied compared to the previous game but still suffer from repeating the same area a few times.. Mainly Thoben and the hunter areas

Platforming feels improved substantially but there is still some areas where it performs clunky.

Puzzles and platforming puzzles are still good but in this they are better in places namely the mission involving the many gauntlets that was quite fun

Boss fights are somewhat better but still very mediocre and uninspiring but its still a massive upgrade from the shit fest that was the final boss in Styx Master of Shadows.

Negatives

Corner mechanics are nerfed beyond hell since if you whistle your enemies in their pathing will make them go around the corner which is a good thing and bad thing at the same time.

While the equipment options are great some of the skill upgrades and Quartz upgrades I find lacking and unneeded.

The bosses are lame to be put bluntly, youre seen and permanantly seen during them so its more just timing and using invisibility so its quite meh overall.

Fuggin Roabies, thats all im saying at least they now have a lore reason why the roabies are teaming up with the main enemy.

A good deal of the upgrades suck

Lockpicks exist, locked doors dont really

The best upgrade you can get is locked behind the whole game so unless youre a completionist its pointless

This game is still press f5 and f9 loading simulator

the writing and voice acting is still quite bad but isnt that a perk of this game?

the story is also meh instead of finding master and the revenge its just I want amber I will steal amber ooh quartz good


So overall this game is a far far improvement of the prequel gameplay wise but still has a lot of shortcomings.
Should you play this and not play the 1st one?

Yes avoid the first one like a plague and give this one a shot

review:
Jeśli marzyłeś by grać takim Goblinem w stylu Gangsta Nyga Joł Ziom 

To ta gra jest dla ciebie jeśli nie to nie kupuj bo Goblini Gangsta Nyga koleszka i jego chumor jest odcuwalny całą gre .

Ja Nie jestem fanem, a raczej regularnym graczem skradanek, ani gier skradankopodobnych. I kupiłem grę tylko ze względu na przecenę bo humor okazał sie przedni jak mi sugerowano. Okazuje sie jednak w samej grze, że sam gameplay jest świetny, zmusza do kombinowania, i myślenia co zrobić jak zrobić i gdzie zrobić, szczególnie gdy napinam sie o przechodzenie misji bez zabijania :D


Do gry podchodziłem z bardzo pozytywnym nastawieniem ale niestety gra jest po prostu słaba, 1 prolog + 9 misji , misje polegają głównie na tym że jesteśmy w jakieś lokacji i mamy za zadanie podkraść komuś list i kogoś zabić plus ewentualnie jakaś misja poboczna czyli w 80% zboczyć nieco z drogi i zdobyć kawałek kryształu.
Grafika nie powala ale nie jest też zła, gre w sumie ratuje główny bohater który swoimi tekstami umie rozbawić ;).

Dał bym 5,5 / 10

review:
I like the universe of the game and the character - it's good. The thing I don't like though is that you can't actually see enemies until you get to their spawn area - so you pop up onto a ledge and find yourself confronted by enemies you had no way of knowing would be there. You re-load the game and think "maybe there's another way around?" and you try. And you fall off things - a lot. And you find another way around, and run into more enemies who don't appear until you're right in their eyeline. Rinse, repeat. Every level is an incremental grind of this stuff and it's just not compelling enough to make me want to bother. 

I honestly think that there's a good game in there somewhere, but I'm just not motivated to work that hard to find it. I think Tenchu did it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967629529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1605454162}
review:
This is the "AAA mainstream" version of the original, where controls, dialogue (somehow), story and gameplay are all worse.

So controls, they fixed being able to hang off ledges, but instead everything has a delay and Styx will grab anything he can that is remotely near him. If you're near a rope, good luck getting away from it.
Also if you're sticking to a surface and press left or right, he moves in increments instead of however much or little you press, which is just mindbaffling stupid. 

Where the original had tight tolerances, the maps in this one are much more open, but cluttered with enemies. The first time you meet roabies in this one there are eight of them all on top of eachother.
The game loves to tell you how things function, but it doesn't allow you to deal with them however you want and a couple of maps in you start getting railroaded. 

Styx' abilities have been divided out between bloated skill trees that didn't need to be so elaborate and it's obvious that the devs wanted to have you "make meaningful choices" with the end of each tree. 
Why? So devs can feel good about doing "good development" rather than giving you a fun experience. 
As an example, you can either have visualization of footsteps and enemy trails without amber vision OR you can see tokens through walls and nothing else. Tokens give you skill points and maybe achievements, this is completely useless and should've been a suboption earlier on. 

Crafting has been introduced, but unless you want to spend your hard earned skill points on it, you can only make darts (this game's version of throwing knives) and healing potions. There are lockpicks for some reason, but it is extremely rare that you need any. 
The maps are absolutely cluttered with crafting materials and if you pick a skill, Styx will go "hmm" everytime he's near one. You're always near one, he never stops going "hmm", ever. It took me two minutes of that before loading a game to pick something else.

For those who like to pick off one enemy at a time in long sessions, this is not like the first game, you are more than heavily discouraged to do so and there are absolute tons of enemies and they are FAR more alert. There's no point to extinguishing torched, because it draws TONS of attention rather than giving you room to breathe.

So how about the story/dialogue? You're thrown into some wild hunt almost right off the bat that takes you into a crazy conspiracy, it's hamfisted and full of tropes, which would be fine if it was fun, but it's not.
The dialogue is extremely bad even compared to the first game. You will be introduced to elves early on (they've lost their amber sense, so they're effectively the same as humans now...) and whenever you overhear them, they go into long diatribes of exposition read by some intern voice actor who has no idea what setting they're in. American and half-british accents are intermingled and all characters including Styx are overplayed and dumb. Styx spends most of the game breaking the 4th wall which is a lot less fun than it sounds. 

There is a gimmick boss fight a ways in, which doesn't let you save and has nothing to do with stealth or planning, the game essentially turns into a cover shooter, without the shooting. Absolutely god awful and after beating the boss the first time, I ran into one of the traps and died, having to do it all over. I opted to risk viruses to get a trainer, rather than have to play through that again.

Textures are better, but the art style is cluttered and a mess of colors. Despite areas being open they feel claustrophopic and it's hard to tell if someone's there as everything looks so busy. 

I don't know who made this game, if the devs changed or what, but it's as if someone heard what the game was about and then made it not knowing why the first one was fun. This is a competent game but it's godawful to play, it's like nails on a chalk board at every turn, making your toe curls at how incompetently they've made this. 
As bad as it sounds from what I'm saying, you can play this without any problems, the thing is that none of it feels good or fun. At some point I gave up trying to explore and kill enemies and instead just followed the railroaded enemy routes in bright light and walked past everything, having no fun and being annoyed whenever the game would slow down and waste my time.

Revision: Finished it, it's worse than when I first reviewed it. Absolute trash with a cliffhanger ending that leaves you mind blown that they thought they'd get a sequal for this.

review:
전편에 비해 진보하면서도 여전히 그대로인 작품
여전히 문제가 있는 작품임에도 불구하고 이 게임은 재밌다.

적 이동패턴 및 맵 구조 파악해야하는 집중력 요구때문인지 몰라도
몰입도는 좋은편이다.

늘 느끼는 거지만 주인공 캐릭터는 잘만들었음...

전작이 좀 팔렸는지 제작진들의 욕심을 좀 낸거 같다.
컷신의 변화와 캐릭터성을 강조한 대사 및 장면이라던가 등..
근데 그 욕심에 비해 덜다듬어지고 딱 절반만 보여준 느낌
엔딩을 왜 그런식으로? 완전 투 비 컨티뉴....

비행선 장농에서 장비를 교체가능 하다. 
근데 제작사가 미쳐 체크하지 못한건지 아니면 
일부러 엿먹으라는건지 모르겠지만 
산성칼 들고 있을때 특정 미션 진행시 난감한 상황이 발생한다.
비행선에서 이 임무 시작전에 산성칼 관련
경고 메세지라도 띄웠으면 좋았을것을...
이거 때문에 힘들게 클리어한 미션 다시 시작함

이 시리즈를 하다보면 기억에 남는것
주인공, 벌레

벌레는 이 시리즈에서 소리탐지 적,
전작보다 민감함을 줄였어야 했고
불만 껐는데 뛰어올때 소름이 다 끼침
제작사가 벌레를 좋아하나?
이번엔 공중적 말벌도 추가 했음...

이번작에서 추가된 냄새탐지 적 드워프는 주인공 탐지 범위가 
너무 넓다고 생각됨. 진짜 너무한거 아니오? 
비틈노려 뒤따라가는건 꿈도 못꿈..
인간이 제일 만만하지...

여전히 멍청한 AI
힘들게 풀어가면서 목적지 도착다가는네 적들이
서로 가겠다고 길막하고 부비부비하며 오도가도 못해 게임을 다시 로드
다른 게임처럼 부드러운 모션까진 바라진 않지만 
이동패턴 시간차 겹쳐서 서로 부딫히는 상황만 없어졌으면 함

게임하다보면 적 이동경로 패턴 파악후 몰래 뒤따라 가거나 
빈틈을 노려 이동, 시선유도, 숨기 대부분 이런식인데
이 시리즈에서 클론은 쓰임새가 많아 전투보다 훨씬 유용하다.
 
몇가지 문제들이 있지만 맵 디자인이 훌륭해 구경하는 맛이 있고 
주인공 캐릭터 스틱스의 매력 때문인지 잼있게 굴러가는 게임이다.
스토리를 그런식으로 끊었으니 다음편에 뭔가 더 풀어주기를 바람

review:
it's a good game

if you liked the first game I would recommend it. if you haven't played the first game I would recommend that one over this one as it has less possibilities and that is a good thing... also there are a bit of learning tutorials build in to get the hang of the basics...

the first game I played twice and tried reaching most of the achievements.
but I do not feel the urge to try this in the second game... due to playing the first a lot longer I also already did most of the achievements anyway except for the time as it's never clear if the mission is halfway after a map or if there is a second map to play trough...

author: {'steamid': '76561198078343797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1623, 'last_played': 1673717543}
review:
[h1] LAMB OF GOB! [/h1]

Доброго времени суток, приятель! Меня зовут гоблин Стикс и это третье приключение, о котором я хотел бы тебе поведать, поэтому усаживайся поудобнее и наслаждайся моим рассказом.

Я гоблин разумный, единственный в своём роде и поэтому не стоит меня приписывать к этим зеленомордым болванам, которых ты возможно встречал раньше, я совсем другая история. На жизнь зарабатываю чем придётся, но зачастую я выполняю кое-какую грязную работёнку. То людскую знать под покровом ночи обчищу, то проведу своим острым кинжалом по хрупкой шее болтуна, в общем за словом в карман не полезу!

Чёрт побрал бы всех этих людишек, эльфов и гномов, которые никогда не дадут мне спокойной жизни! Сколько раз наш род пытались истребить и не сосчитать… И вот опять эти болваны принялись за старое! Тёмные эльфы и гномы заключили тайный пакт, решив истребить нас окончательно, но эти болваны не учли одного, покуда буду жив я, будет жив и род, а до меня им добраться будет ой как не просто.

Слава богам, что им неизвестен мой маленький секрет, которой и помогает мне держаться на плаву все эти годы. Но так я тебе и рассказал, что это за секрет, ха-ха! Ладно-ладно, пообещай только, что никому не расскажешь, иначе это станет твоими последними словами, усёк?! Янтарь, мой драгоценный янтарь, который я научился использовать особенным образом, помог мне обрести полную невидимость, что позволяет мне шнырять прямо под носом у этих недотёп. А ещё могу вымочить кое-что похлеще, я могу создать своих клонов, которые исполнят любой мой приказ, здорово, да? То-то же! Наверное каждый мечтает о таком, они конечно не очень умные, но зато какие исполнительные! Под моим плащом, есть несколько интересных инструментов, которые позволяют мне быть истинным мастером-теней. Могу даже растворить труп врага кислотой за считанные секунды и комар носа не подточит!

Так, ладно, вернемся к рассказу, конечно-же, как ты понимаешь союз двух рас не даст им ничего хорошего и до меня они, так и не смогли добраться. Зато я доставил им хлопот немеряно. Вспомнить только, как я обманом заманил посла гномов в западню и расправился с ним в два счёта или как я попал в старинный храм, где мне удалось выполнить все испытания древних и получить мой особенный янтарный кинжал. Или как я тайком плевал в еду этим мерзким эльфам и они потом так смешно корчились от яда или как я умело обрушивал огромные люстры прямо на головы этих болванов, какие славные были времена…

Много времени прошло с тех пор, очень много. Но знаешь, ты можешь вновь узреть это сам, своими глазами, если мне не веришь. Просто купи Styx: Shards of Darkness - это очень хорошая стелс игра, уверяю тебя.

review:
In short, game with a good idea but an atrocious execution.
Graphics are nice, story is boring but most importantly the gameplay feels rough and clunky.
You will miss your jumps, fall to your death, get spotted or fail at executions in a way that feels as if the game interprets your input in a way it feels like rather than as you intended, which leaves a bitter aftertaste.
At the same time the AI and its pathfinding gets glitched out very easily during a normal play
As a stealth game there are many alternatives witch are more worth of your time.

Ok, so I've finished the game and I have to admit, that it is even more disappointing of a game than I have first thought. Firstly, somebody had the bright idea to implement the worst part of the Deus Ex remake, the boss fights. True, there are only two, but they feel like a slap to the face. Stealth is pointless in those. As such the game throws away most of it's stealth mechanics during the boss fights. Great idea guys, said nobody ever in a stealth game. Finally the ending. What a dissatisfying sequel baiting garbage. Avoid this game. You will be left only with a feeling of disappointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052961043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1462, 'last_played': 1604689070}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness is an action adventure game with a course sense of humour, fun references to other games of the genre and forth wall breaks.

Starting with Graphics, Styx's graphics get the job done. Far from the best done on this engine but also far from the worst. The game has many minor graphical glitches, where textures don't quite match or join up, and of course the ragdoll physics of corpses will often result in "unusual" angles. But these glitches are very minor and I personally found they were small enough to just fade into the background after I'd initially noticed them.

Sound in Styx: Shards of Darkness is of a good but not exceptional quality. Voice acting for the most part is on point with the situation and most voices match up fairly well with the character we're seeing. Music and sound effects too, contribute to making a satisfying atmosphere, though I did find some of the sound effects are a bit annoying. Invisibility for example has this rather annoying pulsing sound effect that I did find very grating, thankfully invisibility is only used for short durations so it didn't get too oppressive.

Gameplay is well judged and engaging for the most part. The developers made the intelligent decision not to make this game open world for the sake of it, as many action adventure game developers do nowadays then fill their world with far too much cookie cutter content and miss the entire point of what an open world game should be. There are just enough collectables in each mission to make you explore but not so many that you become tired of it. Where the gameplay does start to become repetitive is the general moving and sneaking. There is a very limited range of ways to sneak, hide and explore which can result in you getting a bit bored as the game progresses. I found there were times on some of the longer missions I started to take a few too many risks as I wanted to get to the end of the mission in order to progress the story and break up the gameplay loop. I also must say that the gameplay has quite a few bugs. I had to restart the game once, because a skill from the skill tree refused to correctly learn. I encountered on many occasions Styx failing to grab a ledge that was right in front of him, even falling to my death on occasion. The AI is also incredibly stupid, most often this works to your advantage, but there were times a guards stupidity caused me to be discovered when I normally wouldn't have.

Which brings me to story. Like with much of the game, good but not great. Styx is definitely entertaining, granting me many grins and a few chuckles but stopping short of being one of those games to make me laugh out loud. The story is a pleasant romp, with simple and sometimes coarse humour, it won't challenge and it won't deliver loads of shocks but I found it enjoyable none the less.

Last I come to value for money. I picked up Styx: Shards of Darkness on sale for £7.19 and it took me a little under 23 hours to fully complete the game with all achievements, though bugs with the gameplay and AI did cause some achievements to take much longer than they should have done causing me to have to reload from save points when I failed an Insignia due to a bug. All in all I'd say that this game was good value for money, but I wouldn't have wanted to pay a lot more for it than I did. So I would recommend that most people wait for sale.

Overall rating: 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206999976', 'num_games_owned': 1110, 'num_reviews': 510, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1604591735}
review:
[h1]Review zu Styx: Shards of Darkness[/h1]

Ich hatte so sehr gehofft, dass Styx: Shards of Darkness besser sein würde als sein Vorgänger...
Und das ist es auch. Zumindest in einigen Stellen. Stellenweise wurden seitens vom Entwickler sogar die gleichen Fehler, wie im Vorgänger gemacht. Teilweise sogar neue hinzugefügt.
Styx 2 sieht deutlich besser aus und auch die Steuerung und Spielweise ist ähnlich wie im Vorgänger. Leider leidet unter dieser erzwungenen Schönheit dann jedoch die Größe und Komplexität der Level, die stellenweise ruhig etwas weitläufiger hätte ausfallen können. Ironischerweise sind die Level selbst dann ziemlich detailliert gestaltet, wenn auch nicht so großartig, was die Szenerie anbelangt. Zwar waren die Menschenstädte aus dem Vorgänger unlogisch monumental erbaut, hatten so aber doch ihren ganz eigenen Reiz gehabt. Stattdessen dümpelt man in Styx 2 hin- und wieder von einem trostlosen Ort zum anderen. Zumindest meiner Meinung nach. Die Elfenbauten fand ich nie sonderlich interessant, lediglich Korrangar hatte irgendwie etwas Mysteriöses an sich, bei dem man nur entdecken möchte.
Apropos entdecken. Endlich gibt es im Nachfolger auch mehr Gründe, als sich die Level gründlicher anzuschauen. Die plumpen Goldmünzen aus dem Vorgänger waren da eher weniger Grund dafür. Stattdessen gibt es in Styx 2 jetzt ein Craftingsystem und mit ihm Craftingmaterial, dass man im Level auflesen kann, wodurch wiederum ein Drang zum Erkunden entsteht, der dann wieder dadurch gedämpft wird, dass viele schwer gepanzerte Gegner - die nicht mittels Dolch, sondern mittels Miene, oder Falle etc. getötet werden müssen, in den Leveln herum eiern und so häufig den Weg versperren. Dann doch lieber auf dem sicheren Weg weniger erkunden...
Es ist allgemein doch irgendwie recht schade. Teilweise denke ich mir, dass dieses Spiel mehr Aufmerksamkeit als sein Vorgänger verdient hätte, andererseits jedoch irgendwie ja nicht... Beispielsweise ist die Geschichte in Styx 2 nicht wirklich interessant gewesen, wenn nicht gerade sehr vorhersehbar. Die Geschichte des Vorgängers konnte hierbei wenigstens noch mit Überraschungen aufwarten.
Vielleicht ist es sogar das größte Problem von Styx 2, dass es nicht mit Überraschungen aufwarten kann und wenn dann nur mit negativen. Ich meine, die einzige positive Neuerung, die ich bemerkt habe, war, dass man nun ein Craftingsystem hat. Generell bin ich nicht wirklich ein Freund davon, aber sah recht schnell das Potenzial, dass Erkundung der Level durch die Suche der Materialien dadurch gerechtfertigt sein würde. Und doch habe ich in Styx 2 deutlich weniger erkundet als in Styx 1. Wahre Ironie.
Was die weiteren negativen Punkte, die durchaus überraschen können (allerdings nicht, wenn man diese Review gelesen hat) erwähnen keine ausführliche Beschreibung meinerseits, die werde ich einfach weiter unten auflisten.

Kommen wir für die Schnellen unter uns einfach mal zur Pro-Contra-Liste:

[u][b]Pro:[/b][/u]

+ Einzelne Objekte haben eine Physik und können umgeworfen werden, um Gegner, gewollt, oder ungewollt, auf sich aufmerksam zu machen
+ Zwar ist das Spiel nicht auf Deutsch vertont, dennoch sind die Synchronsprecher recht talentiert
+ Musik ist an sich recht spärlich verwendet, aber ich kriege jedes Mal Gänsehaut, wenn das Streichquartett zum Zug kommt!
+ Amüsante Monologe von Styx. Leider bringen die deutschen Untertitel den Humor nicht ganz so gut rüber
+ Coole Killmoves
+ Interessante Spielmechaniken, selbst für ein eher, meiner Meinung nach, plumpes Stealthspiel. Beispielsweise das Auflösen von Leichen mittels Säure, das Erschaffen eines Klones, dass man Kronleuchter oder Kisten auf Gegner herabfallen lassen kann, oder sogar Früchtekörbe und Wasserbeutel vergiften kann. (In die man zum Vergiften amüsanterweise hineinspuckt)
+ Großangelegte Levelkomplexe
+ Die Grafik sieht, dank der Unreal Engine 4 Grafik recht gut aus
+ Viele Spiele haben beim zweiten Durchlauf das Problem, dass das Tutorial den Anfang beträchtlich ausbremst. Nicht so bei Styx 2, weil ein Großteil davon freiwillig ist und so kaum aufhält
+ Sehr detaillierte Umgebungen. Wenn man die karge Einrichtung aus dem Vorgänger noch kennt, dann ist das Spiel wirklich eine Augenweide
+ In Verstecken, die oftmals in der Egoperspektive sind, hört man das Atmen von Styx. (Ich bin mir nicht sicher, ob das nicht schon im Vorgänger der Fall war, zumindest ist mir das nicht aufgefallen) So wird ordentlich Spannung erzeugt, selbst beim Verstecken!
+ Einige Shots aus Cutscenes sind in der Egoperspektive gezeigt worden und sind ziemlich immersiv!

[u][b]Contra:[/b][/u]

- Automatische Checkpoints sind zu weit voneinander entfernt. Glücklicherweise gibt es eine Schnellspeicherfunktion
- Generell kann man in Styx vieles nicht... Man kann nicht sprinten. Das lahme Joggen finde ich, besonders bei den riesigen Levelkomplexen, eher unvorteilhaft. Man kann Feuerschalen nicht mit Sand löschen, sondern nur Fackeln. Man kann Gegner nicht gegeneinander ausspielen. Z.B. die Insekten gegen Menschen, Zwerge gegen Elfen, oder dergleichen wäre interessant gewesen. Stattdessen leben die in irgendeiner Art von Symbiose
- Apropos wiederverwenden. Ab einem gewissen Abschnitt des Spiels werden viele Level nur noch recycelt und mit anderen Gegnern vollgestopft. Das hat mir nicht sehr gefallen. Es wirkte so als würde man das Spiel künstlich verlängern wollen. Ich fand das jedenfalls recht faul vom Entwickler. Leider haben die Entwickler dies auch schon im Vorgänger abgezogen...
- Ich HASSE gewisse Gegner. Die Mücken, Zwerge, schwer gepanzerte, Mutantenschaben...
- Styx´s Gedankenmonologe kommen oftmals während NPC-Charaktere sich gerade unterhalten und übertönt deren Diskussion. Das nervt. Ich will das schließlich hören...
- Häufig kann man sich an die Magnethände von Styx beim Klettern verlassen, doch wenn er sich mal partout nicht festhalten will und man deswegen stirbt nervt das umso mehr
- Gelegentlich glitchen NPCs. Sie bleiben stehen, laufen gegen Wände und Gegenstände, sodass sie stecken bleiben, machen hektische Bewegungen etc...
- Bei Bosskämpfen kann man nicht selbstständig speichern

[u][b]Prontra:[/b][/u]

+- Das Intro beim Starten des Spiels ist nicht zu überspringen
+- Ich habe das Spiel auf dem Controller gespielt und das Umschauen, während man einen Gegner leise erledigt war nie wirklich angenehm, da man dafür wirklich beide Hände, beinahe überkreuzt, nutzen muss, um das gleichzeitig hinzukriegen. Mit Maus & Tastatur gab es dabei jedoch keine Probleme
+- Es ist nicht immer ganz klar, was erklimmbar ist und was nicht
+- Kleine Glitches in Ingamecutscenes
+- In der Theorie gibt es durch die sammelbaren Craftingmaterialien mehr Gründe zum Erkunden, neben Goldmünzen und Items, doch wird das Erkunden beträchtlich dadurch erschwert, dass mehr Gegner schwer gepanzert sind und dich teilweise sogar sofort töten können
+- Ich hatte oftmals große Probleme schwer gepanzerte Gegner als solche zu identifizieren. Das Problem ist im Vorgänger nicht aufgetaucht
+- Obwohl es einen Perk gibt aus Verstecken zu töten funktioniert das nicht in Fässern, Urnen und dergleichen. (Verstecke, die man nicht in der Egoperspektive betritt, Tunnel sind dabei ausgeschlossen) Das funktioniert nur in Truhen, oder Schränken

Styx: Shards of Darkness war okay, aber nochmal spielen muss wirklich nicht sein. Da spiele ich lieber die Dishonoredreihe, wenn ich mal wieder Lust auf ein Stealthspiel habe.
Der Normalpreis von 19,99€ ist per se ganz in Ordnung, muss jeder für sich selbst wissen, ob man so viel Geld dafür ausgeben möchte.

Ich danke fürs Lesen und wünsche sehr viel Spaß beim Spielen! ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198238709208', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2232, 'last_played': 1653617377}
review:
Styx Shards of Darkness is a callback to video game best stealth genres. Its stealth is rock solid which has great feedback on when you will be spotted, how dark you are in certain places, how loud your actions make and its sound design make it easier to hear enemies from distance.

Great:
1. Stealth is pretty satisfying, Styx control is good and responsive.
2. Visually stunning environment designs and art direction which makes every place a lived-in world and Styx a visually pleasing to look at (although his goblin appearance is ugly to some but that is part of his charm)
3. Lots of twists and turns in the overall plot.
4. Memorable characters
5. Styx Goblin Power is game changing that makes picking certain powers forces you think and play stealth differently.
6. Poor combat which makes this a pure stealth game.
7. Outift customization

Good:
1. Music and the game's overall tone are consistent 
2. Big-mouthed Styx is always welcome and funny.
3. Certain powers are kind of underdeveloped.

Mixed:
1. Styx's too many remarks on pop culture references to certain franchises like Toy Story, Assassins Creed, etc is too much.
2. Styx's death cutscene commentary is funny for a few times but ridiculous and boring after you die too many times. Thankfully you can turn this feature off.
3. Playing without quest markers is great but without map feature or more descriptive quest explanation makes playing without quest markers an unnecessary hassle because you almost never know where to go if you turn it off entirely. Map design in Thief 1 and 2 would be better as that makes it playable without markers and not making the experience of navigating the world confusing.  
4. Certain important characters in the story are just gone later in the game (maybe for a potential sequel?)

Bad: 
1. Abrupt and unsatisfying ending to an engaging plot.

With how Shards of Darkness seemingly underperform in commercial compared to its prequel makes a potential sequel in limbo but I really hope there's a sequel to this game because Cyanide's Styx Shards of Darkness is AA great stealth-focused game and with how rare pure stealth games these days make it a definite game for fans of stealth genre

author: {'steamid': '76561197968583682', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1243, 'last_played': 1603830736}
review:
The first Styx (Master of Shadows) was kind of rough around the edges, but the sequel improved on it in pretty much every way. The basic gameplay is the same, the game is still a hardcore stealth game, but the movement, controls, gameplay and stealth felt better right from the beginning. For example the lighting of the engine is much better, now you can tell wether you’re in the shadows or not just by looking at the game world, though we also got a lightgem to help us. Styx’s special abilities return, both the invisibility and the cloning, the latter allowing us to safely recon ahead or distract guards. Enemy variety is still great, although there are no major new additions.

There are also items to aid us in our quest, like the familiar throwing knife to deal with unarmored enemies, or the pocket sand to extinguish torches, and some new ones like the acid trap, which kills any enemy, and dissolves the body so others don’t find it. The major new aspect of these is that we no longer just find them, we have to craft them from raw marerials found in the levels. This was a really good idea, since hunting for materials gives another reason to explore the locations. And explore we can, since compared the the first game, the levels are bigger, and less linear with more paths. Apart from doing secondary objectives and collecting materials, there are also so-called Tokens to collect. This is also better than in the first game, since there we had to collect all of them to get rewards, but now we get some xp even for getting half of them. Another reason to thoroughly look around the levels.

I mentioned xp: the small rpg system from the first game returns, allowing us to upgrade Styx’s abilities from the experience points we get from completing objecitves. Most of these are actual, meaningful addition to the gameplay, and some of them are quite clever. For example, one ability allows us to craft a clone cocoon, which can be thrown and it spawns a clone at the point of impact. Another ability allows us to teleport into our clone. Combining these we can significantly increase our mobility, which I felt was cool.

So the gameplay is really fine, with one exception: there are two bossfights. You kinda have to use stealth in those too, but you can’t save, and it’s easy to die, so they end up being quite annoying, although having the right abilities can help a lot. I rarely encountered bugs, only one where I had to reload a save to be able to complete a secondary objective. I’d also mention objective markers. The game is designed around them, so you have to use them, otherwise you can’t really find where to go. I don’t consider this a problem, even though it would’ve been better to have, like, a map and compass or something.

The story was entertaining as well, although not as good as in the first game, but kept me interested until the end. There I received a big slap unfortunately, since the game ends in a massive cliffhanger, and there’s no Styx 3, so that’s kinda disappointing. The writers tried to be funny in this, and while the fourth wall breaking humor was pretty bad, the rest of game managed to make me smile often, despite the humor being quite crass and juvenile. Styx is an a**hole, but he’s an entertaining a**hole, at least he was for me.

All in all, the game is a big improvement over Master of Shadows, and in my opinion is actually a good stealth game. I’d recommend it to anyone who likes the genre.

review:
This game is the second styx game, it is mainly stealth style game.
I am using "mainly" because the play style can depend on difficulty, if you play on Goblin difficulty and above, you have no choice but to go stealth, because the twice-your-size enemies will kill you instantly if they caught you.
That's actually what i like about this game,  like the first part the stealth game play is what you enjoy here, you have several options, paths and skills to get the job done, leaving you to do it in your style.
But like the first game, the story is not that engaging , i would say it is even worse, i finished the game in nearly 18hr, so you will probably get some decent play time, but it is all quest style,  after finishing the game you realize how shallow is the story, no surprises , no twists , shallow characters, including even styx.
Anyway if you liked the first game , you will probably like this one as well , it is nearly the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320444374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1603531829}
review:
Just completed this stealth masterpiece. To be frank, this was my first stealth game. I've played other games like Splinter Cell etc. where I used to aim for stealth but it was not mandatory. This was a different game for me. 

Reading all the reviews, I was a bit skeptical regarding the game but it turned out to be fine. 

The maps are intricately designed, straight out of Tolkien, and there are a plethora of ways to complete an objective. Even while watching a walkthrough, the routes I have taken, was unique. This again is a novel feature. 
Once you understand the thought process behind creating the the character Styx and how he respond to the world, his actions and dialogues fall into place which was deemed by many as irksome. 

Ofcourse, there is a chink in the fluid motions of Styx (compared to AC) and the AI is not that great. But if you could overlook that, this game gives you a gripping story and unique gameplay. 

My ultimate suggestion, go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970616511', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 2100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2100, 'last_played': 1603490521}
review:
A really good stealth game with lots of options in regards to how you want to play. The levels are vertically fun. It is similar to the first Styx game, but the controls have been improved. The story is meh, but considering the ending that is probably a good thing and there is no need to have played the first game to play this one.

What the game does not do well is the aspect about stealing stuff. While there are some things you need to take and the game also have tokens you can collect for extra credit on the mission. You wont get the clepto vibe you might have gotten via other games like the Thief series. The port to PC also has some issues. Mouse lag, fixed via turning off vsync, mouse sensitivity is too low, fixed via setting ingame to max and adding a higher dpi profile on your mouse software or increasing the Windows mouse movement and bloom from hell that does not have an option, but you can turn off via .ini edit. Just search the forums for it because its not the regular .ini edit, but a Unreal Engine .ini edit where you need to add stuff. Ironically the game looks allot better with bloom off. 

Overall a game one should consider if one likes stealth games because its pretty good and there are few modern options out there. The game has a decent price during sales as well. One of the few games I actually 100%ed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052021468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4460, 'last_played': 1603228336}
review:
Once again revisiting this game to accrue missing achievements as with Styx: Master of Shadows, Styx: Shards of Darkness did not disappoint. I had fun playing through the story a second time, having just finished the previous game in the series. The narrative picks up right where it left off with a "green plague" outbreak after Styx's prior adventure, but takes off in a new direction aimed at political war between the elves and dwarfs.

The game introduces new enemies and new mechanics and skills, and does so fluidly, without muddying up what we knew and loved from the first game. New skills open up new ways to tackle familiar problems, and new enemies bring on new challenges in how you play the game, whether you choose to sneak around unseen or unleash bloody murder across the map.

If you've played and enjoyed Styx: Master of Shadows, I can promise you'll enjoy the sequel of Styx: Shards of Darkness. It's not entirely necessary to have played the first game in order for this game's narrative to make sense, but there will be occasional holes where you might wonder what happened before or what's being referenced in a fourth-wall-breaking joke. Having played through both games fully twice each, I strongly recommend this game to fans of stealth-based game-play and to those new to stealth games who might be looking for one of the better-made games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041169995', 'num_games_owned': 1051, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1622184436}
review:
[i]Так как в Стиме отсутствует возможность оставлять нейтральные отзывы, то, для баланса добра и зла, света и тьмы, мух и котлет, и вот этого всего, приходится писать отзывы отрицательные.[/i]

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Натужный сиквел[/h1]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/242640/]Styx: Master of Shadows[/url], первая игра серии, являл собой приквел крайне неудачно реализованной и оттого малоизвестной игры [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/216910/]Of Orcs and Men[/url]. Он рассказывал закрученную историю о том, откуда этот самый Стикс взялся, раскрывал его циничный характер и пристрастия.
И вот тут кроется основная проблема Styx: Shards of Darkness - разработчикам больше нечего нам сказать, всё уже было сказано. Но народ просит добавки, поэтому приходится выдавливать какую-то историю о мутном кварце, никак не соотносящуюся как с историей оригинала, так и со следующей хронологически Of Orcs and Men.
Следить за историей банально не интересно. Настолько, что с началом новой миссии я напрочь забывал, что и зачем мы делали в прошлой. Многие люди играют в игры ради игрового процесса. Я же играю ради истории. И, думается мне, я не одинок, раз все эти стримеры стали так популярны. Поэтому скучный сюжет для меня фактически ставит крест на игре.

А теперь о том, почему этот отзыв нейтральный.
Первая часть, как мы помним, страдала от проблем управления: о, это аккуратное примеривание к краю с резким поворотом в падении, чтобы успеть ухватиться за уступ! Здесь же всё выполнено на пять с плюсом! Исправлены все баги, графика подтянута до современного на момент выхода уровня, механики отточены до блеска.
Пожурить разработчиков можно разве что за пропавшую возможность подбирать тела с пола, находясь на балюстраде балкона, что не позволяет невозбранно сбрасывать их в бездну в непредусмотренных для того местах. Но будем считать, что это была техническая недоработка движка оригинала.

Подводя итог: технически качественная, но совершенно бессмысленная для серии игра. Если вы любите стэлсы за геймплей - поиграть можно. Если же вам, как и мне, важна история, то будет скучно.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972146100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1603160062}
review:
Styx is a classic stealth game with a colourful protagonist. Styx is similar to Thief and Dishonoured, but has its own thing going for it. Great multi-storied level designs, fun thieving abilities at your disposal, with multiple and randomized objectives for replayability. It's fun to scout out a level and find your objectives, enemies get progressively harder to beat, and the fantasy setting is nice. The game has a few annoying bugs, so look up the mission 3 bug if you get stuck, but otherwise it's definitely worth a play. Controls feel more polished than the first game. 

I recommend Styx to fans of the stealth genre.
