author: {'steamid': '76561197966935176', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1602646578}
review:
Solid stealth, mostly consistent AI, lots of fun puking in stuff.

A lot of negative reviews talk about how after the first half of the game, the second half is all replaying the same initial levels with more guards/objectives. This is true, but it's well done and works with the story. I would love to see another Styx game with 100% unique levels throughout the story, but it's a small gripe when the sandboxes built here are really well done. 

I'm not a "good player" by any stretch, and put in roughly 18 hours to beat the game on Goblin difficulty. I can't say I enjoyed every minute of it as there were more reloads for me than deaths in dark souls 3, but the gameplay is fun and fair. Later in the game I was disappointed with the number of armored enemies I couldn't murder, but it added a lot of difficulty and made me think like a goblin. I'm always happy when games can make me change my style and I end up trying new things.

Styx is written well but after the first few levels I had to turn off his post-death taunts. Yeah, they're humorous but after a while just repeated too much. Don't fail as much as me and this is a non-issue. The tools you're provided are fun and the mechanics are creative. I enjoyed killing guards, which is penalized for mercy badges but I still finished the game with more than enough skill points for everything I wanted. If I played this "right" I'd go back through and kill only objective targets. The focus on being sneaky is 10/10.

Anyway... if you love stealth sandbox games you're doing yourself a disservice by skipping this. Played well on kb+m and only a few small bugs. I hope this studio does more. Cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020492003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1602679012}
review: Bought this game 3 years ago and couldn't push through it till now. As soon as I launched it 3 years earlier, I didn't feel the same buzz compared to Master of Shadows so left it till now when I finished it finally. And it's nothing special. Yes, Master of shadows was buggy, messy game, but the stealth was actually decent. The story had a surprising twist and if you got more interested in it you could search the internet for Styx's lore. Here the stealth and the story are kinda garbage. I literally W-ed my way through sections I should've been seen or used some distraction or become invisible in order to pass by, but the AI is so dumb that most of the time I didn't need to do any of these things. And I played on the hardest difficulty. Overall it's pretty "meh" game, with repeated uninspired levels. If you don't have a stealth game to play, give it a shot, but otherwise wait for a sale, cuz it's kinda disappointing after the first game. I hope they make a third game on a different engine with better story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350390467', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1831, 'last_played': 1629052292}
review:
A game that gives you many options. You can run and try to destroy them all, or sneak around like an invisible shadow. I enjoy how many ways you have to get to the desired end. Will he choose the path and not suit you? Never mind, there will probably be three more nearby, you just need to find them.

You have the skills, the tools and the trick. The game fascinated me, and did not disappoint me. You don't have a completely open world, but you can really go almost anywhere, which will open up possibilities for you to play the game.

For people who enjoy games where you can't be seen, but also for players who like to drown someone in acid, it's a great choice.

review:
Very good stealth game. Perfect atmosphere and badass Styx... but all this if you play solo. Coop feels like the game was planed to be single player all the time, but once it was almost done somebody decide "lets add coop there, but you have only 24hrs for this task.." There are 0 point to play coop. Its terrible. It brakes everything. Its not about game crashes - no. Im about how enemies patrol, talk to each other etc.. The only coop mech there - respawn on death... in stealth game.. rly? And you cant rly save...
Anyway as the solo stealth game its 10/10... as a coop stealth its 0/10. Still highly recommend buy and play solo - worth it for sure. Just never ever play coop :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197979542498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1602104598}
review:
For all the Coop players: if you never played this game and liked it, dont buy/play it for its coop-mode. You'll get frustrated like me and my bro. 

Beautiful game world, stealth-game with some assassinations and stealing in a middle-age fantasy setting. Great idea!

Played and bought this game w/ my dude to play in online-coop. #
Hint: When you disconnect, all your saves are gone. nice!

The gameplay is clunky and works imo not as it should be. you die all the time, because the gameworld repells you or you character does not what you want him to do. Online-Coop has lag and sometimes the gameworld the joined player sees is not what happens for the host (Guards facing diffrent directions, you cant move in one direction).

Story/plot is acceptable. Main Character is not the charming one. I dont like him. But thats a matter of opinion. 

TL;DR: The idea of the game is brilliant, the implementation is awefull.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156635592', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2000, 'last_played': 1601638449}
review:
Великолепная игра в своем жанре, одна из лучших на данный момент.ЕСЛИ ВЫ ЛЮБИТЕ СТЕЛС ИГРЫ, СОВЕТУЮ БРАТЬ НЕ РАЗДУМЫВАТЬ!!1!
 Игра выжимает из небогатого повествованием мира максимум путем грамотной подачи сюжета, неплохо построенного геймплея, гениального дизайна локаций и музыкой.
Плюсы:
- Игра имеет в себе элементы всех известных и самых популярных игр жанра СТЕЛС (причем не того, что сейчас принято называть этим жанром, типа Plague Tale или The Last of Us, а именно суровый хардкорный АНАЛЬНЫЙ СТЕЛС). Здесь тебе и механика незаметности в тени из серии Thief, издавание шума для привлчения внимания из старых MGS, магия и мана-пул из Dishonored (причем игра даже сама себя на эту тему выстёбывает в первой же миссии после пролога).
- Сюжет не в ущерб геймплею. Сюжет в игре для галочки и не создает перед игроком никаких психологических барьеров. Хочешь мастерски крадись, хочешь жестоко всех убивай, все равно ты поступишь как Гоблин. Когда Стикс в очередной раз ломает 4ю стену, обращаясь лично к Вам посреди миссии, вас это даже в какой-то момент перестает удивлять (хотя после первых смертей в прологе я серьезно извинялся перед Стиксом, который ругал меня в заставке)
- Ачивки. В конце каждой миссии можно набрать 3 достижения - за скорость, тишину, милосердие и собранные монетки (по 10 на локации). Если не получилось - всегда можно переиграть миссию и забрать оставшийся жетон. По настоящему оценить механики игры я смог только пройдя все миссии на золото за время (по 15-25 мин на миссию, занимавшую по 1-1,5 часа), и я крайне благодарен игре за то, что меня на этот подвиг смотивировала.
_ Стикс. Стикс как антигерой очень вписывается в сеттинг игры, своего рода дарк-фэнтэзи, где все самые типичные представители фэнтэзийной фауны как минимум мудаки, а как максимум заслуживают смерти. Циничный злорадный гоблин-наркоман, который заботится только о себе (хотя и допускает местами сентиментальность по отношению к таким же как он "ракашам"(оркский язык кста)), очень доставляет, вознаграждая едким комментарием о мире игрока, который выбрал нелинейный путь и подслушал разговор стражи в дальнем конце карты.

Минусы:
- Игра уж очень похожа на Styx:Master of Shadows. Она стала удобнее, чем предыдущая часть, но в целом ключевые механики игры не изменились. Мы получили продолжение предыдущей игры, по больше части. А хотелось чего-то большего.
- Линейный сюжет. Опять же игра не про сюжет, но хотелось бы в миссиях, где есть разные пути прохождения, хотя бы другую интересную катсцену.
- Боссфайты, целых два. В стелс-игре. ЗАЧЕМ?!
- Геймдевам, придумавшим фрагменты в миссиях, где нужно проходить полосу препятствий из смертельных ловушек уготован отдельный котел в аду

review:
是一个非常不错的游戏，内容很丰富。可以双人联机，但很难匹配到人，得邀请好友。

以潜行刺杀为主，但必要时也可以用袖箭等快速击杀敌人，对于重甲单位可以使用陷阱或者破坏吊灯砸死，躲避矮人有遮盖气味的药水，砂砾可以直接击坠毒蜂。想完成成就选择不击杀敌人的话也能用毒箭让守卫腹泻创造机会，或者用克隆体引走敌人。
对于锁住的门可以消耗开门工具，也可以按X发出声响吸引敌人来开门。

技能对游戏的帮助很大，操作克隆哥布林时母体隐身和隐身时2m内其他哥布林隐身搭配可以进行简单的无消耗隐身；投掷克隆蛋配合重生技能可以起到类似闪现的效果，方便绕开守卫或者到难以到达的地点；道具制作相关的技能里可以解锁一把击杀回复能量的武器，配合隐身可以更轻松的击杀聚集在一起的守卫。（用击杀回复能量+隐身静止不消耗能量+隐身无声可以在无护甲的守卫堆里乱杀，只要注意不直接接触到守卫就可以）

初期上手具有一定难度，要会侦查地形，有计划的行动。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052602027', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1602184240}
review:
Старый добрый Стикс.

В первую часть я играл давно, поэтому мог что-то подзабыть, но мне кажется, что глобально кроме системы прокачки ничего не изменилось.
Немного смущает ветка боевых навыков, которая есть, но совершенно не нужна:
1. На высоких уровнях сложности половина её бесполезна, потому что парирование не работает.
2. За прохождение уровней без убийств дают больше очков опыта.

В остальном отличная игра.

review:
в этой игре вас отпиздят 
-Эльфы
-Люди
-Стражники(люди н оне ссука  не люди)
-Гиганты (бляди с острым нюхом)
-и все остальные элементы интерьера 
за монетку в этой игре вы превратитесь в кусок пидараса 
крафт здесь есть но сука пока 2 вещи стрела и зелька 
пойдем дальше окрытые локи делай что хочешь главное не сдохни (с последнем кста удачи)
ну и в конце тебя еще и гоблин обматерит

review:

Ive seen it tons. but the game is solid otherwise. wall grappling on par with PoP/AC games, Stealth on Par with Thief, And Decent VO.  I Enjoyed this so much That I am looking at the previous Styx Titles. 

7.5/10 a Pretty good stealth game

author: {'steamid': '76561198068639706', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1601172777}
review:
I hate to give this a negative review because I absolutely loved the first Styx, but ultimately I'm not having fun with this second installment. This is because what made the first game such a good game is arguably completely missing from the second one, and that is the godly level design. The first game had such amazing levels: non-linear, multiple vertical layers, immersive. The first two levels of Styx SoD are ultra linear and literally feel like a Super Mario game. 

The setting and story is also far less compelling and just does not suck you in. Styx is now a cartoon character that talks to the screen, the immersion is completely dead.

12 hours in I'm pretty bored and do not want to continue, whereas I played the crap out of the first one, despite it's technical flaws.

TLDR: this is Super Mario. Just play the first Styx, and pick this one at a heavy discount if you really liked the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056064223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2113, 'last_played': 1601124477}
review:
"Styx: Shards of Darkness" est un jeu d'infiltration très similaire à son prédécesseur, "Styx: Master of Shadows". En effet, on y incarne toujours Styx, un gobelin doué dans l'assassinat grâce à sa panoplie d'armes discrètes et de pouvoirs divers et variés. De ce côté-là, le jeu est plus peaufiné que son prédécesseur, offrant davantage de possibilités. L'humour est également davantage présent, Styx détruisant souvent le 4ème mur. Et ce sont malheureusement pratiquement les seuls points qui ont été améliorés. La musique et bande sonore sont de manière générale bien moins marquante que celle du premier jeu, qui était déjà bien discrète. Niveau graphismes, ce jeu est techniquement meilleur, mais MoS avait une bien meilleure utilisation artistique de sa palette (je pense notamment à l'application de la couleur ambré dans le premier jeu qui était presque malsaine par moment). Le scénario est faiblard et prévisible. Concrètement, les elfes noirs sont possédés par de l'ambre contenu dans les gobelins (ce qui est connu du premier jeu) et Styx fout la pagaille (ce qui est attendu). Le level design est décevant, la majorité des ennemis étant pratiquement toujours divisé en deux groupes: ceux qui peuvent être assassinés à la dague et des ennemis plus armés. Les autres antagonistes sont soit peu courants, soit peu intéressants (il est facile de tromper les nains et leur odorat p.ex.), soit les deux (les trolls). Les boss sont presque désagréables à affronter. Enfin, les derniers lieux parcourus sont une copie de missions précédentes en moins efficaces.

Bref, "Styx: Shards of Darkness" est une copie du premier jeu en moins bien. Il reste potable, mais c'est surtout parce que MoS est excellant. Quitte à choisir entre les deux jeu, prenez "Master of Shadows".

author: {'steamid': '76561198055058058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1122, 'last_played': 1600745445}
review:
[h1] Good, but I have some concerns [/h1]

Overall, this is a good game. I enjoyed it. It was challenging in certain parts, but in the ways that I've come to expect from a stealth game. However, I do have a few qualms. First, the length of the game. I played this game for almost 19 hours. That may sound like a lot, but regardless, it didn't feel like it. I took my time, not painstakingly grabbing every collectable, but not speedrunning it either, and it still felt too short. And at the ending, without giving any spoilers, it just sort of ended. There wasn't a resolution of any kind. It's like there was supposed to be DLC for this game with the real ending behind a paywall (which also wouldn't have been great) that just never came out. 

Second, they added to a few mechanics and took away some old ones for this installment in the Styx franchise, but they didn't really add any brand new mechanics, which I was quite disappointed at, and what they did add to (daggers, cloaks, crafting options, skills) didn't do much to incite excitement in me. There were a few cool things, but the new additions were largely underwhelming.

Third, the story. The story of Styx 2 is at best, garbled, and at worst, a series of random levels and cutscenes stitched together in any order. Don't get me wrong, despite my complaints, the gameplay is fun, but it seems like they thought up the story only after they'd finished building all the levels because they needed a reason for Styx to get into these situations in the first place. Another big problem I had with the story is that it couldn't seem to decide on an antagonist. First it was the C.A.R.N.A.G.E. squad, but oh, no, that's disbanded now, then the Guild, but no, they're only in that one village, then the elves, then not the elves, then the elves again.

Finally, the environments. They're all well-designed and layed out, I commend the development team there, but from the look and feel of them, it seems like they just recycled the same old assets they used in Styx 1. The stone hallways of the elven city did little to differentiate themselves from those of the castle of Akenash from the first game. Every inn and tavern felt like every other inn and tavern, first and second game both. I was hoping to see a little more of the world of Styx and that just doesn't happen.

In review of this review, Styx: Shards of Darkness is an enjoyable game if you enjoy stealth games. But don't expect anything innovative. Or really, anything much different from the first game at all, save for a new setting (in name, at least) and a new race. I give it a 6.5/10.

Thanks for reading, and I hope you found this helpful!

review:
An improvement on the original in almost everyway. Styx: Shards of Darkness is one of the greatest hardcore stealth games put out in the last decade. It's an absolute love letter to OG stealth fans. If you enjoyed games like Thief, Dishonored, or Splinter Cell, you will have a good time playing this game.

Only complaints would be some of the humor is just bad, the animations and voice acting are once again hilariously bad, and the story is pretty meh. In terms of sheer gameplay though, Shards of Darkness is a masterpiece. Everything from the level design to the abilities to the movement all comes together beautifully. Buy this game if you're a stealth fan.

review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th][h1]Styx: Осколки тьмы[/h1][/th]
   [/tr]
[/table]

Рекомендация игры: 
[b][i]ПОЛОЖИТЕЛЬНАЯ[/i][/b] / [strike]НЕЙТРАЛЬНАЯ[/strike] / [strike]ОТРИЦАТЕЛЬНАЯ[/strike]


[h1] [b] [i]Вступление[/i] [/b] [/h1]
[quote=ℊዙטȿᎿ ∂aჩᶄȵeȿȿ]
Когда лев тpаxнyт в своем логове, а ты тем временем познал свое происхождение. Настало время новых приключений о бестрашном зеленом гоблине по имени Стикс. Нуу поехали...
[/quote]

[h1] [b] [i]Об игре / Личное мнение[/i] [/b] [/h1]
На этот раз события игры разворачиваются в древнем городе Карнгар, где Стиксу предстоит выкрасть таинственный посох у темных эльфов, который наделен могучей силой, способной превращать зеленых гоблинов в фарш.
Казалось бы ничего сложного в этом задании нет, но когда за этим артефактом охотится нечто, способное изменять внешность, то тут даже великому мастеру теней придется использовать все свои способности, чтобы хоть как-то быть на шаг впереди. 

В отличии от своего предшественника, на мой взгляд, [b] [i]Styx: Shards of Darkness [/i] [/b]получилась более сочной в плане графики, эпичной и просто отличным продолжением о маленьком, харизматичном зеленом гоблине.
Первое, что бросается в глаза, так это дизайн уровней и подача сюжета уже в более качественных кат сценах, где можно смело сказать, что разработчик проделал, вполне, не плохую работу.

Сама сюжетная линия в игре также закрученная, но если сравнивать сюжетку с первой частью, то я бы выбрал ее предшественника, т.к. там история имела намного больше неожиданных поворотов и была менее предсказуемой в отличии от [b] [i]Shards of Darkness. [/i] [/b]

[u][b] [i]В итоге, за что мы больше всего можем полюбить Styx: Shards of Darkness, так это за:[/i] [/b][/u]
[list]
[*][i]Красивый дизайн уровней[/i]
[*][i]Хорошую графику[/i]
[*][i]Отличную атмосферу с мрачными оттенками[/i]
[*][i]Геймплей, который впитал в себя больше возможностей и о нем конечно же я расскажу чуть ниже[/i]
[*][i]Качественное муз/звук сопровождение[/i]
[/list]
История разделена на 9 глав не считая пролога и в целом напоминает первую часть игры в плане прохождения [i](из одной точки добраться в другую и пожеланию выполнить какие-нибудь второстепенные задания),[/i] но здесь это выглядит намного интересней. И да, каждая глава разделена на два уровня.

Что же нас ждет в геймплейной части игры?


[h1] [b] [i]Геймплей[/i] [/b] [/h1]
Стикс знает свое дело, а кто знаком с первой частью игры - знают свое и уже скорее всего догадались, что какого-то грандиозного нововведения в геймплейную часть игры здесь особо нет.
Игровой процесс по прежнему опирается на стелс прохождение, преодоления различных препятствий и решения простеньких головоломок.
Открытое столкновение с противниками никто не запрещал, но вы сами понимаете, что такой вариант обычно заканчивается не в нашу пользу. Тем более здесь мы также будем получать знаки отличия (медали) в каждой главе:
 [list]
[*][b]ТЕНЬ[/b] [i](поднято тревог)[/i]
[*][b]СКОРОСТЬ[/b] [i](игра на время)[/i]
[*][b]МИЛОСЕРДИЕ[/b] [i](убивали ли вы врагов или нет)[/i]
[*][b]ВОР[/b] [i](сколько сперли жетонов)[/i]
[/list]
[i]... и конечно же за это вы будете получать очки, которые можно будет потратить на новые умения и способности Стикса.[/i]


[u][b] [i]УБЕЖИЩЕ / НАВЫКИ / РЕМЕСЛО[/i] [/b][/u]
И так, как и ранее после каждой главы мы будем посещать убежище Стикса и их кстати будет несколько.
В убежище мы можем приобрести новые навыки, заняться новым делом (ремесло - создание предметов) и даже поменять костюмчик нашего гоблина, а также перепройти уже завершенные главы (для достижения лучших результатов).

[u][b] [i]Навыки делятся на 5 веток:[/i] [/b][/u]
 [list]
[*][i]Скрытность[/i]
[*][i]Убийство[/i]
[*][i]Алхимия[/i]
[*][i]Клонирование[/i]
[*][i]Восприятие[/i]
[/list]
... каждая ветка имеет по 8 умений и того в игре 40 умений плюс к этому есть еще одна доп. способность.
Как на мой взгляд, здесь есть жесткий минус, который заключается в том, что мы можем сколько угодно сбрасывать навыки и за это от нас ничего не требуют. 

[u][b] [i]Ремесло (New)[/i] [/b][/u]
К ремеслу относится создание всякого снаряжения при помощи различных ингредиентов, собранных в ходе прохождения.
 [list]
[*][i]Различные дротики[/i]
[*][i]Флаконы[/i]
[*][i]Бомбы и т.п.[/i]
[/list]
[u][b] [i]Гардероб (New)[/i] [/b][/u]
В гардеробе мы можем сменить оружие и костюмы. Я прошел игру на 100% и скорее всего это полный комплект всего гардероба.
 [list]
[*][i]4 кинжала + голые руки[/i]
[*][i]5 костюмов[/i]
[/list]
[u][b] [i]КАК И РАНЕЕ (ИЗ ПРОШЛОГО ОБЗОРА)[/i] [/b][/u]

Помимо этого Стикс наделен уникальными способностями такими как:

[b] [i]Невидимость[/i] [/b] - [i]на короткое время наш герой становится полностью невидимым для врагов.[/i]

[b] [i]Призыв клона[/i] [/b] - [i]Стикс способен призвать клона (точнее выблевать его), которым мы также можем управлять. Клоном мы можем отвлекать врагов, пролазить в узкие решетки и использовать его как наживку. Если приобрести соответствующие навыки, то при помощи клона можно устанавливать ловушки. К примеру, посадив клона в шкаф или сундук он автоматически поглотит проходящего рядом противника. Это крайне полезно для тех врагов, которых Стиксу не под силу убить.[/i]

Устранять врагов мы можем разными способами (обычными убийствами, убийствами с высоты или с карниза, толчком или же подделывать несчастные случаи - скинув клетку или люстру на чердак врагам.

[u][b][i]КООПЕРАТИВНЫЙ РЕЖИМ (New)[/i][/b][/u]
То, чего не хватало в Master of Shadows. Всю сюжетную линию мы можем пройти в совместном режиме.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036104524', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1600502933}
review:
М-м-м, вы тоже любите, когда по отзывам в "Стиме" ничего не понятно об игре? Когда одни пишут, играть легко, другие — сложно.
Сразу оговорюсь, я не фанат сложных стелсов, стелсов вообще да и любых сложных игр в принципе. Стелсовые уровни в "Пэйдэй" до сих пор снятся в кошмарах. Но кривая "Of Orcs and Men" запала в душу героями, музыкой и атмосферой, так что спин-оффы я решил не пропускать, хоть оба "Стикса" всё ещё и являются очень сложными для меня играми. По сравнению с первой частью "SoD" стала и легче, и сложнее одновременно. Знаю, странное сравнение, но мне вспоминаются "Как достать соседа": во второй части можно было попасться на глаза не один раз, а трижды, но само "минирование" стало извращённее и даже требовать от себя повторного использования.
Легче стало с расходниками поскольку появился крафт. Прокачка зачем-то стала мудрёнее, но она вполне доступна: если вам стыдно играть криворуко и вы стараетесь выбить все медальки (ну, кроме жетонов), то вкачаете чуть ли не всё, что есть в наличии. Появились саботажные кувшины, отвлекающие сладкие парочки охранников, приклеившихся к полу, а вкачанные клоны теперь ходячие респауны, что технически делает Стикса бессмертным. Ну и дизайн уровней стал гораздо более открытым и нетуннельно-подземельно-канализационно-коридорным, так что с медалькой "тень" попроще.
Компенсация упрощения тут же. Сложнее стало драться: достаточно парировать один удар для победы и убийства, но промах будет стоить заметно больше здоровья, чем было в первой игре. Против семи-восьми пропусков удара в "MoS" здесь хватает трёх, реже четырёх ран для лицезрения сценки с возмущающимся с того света Стиксом. Замечать стражники вас стали ещё быстрее, как ни старайся, хоть у уровня "сокрытия во тьме" и появилась аж целая шкала на кинжале. Причём если в первой части дуэль могла быть предпочтительней в том числе и потому, что нападает на тебя едва ли один хер, то в "SoD", такое ощущение, чтобы всполошенный гардиан ставит на уши всю карту. Это сурово осложняет жизнь любителям играть грубо и брать некоторые комнаты штурмом. Тарабисы, кстати, теперь ваншотят, если угодить им в жвалы. Завершу абзац усложнением задач. Уже не везде требуется только дойти в точку Бэ: от игрока требуется подслушать разговор или пройти серию архитектурно-ловушечных испытаний в духе "Принца Персии". Как-то так.

Самый крупный минус — и опять с сюжетом не пойми что. За три игры эльфы меняют внешность и пропорции тела и так, и этак. То они чуют по запаху Стикса, то нет, но зато уже гномы это умеют. Финал "SoD" открыт, ну спасибо, блин. И самое трагичное то, что мы так и не получили и, чувствую, не получим полноценный сиквел "Of Orcs and Men". Да сделайте вы уже хоть тупой слэшер, да даже соулс-лайк, продолжающий историю Аркайла и Стикса, хоть что-нибудь. Это, блин, просто обидно. Денег студии вроде накинули, учитывая, что у "SoD" впервые есть красивые кат-сцены. Так в чём же дело?

author: {'steamid': '76561198035007015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1600211019}
review:
Same as the first really, which works as the first was great.
A proper stealth game where being seen gets you killed, not gets you into a 6 on 1 fight you can probably win. 
Difficult but the right kind where when you die you don't feel cheated, you just feel you could have done better.
Seen some negatives about it re-using locations but they're so big and you have so many options on how to get through them that you don't really feel like you're playing through padding. The change up in enemies when you do means you have to play them totally different anyway.
Looks great, plays great and Styx is an awesome and very funny character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198828834459', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1685028891}
review:
Игра хорошая, рекомендую. Играть интересно как проходя сюжет в одиночку, так и с другом. Особо класно планировать какие-то тактики по прохождению (ибо это стелс экшон). Прикольно слушать комментарии этого гоблина во время игры и на экране смерти)) Конечно системные требования немного кусаются, но даже на моем ноутбуке на средне-низких играется приятно. 

По поводу цены. 
Если брать за полную цену, то точно завышено. Но если попасть на акции, или еще лучше на распродажу, то можно урвать почти с 80% скидкой! 

По акции игра стоит около 60-70 гривен (120 - 140 руб), и как по мне, очень даже приятная цена для такой игры.

Играл также в первую часть (Master Of Shadows), и по геймплею очень похоже. Так же доступны навыки, два вида убийства (тихое и громкое) и их разновидности типо убийство из укрытия и убийство в полете. Прокачка интерестная, но вынуждает попотеть.

У игры конечно же есть свои недочеты, но вцелом, мне игра понравилась. 9 из 10.

review:
Styx ist definitiv ein Charakter, den man sofort mag. Er hat immer einen lockeren Spruch auf den Lippen, und man kann sich ein Lachen selten verkneifen.

Die typische Fantasy-Klischees werden auf den Kopf gestellt. Die (Dunkel)Elfen sind hier die Bösen, die Goblins die Guten. Das ist sehr erfrischend.

Ein Problem habe ich mit dem Ende. Das Ende ist offen. Das an sich ist nicht das Problem. Aber das Ende kommt so schnell, daß man sich fragt: "War es das schon?" Ich habe etwa 9 Stunden für den Durchgang gebraucht. Und dabei war ich wirklich langsam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198440616706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1601053279}
review:
挺不错的潜行类游戏（前期可以试试单挑无双，跑酷过图，后面几乎就是纯潜行类游戏了，因为被发现后敌人都可以对你一击必杀XD）
后面的难度对于初见者还是挺高的，比如可以听声辨位的虫子or较近范围能直接嗅到你踪迹的矮人or发现你直接法杖远距离直接控死你的魔导师or几场boss战（对，你没听错，潜行游戏里有boss战）挑战难度都不一般....所以建议一定要刷够技能点点出你比较顺手的流派过关
我就比较喜欢克隆分身流，无论是克隆体死亡产生烟雾弹效果还是本体死亡可以直接传送到克隆体身边重生又或者是两位一体同时操纵还可以各自无限隐身，跑酷过图都是相当给力跟省心。。。。。不过潜行流和炼金术士流也挺不错的。前者保证你无伤无动静通过，后者可以利用各种道具击杀无法打败的敌人或者制作工程道具或者外观武器，而且后期地图还有装备收集要素（无限隐身斗篷跟琥珀匕首）
每一关结算技能点，一方面看你主线跟支线任务完成情况，另一方面还要看你的游戏风格（没有触发警报，没有击杀敌人，限时快速通关，地图要素全收集）要是全做到的话，一关能拿到的技能点相当多，养成习惯的话后期几乎能把所有系的技能书都点出来，那个时候完全体真正的暗影大师冥河styx就出现了。
玩起来虽然还是比较爽的，适合我这种喜欢纯潜行玩家
但是游戏有丢丢烂尾，而且虚幻引擎的地图也没有利用好，地图设计挺好看的，但是玩家一般很难去全部探索看看（地图塞那么多敌人，杀都杀不过来），手感也有点奇怪 起跳判定做的不宽松 而且敌人ai时好时坏的 过场动作有点僵硬 技能树也就1代翻版的感觉......整体游玩下来  冥河：黑暗碎片有点像第一代冥河：暗影大师的加强版 除了模型纹理 整体进步不大

而且最最最重要的是..............................................没有中文，没有中文耶！！！！注定在中国就是个冷门小众的边缘游戏了，有点可惜了，游戏质量还是不错的
当然不用担心没有中文这种事，我们有亲切的3大妈汉化补丁嘛，还是照常愉快游玩
可惜这一作貌似卖的还没上作高，也不知道续作还能不能在有生之年见到了......毕竟接下来估计就该讲讲关于《妖兽与人类》游戏里的一些剧情了（妖兽与人类是比较早的游戏了，里面主角是一个兽人和伙伴哥布林，哥布林就是现在的冥河STYX，相当于冥河这两作是妖兽与人类游戏的前传）

游戏真的不错，ign打6分，我能给打个8分左右

author: {'steamid': '76561198004473981', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1600031726}
review:
Вышло короче и слабее предыдущей части в плане сюжета, который обрывается непонятно на чём. Впечатления немного смешанные, будто последнюю четверть игры просто вырезали. Цельно не выглядит, к сожалению. Игровой процесс изменений не сильно претерпел, что хорошо. Стелсить было приятно, Локации большие и с разными подходами, хотя, как и в предыдущей части — по сюжету приходится возвращаться в старые места, ну да и ладно. Запомнились подколки в сторону Dishonored и Thief. Да и вообще, это же Стикс. Всё ещё. Пока.

Так-то всё было здорово, но... ожидал большего, концовка игры не удовлетворила совсем, хотя в процессе игры ни к чему вопросов особо не было, удовольствие получалось и лилось как янтарь в горло.

review: I love everything about this game; the atmosphere, the humor, the level designs, how sneaking works... Except the controls. What is a total dealbreaker for me, is how Styx does not automatically grab onto ledges he drops off. How he can even jump straight up from a ledge, but miss it on the way down!? When I die in this game it is 90% of the times ledge-control-releated deaths whre I plummet to Styxes death (and 10% of natural causes). I read about holding down shift... Nope it does not work. I'll update if I find a solution that works. But so far its a total failure that many other games solved without a problem (Assasins creed, Splinter Cell, Uncharted, Prince of persia, Dishonored....).

review:
Je me suis amusé avec ce jeu. Il m'a diverti, alors mission accomplie! Je le recommande.
Les problèmes du premier jeu sont résolus et le visuel est bien réussi. Ils ont réussi à créer un petit univers propre à Styx qui, bien qu'emprunté à tout ce qu'on retrouve dans le genre "fantaisie", réussit tout de même à se forger sa propre identité. L'arbre de compétence est bien développé, on a un petit choix d'équipement, on a des objectifs de réussite (temps, clémence, etc.) et on a plusieurs approches différentes pour compléter chaque mission. J'attends le 3e opus, en souhaitant encore plus d'équipements, un meilleure AI, et une voix différente pour le personnage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012891893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1598816496}
review:
Ez sokkal jobban tetszett, mint az előző rész. Viszont sajnálatomra rövidebb is lett.
A zenék jobbak, érdekesebbek lettek. Végre kaptunk normális átvezetőket is, amitől jobban el lehet merülni a játék történetében, ami viszont már nem annyira érdekes. Styx karaktere fenomenális, de kaphatott volna egy drámai szálat is, amitől még közelebb kerülhetett volna hozzánk. Mert számomra a folyamatosan beszólogatós és viccelődő kobold nem túl megnyerő. Mutassák meg egy sebezhető oldalát is. Nézzétek el nekem, de szívesen láttam volna ezt a koboldot sírni.

Igazából egy problémán kívül nagyon élveztem a játékot és ez a hiba az utolsó főellenségnél volt. Ha annak a pályának az elején meghalsz (elég könnyű "one-hit"), nem a szint elejére, hanem a rejtekhelyre dob vissza, amit így újra betölt a játék. Majd aztán vissza a pályára, ahol meghaltál és BUMM újabb töltőképernyő fogad. Ez nem tudom, hogy nem tűnt fel a készítőknek. Ami nem tetszett még az a "cliffhanger" a végén. Egy normálisabb lezárásnak jobban örültem volna.
Mert így most kénytelen vagyok megvárni a következő részt, mi viszont nem biztos, hogy el fog készülni.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084726494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1990, 'last_played': 1598806826}
review:
This is a decent follow up to the original.  It fixes many of the problems but does not expand the gameplay in any significant way.  A few tips for the devs if they ever make a sequel and a highlight of issues with the current game.

The game could use about 5x more dialogue.  The dialogue is sparse and full of non-sequiturs and does absolutely the minimal to move the story forward.  It would be nice to have more of a sandbox approach if they were ever to get the budget.  This might require adding friendly NPCs and having locations where Styx was not considered a threat by the locals but that could be interesting.
If a sequel were similar I would want to see WAY MORE variation in NPC behavior and strategies.  The AI need to be smarter which would give the player more opportunities to fool them and so forth.  As it stands every NPC basically reacts exactly the same so the strategy never really changes even with the addition of some new abilities.  The result is this game gets really repetitive really quickly and then halfway through starts recycling the maps  .. which only makes it worse....
I love the character and concepts and I hope there is a sequel with a much larger budget to do Styx justice.

Edit: the ending of the game was really bad....

author: {'steamid': '76561198007550697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1598549319}
review:
Сыграл во вторую часть "Стикса" сразу же после первой. Честно сказать, по первости был как восторг, так и легкое недоумение. Если восторг был связан с тем, что:  
1) мы снова можем сыграть за полюбившегося нам гоблина, послушать его фразочки и шуточки;
2) улучшенная графика, что возможно рассмотреть все детали, да и радует глаз; 
То второй фактор был связан больше с нововведениями.
Новый геймплей сначала заставлял меня возмущаться (Инвентарь-это отдельная кнопка; Кравфт-теперь можно контролировать кол-во предметов сколько душе угодно, нежели в первой части; Противники-индикатор обнаружения чувствительнее, нежели в первой части), но чем больше я играл, тем сильнее привыкал, и вскоре стал для меня очень удобным ( хотя пополнение жизни и янтаря являлось не очень удобным действием, а так же переключение между предметами в срочных ситуациях) . 
Что касается истории-захватывает. Из первой части плавно перетекает по событиям во вторую. Правда, в конце мне показалось, что некоторые вещи были не досказаны, к примеру: Стикс избавился от зависимости янтаря, как ему обещал Джарак? Что теперь будет со всеми государствами? Эльфы были показаны с другой необычной стороны ( правда я ожидал, что как и в первой эльфы будут огромной проблемой из-за того, что они чуют запах янтаря, но разработчики решили чутка поменять особенности противников). Приятно было  встретить персонажей из первой части, пускай и "временно", знакомых и привычных противников, а так же здорово было "познакомиться" с гномами. Очень порадовало наличие боссов! Огромное удовольствие получил от прохождения уровней с ними: относительная динамика и потрясающая музыка, которая добавляет напряжение событию.
Играл на средней сложности. По сравнению с первой частью игра показалась проще из-за крафта вещей. Если в первой нужно было грамотно экономить вещи, так как ты их мало где найдешь и нужно постараться еще заполучить, то тут найди только припасы и делай сколько хочешь вещей! На время прохождения не жалуюсь, меня устроило, хотя оно и правда короче чем у первой. 
Я доволен, и могу посоветовать игру другим. Лично мне бы было интересно еще откуда все же Стикс к нам пришел, что заставило его стать тем, кем он является? В первой части были предпосылки, что он ранее был орком, но хочется прожить со Стиксом его историю. Я знаю, что была игра " Of Orks and men", не играл в нее, но знаю, что там тоже фигурирует наш любимый гоблин, может быть там как раз и есть его предыстория?
Во всяком случае, большое спасибо за столь здоровскую игру! Рад был поиграть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041485846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1610138746}
review:
HAAAMMER!!!
Nachdem ich den ersten Teil, "Master of Shadows", gespielt habe, war ich mir nicht so sicher, ob ich den zweiten Teil auch spielen will. Mein Fazit, nun da ich das Spiel durch habe:
HAAAAAAAAMMER!!!! Ich würde es am liebsten sofort wieder von vorne anfangen! 

+ Stxy kann um einiges mehr an Zeug sammeln und herumschleppen
+ Schwierigkeitsgrad wächst mit den eigenen Fähigkeiten
+ Grafik Wahnsinn!! Ich konnte mich einige Stunden nur in den ersten Leveln rumtreiben, um alles mögliche zu entdecken
+ überraschende Nebenmissionen, wenn man Wachen zuhört (die stehen dann in Gruppen rum und unterhalten sich)
+ viel zu entdecken (Verstecke, Fähigkeiten, Gegenstände), demnach sollte man sich bei jeder Mission wirklich Zeit lassen, die Häuser zu erkunden
+ Vielfältige Gegner (Menschen, Ritter, Zwerge, Elfen, Käfer)
+ Vielfältige Fähigkeiten, um mit den Gegnern fertig zu werden
+ Endgegner super gemacht! Man kann ihre Bewegungen zwar recht gut erahnen, aber dennoch sind sie ziemlich stark
+ tolle Geschichte!
+ Styx Sprüche sind der Wahnsinn. Selbst wenn man stirbt, kriegt man noch sein Fett weg. :-D
+ Goldharzvision fordert kein Goldharz mehr, sodass man die Wege wirklich gut erkennen kann. Das macht die Entscheidung, welchen Weg man nun nehmen soll, zwar nicht einfacher, aber immerhin kann man zu einer Entscheidung kommen - anders als bei Master of Shadows.
+ zusätzlicher Anreiz: es gibt Medaillen für zusätzliche Pluspunkte (zur Entwicklung von Fertigkeiten), z-B. für Schnelligkeit, Schatten (wenig Alarme ausgelöst) und eine für wenig Morde. Die für Schnelligkeit habe ich allerdings nie erhalten. Das ist evtl. eine Aufgabe für den 2. Durchgang.  :-D
+ Styx hat verschiedene Ausrüstungsgegenstände zur Verfügung (verschiedene Dolche + Umhänge), die auch verschiedene Auswirkungen auf das Spielerlebnis haben. Ich persönlich habe mit der Alchemie-Kluft und dem Goldharz-Dolch gespielt und bin prima klar gekommen. Manche Ausrüstungsteile muss man allerdings im Spiel finden. 
+ Steuerung 100 mal besser als die von "Master of Shadows", alles individuell einstellbar, mit Controller und auch mit Tastatur und Maus spielbar!

Ich liebe dieses Spiel und werde es definitiv nochmal spielen, sobald etwas Zeit vergangen ist. 
Alles in allem ein wunderbares Spiel!! Alle Daumen hoch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198289848754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2915, 'last_played': 1710309863}
review:
This is the first stealth game I have ever played and it was great! I cannot fault a single thing about it.

The story is great, it gets you thinking what the outcome is going to be and drops hints but you don't find out fully until you are almost finished. 

Another awesome thing is there isn't just 1 way to get from point A to point B, it makes the game play very interesting every time you replay a level. Also it isn't just finish the mission then leave, there are extra bits to do and you can go exploring which is awesome.

All the levels look amazing, the whole map in itself is brilliant, getting on top on a building and just admiring the work they put into the game is crazy.

And don't even get me started on the script, its brilliant, Styx with his extreme passive aggressiveness, wit and sarcasm really bring life to the game and makes it more enjoyable to play.

It is definitely worth the time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164236274', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1596921468}
review:
[h1]Resumen de puntuación[/h1]
Parkour/Escalada: 7/10
Historia: 8/10
Escenarios: 7/10
Personaje: 10/10
Habilidades: 6.5/10
Mecánica de armas y armaduras: 6.5/10

[h1]Explicación[/h1]
[b]Escalada[/b]: Una jugabilidad repleta de escalada. La única pega que tengo sobre esto es que hay a veces que se tropieza con el borde y se caer sin tu poder hacer nada.

[b]Historia[/b]: Para una mayor inversión en la historia recomendaría jugar al titulo anterior de la saga, ya que te podrías no enterar del trasfondo de la historia. El juego va sobre nuestro pequeño rakash teniendo locas aventuras.

[b]Escenarios[/b]: Creo que en total hay unos 4 escenarios. Lo único que cambia es la forma de recorrerlos (vuelves al escenario, empezando por el final). Hecho en falta diferentes escenarios y que se vea de fondo el anterior escenario (ya que son los mismos lugares o casi los mismos)

[b]Personaje[/b]: No tengo nada que decir sobre el personaje, con unos buenos toques de humor que le dan mucha personalidad

[b]Habilidades[/b]: Demasiadas habilidades para poder disfrutarlas todas, generalmente te centras en un modo de juego. En mi opinión han intentado poner mucha variedad pero no han restringido el hecho de que tengas que elegir tu estilo de juego. Generalmente vas a utilizar 10 habilidades de 35 aproximadamente

[b]Mecánica de armas y armaduras[/b]: La mecánica me gusta. Pero preferiría que fueras mejorando el arma y la armadura. Además de que algunas armas y armaduras rompen el juego completamente. Como el hacerte invisible y si estas quieto no pierdes ambar + habilidad en la que dañar a alguien recuperas ambar.
En mi opinión, se podría mejorar mucho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082815078', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1679, 'last_played': 1706207812}
review:
[h1] Styx is an imperfect stealth game, but if you can play through it's flaws it can be an enjoyable experience [/h1]

[h1] Story (Spoiler free) [/h1]
Styx himself in the beginning is insufferable, let's not sugarcoat the fact of the matter. Constant references to popular stealth games can be funny, but in this case I feel like it's rather overused and can distract more than break the 4th wall as intended.
Other characters are pretty underdeveloped but make sense, and there are some stand out characters that really make the story pop out.

If you play games for their stories though, don't expect much though, I found it really dissatisfying.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Oh boy. Now this is where I am them most conflicted about my feelings. Gameplay feels fluid when on the ground, but the parkour still is rather rigid and unresponsive. It is not as bad as in Styx Deadly Shadows, but I still, even after 20+ hours didn't get comfortable with it. But other than that, Styx controls awesomely and if you can get a hold of the controls you can start doing some really impressive and wacky stunts.

The AI however, is horrible. This being a stealth game, requires at least a decent AI. In this game it is anything but. I have encountered numerous glitches and bugs that really broke the game and in many cases required a quickload to my previous save. Being stuck in level geometry, in physics objects, not moving until I got close (even after maxing my settings.)

If you can get through the initial barrier of bad AI and bad parkour, this game can be a really fun experience though and anyone who loves stealth, will find something to love about this game.

[h1] Environment and graphics [/h1]

This is by far the biggest improvement from the last game. The graphics and environment are fabulous and spacious, the world is interconnected and vast, even though most of it is empty space.
It is a lot of fun to explore and experiment with all objects and ways to kill the NPCs, the AI can make this either awesome, infuriating, hilarious or mix of the three.

[h1] Should you buy this game? [/h1]
YES, GIVE YOUR MONEY TO CYNIDE SO THEY MAKE STYX 3!

All jokes aside, this game is very imperfect, and can be super infuriating if you don't get used to the jankyness of it. But inside it is a loveletter to stealth as a genre and a fun one at that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004022855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1596853594}

author: {'steamid': '76561198231866648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1621, 'last_played': 1685382028}
review:
Very good stealth game - if you're looking for Hitman equivalent with more engaging plot look no further. (Yes, IO is slacking BIG TIME with the plot lately - Japaneese showed them how to do it with Absolution but all was wasted - @IO: better something than nothing though, keep up the good work!).

review:
Cyanide nous fait encore une fois plaisir ! 
On retrouve la verticalité-complexité jouissive du level design déjà top dans le premier opus, énorme atout comparé aux autres franchises d'infiltration en particulier Hitman.
L'IA n'est pas ouf mais reste correcte (perso à part dans Splinter Cell Blacklist (et encore) les IA du genre n'ont jamais vraiment été à la hauteur, hélas)
La créa graphique super, et le jeu est beau. 
Seul gros défaut : malgré un scénario prenant, l'histoire se termine (en seulement 15h en mode gobelin!!!) en queue de poisson sur un cliffhanger qui laisse plus un goût de "on a pas le temps d'aller plus loin" que "Préparez vous à Styx 3 ça va déchirer des mères".
Ils auraient dû passer moins de temps à rédiger les vannes que Styx te lance quand tu crèves (ce qui reste sympa au demeurant, quand on bloque pas sur un boss)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025522562', 'num_games_owned': 1499, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 1863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1863, 'last_played': 1595362553}
review:
I'm just going to reiterate my review from the first Styx installment.

"If you like platformers and stealth games this is highly recommended. It's a fun game that doen't demand to much of you. Solving the "puzzles" to get past the guards can be done in many different ways raning from luring them away with a sound or a clone, or sneaking past them when you find a spot in their patrol. Or just ambush them and take them out.
It's also fun trying out levels multiple times to see if I can find a better way of clearing the level. The achievements help with that, forcing you to do a no kill run, never spotted or speed run. All demand different tactics and routes to be taken."

But I'm going to add that the skill tree in this game is much more fun to play around with. A lot more options that might fit some levels better than others. But if you always make sure that you get all the skill points before moving to the next level, about halfway through the game you will be able to unlock so many skills that it become quite easy to move through the levels. So for added difficulty I would suggest leaving some SP on the table and not unlock everything.

review: Müthiş bir devam oyunu. İlk oyunu oynamadıysanız önce ona bakmanızı tavsiye diyorum çünkü yeni oyuncu dostu bir oyun değil. Bu oyunu 3 ana başlık altında ele almamız gerek. Hikaye, oynanış mekanikleri ve RPG ögeleri, yapay zeka. Hikaye bakımından biraz zayıf olduğunu söylemek zorundayım eğer ilginizi çeken kurgu ve evreni yok ise sizi kendi içine çekemiyor. Fakat hikayeyi çok kafanıza takmasanız bile oynanabilir. Oyun mekanikleri ve RPG ögelerine gelecek olursak ilk olarak craft eklemiş olmalarına sevindim. Haritayı daha verimli hale getirmişler. Size ilk oyundaki gibi her şeyi bol keseden vermiyorlar. Yetenek ağacını daha efektif hale getirmişler, geliştiğinizi ve oynanış mekaniklerinin değiştiğini hissedebiliyorsunuz. Kendi oyun tarzınızı oluşturmak için elimizde pek çok imkan bulunuyor. Bu konuda eksik olan şey ise tam anlamı ile oyunu bitirmeye yakın gelişmişlik hissini bazı tarzlarda erişemiyebilirsiniz. Son olarak yapay zeka konusunda diyeceğim şu kİ gerçek bir gizlilik oyunu istiyorsanız normal zorluğun üstünde oynayın. çünkü bazı şeyler gerçekçilikten uzaklaşabiliyor. İlk oyunda olan bazı işleri değiştirmiş olmaları ise oyunda büyük bir farklılık yaratmış ama göze batmıyor.

review:
정말 애매한 게임이라고 생각한다. 잠입 액션을 중점으로 본다면 매우 완성도가 높은 게임이라 할 수 있지만 잠입에만 너무 치우쳐 있다고 생각한다. 올클리어 후 전투 특성을 찍어서 해보려고 했으나 잠입이 더 쉬운 것 같다...
결정적으로 부정적 평가를 남기는 이유는 엔딩이 미쳤다... 어벤져스 인피니티 워와 엔드 게임중 인피니티 워만 한 것 같다.

레벨 디자인이나 컨셉이나 모든 면에서 좋지만 다회성 플레이를 하기에는 루즈한 감이 있고 무쌍 플레이를 하기에는 능력이나 그 외의 것들이 재미가 없다...
무쌍 플레이를 하면서 느낀 것은 디스아너드가 하고 싶다는 생각이었다....

오직 잠입만을 위해서라면 추천할 만 하나 그것이 아니라면 애매하다고 생각한다..........

사실 엔딩만 그지랄 안났으면 긍정적 평가 남겼을 듯 ㅋㅋ

author: {'steamid': '76561198089653716', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 3273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1643215752}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness review

This was the best stealth game I ever played. Comparing this game to the first one (Master of Shadows) many may say the gameplay was improved in a good way but the story not so much; I agree. This game gives the player a very good stealth feeling while playing and you can play the game different ways (using clones, shooting from distance, using acid, just sneak through everybody,etc).
One of the things I most liked was his character. I don't know what other people think but I actually enjoy most of his jokes except the bully he makes me when I make him die :(
As I said the story is not that good especially the end.

A freature that was added in this game that is not on Master of Shadows is online coop.
If you watch the coop trailer you may say "that's some really good coop", and you're totally right. This game is awesome while playing with a partner.

In my opinion this game should have more attention since it's really underrated for what it is (unique gameplay and much fun while playing it). In case you don't know if it's worthy or not buying it, you can always play the demo and see for your self :)

Review: 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198069942435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2880, 'last_played': 1602621969}
review:
The best modern stealth game I have played, high amount of optional paths and objectives, with no moral system or other ways of judging your play style with xp rewards for high performance in different fields. There is a clear indicator of both light and noise levels around your character. The story is easily accessible without requiring you to have played the first game. The co-op mode also offers the chance to play with friends which does undermine the difficulty but is certainly alot of fun.  

On the more negative side the same maps are reused throughout the course of the game however the amount of effort put into constructing them and the different objectives and locations you are  required to visit means that they are played through differently with each visit.

review: Брал за две сотки и скажу что даже жалко денег. author: {'steamid': '76561198149563411', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1628421044}
review:
Donc après coup d'avoir fini le jeu il est vraiment cool ! 
Expliquons ça point par point :

- Difficulté augmenté (même en normal, hâte de refaire le jeu avec le mode le plus hard)

- Réalisme sur la manipulation des ennemis et de son propre personnage (vision ambre, voir là où regarde les ennemis, wh avec certaines compétences apprises)

- Lore beaucoup plus développez, apparition des Nains et des Elfes Noirs intéressante.
(except que les Nains vous reniflent alors que normalement c'est une compétence des Elfes qui sont addictes à l'ambre, après sans l'Arbre Monde d'Arkenash, on peut penser que c'est juste devenu une drogue)

- Continuité de Master of Shadow sans erreur (except le fait qu'il faut comprendre que Barimen est le nom de famille d'Aaron) (J'ai adoré le petit clin avec Arkail)

- Histoire et scénario correcte (moins performant que Master of Shadow dû au sujet mais assez intéressant pour ne pas perdre l'envie de continuer à jouer)

- Nette amélioration des actions sur plateforme et saut, MoS avait un vrai problème sur les propositions automatiques des sauts qui vous font forcément mourir 3,4 fois dans le jeu. 

- Le jeu est légèrement plus court, je pense qu'il y a 3 missions de moins que MoS mais franchement c'est juste dommage sur le point que le jeu est très agréable et qu'on aimerait que ça dure encore un peu.

- * L'arbre des talents et beaucoup mieux, super prise en compte des devs que les compétences de MoS sont acquises directement dans le jeu. Par conséquent les petites améliorations sont top, je vous cache pas que ma préféré et dans l'arbre "Combat" la dernière lock, avec 1 quartz et 350 points vous pouvez assassiner vos cibles à 4m de distance en faisant une courte "tp" c'est super kiffant et ça offre beaucoup beaucoup de possibilité ! (Surtout avec la dague effilée qui rend tout vos assassinats au sol "discret")

* Les Clones aussi sont supers, la fumigène et toujours aussi efficace, sans parler de la dernière compétence qui permet de faire exploser votre clone et de tuer un garde pour une tranche d'ambre sans être détecter, car l'assassinat et considérez comme un "accident".
Aussi "Renaissance" qui est clairement une compétence vitale dans le jeu, surtout pour les boss où vous ne pourrez plus faire des petites saves, c'est les seuls endroit où vous pouvez vraiment perdre votre sang-froid. ^^

- Les décors et les graphismes sont justes incroyables on sent une vraie évolution entre les deux opus, ce qui est normal est donc parfaitement réussit. La mobilité de Styx est upgrade elle aussi, beaucoup plus sensible et fluide, moins carré ou saccadé. 

- Enfin l'ambiance du jeu, ainsi que les répliques, le fait que Styx vous vanne, vous parle, ou même les morts de Styx avec les petits running-gag c'est vraiment assez plaisant, au départ ça fait bizarre mais on prend goût à ce jeu qui se permet de vous rappelez que vous êtes dans un jeu mais qui ne casse pas toute l'immersion. Je n'oublie pas aussi toutes les petites références au Seigneur des Anneaux, aux anciens opus de la saga et autres... Très sympa.

Un très bon jeu agréable, encore plus appréciable si vous avez jouer à MoS et/ou à Of Orcs and Men. Un poil trop court mais bon j'ai quand même mis 13h en mode normal alors que je suis pas un novice en jeu de discrétion. A refaire plus tard en augmentant la difficulté, je sens que je vais m'arracher les cheveux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033198373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1988, 'last_played': 1591700613}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness is set some decades after Styx: Master of Shadows which is recommended to play before this game if you want more insight in the game story although it is not needed. This is a stealth based game, so if you're not into stealth and is the type of person that when on a stealth mission kills everything in sight then this game is not for you.

Controls;

Controls and ledge detection are probably among the most hated things about this series, but it's really not that bad. 
The sensitivity of this game is way lower than the first and as someone that use a relatively high DPI I had to crank up the in-game sensitivity to maximum and my mouse sensitivity to the max (6400 DPI) and it still felt a bit too slow for me although I became more used to it as I played the game. If you play on low sensitivity from before then this should be of no issue for you.
Ledge detection has been somewhat changed from the last game as now instead of almost always automatically grabbing on to a ledge when walking off a ledge you have to hold down a ledge grabbing key when walking off the ledge which can be a pain to get used to. As for jumping the ledges you hang on to have also been changed in their appearance and detection and in my opinion become more annoying to grab onto. Although the ledge mechanics are for sure flawed and is something you may or may not die a lot to it, but despite all the troubles with the ledges you will get used to it.
The controls may also feel outright janky at points, but this is simply the result of developing a game with console in mind. I haven't played this with a console so it may actually feel better to play with a console, but I cannot say that for sure.


Stealth/Game Mechanics;

The stealth mechanics and the combat is quite similar to Styx: Master of Darkness, but due to a more fleshed out skill tree you have more potential for stealthing your way through a level. For the higher difficulties straight up combat is turned off meaning you cannot kill people in a 1 on 1 fight when you are detected. A major element that has changed from Styx: Master of Shadows to this game is the fact that Elves which the plot largely revolve around no longer sniff you out, instead Dwarves have been introduced to be the ones that sniff you out instead. I guess the change was made to make the game possible as you will mostly be around Elves and if they could all sniff you out then there would be no game. Amber and health has also seen a change in this game and you'll see that you have actual bars of amber. It felt like the amber was drained faster by things like invisibility in this game than in the previous game, but due to having many more skills are your disposal this is not too much of a trouble. The most interesting skills that should be pointed out is related to your clones as you can now take the place of your clone and throw a cocoon that makes you able to create a clone wherever you can throw the cocoon. 

Another huge change from the previous game is crafting being introduced. It is both a good and bad system as you might be hunting for crafting resources to stock up on precious amber vials. Although the crafting is not needed it makes the game a lot more difficult if you ignore it as unlike the previous game you don't get a bunch of free resources at the end of each level to get you fully stocked up as you're expected to craft although you can also just steal whatever it is that you need. A positive with this is that if you ever run out of something you can simply find a crafting station in a level and make more of it if you so desire. 

Story;

The story is pretty good although it pales in comparison to the story of Styx: Master of Shadows. The story itself takes place some decades after Styx: Master of Darkness and the world is now under a goblin invasion and the story essentially revolves around how the other races are prepared to deal with the goblins and in this case mainly the Elves which find a very effective way to handle the intrusive goblins. The real issue with the story is that there was a lack of fleshed out characters that should have been in the story, but most characters just ended up as wasted potential.

Level design and graphics;

Obviously the graphics have improved since the previous game and the artstyle and levels really fits into the world of Styx. Just like in Styx: Master of Shadows the level design is great and provides you with a multitude of routes to take to your objective with even greater amounts of routes in this game I'd say. Each chapter now usually consist of 2 levels unlike the 3 or 4 for Master of Shadows, but the length and complexity of each level is increased by a lot. The only negative about the level designs that could be mentioned is that there were a couple of levels that could make you feel a bit lost as to where to go, but that may have just been me being stupid.

Overall this game is a great stealth game although I consider it inferior to Master of Shadows. It is definitely worth playing preferably after Master of Shadows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245276064', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 115, 'playtime_at_review': 3754, 'last_played': 1712010026}
review:
My favorite game of all time!

Styx: Shards of Darkness is a perfect blend of story, unique and innovative gameplay mechanics, beautiful graphics, fantastic sound design, funny post-death screens, really good music, the best level design I have ever seen, great boss fights, and to top it all off, it also has a great sense of humor. 

This game took everything from Master of Shadows and enhanced every aspect from that game. Not only did it enhance what came before, but it also added a lot with a fantastic crafting system, a perfect skill tree, new outfits, new equipment, new daggers, many new environments, a ton of unique and extremely fun new abilities, new enemies, and new parkour/stealth mechanics. 

The final praise I have for this game is the brand new addition: CO-OP. While lag can sometimes make it tricky, it still is absolutely fantastic and is an amazing addition to the Styx games. It allows for completely new ways of playing and really changes up the game. It is implemented flawlessly and is balanced perfectly so that the game is still very challenging.

Like I said earlier, Styx: Shards of Darkness is without a doubt my favorite game of all time and I would highly recommend buying it!

My only complaint is that it ends on a massive cliffhanger, so Devs, please make another one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057744571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 2229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2229, 'last_played': 1592602377}
review: Although I enjoyed the game and would recommend it to those who like PURE stealth games like me, I agree with a lot of the negative review comments I read. The game was too easy, even in goblin mode (the higher mode just prevents saves and that's an artificial way of making the game itself more challenging). Gathering tokens and quartz was not really necessary, but without them the game would be too short. There were no difficult puzzles and I only found one location where a clone was actually needed. The skill advancement was redundant and misleading - some gave the impression that they might be needed to progress in the game whereas in reality they had no use. Perhaps the designers were focusing on those people who like to replay missions, and I'm not one of them. The story was OK but the execution felt a bit disjointed and the ending was rather abrupt.

review:
My modem died, recently and since AT&T is a garbage fire of a company, i had plenty of time to play a solo game. I've been wanting to play Styx for a long time and finally didn't have something else that took priority. The story's not bad, even though sometimes Styx's motivations seem a touch far-fetched. Definitely a stealth game (not a stealth-COMBAT game) with plenty of customization options and fun ways to play. It's absolutely worth playing if you get it on sale. 

Graphically, i was pretty much in love. To a point, i like the need to revisit areas for new missions, but with the length of the game, it would have been much nicer to have seen more varied locations. I love the pseudo steampunk/magicpunk feel of the (nearly identical) towns and the height options in the elven areas. 

The boss battle at the end was fun (when it didn't glitch out on reloads) but the end was a HUGE cliffhanger, and i'm really hoping they do another game!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198208584932', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1896, 'last_played': 1591741101}
review:
What to say about Styx: Shards of Darkness... Firstly, great game, thoroughly enjoyed it! I loved the new levelling mechanic, having far more options in each skill tree to pick from as you build your character whilst staying true to the stealth genre, emphasising the need for stealth tactics rather than making your fighting skills op.  Some clever, unique features that built on the simple system of the previous game, so pretty well done in that aspect. A few things I didn't like were the graphics being so vastly different from the previous game, and the keyboard mapping being changed as well (minor issue sure, but still silly). Some of the mechanics were frustratingly clunky, and there wasn't really a need for it, but hey ho, not the end of the world. Would deffinitely recommend for anyone who is a fan of RPG, fantasy and stealth genres.
Quick rating, pros and cons list:

Gameplay: 9/10
+ Stays true to the stealth Genre
+ Provides some decent challenges, and really makes you think tactically
+ Large levels, which although not open world, provide a reasonably nice expanse of map to explore and play around in
- Mechanics could get a bit clunky at times
- Unlike the previous game, this one annoyingly wouldn't let you save whilst enemies were on any sort of alert
- Sometimes had issues with saves when I was on my second playthrough, which meant that when I started certain levels and didn't get far enough to reach a save point, I would be sent back to the hideout to then reload the mission, which could get rather frustrating.
- Towards the end of the game, and particularly on my second playthrough, saves started taking quite some time to load, despite ensuring to delete unnecessary savefiles.

Story: 8/10
+ Coherent and made sense
+ Well thought out, and creatively implemented
- despite some good twists, it was relatively predictable

Graphics: 8/10
+ Clean and smooth textures and rendering
- Doesn't really fit with the style of the previous game

author: {'steamid': '76561198035599199', 'num_games_owned': 1983, 'num_reviews': 493, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1590709738}
review:
A recommendation with caveats.
The stealth is solid.  If that's all you need, you can quit reading now and buy the game.  This game provided me many hours of sleuthing round hordes of enemies, stabbing a few without mercy who got in my way, without any annoying morality system to crap on my fun.
The game is also pretty gorgeous as well and the sweeping vistas are impressive.  And enemies like dwarves who could sniff me out provided that extra layer of welcome complexity to the levels, though I was disappointed the dark elves were basically reskinned humans.  They should have given them darkvision or something to keep with the fantasy and to add a bit of complexion to them as enemies.
The side missions however are completely throwaway.  The first one has you going round ripping down flyers off walls.  That's some assassin's creed level of dullness.  Then you realise how little that benefits you when you see the tally at the end of the mission - just completing the mission alone to advance the story provides far more XP that completing the optional objectives or completing the game stealthily, swiftly or without kills.  So I completely dropped them after that - not that it made any difference because I was able to buy up every skill I could possibly be interested in without having to maximise score on a level.
And I don't recall Styx ever being this juvenile and gratuitously crude.  Maybe it's because the humour isn't quite as on point as usual is why this stands out more, but I certainly remember enjoying Styx's character more in all other outings.
The game is also a bit on the easy side.  Even on "goblin" mode, though you can't fight back once spotted, I found the enemies were by and large fairly shortsighted which meant you could get away with alot more than you should be able to.  And they were pretty lazy in their pursuit, and stuggled to find me when I'd only just ran into a hole in the wall.
And the story didn't land for me either.  The big reveal is telegraphed a mile away, and the final boss is ridiculously easy and unsatisfactory in complete, and then it all ends on an awkward cliffhanger with some fairly major plot points unresolved.
Everything beyond the base mechanics just felt horrendously rushed, as if they spent all their time perfecting the core gameplay loop, and then forgot to craft an engaging game or story around it.
But if stealth is all you need, this is worth a gander.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253924367', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1355, 'last_played': 1590600027}
review:
If you're a Rouge and enjoy games of the Stealthy nature (*Thieving sneaky shadow but can't fight so well  style* primarily more so than the Assassinate a whole compound, unstoppable take down multiple guards at once style to reach a target) then this is the game for you.

Bit jarring without a map at times so you can feel lost even with a directional marker but lots to explore and the abilities (especially cloning) are a fun add on. The crafting system is simple to use and the UI is pretty clean/simplistic.

Parkour mechanics are annoying and quite platformy (his jump trajectory and arc is weird, more upwards momentum than forwards not like how you would in real world parkour although this allows you to grab platforms higher up) it's based on jumping and grabbing. Rolling feature is nice for dodging and stealthing but can't be used as a height breakfall.

Don't expect to survive group combat as it's based on a parry system. The best way is a classic stealth approach.

review:
Really well made and polished stealth game, super fun. HOWEVER. I played on top tier difficulty and it still felt way too easy to cheese the game. Standard stealth issues like when a guard gets alerted he forgets about it for some reason eventually or doesn't alert the whole base. You can leap around killing lots of people and do stuff like make copies of yourself so you are practically invincible. 

Other than the difficulty its great, some levels are fucking horrible (the elven maps especially are boring corridoors) but its made up for by how amazing the GOOD maps are. Personally I just handicapped myself to make the game feel fairer, for example I would restart if I was spotted and I would also not use clones or OP combat techniques.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077472678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1658556041}
review:
Li alguém reclamando do hit kill, certamente o cidadão não jogou o anterior e muito menos sabe como funciona um jogo de stealth puro.
Fora essa alegação o jogo está excelente ainda mais com o uso da UE4, melhorou demais em vários aspectos. Músicas incríveis (principalmente a batalha final), ambientação grande e muito bem diversificada nas possibilidades de stealth, assim vai. Agora o que me incomodou um pouco foi a questão das cutscenes, os cortes que ocorrem senti serem muito abruptas, tanto que nesses cortes da pra ver a roupa "voando" como se tivesse acabado de pular, nada dramático apenas um incomodo que notei. Outra coisa que achei meio triste foi a falta da legenda pt-br, o jogo é excelente e ainda mais a quem não sabe em sua totalidade, podem dizer que é desculpa de preguiçoso, mas uma legenda é bem vinda demais ainda mais pra tanta tirada que Styx faz.
Enfim, excelente jogo e vale a compra, aproveite quando houver promoção!
Minha marcação de tempo está errada, passei mais de 20h jogando e aproveitei o máximo que dava e ainda faltou coisa pra fazer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996852554', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1589726620}
review:
[h1] Говорящий гоблин против четвёртой стены └༼ ಥ ᗜ ಥ ༽┘  [/h1]

[i] [u]Сполеры в отзыве[/u]: [/i] нет 
[i] [u]Последняя версия игры[/u]: [/i] 17.05.2020
[i] [u]Сложность прохождения[/u]: [/i] Гоблин
[i] [u]Время в игре [/u]: [/i] 9 ч.
[i] [u]Получено достижений[/u]: [/i] 21 из 38 (55%)
[i] [u]Предыстория[/u]: [/i] Купил игру ещё на релизе и ждал два года компании для коопа, в итоге забил и прошёл в одиночку. До этого прошёл другие игры серии. 
[i] [u]Кому я рекомендую игрульку [/u]: [/i] Любителям стелс экшенов и фанатам харизматичных гоблинов. 

Ну и дальше, что мне понравилось, а что не очень:


[h1] Плюсы: [/h1]

+ [b] Главный герой [/b] (Ломает четвёртую стену и обладает крепкой харизмой)

+ [b] Годный стелс [/b] (Он простоват, но в целом приятный и интуитивный)

+ [b] Навигация [/b] (Перемещаться по многоярусным уровням легко и удобно, даже без мини карты понятно как и куда идти)  
 
+ [b] OST [/b] (Годный и атмосферный)

+ [b] Графика [/b] (Конечно всё серо-чёрное, но неплохая для своего времени) 


 [h1] Нейтральные факты: [/h1] 

\ [b] Кооператив [/b] (Я не смог заценить, но по идее будет веселее) 

\ [b] Прокачка [/b] (Сделана для галочки, интересных перков нет)  

\ [b] Крафт и кастомизация [/b] (Они есть – но зачем? На картах стало море мусора, а костюмов в игре три с половиной)   


[h1] Минусы: [/h1]

- [b] Сюжет [/b] (Он отвратительный и сделан для галочки: персонажи плоские, а мотивация гг возникает из ниоткуда. Концовка это клифхенгер)      

- [b] Управление и боёвка [/b] (Боёвки как таковой нету, управление не всегда удобное из-за вращения камеры можно не попасть в выступ при прыжке)   

- [b] ИИ [/b] (Деревянный и откровенно слабый)  

- [b] Битвы с боссами [/b] (Абсолютно не нужны этой игре и лишь раздражают) 

- [b] Самоповторы [/b] (Геймплей практически без изменений перекачивал из мастера теней: те же враги, та же прокачка, ничего нового. Со второй половину игра использует некоторые свои карты по второму кругу. 


 [h1] Моя оценка: [/h1] 6 ракашей из 10. Практически полное повторение предыдущей части игры с коопом. Стел хороший, сюжета нету. В целом проходняк – если хотите попробовать, то только с другом и по скидке.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139484676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 1620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1654658539}
review:
Insanely underrated title.  Solid Stealth gameplay, gorgeous maps, sarcastic, 4th wall breaking humor, a snarky anti-hero protagonist.  Dazzling, almost AAA good  graphics, that can be tweaked to be ever better.  Levels of challenge from noob to wunderkind.

Grim dark/High fantasy.  Some of the NPC's are just very lovely, but not in a tawdry way.

The game does things that I have wanted to see happen for years.  The first real level is on a
Pseudo-Victorian (Steampunk?) Airships....  and they MAKE GOTHIC STEALTH work in THAT setting.

The next level?  An elven fortress inside a mountain....  with a giant door for AIRSHIPS.

It just keeps getting better, and I don't mind the grotesque number of deaths I am experiencing.

AI is really dumb, but that isn't really a problem since smart AI would just kill me more often.

There was a pretty good Boss fight!

Will update.

Worth it at full price and more.

Man I wish this Studio could do a game with a AAA budget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085990724', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1535, 'last_played': 1590167432}
review:
The Styx franchise is a bit of an odd one overall. They've all been just a little bit janky, but in an endearing kind of way. Of Orcs and Men was mechanically unique in a lot of ways. Focusing down on the stealth aspects in Master Of Shadows was probably a sensible move, and this latest instalment is more of that. Pretty solid mid budget stealth. There are some differences in the abilities, but it's a fair continuation of what was done previously, at least in terms of mechanics. Plot wise I wouldn't say you need to have gone anywhere near the previous games, and honestly the story is probably the weakest part of the game. Somehow it never quite flows. Loading screen text does a lot more legwork than any of the cutscenes, but really I don't find it huge problem, since the plot is basically an excuse to get to the next round of stabbing. And that's pretty satisfying. The humour may be a little wearing in places, and whilst the death screen taunts are a nice idea they can get a little repetitive if you're having difficulty.

Spoiler alert, whilst I enjoy these games immensely I am by no means actually good at them.

It's worth nothing that the game is pretty good at reloading once you're in it, so it's not actually a huge issue if you do die a lot, provided you remember to quick save.

But yeah, pretty fun stealth game with some well done mechanics. Worth checking out if you have an interest in the whole stealth thing.

review:
[b][u]Avis général[/u][/b]: Très chouette jeu d'infiltration, je recommande vraiment si vous aimez ce style (je l'ai joué en 'fantôme' pas en 'barbare', il doit être moins sympa en mode bourrin). Si vous avez aimé dishonored vous aimerez probablement ce jeu. 
[b][u]Difficulté[/u][/b]: Si vous êtes habitués à ce type de jeu, joué en mode 'initié' la difficulté est correcte, même si au fil du jeu avec les améliorations de compétence il devient un poil simple (mon conseil si vous aimez que ça soit un peu relevé, jouer le niveau au dessus d'initié du coup).
[b][u]Avis plus détaillé[/u][/b] : Un gameplay fluide et bien pensé, de l'humour bien senti, le jeu est beau et permissif (plusieurs manières d'accomplir une mission) un bon feeling infiltration type 'dishonored' (les dashs en moins). Pour les 'moins' au bout d'un moment il tourne un peu en rond niveau lieux, on revient sur les mêmes maps pour faire d'autres missions (les devs ont mis des touches d'humour là dessus dites par styx dans le jeu où il blame le manque de budget :). L'IA a des bons côtés (réactifs, s'alertent facilement et vont fouiller dans les coins pour vous trouver) et d'autres plus basiques (patterns en boucles, ne remarquent pas la disparition des autres gardes etc, mais peut être j'en demande trop là dessus)
