author: {'steamid': '76561198162011324', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 1538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1541800438}
review:
Najwyższy poziom trudności to masochizm- nie różni się niczym od przedostatniego poza tym, że nie ma savów! Albo ja jestem noobem albo jestem mega nie cierpliwy albo zwyczajnie mam rację i to czysty masochizm. Ukończyłem całą grę na przed ostatnim poziomie trudności ( nie licząc pierwszych 3 misji gdzie grałem na maxymalnym)

Gra jest dość trudna ale bardzo przyjemna i wciągająca, zdecydowanie jedna z najlepszych skradanek jakie do tej pory wyszły. Fabuła jest dość przewidywalna ale może wciągnąć. Nie spotkałem się z żadnymi bugami. Mapy są liniowe ale za to jest wiele rozwiązań i wiele dróg do każdego celu (poza walkami z bossami- tak są bossy w skradance xD) za co daje ogromny plus bo jest np. zadanie UKRADNIJ coś jakiemuś strażnikowi i możesz to ukraść nikogo nie zabijając i pozostając nie wykrytym (savuar vivre skradankowców) ale możesz też zabijać z ukrycia prawie każdego kto stanie na drodze włącznie z celem w kńcu jak kogoś zabijesz to możesz i okraść, ale można też zrobić mieszankę i zabijać ludzi i elfy oraz krasnoludy po drodze ale ostateczny cel pozostawić przy życiu, Styx prawie zawsze to jakoś skomentuje i zrobi to inaczej w zależności od tego w jaki sposób to zrobiliśmy. Do tego dochodzą (często ukryte) misje poboczne które również są zrobione ciekawie.

Nie można nie wspomnieć o oryginalnym i zajebiście wykonanym death screen'ie- zawsze jak umrzemy to Styx to skomentuje, ma wiele tekstów więc rzadko się powtarzają te same pod rząd. Do tego niektóre teksty można odkryć tylko w konkretnych sytuacjach i tylko w niektórych misjach co dodaje jeszcze więcej satysfakcji gdy taki tekst odkryjemy. To samo tyczy się tekstów Styxa w grze gdy żyjemy, wiele nawiązań do innych gier czy książek a nawet filmów, tutaj również nie wszystkie teksty usłyszymy bo wiele z nich jest ukrytych np. pocisk w stronę assasyna (nie będę zdradzał treści) aktywuje się tylko gdy znajdziemy się w konkretnym miejscu w konkretnej misji i nigdzie więcej go nie usłyszymy i nie jest to lokalizacja do której każdy na pewno się uda, takie esterr eggi to ja rozumiem a nie jakieś durne 200 znajdziek! (gta o tobie mówię, mimo że to zupełnie inne gry to kwestja znajdziek jak najbardziej na miejscu)
Co tu jeszcze dodać... Styx to po prostu bezpośredni i szczery do bólu pierdolnięty kozak. Uwielbiam gościa!

Ta gra to must-have dla każdego fana skradanek oraz nie typowych gier ( w sęsie jak szukasz czegoś nowego to bingo znalazłeś) ale polecam ten tytuł każdemu, chociażby spróbowac przez te 2h czy się spodoba. Myślę jednak, że spodoba się zdecydowanej większości :) 

Rzekłem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985302505', 'num_games_owned': 1746, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2387, 'last_played': 1541619216}
review:
Старый Стикс лучше новых двух.

Перейдя на новый дввижок UE4 Cyanide Studio умудрились создать слабый клон былой игры.
Графически игра стала выглядеть опрятней и приятней, в буквальном смысле. Карты и цветовая палитра стали черезчур 
 локальными, теплыми и ламповыми, добавив неуместной уютности в некогда чуждый мир. Кое-что подвергли редизайну, например, эльфов, которые из криповатых аватаров были очеловечены до обычных выосокомерных любителей поисследовать гномьи шахты. Сам Стикс из язвительного, но харизматичного персонажа, превратился в пародию на Дедпула от мира стелс-игр, с закончившимся запасом перлов у девелоперов с середины игры.
Стикс ослаб, он более не может таскать врагов в тяжелых доспехах. Трупы то и дело цепляются ногами за уступы, с которых ты пытаешься их сбросить. Вместо того, чтобы придумывать новые скиллы и механики, разработчики раздробили старые на большее число, делая иллюзию прокачки. А некоторые вообще перестали быть необходимы. Были выкинуты простенькие пазлы на использование клонов, а вкупе с упростившейся сложностью, ветка клонов стала вовсе бесполезной.
Сюжет потерял былой шарм и на смену локальной истории выживания, в которой политика и интриги выступали фоном, пришла мыльная опера, где фон стал доминировать над персонажем. И все это заканчивается дурацким клифхенгером.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979893537', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2028, 'last_played': 1541297109}
review:
Ce deuxième épisode est bien meilleur que le premier :
- graphiquement superbe
- des niveaux toujours aussi grands et verticaux
- le platforming toujours aussi précis
- plus de compétences : on retrouve des anciennes capacités et des nouveautés :)
- des équipements : certains secrets du jeu peuvent changer l'équipement de Styx. C'est pas désiquilibrant pour le jeu et c'est cool.

Des défauts corrigés :
- Styx arrête de grimper systématiquement sur les rebords auquel il s'accroche
- les assassinats sur les rebords et de côté sont mieux détectés

Pour les moins, je dirai :
- le pathfinding / l'IA qui se plante trop régulièrement
- une fin médiocre qui laisse présager un nouvel épisode ?
- j'ai trouvé personne pour jouer en coop avec moi (j'ai pas d'amis :'( )

J'ai découvert la série de jeux Styx cette année, mais si les mêmes devs sortent un nouvel épisode, ce sera un achat day-one pour ma part.

review:
Naomi Xian was thinking about Andrew McFece again. Andrew was a vile vicar with sloppy moles and ample eyelashes.

Naomi walked over to the window and reflected on his outlandish surroundings. He had always loved boyish East Kilbride with its horrible, high hairmyres airport. It was a place that encouraged his tendency to feel ambivalent.

Then he saw something in the distance, or rather someone. It was the vile figure of Andrew McFece.

Naomi gulped. He glanced at his own reflection. He was a daring, gracious, grapefruit juice that mixes poorly with SSRIs drinker with fragile moles and spiky eyelashes. His friends saw him as a ripe, real rover. Once, he had even made a cup of tea for a grumpy disabled person.

But not even a daring person who had once made a cup of tea for a grumpy disabled person, was prepared for what Andrew had in store today.

The drizzle rained like rampaging eggs, making Naomi sparkly. Naomi grabbed a ribbed sausage that had been strewn nearby; he massaged it with his fingers.

As Naomi stepped outside and Andrew came closer, he could see the anxious smile on her face.

Andrew glared with all the wrath of 4317 brave kindly koalas. She said, in hushed tones, "I hate you and I want licking."

Naomi looked back, even more sparkly and still fingering the ribbed sausage. "Andrew, me angry with you," he replied.

They looked at each other with sneezy feelings, like two brief, blue blue bottles gyrating at a very admirable bar mitzvah, which had Thom Yorke music playing in the background and two peculiar uncles singing to the beat.

Suddenly, Andrew lunged forward and tried to punch Naomi in the face. Quickly, Naomi grabbed the ribbed sausage and brought it down on Andrew's skull.

Andrew's sloppy moles trembled and her ample eyelashes wobbled. She looked unstable, her emotions raw like a kindly, knobbly knife.

Then she let out an agonising groan and collapsed onto the ground. Moments later Andrew McFece was dead.

Naomi Xian went back inside and made himself a nice drink of grapefruit juice that mixes poorly with SSRIs.

THE END

author: {'steamid': '76561198440423463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1636403703}
review:
Die Fortsetzung des erfolgreichen Indie-/Stealth-Game Styx: Master of Shadows

[i]Story[/i]

Ihr spielt einen pessimistischen, sprechenden Goblin der eigentlich nur versucht seiner Vergangenheit zu entrinnen. 

Mit Diebstählen versucht er sich über Wasser zu halten und ist dabei auch recht erfolgreich. Eines Tages, als er den Sold einiger Soldaten stahl, wird er von dem Captain der "Goblin Vernichtungstruppe" dabei erwischt. Der Captain machte Styx ein Angebot, das er nicht ausschlagen konnte: Styx soll sich auf die Suche nach einem mächtigen Zepter, welches ungeheure Kräfte besitzt, machen.

[i]Gameplay[/i]

Als Goblin seid ihr ein sehr leichtes Ziel für Gegner. Aber so klein zu sein hat auch seine Vorteile. Versteckt euch in den Schatten um euren ahnungslosen Gegner aufzulauern oder lasst einfach einen Kronleuchter auf sie fallen. 

Styx: Shards of Darkness bietet euch eine Vielzahl an Möglichkeiten eure Gegner auszuschalten. Es gibt aber auch viele verschiedene Wege um an euren Feinden vorbeizuschleichen. Töten muss also keine Option sein.

Aber da ist mehr als nur die Menschen, die sich euch in den Weg stellen. Monster, Elben und Zwerge machen euch das Leben besonders schwer. Aber keine Angst, das Spiel besteht ja nicht nur aus Euch, euren Gegner und eurer Klinge. Das Crafting-System ist eine große Hilfe und auch der Skill-Tree ist sehr umfangreich. 

Das spielt lässt sich auch im Koop spielen was ein sehr schönes Feature ist. Doch der Koop-Modus ist nicht unbedingt einfacher, da man immer nur einen Schlag aushält. Also solltet ihr Kämpfe besser meiden. 

Ein weiters Feature ist das Ausrüstungs-System. Ihr müsst nicht nur mit der gleichen Waffe kämpfen. Ihr könnt zum Beispiel einen Dolch ausrüsten, der Gegner nach dem Töten zwar auflöst, doch ihr könnt sie mit dem nicht lautlos töten. 

Eine Sache noch: Ihr werdet sterben. Sehr oft sogar. Doch statt einem langweiligen Todesscreen bekommt man einen lustigen Spruch von Styx zu hören. Eine sehr nette Idee, wie ich finde.

[i]Grafik[/i]

Das Spiel hat seinen ganz eigenen Grafik-Stil. Sehr schöne Texturen und sehr viele Details in den Leveln.
Die Welt ist eher im Fantasy-/Steampunk-Bereich angelegt, was besonders WoW-Fans interessieren könnte. 

Charaktergestaltung ist sehr umfangreich doch nach 4 Stunden wiederholen sich desöfteren. Trotz allem ist die Welt von Styx unglaublich mystisch und interessant. (Styx stammt aus dem Universum von: Of Orcs and Men)

[i]Sound[/i]

Das Spiel hat eine sehr schöne Hintergrundmusik und Styx' Sprüche sind humorvoll und begleiten einen durchs ganze Spiel. Wie oben schon erwähnt, macht sich Styx jedes Mal über einen lustig, wenn man stirbt. Die Animation dabei ist sehr gelungen und ich muss zugeben das die Sprüche auch nicht ohne sind. 

Hier ein Beispiel: 

[spoiler]"Du weißt, dass es nichts bringt, wenn du mit den Füßen spielst, oder?"[/spoiler]

[i]Fazit[/i]

Aufgrund des hohen Schwierigkeitsgrades sollten Assassins Creed-Spieler besser einen Bogen um das Spiel machen aber für Hardcore-Stealth-Spieler ein absolutes Muss. Ich persönlich finde 40€ ein bisschen zu hoch gegriffen und würde empfehlen es im Sale zu kaufen, da die (Story-)Spielzeit bei ungefähr 10-15 Stunden liegt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389060277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1598336139}
review:
Really fun and interesting game with a cool co-op functionality built on. Generally good looking except for some really garbage textures that they forgot might be up taking the majority of your screen if you hide lol. It's challenging and instense and really satisfying to complete. Really fun co-op I might add. It's always amazing when a single-player game has co-op built in instead of the game being built specifically online/multiplayer and this game does it really well. Your mostly plotting and sneakily killing your way through the mazes in this game trying to as stealthily kill as many people as you can without them finding and trying to squash you. Super enjoyable I really wasn't expecting this fun gameplay.
(No I haven't played any other Styx games, but I'm looking forward to it because this one was really good)

author: {'steamid': '76561198112372711', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1596795469}
review: Really enjoyable game. Stealth elements are execellent and always keeps you guessing what to do. You have to be stealthy in this game as combat between multiple opponents is basically impossible, I love that this game actually had difficult stealth elements with different types of enemies which could detect you differently. I loved the humour of this game but at times the jokes were a bit corny but overall made the game feel less serious then many other stealth games. I also found some of the boss fights intresting, I was suprised that a game that relied on stealth this much had boss fights. These fights were pretty bland though. This game is a must have for anyone looking for a hard stealth game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083018726', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1539549702}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness es la segunda entrega de la saga Styx, en la que interpretamos al goblin bicentenario Styx. La base del juego es el sigilo, pudiendo optar por eliminar a los enemigos de cada escenario o dejarlos vivir. Dispondremos de múltiples habilidades para poder sortear los distintos obstaculos, así como para distraer enemigos o acabar con ellos.

Tiene una muy buena historia acompañada en todo momento por el sentido del humor de Styx, con el que te reirás a buen seguro, no solo durante las escenas, si no también con algún comentario durante la partida y sobre todo, con sus comentarios postmorten. Si si, lo que lees, cada vez que Styx muera aparecera en una pantalla de unos pocos segundos para recordarte que el mando no se usa con los pies, el botón de salto no lo tienes donde la espalda pierde su nombre, o ver si es que en realidad te gusta pararte a charlar con él. Gracias a esto, no solo no te preocuparás por morir tanto como en otros títulos, si no que incluso puede llegar el momento en el que te suicides voluntariamente para ver qué nueva perla te suelta Styx. 

Estéticamente me ha encantado, y el diseño de los mapas muy logrado.

review:
To be brief, this game caters to people who enjoy stealth games. Combat is absolutely not part of the core aspect of the game, so for people who do like the combination of combat and stealth (e.g. Dishonored, AC, ...), caveat emptor! The game is focussed on being unseen and combat should only be engaged in if you are stuck and can't find a way out. I would suggst this game strongly to people who are looking for a quiet game they can play after work/school that makes you calm down because you need to focus on being unseen, 

That being said, the game is extremely enjoyable thanks to it's cartoony and humouristic characteristics. The story line is nice and is easy to follow and each mission can be completed in different ways, so there is a certain amount of margin in how you want to play the game. 

All in all, I did buy the game on sale for 11.99$ and I am extremely satisfied with it, however I do think the game is worth it's orginal selling price of 39.99$, yet only if you like mission based stealth games, people who are looking for a hybrid stealth/combat game should only buy this on sale because this game only caters to stealth players. 

If I had to put on a score on this game I would say a solid 8/10 for a stealth game.

review: The story is clearly not the better aspect of the game. It does the job but stay simple all along. However, the gameplay is very well done. Each map have at least 3 pass to get to any of the "important point" you will need to reach to accomplish the mission, and there is between 3 too 5 points on 1 mission, and each pass have its own type of difficulties (guards, blinds bugs that detect ANY sound, dwarfs that can smell you...). Adding with it secondary mission that can make your progression in the rest of the game easier, but which require to be done during the principale mission and a good difficulty. I'm probably exagerating a little, but with my last infiltration game being an assassin creed, this was very refreshing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047680332', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1538397032}
review:
So far this has been a great game to play. That funky little goblin is witty, crass and deliberately breaks the 4th wall on many occasions, but this is a well-loved part of the previous games that has come back in this installment. 
While some of the dialogue and cutscenes are a tad janky but nothing to bring you out of the fun.  There's just enough story to set up each mission, which is perfectly fine by me,as it doesn't bog you down with unecessary exposition and gets right into the most important part - the gameplay.
The mechanics here are solid and honestly, I feel they're very fair. If you are determiend enough you can complete complete missions without using clones or things like invisibilty, and you even have the option of not using a dagger to silently kill foes. If you're new to the series (like me) then you'll find that each new race or creature (dwarves, roabies, etc) is introduced in a way that lets you see and get used to the mechanics to get around them, and subsequently you'll find them in later missions in a few ways to shake things up. It is also fun to explore the levels and Styx is pretty solid to handle. I have died numerous times but most of the time the fault was with me, rather than with any kind of broken mechanic. Even when I thought I was stuck a few times, there have always been other ways to get into a room or kill the target.

TL;DR: It's a fun game. If you want to try something sneaky with a crass goblin at the helm, totally go for it. I have been pleasantly surprised by pretty much every aspect of this game so far, and I think that'll just keep going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062801622', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1492, 'last_played': 1538324295}
review:
In general, Styx: Shards of Darkness is a pretty goddamn good stealth game. It has its issues like bad AI and some minor gliches, nothing gamebreaking though. It does a good job at making the player feel satisfied after going through a mission without even being seen. Gameplay wise it's a bit of an upgrade from the first game adding some additional options. The map design is a bit inferior to the Master Of Shadows, especially since Cyanide Studio decided it was a good Idea to start recycling maps halfway through the game. But oh well, at least they still have a bajilion possible approach options per mission, which is great. The game offers quite a good replay value thanks to those. The story is decent and the soundtrack fitting. 

There is no harm in buying 'Styx: Shards of Darkness', the gameplay kept me entertained for like 2 weeks and now that I've reached a 100% completion I can most definitely say that this game is worth its price tag. A solid 8,5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004780654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1398, 'last_played': 1538594191}
review:
Well I have to say Cyanide studios does it again with another great game about my favorite greenskin. Styx: Shards of Darkness shows an improvement in the quality of gameplay compared to its predecessor. The larger variety of gear allows for some creativity like one might find in some of the games from the Hitman franchise (another favorite of mine) while still staying true to the spirit of the game. I do feel there is a reduction in the challenge of this game though. After playing it on normal difficulty I was left wanting more. Based on some of the abilities available to Styx it seems the real enjoyment of this game is best suited to playing on the Goblin difficulty level. I intend to replay it on this difficulty. If you are an avid fan of Styx: Master of Shadows or other stealth games I suggest just starting on Goblin difficulty.

I hate to say anything bad about a game from the Orcs and Men universe but I do have to say the storyline in this game is without a doubt the shallowest of the three games in the series. That is not to say it is bad, it is a good story, just not what we have come to expect from Cyanide Studios. If Of Orcs and Men and Styx: Master of Shadows are drama, Styx: Shards of Darkness is without a doubt a comedy. There is nothing wrong with that and I found many aspects of the game to be quite funny and enjoyable. However, I was not expecting it.

Some people complain about the ending because it leaves a lot of loose ends and is rather abrupt and this is a legitimate complaint. I would say that people should be reminded that this is not necessarily an ending and might be the beginning of the next story in the saga of the goblin Styx. That aside a little more closure would have been nice. I will point out that some unfinished business from the last game and a few allusions to Of Orcs and Men made its way into the game though and that was a treat. On top of all that the personality of Styx has certainly evolved (or devovled) in colorful and witty if gutter mouthed way. Expect plenty of dirty jokes and sarcastic remarks from a lead character who only shows apathy to the goals and struggles of the people around him. The best new feature happens when you die in the game. I am not going to ruin it for you but be warned you may be killing yourself over and over a few times just for the laughs. Over all this game has a much more light hearted tone than its predecessors.

I have not played this game with the newly introduced co-op feature so I cannot comment on it.

Over all it is a game I was glad to play and even though I was slightly disappointed with the story, in retrospect I found enjoyment in it for its own merrits. I do suggest this gmae, just don't expect the same tone or depth found in the last two games. Cyanide Studios, please keep up the good work. I like all the new features a lot, I like the comedy, but I do miss the depth of this vivid and unique world you have created. Please don't forget about it. I look forward to another game in this series, a little closure to this adventure, and maybe a little more drama (please?).

author: {'steamid': '76561197979860899', 'num_games_owned': 1192, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1538242011}
review:
К сожалению ничего нового, кроме ломания четвертой стены, по сравнению с первой частью не завезли.
- Сюжет очень хромой, кто, зачем, почему, все притянуто за уши.
- Физика, в частоности аэродинамика Стикса в виде рязиногого мяча, очень утомляет в платформенных частях.
- Экономия на уровнях, после середины игры опять проходим те же уровни с другими врагами.
- Баги: у меня частенько исчезали канаты, вторичные цели, а в один момент пропал даже финальный босс.
- UE4 неплох по оптимизации, но видно что все довольно бюджетное и художников явно не хватало (к диссу на уровни)

+ Это все тот же Стикс, который кривляется и ерничает. А самый ответственный момент из-за триумфа палится, что умеет говорить. А также его комментарии вашей игры после сметри доставляют.
+ Все можно пройти без каких либо умений, но апгрейды отлично раскрывают игру, позволяя по разному выпутываться из ситуаций.
+ Ну и вау эффект от различных путей прохождения, когда мучаешься целый час, обходя все в стелсе, а на самом деле можно было спокойно пройти по другому маршруту.
+ 2 прикольные отсылки: к Бэтмену в шахтах и к of Orcs and Men на миссии с гномами.
В общем 1999 р игра не стоит. Только по скидке и если не расстроит отличие от первой части. 

P.S. На плати точка ру ее можно взять за 365 р, что очень неплохо =))

review: It's a great little stealth game that doesn't overstay its welcome. I finished it in 10 hours on hard, making sure to get every stealth and mercy gold medal. The mechanics are fun and the fourth wall breaking jokes are neat. From the cutscenes you notice that it doesn't quite have the budget of a AAA Title but it doesn't have to. It's quite challenging and fun from beginning to end. However, I bought it on sale for around 10 bucks which it is more than worth. The full price of 40€ seems quite steep to me, but you can decide if 10 hours of great gameplay is worth that to you. If you're intent on 100%ing the game you might get around 15-25 hours out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032510792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1538922118}
review: Great game in the spirit of Thief. If you treat it as such and don't expect Assassin's Creed like combat you will have a blast. Atmosphere is great. About the environment/level design: Some areas feel a bit like set pieces, especially when they are more open and you can see clearly the movement path of the opponents (on rails) which happens especially in your hometown. The more Dungeon like levels feel great and less predictable. None the less the game offers a good balance between challange and flow. The more difficult passages happen when enemies cover each other with their line of sight. Not all skills are equaly important. I put most points into Stealth and Alchemy, secondly perception. Fighting skills can be ignored, because if you get caught you will die and reload. Did not try the clone abilities that much. Very positive is that you can change your skill distribution in between missions and try out new things or get rid of skills (with xp refund) which you do not find useful, meaning you don't have to worry that your early skill choices are set in stone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025116695', 'num_games_owned': 7739, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1537738959}
review:
Gutes Spiel im Styx Manier.  Eindeutige Empfehlung für das Spiel kann ich leider nicht aussprechen. Die Qualitätskontrolle bei dem Spielentwickler hat geschlammt und so in 3 Levels gab es nur Frust pur.  Wegen einer ungenauen Steuerung und der fehlenden Möglichkeit abzuspeichern an den kritischen Stellen musste man die Passage wieder und wieder und wieder durchspielen bis es endlich weiterging. War sehr frustrierend. Am besten wäre es solche Passagen entweder sauber zu programmieren oder gänzlich wegzulassen. 
[spoiler] Im Letzen Kapitel man bekommt ein Gespräch mit dem Begleiter und muss dann kurz ans Ruder des Schiffs.Darauf folgt der Ladebildschirm und ein kurzes Film, dass man zum Teil überspringen kann. Auf dem Schauplatz angekommen erzählt Styx einiges zum Geschehen. Danach muss man eine kurze Passage durchqueren, nichts Schweres. Leider ist dieser Abschnitt so verbuggt, dass Styx hier immer wieder runterfällt und man bekommt diesen gesamten "Spoiler" komplett von vorn. Es nervt. Zumindest ein Speicherpunkt dazwischen wäre nötig gewesen. Das Problem in ähnlicher Form gab es noch an 3 weiteren Schauplätzen. [/spoiler]
Als Stealth Spiel ist es sehr angenehm zu Spielen. Die Fähigkeiten von dem Hautcharakter passen sehr gut zu dem Genre. Dass ist leider schon alles. Leider sind die Geschichte und Personen in diesem Spiel ein Witz und komplett austauschbar. Die Levels sind viel zu dunkel und man bekommt nur sehr wenig von dem Level zu sehen (auch wen man die Helligkeit des Spiels nach oben regelt). 
Fazit: Gutes Stealth Spiel im Styx Manier, mit äußerst unangenehmen Frustmomenten. Der Vorgänger Styx: Master of Shadows ist ein deutlich besseres Spiel mit schöneren Leveln und interessanter Geschichte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062725504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 6203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2902, 'last_played': 1706902220}
review:
Neue Rezension:

Der Hammer in VR. Spielbar in VR über den neuen UEVR-Mod. Aber es braucht einen guten PC für tadellose Performance. Mit meiner RX 6700XT musste ich leider die Auflösung reduzieren, was man auch sieht. SDpiel ist trotzdem in VR ein Erlebnis. Endlich sieht man richtig, wiegroß die Gebäude sind, und Styx sieht auch klasse aus. Klare Empfehlung für alle, die Stealth in VR erleben wollen.
Was ich noch nicht probiert habe, ist ein Koop-Match in VR. Ich denke aber, dass es möglich ist.

Alte Rezension:
Für mich leider ein Rückschritt zum ersten Teil.
Das Gameplay wurde geändert, die Steuerung wurde geändert, der Fähigkeitenbaum wurde geändert, dann noch die Unreal4Engine, die zwar mehr Ressourcen benötigt, aber leider diese nicht umsetzt in schönere Welten.

Katastrophal ist der Koop-Modus. Wenn denn mal eine Verbindung mit dem Spielpartner zustande kommt, dann darf man sich über massiven Lag beklagen. Auch wenn in diesem Fall die Verbindung über das Internet von einer 25 Mbit, oder in meinem Fall von einer 200mbit Leitung befeuert wird. Es laggt dermaßen, dass meine Figur augenscheinlich in den Tod gesprungen war, aber 2 Sekunden später teleportierte sie sich an den Punkt, zu dem sie zum Sprung angesetzt hatte.

Von der Story weiß ich kaum noch etwas, so unberührt hatte sie mich gelassen. Allerdings gibt es in einem der mittleren Levels eine Bossgegner, der ansich schon eine Frechheit ist. Dieser Boss ist meiner Meinung nach zu stark, und es passt nicht zum übrigen Schwierigkeitsgrad.

Leider fehlte mir die Faszination, die der erste Teil auslöste, und auch die Motivation alle Medallions zu stehlen.
Im Grunde habe ist das Spiel an mir vorbeigelaufen und in einem Jahr werde ich nicht mehr wissen, dass ich es in der Spielebibliothek habe.

Da ich aber dem Entwicklerstudio alles Gute wünsche, denn die Ambitionen diesen neuen Teil zu entwickeln, waren groß, spreche ich eine Empfehlung für absolute Fans der Serie aus.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997476882', 'num_games_owned': 1240, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 2268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2268, 'last_played': 1536780456}
review:
遊戲心得:

潛行遊戲，難度頗高(有時我都快抓狂了)。主角是哥布林被發現只有跑跟躲。遊戲比我想的還長，雖然地圖不多，但不影響遊戲性。

善用F5跟F9(S/L)。

遊戲中有些小BUG，例如NPC卡住不動，不僅無法觸發事件也有可能擋在路中間，只能丟瓶子等等強制NPC做出回應。隱身砍不到的技能點出來之後還會被用手抓出來的這設定我無法理解。

想要快速熟悉遊戲建議一開始一路殺過去。殺到第二章後面因為有重甲NPC就要開始運用潛行的技術了。

第一輪在點出可以看到徽章的技能前可以忽略收集徽章。專心沉浸在劇情中直到點出那技能好節省時間。

幾個小小技巧，Shift可以降低移動發出的聲音，甲蟲不算擊殺人(盡量殺)。若要解推人或是融化的成就可以用SL大法。

author: {'steamid': '76561198086985944', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 1906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1536131579}
review:
[h1][b]-Пригнись!
-Я уже пригнулся.
-Забавно, я все никак не пойму, ты сидишь или уже стоишь.
-Очень смешно. (с) Хелледрин и Стикс[/b][/h1]

Долго я засматривался на эту игру, но уж сильно кусался ценник, тем более в сравнении с ценой прошлой игры. Но ухватив на плати.ру ключик за 350р., я все же опробовал сей продукт. Оправданное ли повышение цены до полноценного трипл-эй проекта? Обо всем по порядку.

В сюжетном плане какого-то масштабного скачка вперед нет, да в принципе, и не ожидалось. Это далеко не та игра, от которой хочется видеть что-то выдающееся в сюжете. Игра берет вариативностью в стелс-геймплее и каким-никаким юмором. В сиквеле, к слову, с этим всем стало еще лучше. Стикс нередко ломает четвертую стену, стебется над всем, что движется, и "бомбит" на вас на послесмертном экране. А многоуровневые локации с местами, где можно пролезть, залезть, тактично обойти, спрятаться стало в разы больше. По ходу заданий можно получить альтернативный способ пройти его, подслушав противников или же самому наткнуться на него. Данные возможности всегда приветствуются в жанре. Каждая локация позволяет вам пройти ее незамеченным и не запачкав руки. И этому неслабо способствует крафт, что был добавлен в игру.

Крафт очень уместно вписался в игру, и он откровенно навязывается вам в течение игры, т.к. ресурсы довольно-таки часто встречаются. Из предлагаемого вы можете создавать наземные ловушки, хилки, кислоту для растворения трупов, метательные ножи и многое другое. Прокачка так же перекочевала из прошлой игры, позволяя не только прокачивать вашего Стикса, а еще и обменивать опыт на костюмы и оружие. Оружие и шмот имеют свои бонусы и штрафы, так что свободно можете приодеть вашего персонажа под наиболее подходящий вам стиль игры. К слову, оружие и шмотки можно получать и за прохождение сюжетных и дополнительных заданий. С помощью янтаря Стикс по-прежнему может создавать клонов и становиться невидимым, а прокачка способствует расширению сфер применения клонов и невидимости.

Но игра не без изъян. Во-первых, в игре встречаются баги в виде застревания NPC, или они бывают просто напросто игнорируют ваши отвлекающие шумы. Во-вторых, имея в наличии 9 миссий, локаций всего 3-4. Постепенно от миссии к миссии мы будем возращаться в прежние зоны, но проходить мы будем их с другого конца. Очень знакомо, да? В прошлой части было точно так же. В итоге вы проходите уже знакомую вам локацию, зная заранее все ходы. Имея такой ценник, неприятно видеть повторяющуюся историю.

Но несмотря на все это, я остался доволен игрой, даже открыл все достижения. Если вам понравилась первая часть, то по скидке вполне можно взять. Играется как всё тот же Стикс с внедрением некоторых новых идей. Styx: Shards of Darkness разработана на движке Unreal Engine 4, что позволило не слабо апнуть графон. Игра выглядит прилично даже на фоне новинок 2018-го года.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972013765', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1600789986}
review:
Not as good as it's predecessor, Styx: Master of Shadows, but still a very good stealth game. The plot and sound acting is a bit corny, but the gameplay is very solid and enjoyable. Level design is just amazing, it really gives new meaning to "3D" in games, as the levels have a new dimension not utilized so much in games: height.

While not open world, the levels are open and have multiple ways of proceeding through them. The new Co-op mode is a welcome addition to the series as well, there aren't that many PC games with co-op option I think.

All in all would recommend for stealth game fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972103191', 'num_games_owned': 1215, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1535466573}
review:
This is a fantastic gem that way exceeded my expectations. 

If you do not like difficult stealth games, this is not for you. Those that are dropping negative reviews due to the due to the difficulty are clearly not playing it with stealth. Unlike Hitman or Splinter Cell etc, where it wants you to play stealth but you are totally allowed to run and gun, this game will brutally punish you if you do not play with stealth, time movements, stick to shadows, stay on carpets etc. There are enough pieces here that you have a lot of ways to play out the levels... kicking down the door and going postal is not one of them... ever. At first I died a lot, by the third level I almost never died. At first I had 20 kills per level, by the third level I had maybe 1 usually 0 through the game. That should explain it enough. It's all about AVOIDING confrontation.  

I was a little taken aback by the lack of tutorial or anything, an never having played the original Styx, I had no idea of some of the abilities (such as going invisible for a short time) until a bit into the game when I stumbled upon it... sure would have been handy before. While sure you can parry a guards attack and potentially kill them in mele, you will get pounded if you don't use stealth. 

This reminds me of a really good modern Thief game... way better in fact. The levels are HUGE, and the secondary objectives in each mission is usually a multi-stepped event that has great rewards. The level design is expert level and each level has so many paths for exploration and compliting objectives in wildly different ways that it lends to replayability. As you progress you can level up your character with new abilities and gear, which also lends to replaying earlier levels with your new toys. 

U4 engine makes the graphics look quite nice, it sort of reminds me of a grittier version of dishonored in that regard. Styx, the main character, also breaks the 4th wall often ala Deadpool, and is quite humorus. If you are easily offended and need a safe space, turn away. The fact that there aren't mini-maps and objective markers everywhere really keeps the UI clean and adds to the overall asthetics of the game. The game takes you into many different areas to explore, each with a different asthetic to it, so the eye candy never really gets boring or loses its flair. 

One REALLY annoying thing I did notice in the game is the fact that you cannot close doors after you open them. While you should try to avoid doors anyway, sometimes you need to open one, and the fact you can't close it behind you and just leave a new way for guards to detect you just is silly. 

You can interact with the environment to a degree ala hitman (poison food, kick a barrel down steps into guards, booby trap alarm bells) it would have been nice to have a few more options though.

The story is serviceable, but it is just a setup to introduce a new playground for you to play in for the next hour. 

I encoundered few glitches, and those I saw were not game breaking in the least. Guards, for instance, would walk into eachother or walk into a wall, but would fix themselves after a few seconds. 

Climbing up stuff is easy, climbing down can sometimes lead to unintended deaths ala Assassins Creed 2 but not nearly as bad as that (jumping the wrong way to what you are aiming etc... but this only happened a few times). 

I love stealth games and have played many, this is going right up there as one of the top-end ones. Definitely going to be following the series here on out. 8/10

The main character can be a bit much sometimes, but he's lovable. Don't be afraid to fight like a little bitch, and always think about your plan of attack or route to the exit before just storming off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060262647', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1535138939}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness:  What if Thief but fantasy?

Styx and Of Orcs and Men as a series has passed me by until now, I was aware of it and have seen it in stores but it never really interested me enough to play it until it was pitched to me as a sort of Thief game but with a fantasy world setting (you know the kind; Elves, Dwarfs and Humans in a middle ages high fantasy backdrop) the prospect intrigued me as I have really enjoyed Thief 3 in the past and other stealth based games as well. It is also by Cyanide studios, the same devs who have worked on Of Orcs and Men, Styx: Master of Shadows and the upcoming Call of Cthulhu: The official video game, a title that I have personally been looking forward to.  So is Styx: Shards of Darkness a good game? Let’s find out...

 Styx is your ordinary, loveable anti-hero, stealing from the rich and keeping it for himself, while cracking some witty forth wall shattering jokes. Most importantly he is totally unsympathetic towards the blight of those around him and only ever gets involved in the political intrigue of the day because of personal gain. If this sounds anything like a certain protagonist from a certain influential series then you would not be entirely wrong as Styx is very much a more comedic Garrett who often talks to the directly to the viewer about the absurdity of the current situation or whatever terrible pain you have inflected on Styx, if you wanted to or not. Overall the writing is okay for a majority of the game, it is compelling while it is there and is not entirely predictable but ultimately unmemorable unlike Thief which had better world building, characters and dialogue. Styx Shards of Darkness does try to build an interesting living world and sometimes it gets close to differencing itself from the Tolkien standard but it falls short of being truly compelling, the bugs and glitches do not help  with immersing the player in the story but we will get to that later. Where the writing really falls short is in the final 2 loading screen text updates which I will quote now “Do the Dwarfs already have started their offense?” and “It is also time for Styx to leave this city that is on the verge of war.”  The grammar declines in quality seemingly out of nowhere and it is very distracting and somewhat laughable.  The ending itself is suitably climatic (if poorly designed but we will get to that later) but the game itself just stops rather abruptly after the final boss. It was neither a cliff-hanger nor a finished conclusion to 20 hours worth of content. I do suspect that either the budget was running out or time to release was drawing closer then desired because it is really jarring.

The gameplay itself is classic stealth, you have to sneak your way through expansive levels to complete objectives, there is no shop so you have to savage for resources and items from each of the nine levels that make up Shards of Darkness, there is an focus on platforming here with different routes to take when travelling over the levels looking for secrets and collectables that all benefit the game in some way or another. The stealth itself is very well done in that you can escape your pursuers if you get spotted and the game gives you multiple ways to know where the patrolling guards are and how to get past them.  Not every single person in the map instantly knows your exact position and if you use the terrain to your avenge you can escape them and the maps offer a lot of hiding places. The AI is very smart and will actively look for you in the nearby area forcing the player to think on the fly and study the level to remember the possible best places to hide.  In short the stealth ticks all the right boxes of exploration and design. 

However the more I played the more cracks in the game’s design started to appear. Starting first with the ‘combat’ the game might suggest there is combat but it is not, more of a quick time event, if you get caught and have nowhere to run enemies will murder you in two hits, you can parry whenever a button appears and that is it. You cannot hope to kill anyone unless you backstab them. This can make any option to get out of a tight spot with fighting like in Thief completely mute you might as well load a save as there are times when you cannot hope to escape or hide.  It does not help that the parry function is far too unforgiving in terms of a time window (even then I swear it does not register the hits the button prompts sometimes) another problem arises with how skill points are rewarded.   At the start of each mission you have four reward tiers, first one demands you to complete the mission within a set time limit, the second a set amount of people you kill throughout the mission, the third asks you to not trigger alarms and the forth reward tier asks you to find a number of collectables found in each mission. Let me ask you this dear readers, how does it make any sense for a stealth game, a genre where careful thought, planning and observation are key to success to have a time feature that punishes you with losing experience points for planning your route and exploring. Hell even the forth tier tells us to look through the massive levels to find collectables at the expense more experience points. Maybe on the second playthrough when you know the map layout and AI movements and placements but not when the player is learning how to get from point A to point B without getting  spotted or triggering alarms because there is no combat, while getting punished for not getting from A to B fast enough.   It is a strange and stupid bit of design that clashes with the game’s central stealth mechanic all the time.

Now about that final boss....

There are only two bosses in this game, just as well as Stealth games do not encourage bosses as a whole, the first one is not bad, it does involved mostly platforming and little stealth but it works fine and is harmless as a whole. The final boss fight however involves you reaching a certain place to deliver the killing blow, all the while the thing is tossing instant death AOE everywhere you go, there is very little margin for error and you cannot make your own saves, it is only check point based and if you happen to die (and you will) you have to go through two loading screens and a cut scene. While the boss does improve after the first checkpoint it is amazing at how terribly lazy the boss is designed before that check point.  No boss should ever have AOE instant death attacks ever.

The graphics are very good, it looks on par if not better than most AAA products, the lighting and surroundings are superb to look at. The art style itself is just high fantasy classic with a little bit of steam punk thrown in for good measure, it looks fine really and that is about it. 

Majority of my time spent on Styx has been marked by mostly stable performance, FPS was at a consistent 60 and no screen tearing was found. However the lib syncing is quite bad, mouths do not so much create words as they do move up and down like dustbin lids, it is a little distracting seeing listening to some really good voice acting not syncing up with the character’s mouths on screen. Then there are minor bugs like hands and feet sinking into the terrain or some character models not moving when speaking. Then there are other more serious ones like character models getting stuck in the terrain or they will glitch out with strange movements, sometimes they would just not see me even after I walk right under their nose.   Sometimes the sound just cuts out if you move to the side of the character speaking.  Nothing really game breaking per say but it shows a deep lack of play testing before release, the game itself suffers badly when some elf guard’s animation just stops working and she slides gracefully in stock loading pose towards the water fountain. 

Styx is a flawed game that needed a few months polish before getting sent out into the world, a game that could have been great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041379206', 'num_games_owned': 4599, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 1631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1535119597}
review:
[h1]ステルスアクション。日本語対応。[/h1]
『Styx:Master of Shadows』の続編であり、『Of Orcs and Men』のスピンオフ作品。
ゴブリンが主人公で、透明化などの特殊な能力が使える。壁を登るなど三次元移動が多い点ではアサクリに似ているし。主に陰に隠れるステルススタイルはスプセルっぽくもあるし、クローゼットに隠れたり死体を隠したりするところはヒットマンに近い。
[b]【スト－リー】[/b] 
2作目であるため、前作をプレイしていないと世界観が分からずとっつきにくいと思うが、ストーリー自体に前作との繋がりはほとんど無い。
死んだらプレイヤーを罵倒するムービーが流れたり（設定でOFF可能）、ちょいちょい製作者や他のステルスゲー（アサクリ等）に言及するなどメタ発言が目立つ。
[b]【戦闘】[/b] 
後ろから敵に忍び寄りキルできる。普通のキルは音が出るので周りに気付かれる可能性がある。逆にステルスキルは音が出ないがキルするのに時間が掛かる。
直接キルする以外にも、食べ物や水に毒（Styxのゲロ）を入れたり、吹き矢や罠を使ったり、シャンデリアを落としたりといった方法で暗殺可能。
敵に気付かれても戦闘はできるがこちらから攻撃はできず、敵の攻撃をはじき、よろけたところでキルする。この敵の攻撃をはじくタイミングがシビアで結構難しい上、同時に1人しか対応できないため、複数の敵に襲われた場合は死確定。
[b]【ステルス】[/b] 
暗闇に隠れての隠密が基本だが、壺の中に入ったり机の下に身を隠したりもできる．敵の死体は運ぶことができ、クローゼットなどに死体を隠すこともできる。
暗闇の中ではゴブリンのナイフが光るので、自分が暗闇に隠れられているのかどうか一目でわかる。
[b]【特殊能力】[/b] 
クローン（殺傷能力のない分身）生成、透明化、千里眼（アイテムや敵のハイライト）の3つ．クローンと透明化はMPを消費する。各能力はスキルで強化可能。
[b]【システム】[/b] 
各ミッションの『サブミッション達成』『クリア時間』『被警戒数』『不殺』『収集品数』をそれぞれ金銀銅で評価される。評価が高いとより多くのXPを取得でき、そのXPでスキルを開放していく。前作同様スキルでStyxが劇的に強くなることはない。
[b]【総評】★★★★★★★★☆☆　良作[/b] 
前作から操作性等が向上し遊びやすくなっている。クイックセーブが可能で、ストレスフリーな作り。システムに大きな変更点はないため、前作を楽しめた人は間違いなく楽しめるだろう。
以下不満点
・前作同様プレイスタイルに幅がない
・クローンの使いどころが無い
・後半のマップが前半の使いまわし

author: {'steamid': '76561198071540153', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 1234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1234, 'last_played': 1535025599}
review:
不知道是我心态变化了还是怎么的，相比我一年前玩的前作没那么浮躁不耐烦了。

毕竟用了虚幻4引擎画面看起来舒服多了，优化也不错基本全程60帧没有卡顿。但其他方面我是真没感觉有多大的进步。
可能作为一个小工作室无法继续深化AI，AI仍然像前作一样呆板，只会固定的路程来回巡逻，并不会对一些事件作出更加真实的反应（比如门开了）。

技能仍然像前作一样鸡肋技能太多，我加到一半就感觉没有再往下加的必要了。而有些技能又太imba，比如隐身。

制作系统虽说新加入一些杀人道具，但作为一款鼓励潜行的游戏加入这些不显得有些多余吗？如果不是成就要求我甚至一次都没做过这些杀人道具。后期的地图重复利用也不知道是在继承传统还是小工作室资金短缺，总不免让人有偷工减料的嫌疑。

唯一让我感兴趣的是新加的服装系统，可以选择不同属性同时又带有一些负面作用的衣服和武器，但遗憾的是制作者并没有在此方面做太多的文章，整个流程下来只有两三件可以替换，选择种类非常少。

总的来说，游戏不难，很轻松的小品级潜入游戏。不是特别感兴趣也就不用来试一下了，想买的话可以去找找入包key，更实惠。
中评吧！

author: {'steamid': '76561198316398512', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 1732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1555, 'last_played': 1534858128}
review:
冥河：暗影碎片汉化补丁： panbaiducom/s/1c3OO1jU   汉化质量一般，好多技能效果翻译的不明确，还得自己尝试才能具体知晓技能用处，保存成功总是翻译成成功拯救很出戏。

硬核潜入游戏，主角是个哥布林很新颖，死亡后主角会讥讽你。敌人种类众多，在听觉，嗅觉，防御力，攻击力等多个方面都要高于主角，大部分敌人都是不能杀或者很难杀的，无双是不可能无双的，一旦超过一个敌人同时攻击你，基本只有死路一条，升级技能和装备可以提升你的暗杀体验，正面刚就不要想了，升级技能后你的暗杀体验基本就是从合金装备→刺客信条的变化，小公司出品，对于过场动画的精良程度就不要太过严格了。

这游戏的成就图标是我见过最奇葩的，好多个成就图标一个模样。前期每一关的地图还是很精致的，想要前往一个目的地可以在非常多的路线中选择，游戏后期和一代一个毛病，连续好几关让我们把前头走过的地图再走一遍。

7/10，潜行爱好者可入.

review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness - skradanka, myślałem, że nie jestem fanem tego gatunku, ale po zagraniu w styxa uważam, że to chyba jeden z moich ulubionych.
Fajne jest to, że nie wbijasz sie tam po prostu na chama i nie zabijasz bo już z dwoma przeciwnikami na najłatwiejszym poziomie trudności masz raczej marne szanse, dlatego do wykonania zadania trzeba podchodzić taktycznie, a dróg dotarcia do celu jest zawsze więcej niż jedna, dlatego gra daje też dużą swobodę, możesz powybijać wszystkich po kolei z ukrycia, ale też odwrócić ich uwagę i przemknąć się niezauważenie, raz nawet gdy wykonałem zadanie i byłem przy wyjściu zaryzykowałem życie, żeby wykonać misję poboczną (zdarcie plakatu) więc rozgrywka jest bardzo klimatyczna i angażująca. Zdecydowanie polecam zarówno fanom skradanek, jak i graczom, którzy wcześniej nie mieli z nimi do czynienia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198419297054', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 3153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3060, 'last_played': 1655661159}
review:
[h1][b]Review of:[/b] [i]Styx: Shards of Darkness[/i][/h1]

[h2][i]Dead again!? Is that your controller in your pocket or you’re just pleased to see me? ~Styx[/i][/h2]

Styx is back! The sarcastic and mean goblin who claims to be the master of shadows (well, not without a reason!) returns in a completely new stealthy adventure. [i]Styx: Shards of Darkness[/i] is the continuation of the previous instalment, to be specific, [i]Styx: Master of Shadows[/i], although you don’t really need to play through the prequel to enjoy the storyline. Both games were developed by [b]Cyanide Studio[/b] and released by [b]Focus Home Interactive[/b]. 

Long story short, without revealing any details, the story isn’t as good as in the previous title, but it’s still genuinely interesting and entertaining. There are a few surprises here and there, moreover secondary characters are rather fine, however, the end of the game is just disappointing. Why? Well, it’s a cliffhanger that makes the game look unfinished and I can only hope there will be another sequel in the future. Anyway, fortunately there’s still our favourite goblin and his… unique sense of humour. Styx is one of those memorable characters that not everyone may come to like, however, in my case, I honestly enjoyed his company and I can’t imagine anyone in his place. Styx is as vulgar, cheeky, mean and grumpy as always, not to mention about his sarcastic attitude towards everyone and everything. Also, there are many references to pop culture and other popular stealth games. Besides, Styx somehow mastered the skill of breaking the so-called fourth wall; everytime you die (or rather he dies) the goblin appears on the loading screen roasting you and your lack of skill as well as complaining about the game and its designers. It’s really funny and makes the gameplay more immersive. Well, at least Styx realises that he’s digitised.

[i]Styx: Shards of Darkness[/i] offers exactly the same repetitive gameplay as its prequel, however, there are a few significant improvements. Starting with locations, they’re recycled again, but diversified at the same time, which makes them a bit less tiresome. Unfortunately, despite their enormous size, the game itself is much shorter in comparison to the previous instalment because of missions related to the main storyline that have less objectives as well as don’t require extensive exploration. Also, there are new types of enemies such as Dark Elves and Dwarfs. Nonetheless, all locations are great and they offer a lot of various ways to achieve certain goals by simply avoiding guards or just taking them out by any means. There are a lot of possibilities, but again, nothing new in this matter.

When it comes to Styx’s equipment, well, there are some new things worth mentioning too. First of all, our goblin has a few outfits and daggers to choose from before leaving his hideout and beginning a new mission. Also, this time Styx has a little (but deadly!) wrist-mounted crossbow with standard bolts that work exactly the same as throwing knives, but additionally there are special poisonous bolts that only immobilise guards instead of killing them. Styx can also prepare special acid traps that not only take care of enemies that step on them, but also dissolve their dead bodies, leaving no evidence. Another new item is called a cocoon and it can be thrown to create a clone at a distance, without consuming any precious amber. Thanks to the new crafting option, Styx is able to make all usable stuff as long as he has specific materials and ingredients. 

In terms of Styx’s abilities - nothing has really changed; you earn skill points by completing the main storyline missions along with additional objectives and unlocking Insignias for completing every mission without alerting nor killing anyone, within the specific time frame and with all tokens collected. However, this time all Insignias have three levels - bronze, silver and gold. Now, most of the available skills are the same as in the prequel, but there are a few new ones that are actually useful like, for instance, the ability to make corpses invisible while carrying them if Styx is also invisible or being able to rebirth in place of a clone if Styx had left one behind, which basically makes him immortal, well, at least to some extent.

[i]Styx: Shards of Darkness[/i] utilises Unreal Engine 4; the game is stable and really well optimised, with beautiful graphics - especially lighting effects and shadows. The soundtrack blends in alright too. Fortunately, issues connected with controls have been fixed, this time I didn’t have to struggle with dropping off any ledges or grabbing them after jumping. Furthermore, glitches concerning horrible ragdoll physics of dead bodies also seems to be completely fixed, because I didn’t encounter any. Well, only patrolling guards still happen to bump into each other or get stuck from time to time, but their AI was genuinely sharp.

All in all, [i]Styx: Shards of Darkness[/i] is an awesome hardcore stealth game, yet it didn’t get the proper recognition it deserves. Of course, it isn’t perfect (especially that ending) and there is still some room for improvement, but the game is stunningly beautiful and definitely worth playing, even only for Styx and his fourth wall breaking lines. So, in the end, 8/10 would sneak again. And, lastly, thanks for reading my review.

review:
Der zweite Teil von Styx' Geschichte hat das gute Konzept des Vorgängers nur wenig verändert. Es gibt neue Gegner, die Styx riechen können und einige neue Gimmicks. Das Spiel ist nach Hitman mein liebstes Stealthspiel. Es lädt dazu ein, die Missionen mehrmals zu spielen und dabei unterschiedliche Ansätze zu wählen. Ein Teil des Spaßes kommt eher aus der selbstgesetzten Herrausvorderung als der Story.
Eine gute Fortsetzung, die sich genauso lohnt, wie der erste Teil.

review: The first game was an unsung hero of 2014 for me, but now with a little more kick behind its sequel Styx: Shards of Darkness has set itself up to be noticed by more eager gamers looking for a challenging stealth experience. With a more optimized experience, more freedom to the players and more of that sarcastic and vulgar goblin goodness, Styx has found his way once more back into the heart of this gamer - with a sharp dagger and sarcastic commentary. Gameplay, graphics, atmosphere: all is in the right place. There is a lot to love: The level design in this stealth gem is beautiful, the challenge level is high, the main character is a cynical bastard.  it's a pure stealth game; scrubs are going to rate it poorly just because they're bad at it. If you liked the first one, you'll like this one. Some of the powers carry over, some didn't, and there are new ones as well, including a crafting system. If you're a stealth fan, buy both Styx games. There is a lot to love: The level design in this stealth gem is beautiful,

author: {'steamid': '76561197983740996', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 1712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1532112733}
review:
A shadow scurries through the alley. A pair of yellow eyes briefly lights up, then it's dark again. Seconds later, a door opens as if by magic. Styx finally reached his target. In front of him on the table is the casket with the guards pay. With a sneer, he lets the loot disappear under his cloak.

I like Styx. This cranky creature that walks almost upright under tables, poisoning people by spitting on food - how could anybody not like Styx? It's not that simple with this game though. Even though I think 'Styx Shards of Darkness' is one of the best stealth games around, a few aspects of the game can become pretty annoying. 

Especially the controls are a major source of frustration because, no matter how well you aim, very often you'll miss your target after jumping. You will need to try again and again and again. Thankfully you can save at any point in the game.

The second problem of the game is the story. An endless source of cut-scenes with a lot of bla, bla, bla. The only purpose of the story is to link the levels together. Implausible twists and strange events turn the story rather irrelevant.

Gameplay wise 'Styx Shards of Darkness' is almost a copy of 'Styx Master of Shadows'. But due to some questionable level design decisions, the game is not quite as good as its predecessor, at least in my opinion.
For instance there are almost no orcs in Shards of Darkness. This makes the game far less scary and reduces the games diversity. Mission 6 has many puzzle quests that I felt very annoying and interrupted the otherwise very enjoyable stealth experience. And at the end of the game the final boss fight feels out of place. 

Pros:
- outstanding level design
- huge open world levels in both horizontal and vertical direction
- many secret passages
- nice graphics, textures are still a little too rough at some point but the game looks good
- very good atmosphere
- many different, creative possibilities on how to reach your targets
- one of the best stealth games around
- great combination of stealth and attack abilities
- funny interludes each time you die
- plays best if you decide not to be seen and don't kill anybody
- different type of enemies (but no more orcs!)
- thankfully, achievements are far easier than in Master of Shadows
- still a thousand times better than Thief

Cons:
- serious control issues! I sure missed edges, ledges and pillars, I intended to jump to, a few hundred times. Very annoying.
- weak story with strange turns. Storytelling is truly the second weakest aspect of this game following the control issues.
- Styx is still too rude (although some people might like that)
- lower replay value than Master of Shadows. I remember I didn't want to stop playing Master of Shadows. Stopping to play Shards of Darkness was easy.
- the same very strange, very unique, somewhat annoying, music like the last time

author: {'steamid': '76561197976502416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1562257596}
review:
Compared to its predecessor, Shards of Darkenss improves upon the good, somewhat addresses the issues, is undoubtedly a significant improvement, and remains a flawed gem that delivers a fun and satisfying stealth experience but also its share of frustration.

This is obviously a bigger budget production than Master of Shadows and the maps look better and more detailed. They are also better designed and typically have multiple ways to approach a situation, which generally makes it easier than the previous game because it doesn't have the same bottlenecks that force you into certain solutions.

The control issues that plagued the previous game are...well, it's better, at least. Jumps feel more consistent and less likely to send you plunging to your death, but there are still moments of frustration and you will still learn to save before every jump sequence just in case the game doesn't behave the way you expect it to. Having more ways to work around problems does help the issue because you don't always have to make the difficult jump.

Unfortunately, there has been no improvement in the quality of writing. The story is decent and keeps you engaged, but the script once again is obviously not written by a professional English writer, with some glaring spelling and grammar errors that would have been easily caught by a competent editor. What's truly offensive, however, is their sense of humor. It's OK for Styx to be vicious and mean; being totally unfunny and annoying to the player is not OK. The developers think they're funny; they are not, and it looks like they can't think of anything funnier than cheap genital and butt jokes that most people outgrow by the age of 12. The fourth-wall jokes got tired the first time and they just keep at it like it's the gold standard; some people may like it, but for me it's just really tiring and breaks immersion in what is otherwise a serious, well-crafted fantasy world. The game over taunts that Styx makes to the player are by far the worst, especially since 9 times out of 10 they occur because of inconsistencies with the game's own jump mechanics, such as Styx failing to grab onto a ledge or rope right in front of him. It's enough to make you want to drop a chandelier on the developers.* At least this time round the voice actors don't sound completely bored and ridiculous at the same time.

The boss fight sequence was by far the worst thing in the first game, so obviously they doubled it up with TWO boss fights, both of which are essentially platforming puzzles, and if it wasn't clear enough, crisp controls and smooth jumping are not Styx's strong suits. It's at least better than the crap that was its predecessor's boss fight, but it adds the frustration factor of not allowing saves during boss fights. The mid-game boss fight was particularly annoying in this respect - if you die, you get to do the whole tedious sequence all over again; at least the final boss had checkpoints.

Overall, Shards of Darkness is definitely a better game than Master of Shadows and had a lot of fun moments, definitely worth playing for stealth game fans. The ending almost certainly indicates that a sequel is in the works, which I look forward to as well. But it still has some frustrating moments, and I wish there was a way to turn off Styx's dialogue without compromising gameplay - you never know how good you had it with silent protagonists.

*A later update added the ability to turn off game-over cutscenes.

Better than the first.

However there are a few game emchanics that mad eit not so fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970683570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1532184909}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness is a 3rd person stealth game that focuses on stealth gameplay. It also has other aspects, such as melee combat, story and platforming but all those are secondary, both in quality and quantity. I like stealth games and I like goblins so the premise made me want to like this game. Unfortunately, in the end, I didn't. It isn't a bad game, it just isn't good either. It remained to be nice the whole ~ 5,5 hours I played it. I wanted it to evolve into the good game it could have been but in the end I had to admit that that would not be happening. The game simply does not evolve, it remains to be the same from the start, which is a problem, because it starts up simple, tutorial-like. In fact, the whole game feels a bit like a concept demo. Everything feels as if the developers wanted to copy many elements from the best but didn't quite have the resources to implement them properly. Therefore, much of the game feels like the bare bones of a much better game.

Overall: 6,5

Pros:
+ Styx feels like a person
+ Some of the voice acting is good
+ A lot of nice ideas in the form of items, abilities and interactable objects

Cons:
- Story feels just an excuse for the levels
- AI is not only stupid but really simple
- Even though the AI is so simple, the game structure isn't like a puzzle game but like a sand-box, which makes many of the areas on the levels really easy and simply feel stupid
- Jumping (and related) controls are pretty bad
- The additional items, abilities and interactable objects feel underdeveloped and even redundant at times

author: {'steamid': '76561198141775948', 'num_games_owned': 1709, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 1734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1734, 'last_played': 1531832774}
review:
Styx2作目。ステルスゴブリンゲー。
ストーリーは前作から相当先の話らしいが、別に前作をやらなくても大丈夫。
ただ前作をプレイした方がいろいろとわかりやすい。
グラフィックが大幅に進化している。
基本的なシステムは前作と一緒、不意打ちからのキルがメインで前方からのごり押しで敵を倒すことはできない。
新しい追加アクションとしてロープの滑り降りやクローンに新スキルが増えている。
新スキルのテレポートがあるので簡単になってるように感じた。
もう1つの追加要素で協力プレイがある。
こちらは片方が死んでも、もう片方が生きている場合は10秒後に復活することができる。2人同時に死ぬとゲームオーバー。
しかしHPが少なくて、少しでもダメージを受けると即死、パリィができない、セーブがオートセーブのみとやってみた感じだと協力プレイの方が明らかに難しく感じた。
PS4のコントローラーでプレイする場合、ビックピクチャーモードのPS4コントローラーを使用にチェックが入ってると、逆におかしくなってクローン操作ができなくなるので使う場合は外さないといけない。
全体的に前作の方がストーリーもマップも面白かったかなという感想。

author: {'steamid': '76561198043472327', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1531689888}
review:
If you liked the first one, you'll like this
I was a bit let down honestly.
as in the first one, you only get a couple maps and from the middle onwards, all missions just play in maps you already did.
that is just lazy, even tho the maps are rather big.
Maybe with the intent to hide that a bit, there's no ingame map, which makes some missions really confusing. very bad choice of the devs.
towards the end, 95% of the enemies are in armor, so you can't kill them with your dagger. Seriously, in the second to last mission there were like 2 guys NOT in armor on the map. the previous game always gave you ways to dispatch those, and this one does too in earlyer levels, but towards latter missions it's just like "no, I'm not gonna let you kill those, you will go non-lethal wheter you like it or not"
Speaking of which, I hate that you have to go non-lethal for full exp. Styx makes it clear he does not care about human/elven lifes, so bonus exp when you killed more would fit him more. That was that way in the first game as well, doesn't mean it's good

All in all, if you liked the first one, you'll like this, but don't expect too many positive changes

author: {'steamid': '76561198115408541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1506247085}
review:
고블린 잠입액셕이라는 꽤나 독특한 소재의 게임.

목격자가 없으면 잠입이다라는 식이 아닌, 정말로 적의 눈을 피해 은밀하게 숨어들어가 목적을 달성하는 식의 잠입액션 게임이다. 이런류를 좋아하는 사람들에겐 해볼만한 게임.

다만 난이도가 좀 있는 편이라 게임을 편안하게 즐기려는 분들은 몇 번 플레이 하다가 그냥 꺼버릴 것 같은 느낌. 개인적으로는 약간 게임플레이가 하드한걸 좋아해서 즐기기 딱 좋았었음.


이 게임을 즐기리라 판단되는 분
1) 약간 다크한 판타지 배경을 좋아하는 사람
2) 은밀 잠입 장르를 좋아하는 사람
3) 약간 난이도가 있으며, 공략 방법이 다양한 게임을 좋아하는 사람

 + 주인공 고블린의 걸쭉한 입담과, 고블린 주제에 나름 간지나는 장면들을 보여주는 게 게임의 매력을 더해주는 포인트.

 - 풀어내다 끊어버린 듯한 중간에 끊어진 듯한 스토리는 마이너스 포인트. 


플레이 해보려면 1편부터 해보는 것을 추천한다. 스토리는 크게 이어지는 부분은 없지만 배경설명을 전부 생략해버리기 때문에 스토리 진행상 고개를 갸웃하게 만드는 부분이 좀 있을 듯. 1편도 은밀잠입액션게임이기 때문에 위와같은 사항들을 좋아하는 사람들이라면 충분히 재미있게 즐길 수 있을 것이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252373268', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 2068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1785, 'last_played': 1534104032}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness nie jest ani krokiem w przód, ani w tył względem poprzednika, ale słabym tańcem we wszystkich kierunkach, w którym niestety pogubili się sami twórcy. Historia jest ciekawa, ale słabo prowadzona. Lokacje są bardziej różnorodne i szczegółowe, ale z tego powodu poruszanie się po nich jest trudniejsze i często zamiast złapać się krawędzi zwyczajnie się od niej odbijałem. Nie są one też bardziej otwarte niż w poprzedniej części jak wielu twierdzi. Dalej mamy ich recykling w następnych misjach i podział na liniowe wąskie korytarze i bardziej otwarte twierdze. Poza tym są widocznie krótsze niż w jedynce i nierówne (część to zwykłe wyzwania zręcznościowe). Z tego powodu kontynuacje da się przejść szybciej.

Dodano walki z bossami, ale są słabe, a w swojej rozgrywce w ich trakcie miałem problemy z przezroczystymi osłonami, przez które przelatywały pociski. Walka nie została poprawiona, a kusznik dalej może w ciebie celować przed twoim nosem nie dając szansy na obronę. Ogólnie poziom trudności jest większy. Po lokacjach porusza się więcej i gęściej zwykłych przeciwników i płytowych żołnierzy, pojawił się nowy rodzaj latającego przeciwnika, żywica nie regeneruje się do określonego poziomu, ale trudno to odczuć z powodu nowych umiejętności, które otrzymaliśmy. Jak możliwość teleportacji do klona, strzałki unieszkodliwiające na chwilę wrogów czy miny z kwasem rozpuszczające nawet ciężkich żołnierzy. Oczywiście twórcy musieli zostawić również i bezużyteczne zdolności do odblokowania. Jak większość z drzewka percepcji lub niewidzialności.

Pozytywnej zmianie uległ system ekwipunku. Teraz możemy również samodzielnie tworzyć narzędzia i napoje. W trakcie pierwszego przejścia średnio to czuć i dalej będzie nam brakować surowców, ale jeśli powtórzymy misje możemy nazbierać dodatkowe surowce, które ułatwią nam zdobycie insygniów. Po śmierci pojawia się krótka scena ze styxem, ale jest ich tylko około 10 i po prologu już się zaczęły powtarzać.

Denerwowały mnie misje kończące się natychmiastową porażką po zauważeniu i brak możliwości zapisu w trakcie poszukiwań przez wroga, które troche trwają, ale nie tylko ręcznych, ale i automatycznych. Byłem bardzo zdziwiony, kiedy po 6 minutach gry i przerywniku filmowym musiałem po śmierci zaczynać od początku lokacji, ponieważ wcześniej przewróciłem kikukrotnie krzesło. W pierwszej części nie miałem z tymi aspektami żadnego problemu, ale teraz wielokrotnie zmuszałem siebie do czekanie, żeby nie stracić postępu.

Nie polecam tej części styxa. Mimo usprawnień trudno mi było cieszyć się z gry z powodu dużej ilości błędów psujących rozgrywkę, głupot i niepotrzebnych elementów służących za zapychacz. Zdobywanie wszystkich insygniów męczy i wymaga większej cierpliwości niż w pierwszej części.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002252866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 526, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1350, 'last_played': 1530622779}
review:
[h1] 狡猾で下品なゴブリンのアサシンが主人公のオープンワールドステルスアクション [/h1]

お馴染みのスティクスさんが活躍するスピンオフシリーズ第2作。

お察しの通り戦闘力がほとんど皆無な人なので、基本的には敵に見つかったら即終了。
重装甲の相手だと、ステルスキルや死体の運搬すらできない非力さが最大の特徴となっている。

そのため毒を盛る、罠を仕掛ける、頭上に樽やシャンデリアを落っことす、崖の脇を歩いているときに突き落とすなどの卑怯アクションを駆使しなければならない。

なるべく敵と遭遇しないようにする、ルート工作も重要。
身体の小ささと身軽さを活かして屋根、天井、床下などへ自在に潜り込むことができるため、攻略手段が1つではないのが面白いところ。
「こんなところにルートがあったのか」という発見が実に気持ちいい。

個人的には、死んでゲームオーバーになるごとに、第四の壁を破ってプレーヤーを説教するスティクスさんが面白かった。

review: Dorby sequel więcej tego samego z dodatkowymi opcjami nowymi przeciwnikami itd itp.Co się zmieniło od 1 części to między innymi nowi przeciwnicy doszli a klony które tworzymy nie potrafią już zabijać z szaf czy skrzynek.Inne umiejętności styxa tym razem nie potrzebują amber coś jak mana.Doszła opcja craftowania przedmiotów co jest fajne ułatwia zabawe , niby mamy mnóstwo składników po rozwalanych po całej mapie a jak chcesz już sobie coś skraftować to zaczynasz się zastanawiać co się przyda obecnie.Przeciwnicy czy muzyka swoją inteligencja w sumie wiele się nie róźnią od poprzedniej części.Spotykamy elfy ,ludzi ,krasnoludy,trole i robale.Co się pojawiło nowego to np 2 osobowe patrole gdzie jeden ma b.dobry słuch a drugi jest w ciężkim pancerzu.Poziomy są świetnie zaprojektowane jak wykonasz misję zależy tylko od ciebie i jaką ścieżkę obierzesz.Spotykamy dużo elfów ale nie są tacy lekko Over Power jak w końcówce poprzedniej części.Mamy nawet 2 walki z bosami i wtedy gra zamienia się w gre akcji a nie skradanke.Muzyka jest w tych samych tonacjach co w poprzedniej częśći i świetnie się to spasowuje z tym co widzimy.Pojawił się znowu back tracking czyli przechodzimy jakiś poziom 2x tylko jest np inaczej przeciwnicy po ustawiani lub inni z inna bronia w pancerzach i chodzą po innych ścierzkach.Oczywiście wybieramy sobie też umiejętnośći żeby gra była łatwiejsza a styx bardziej zabójczy skryty uważny itd.Gra wygląda lepiej od swojej poprzedniczki nic dodać nic ująć.Co mnie rozwaliło to orginalna cena jakieś 159zł? No nie sry to za dużo dla mnie,ale jak zobaczyłem na przecenie za 57zł no to jest dobra cena za styxa.Polecił bym każdemu kto lubi skradanki w świecie fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041339237', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1530364149}
review: if you like stealth games, I can see no reason why not to enjoy this game. It may not be the most polished game, but that's not to say it's not well made, it is. The first boss fight might be an annoyance, but the rest of the game is really fun. Styx is not the most charsimatic character in the world but he is who he is, and I dind't mind his sarcastic commentaries all that much (I saw a lot of comments of how people disliked Styx quite a lot, but in the end it comes to how much you can accept that this is his personality). In the end I had a lot of fun playing this game, and I would gladly recommended it to anybody who likes games like Splinter cell, Dishonored or Thief.

review: Didn't get very far with this one. Bought into it as a neat coop experience. Put in a few hours, but didn't have the drive to execute. The game engine is decent. It has a lot to offer as a stealth experience, but there's just something missing... It's missing some polish and some X factor that some corny jokes from a goblin can't account for. It's stiff, but I could understand why someone might jive with it. Too many mooks sauntering around, and not a lot of meaningful decision making. The nail in the coffin was probably the lack of a pull combined with no feedback loop. It's alright.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071813699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1561510106}
review:
Más de lo mismo pero MUCHO mejor. Ante nosotros tenemos una secuela de la primera entrega que lo mejora con creces.

No hay mucho que decir salvo que te encontraras un mundo más amplio, más variado, más opciones para afrontar la aventura, un Styx muy carismático y mecanicas muy mejoradas respecto a la anterior entrega. La ambientación es otro de los puntos que me ha enamorado.

Un juegazo que recomiendo encarecidamente a la gente que le guste el sigilo. 

La duración es aproximada a la anterior entrega, aunque a mi este me duro muchísimo menos debido a que la primera entrega se me hizo más dificil a causa de las pobres mecánicas que tenía.

Me recuerda mucho al cambio que tuvo Uncharted 1 respecto al 2. Más y mucho mejor. 

Al principio tuve mis dudas ya que el primero me dejo muy asqueado, pero al tenerlo en la biblioteca le dí una segunda oportunidad y no me arrepiento de nada. Este juego me causo la sensación contraría y me encanta!

review:
Buen juego de sigilo con mecánicas más pulidas que la entrega anterior. Divertido, con muchas mecánicas y maneras de completar un nivel. Es una atmósfera seria y visualmente fantástica, pero Styx le aporta un buen toque de su humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027916050', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1514476782}
review:
고블린크리드
점점 학살게임이 되어가고 있는 요즘 잠입액션 게임들과는 달리
잡졸 인간 A보다 약한 고블린 주인공이라는 점을 내세운 진짜 잠입액션 게임이다.
하지만 결국 하다보면 [목격자가 없으면 잠입] 식의 진행이 되기 일쑤고
아예 들키면 처음부터 해야하는 미션에서는 오브젝트를 살짝만 건드려도 게임오버되는 것이 스트레스를 유발한다.
사실 가장 큰 문제는 버그인데, 혼자할때는 모르겠는데 코옵으로 진행시 진행이 불가능한 수준인 버그가 자주 발생한다.
인공지능이 꼬여서 그냥 자기들끼리 모여있다가 "저기 고블린이다!" 하고 엉뚱한데로 뛰어간다던지
이동해야 하는 경로에 계속 증식하면서 경계하고 있어서 경비병 시체는 산을 이루는데 결국 목적지까지 진입 못한 적도 있었다.
사실 코옵때문에 산건데 코옵 버그가 너무 많아서 속상했던 게임
4/10

review:
Still only 20% complete, but I can already review it positively: it is everything that the first game brought but with improvements. The atmosphere is still here, the controls, the cool AI (I love the AI in this series, it is one of the best stealth AI out there). But now you get an array of new tools and new abilities.

One of the best level designs I've ever seen. Like stealth? Looking for an amazing stealth experience? You won't regret buying this. 

Just disable the game over animations/jokes, they are terrible and get old after around 5 times.

UPDATED: Finished the game. More awesome than the first impression. And probably there will be more, since the last cutscene leave it open for a continuation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019373741', 'num_games_owned': 4050, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 1307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1307, 'last_played': 1529773700}
review:
Review Edited
When you are used to playing in a fashion you like and that is permitted by the game (with kill skills favoured) and actually having fun, you get a boss with 8 parts to destroy that are located in difficult to reach places and protected by tentacles, bugs and elves, whilst continually getting bombarded by green acid that makes it impossible to see where you are going. A big case of overkill here. And of course you can not save before all 8 points are destroyed. No my idea of fun, absolutely frustrating.
This boss is probably easier if your gameplay is based on clones, invisibility etc and if your skill points are allocated that way. My bad that I tought I could do with a minimum of these and have lots of action. So I can give it a recommended for the real stealth fans, but others be warned.
