author: {'steamid': '76561197978605804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1932, 'last_played': 1520447128}
review:
Its a juxtaposed position for me on this game.  

The good, and there really is good here.  As a true stealth game, the mechanics behind this are well done.  All your choices are risk versus reward.  

engaging in fights with the enemy is not recommended as Styx is not known for upfront attacking.  Sure you *CAN* engage in a fight but styx is at a disadvantage in a normal battle.  This forces you to choose your engagements and actions carefully.  in addition and due to the afore mentioned ability of styx, exploring the environment also has consequences.  So again risk versus reward.  

You can't just run around killing everyone and outrightly attacking in borad daylight.  The way it should be with a stealth game.

This side of the game is well done.  Really well done.  So big thumbs up for this.  

Maps.  What there is of the maps (and i will get to the bad, really bad point on this later) are quite good.  They are open with multiple ways to accomplish what you want.  That is great and the variety is there.  

*HOWEVER*

Despite the great game mechanics of a true stealth game there is a glaring, nay glaring does not do it justice.   A monumentous lazy/slack/kick you in the teeth becuase the developer just can't be Ar$ed to do any more coding really horrific re-use of maps.

Don't get me wrong, i liked the maps.  But being forced to revisit the exact same maps with an excuse of a poor story line or changing humans to dwarves etc is just plain outrageous.  Its so slack from a development point of view it stinks of the game being abandoned before release where a fresh intern to the unreal engine was forced to finish it just by making you revist over and over and over again the same fricken maps.  Ohh he may have changed humans to dwarves or moved a few collectables around but that is it.  Its a right kick in the teeth.

My game experience started very high when i saw the maps (originally) and the open world and multiple ways to accomplish an objective.  Great, i was stoked.  Happy to take the risk to explore.  But as the game progresses and you are forced to revisit multiple times the exact same map you have already painstakingly explored over many save games, well you just can't be bothered to look around any more.

The game tarnishes quickly due to this fact.  Its really a cheap and nasty blow to the customer from the developers who are obviously expeptionaly lazy or half ar$ed.

Aside from that there are bugs.  Often characters that are supposed to be on a patrol route just get stuck for no reason blocking your way.  Dwarves were stuck in bridges/walkways.   The first real boss fight, after dying the first time, the boss just didn't attack me any more.  i ran around in front of it doing what i wished.

Its just do dissapointing that the game starts so well, has a great mechanic and involves you into its world.  Its so good it unfotunately excacerbates the re-use of the maps.

Its a fun game at first.  Its not a long game.  But i would not recommend to anyone unless its on a massive discount sale.

Shame, real shame.  The game had such promise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082238870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1603917362}
review:
The game is frustraiting on the tougher difficulties, and you'll occasionally get horrifically bad saves that just dumps you right back into danger, and don't get me started on the obnoxious character you play and the tiring amount of jokes he makes at seemingly every two minutes. The controls aren't perfect either, and it's far too easy to mess up. For example, most games that follow the Assassin's Creed approach fix you onto beams that you need to run over on occasion. This game doesn't do that, and for the most part, you have total control over where Styx can move over, for better or worse. Just expect to die from the clunky controls more often than you'd like, however.

But, it's surprisingly fun for what it is, and it sure as hell challenges you, especially on the higher difficulties. Bring a friend, and you can have them suffer through terrible jokes with you too!

If you have any curiosity about this game, pick it up during a sale, like I did. £35 is far too high for this game, but I'd say £20 is more forgivable. Be prepared to sink a lot of time into this game if you decide to try and beat it. It's best if you play this blind, but if you are skeptical about this game's flaws, by all means, look up some gameplay online. It'll spoil some of the fun of experiencing these flaws yourself, which, somehow, is part of the fun that this game has, but at least then you know if you're wasting money or not.

I suppose if you're a glutton for punishment, the highest difficulty that you can play on will keep you... Entertained, I suppose. One hit death, and no saving except for very specific parts of the level. And, once again, Styx is obnoxious as hell.
Enjoy, you deranged madman.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054728114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1580254783}
review:
If you're interested in the story, start with Of Orcs And Men. It's not a stealth game per say, but it's where (O.G) Styx's story 'begins'. 

Keep in mind that *spoiler* this is Styx after his 'new lease on life', so with his 'fresh start', I only expect that they're going to try new things, whether it involves his character or gameplay... 
I miss his floppy ears... ;(

Improvements/Changes: 
- Cinematic Cutscenes (compared to still images in Master of Shadows)
- Side Quests that involve picking up Gear (each with their perk and penalty) 
- Diverse Skill Tree (Makes you have to work a little if you want to make things a little smoother)
- You need certain resources to craft items (potions, darts, etc) and it has to be done at a Crafting Table (wherever you find one)
- When using Amber vision you can see the Patrol's line/direction of sight. It also emphasises Friendly vs Foe by marking them red or green.
- "Boss Fights", mostly sneaking around, but I thought they did it well!
- Multiplayer!!! (I haven't tried it 'cause I can't seem to find anyone, so if you wanna add me and play it, go for it! ;w;) 
- With Styx's new lease on life HE'S PULLING SO MANY REFERENCES OUT OF HIS ASS! 
- Styx may sometimes criticize you when you mess up or die. Especially if you fall, missing a rope... >_> 
- Different scenarios involving racial traits: Dwarves can sniff you out, for example. 

The only bugs I've experienced were minor, such as some patrols getting caught on items (which helped me, so I'm not complaining!) or the darn jumping from one part of the wall to the next- usually didn't send me in the right direction so I fell to my death... Another would be grabbing onto random parts on the side of a house. Even though there is no obvious ledge I can grab onto, I'm clinging to it. Oh... and the wording near the end threw me off a little in the snyopsis during the loading screen "Do the Dwarves have already began their offense" or something like that. Threw me for a loop.

The "Cons": 

- It was a little too... 'short' for me. :[

Much like MoS, you explore a few maps and then revisit them in later missions. This isn't a problem though. I feel like I'd be too disoriented if they put like...20... But having come straight from MoS, I still had a fresh feel for the game so the slight change in controls didn't upset me at all. 

As much as I admire the intricate level design, I don't feel like they were 'balanced' as well as it was in MoS. Like... there were 'too many' possible routes to take, to the point where I was scaling half of the area without having to worry about detection.

 Having finished my first playthrough with 0 Detection and 0 kills, I'll probably go back and murder everyone to collect the coins... ;( 


- During the tutorial, I remember the tips disappearing too fast. It took me a while to figure out the rope. You don't have to keep alternating between buttons, just hold down in the direction you wanna swing and he'll do the pumping. 

- THE FUCKING CLIFFHANGER, WHY!!! NOW I HAVE TO WAIT FOR THE NEXT ISNTALLMENT!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970240943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1520386967}
review:
The first issue I had was with the game modes.  The 3rd mode immediately removes normal combat and one of the best parts of the game.  The 4th game mode also removes save points causing you to have super long periods where you have to repeat if you have any issues, which almost always result in immediate death.  

The next issue I ran into was with the controls and consistency of behavior.  They are a combination of forced and highlighted behavior such as jumping from one grapple hold to another, but then in the exact same space, you have a hold that you have to manually navigate to land on.  And the difference between success and failure is slim with nothing to grab Styx.  Then they do in fact add a mechanism to help grab ends of floors so that jumps that are almost failures are still successful.  The rope swinging is a hold toward direction and shows an animation that at first seemed like it wanted me to swing back and forth with the controls, and then after several very confusing behaviors where Styx tries to rotate around it occurred to me that we only need to hold in the direction you want to swing, yet another example of where the game mechanics try to help you.  However, swinging from rope to rope is a manual process that is very easy to miss a swing and fly right by the rope.  Overall I found the controls and mechanics to be inconsistent and confusing, and every time I thought I figured out a new behavior there was a situation that behavior stopped being true for.

The raycasting used for enemies to detect Styx is horrible.  They can see through floors, balconies, and some walls.  It is painful to play with when you are used to modern sight lines in games.

There are these popups to explain the various mechanics and they can be helpful in understanding what they want you to do, but they exist in this space where they are not required and you can just ignore them.  However, they don't leave the screen, so to get rid of the message you either need to do the action they want or to wait for the next one to replace it.  I could not find a way to simply dismiss them, and for simple actions that were fine.  Yet, some of them require the use of an item to clear off the screen, and it never came up the first time when I wanted to actually use that item.  A better situation always occurred a moment later, but I had to have a popup sit on my screen until then.


Saving is a problem.  In lower difficulty game modes you save every 5 steps, figuratively, automatically.  On harder game modes you never save and have to repeat huge spaces of gameplay if you die from any of the mentioned mechanics that don't always work very well.  Also, if you ever find yourself in need to go back for a single pickup and it saves, then you fall down or die to an enemy who sees you through a solid object the save puts you back to the previous item pickup location.  Which may be quite a ways away from the place you were actually at.


I only played this game for 100 minutes, and then requested a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013990301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1521058456}
review:
Quite similar to [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/239160/Thief/]Thief[/url] and [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/203160/Tomb_Raider/]Tomb Raider[/url]. If you liked these two, you will probably like Styx too.

Overall I feel that the game is nothing special. Storyline is not too interesting and the game is not really addicting. There is that interesting concept with creating and controlling the clone, but except this there is nothing new.

I don't like that game rewards you for playing stealthy without killing. It makes the combat skill tree and half of the stealth skill tree useless (that half related to quieter/invisible killing).

I don't think the game is worth £25. Get it on sale. And don't buy Akenash Set DLC (see its reviews for more details).

author: {'steamid': '76561198104858047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1520353245}
review:
[TL:DR] A fun game that some what improves on the first with fun gameplay and an ok story.

The climbing is still somewhat clunky and frustrating and often gets you caught or killed.

The skills are improved from the first, adding more and tweeking some old ones, as well as having a super skill at the end of a tree that can only be unlocked with pure quarts and points and gives you a choice between 2 diferent skills depending on your play style.

The AI can be derpy and hyper sensitive sometimes and kinda kills the mood of the game on occation.

Now, I was really hyped for this game when it was first announced as enjoyed the first. I had reecently finished the first one as I had left it for a loonnggg while and decided to finish the game, I was delighted to see that this one was on sale. The game met expectations but did dip in some areas like the story, and the connecting lore. 
The funny 4th wall breaks if you die were entertaning at first but got annoying real quick, and the final boss can suck my ass. 
This and the ending as a whole really brought the game down for me. (You cant really call it a boss anyway) Just befor the last boss you have to activate the level, you get a load screen, then a cutscene. The game doesn't save after the cutscene so if you die, you have to go back and activate the level again. So you die, loadscreen, start the level again, load screen, cutscene. This pissed me of as the game decided fuck it and I would die for bull shit reasons. 
Then comes the final cutscene, the end of the game; It ends. It literally just ends. I honestly have never been so dissapointed at an ending of a game. 

I can only just recommend this game as the story and ending were just so... meh, infact I wouldn't be recomending it at all if it wern't for the fun I had playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004065946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1981, 'last_played': 1519932301}
review:
An absolute blast to play. Controls are tight, The level design is fantastic and the gameplay loop is solid.

The game does suffer from a simulatenously flat and bumpy storyline. One moment it's literally just Styx wanting to loot and the next moment you're starting a civil war. The boss fights are lame too but thankfully there are only two of those. The only other criticism I have is the lack of levels. Towards the end of the game it starts reusing levels and the enemy variety in the levels isn't enough to stop this feeling repetitive. Thankfully the levels are only ever reused once each (and not all the levels are repeated) and then the game ends.

Still, great game. I wouldn't feel bad paying full price for this as long as you thoroughly enjoy stealth games so if you pick this up at any discount then it's going to be worth your money and time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064801065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1519751331}
review:
All in all the game is very good. It is a similar gameplay from Master of shadows with some improvements. 

HOWEVER.

I was very dissapointed with the story line in general. I had re-played master of shadows a few weeks before getting Shards of darkness. Therefore the story line was quite fresh in my mind. 
In the end of master of shadows, [spoiler]Rakash/Styx loses all his memories of the events at Akenash[/spoiler] but almost from the onset of Shards of Darkness, it is as if Styx had  [spoiler]no memory loss at all[/spoiler]  He remembers everything from the previous game as if the [spoiler]memory loss never happened[/spoiler] Now this would have been perfectly acceptable if the game went into details on how he regained all [spoiler]memories[/spoiler]. During the game he also refers and meets up with a lot of characters from Akenash, talking about taking revenge on certain characters from the previous game, which he should not even [spoiler]remember at all[/spoiler] . Shards of darkness does not kick off many years after the   [spoiler]Fall of Akenash[/spoiler] and therefore Styx should be close to the person he was at the end of Master of darkness.  The game left a huge void in the plot regarding this and I was constantly bothered by the dialogue referring to the previous game. Recollection of what occured in the time passing between master of shadows and shards of darkness in a form of a cinamatic would have cleared all this up and made the game to a die hard fan altogether a better experience. 

There are also some other issues with the plot.  
[spoiler]Djarak says he wants to help his people but at the end when the golem appears, he takes the first ship he can find and runs?[/spoiler]
[spoiler]Helledryn's entire story line is flat. In the beginning she helps styx, with no real reason why. Sure, there is the weapon, but once they discover the truth she just goes flat. It is also never concluded in the end. After you save her from the troll she just dissapears. It feels like a very unfinished end and I would have liked her story to be a little better as she does play a huge part in the entire game[/spoiler]

In my opinion, Master of shadows had a brilliant sotry line. The plot always has a twist and the developement of the characters were so in depth that you felt betrayed in the very end. I was expecting the same kind of experience with Shards of darkness, but it felt flat and undeveloped. Not at all on the same level plot wise as the first. 

I still loved the game, and i would recommend it to anyone wanting to play a stealth type of game with some quirky comments and references to other games and movies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983008629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 4339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3431, 'last_played': 1610300706}
review:
[h1]"Такс-с,..посмотрим, что тут у нас...Странная бледная женщина...живёт под землёй... питается дерьмом...Мне говорили, что тёмные эльфы дегенераты, но сейчас я полностью с этим согласен." (с) Styx [/h1]

Ворчливый гоблин возвращается самостоятельным типом и игра начинается именно с того момента, где и заканчивается Master of Shadows. Выясняется, что мир Of orcs and men обзавёлся новой рассой и её быстро разрастающимися существами - домовыми с зелёной кожей, которые "портят посевы", а Стикс остаётся в полной зависимости от янтаря, от которой потерпел поражение его оригинал. Повторяя его историю, Стикс постоянно самосовершенствует свои навыки и способности и оказывается втянут в политические интриги. Разрабам удалось сделать здоровское колесо умений, которое к концу игры легко почти полностью прокачать и сделать из Стикса хобгоблина очень близкого к боссу предыдущей части, что позволит играть не только в режиме стелс, но и устроить неплохую мясорубку противникам, которые на этот раз не только бесхребетные и жадные люди, но и гномы-нюхачи и пещерные тролли, смахивающие на местных орков, сами орки (Аркаил в наличии...) и ТЭ. Система получения опыта наконец-то возвела милосердие в качестве большого игрового бонуса, так что смысл полного стелса для любителей такового будет давать о себе знать. Разные открваемые в процессе игры снаряжение и кинжалы помогут использовать различные методы прохождения и получить достижения.

В поисках новых источников силы, Стикс окажется в центре основных событий мира Of orcs and men и окажет сильное влияние на их ход, оставаясь почти незаметным. Разработчикам с этой игрой удалось сильно расширить представление о их вымышленном мире, где гг побывает и в поселениях тёмных эльфов, напоминающих комбо из Elderscrolls и Героев, поклоняющихся Великому Таракану и проявляющие своё нетерпение к другим рассам, побиться с гигантскими големами и быть свидетелем начинающейся революции и международного конфликта, что очень многообещающе для последующих частей, ведь прогресс после предыдущих частей для начинающейся серии на лицо: графика, анимация, традиционно хороший саундтрек. Кстати, местные эльфы в отличие Master of Shadows подрастеряли свой телепатический навык..

К сожалению, история обрывается довольно резко и фактически это эпизодическая часть, но по мне того стоит. ;)

review: Overall an enjoyable game in the same vein as Thief and Dishonored. However, the studio needs to avoid such heavy level re-use in later missions. I would also recommend more side quest/goals in each level to help encourage exploration on what were large and expansive levels. Additional activities and side goals might also make level re-use not so repetitive at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081148423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1519072387}
review:
Absolutely recommended. Why?

1. One of the very few games, if not the only one, which combines great design and MEMES!

2. Stealth is interestingly presented.

3. The levels are well thought, having lots of alternative routes to take.
4. The enemies are mixture of ninjas and Harry from Dumb and dumber.
5. Awesome storyline, although too short in my opinion

The things I didn't enjoy

1. Not many outfits to be equipped.

2.  Not many weapons to be equipped

3. Not many skills to be learnt.

4. FUCKIN ROABIE EGGS

5. The heavy armored enemies can be killed only through traps.

All in all, the series has lots of potential. And I hope that the studio will make another game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172445919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1520369053}
review:
[b]First Impressions[/b]: I have about 8 hours on this game so far but I have been a fan of Styx since Master of Shadows first came out.  I've played some of Of Orcs and Men but it wasn't really my thing (I believe MoS and SoD are both prequels to oOaM).  And I have to say so far this is my favorite Styx game.  Frankly I loved MoS because of the world it built.  I do love stealth games but the gameplay of the first felt a bit unpolished with the half-baked parry system and the crummy AI.  I loved the world, the tone, and the character of Styx, and Shards nails this on the head

You are in a very different setting from the first game and I'm not sure if I like it more than Akenash from the first game but I do very much like it and it's very dark somber tone; although, the tone of the actual game, characters, music, and styx himself are a lot less somber than the first.  In contrast of MoS the music is almost steam-punky instead of the super melancholy dones of its predicessor.  I feel like the new soundtrack fits Styx's character much better as well as the new setting.  Akenash was a very dreary place where everyone had something to hide whereas Korrengar and the port town place are a lot more "THERE'S GOBLINS EVERYWHERE AH KILL THEM" Styx is a lot more talkative and funny than before.  He frequently breaks the fourth wall here and sometimes it'a actually really funny and sometimes... eh.  Thank God this time around there are actual cut scenes and not just those painting slide shows which were pretty cool at first but got old watching the same two pictures flash back and forth.  

The gameplay seems a lot more polishsed and tighter, especially with the drop down from a ledge and hang thing.  Some of the parkour is still a bit touchy and sometimes it looks like you could hang somewhere but you can't but it isn't nearly as bad as the first game.  The parry mechanic is different, but still not fantastic.  You only have to parry once (which seems even harder than it was in MoS) and then you can kill them.  The AI has improved greatly and they now react to much more and act a lot more like actual people.  Sometimes this is irritating but it is a lot more immersive.  I wont say the AI is perfect but it is improved.

The voice acting is hit or miss.  The elves seem pretty pompous and arrogant, which is fitting, but the human enemies are a bit awkward and cheesey.  Besides Styx, the Dark Elf priest person, and the main C.A.R.N.A.G.E. captain, everyone else is fairly mediocre.  

The worlds are super vertical and sprawling which carried over from the first game and feels improved.  There is always more than one way to get to another area and you have to wait, watch, listen, and observe to determine the best course of action.  It is beyond fun to explore and discover new areas and new ways to get to places.  It is a fantastic expirence that any stealth game fan needs to have.  The game is still very difficult though.  You are still super weak and can't take on more than one guy at a time and it is a true love letter to stealth fans.  

As of right now I love this game and I intend to continue to update this review as I continue playing through.  I highly suggest this game, especially for its marked price and most especially if it is on sale.

review: Another outing for the jaded (or should I say ambered) wannabe anti-hero. and everyone's favourite goblin, Styx. If you like stealth games you will love this. Everything you would expect from a modern stealth game - use of light and shadow, noise, environment and all the tools of the trade. And perhaps that it is it's one weakness too - everything is expected. Does it do anything new here? No. Did I enjoy it? Yes. Would I buy the next installment? Yes also. It still captivates as you slip through guards and the plot keeps things moving along nicely. A must for stealth fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047766004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2450, 'last_played': 1518058555}
review:
I recommend this game with hesistation.  I'm torn because I really liked playing the first one and I was hoping that they would improve on it but instead the developers did the opposite IMO.  Why?  I really enjoyed navigating with the half-accurate maps and without the objective markers / HUD which basically tell you exactly where you need to go.  Where's the challenge of exploration, navigation, and finding stuff on your own (I played the first with the obective markers turned off)?  In SoD doing that would have been pretty much impossible becuase there are no crude maps provided and not enough clues are given regarding the target/objective.  They just take the lazy way out and hand-hold the player right to where they need to go.

Next, I was really annoyed with how loot is displayed.  You could see that something flashy was laying on the table but it was too difficult to tell what the heck it was and if you actually needed any more of it.  This caused me to waste a lot of time trying to grab items that I already had a full inventory of.  

Technically the game worked fine except for one level where a save point was not available until you progressed part-way through the level, with the problem being that if you died, the game would load the PREVIOUS level, and then after Styx interactied with one item, load the level you died on, all of which ended up being a waste of time.  

Also, why no first person option?  So much more immersive.  The original Thief series was to this day, the most immersive game I've ever played on a flat screen... and I can say with certainty that it would not have that distinction if it would have been a third-person game.... another opportunity passed up.  

Finally, I thought that the ending was too abrupt and didn't bring closure.  I was also really annoyed that Styx never hooked up with his female companion.  I thought for sure that was going to happen and I think it was a huge homorous opportunity that was missed.

Not that all the negatives are out the way, the game was still fun to play; it just should and could have been so much more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027339846', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2275, 'last_played': 1517795825}
review:
Cet épisode de Styx est assez... mitigé et décevant.

D'un côté, les missions sont plutôt bonnes, les dialogues sont bien écrits (audio en anglais et sous-titres en français, les deux sont très agréables) et les environnements sont plus variés que l'éternelle tour du précédent jeu. Malheureusement, plusieurs gros problèmes me laissent au final un mauvais souvenir :
- malgré une bonne écriture de dialogue, l'écriture de l'histoire pose plein de problème et l'intrigue est pleine de trous ou de raccourcis beaucoup trop rapides, avec une confrontation finale qui est une vidéo coupée avant que l'action commence
- des bugs fréquent des IA, qui peuvent être à l'avantage du joueur mais aussi bloquer un endroit, ainsi que un ou deux endroits où des ennemis sont systématiquement coincés dans le décors
- des problèmes de performances qui se dégradent au fur et à mesure du jeu, s'accentuant en freeze de plus en plus longs

Dans l'ensemble, ça me donnait plus l'impression d'une suite forcée plutôt que d'un ajout intéressant au jeu précédent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060655354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1517943723}
review:
I received this as a gift from someone I played the first styx game with, and Ive just gotten to the residential bit of korrangar.

Only a few hours in but so far am thoroughly enjoying it, but there are a few distracting things. First thing you notice is how graphically shiny it is! Incredibly pretty environments, with I think more contrast and focus between light/dark areas than the first game................ but this is not always 100% accurate, sometimes you'll be in pitch black and a guard will spot you, other times the screen will be so dark you cant see them or even where youre going. Small thing to bring up but if youve ever had a visual migrane, the light pattern cast by the torches is like experiencing one of those. 

Guard patterns seem less predictable than the first game, and its less easy to pick guards off if there are others around. This is a good thing, and it seems the overall difficulty level is about the same as the last game. I dont particularly like the medal system for mercy, swiftness and stealth, especially the first two, it creates a weird opposition between wanting to collect all the items and explore the level and being told by the game that whoops, youve been too slow :(. I suppose there are plenty of other people who like that sort of thing, but I wish you could turn it off. Skill tree and items are improved, seems like there is a higher drop rate for stuff than before. 

As for the levels themselves, they seem both more compact and more complex, more verticality, with more to do in them and more pathways to the same goal. This is again is a good thing, although I feel I should be spending more time exploring them more thoroughly and getting all the trinkets etc, at present I reckon I only see about 30% of the level on a run. The multiple vertical level thing can get impacted by the parkour, which is rough around the edges, but 90% of the time is fine.

Styx has still got that 14 year old boy humor thing going on, and more amplified this time. This may not to be to everyones taste, but power through lmao. Story is Very Average but its not exactly the focus of the game if we're being real, and its actually got animated cutscenes this time. 

tldr its almost the same as the last game with better graphics and levels, a few issues but overall a great stealth game
7.7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198121301891', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1831, 'last_played': 1545086347}
review:
Продолжение истории о похождениях харизматичного гоблина. По сравнению с предыдущей частью игра определённо подросла как визуально, так и по части геймплея. Поклонников стелса ждут многоуровневые запутанные локации с вариативностью прохождения уровней и выполнения заданий. Игровые механики стали более разнообразны, добавили крафт предметов из собранного на уровне добра и возможность совместного прохождения в кооперативе на двоих. Сложность, как мне показалось, наоборот стала ниже по сравнению с предыдущей частью, где некоторые места действительно было сложно пройти с первого раза. После очередной смерти наш остроумный гоблин не постесняется потроллить игрока в его криворукости, заставляя лишний раз улыбнуться дерзкой шутке в свой адрес. Сюжет немного пресноват, да и ролики по-прежнему выглядят бюджетненько, но харизма главного героя сглаживает такие шероховатости. И даже повторяющиеся локации во второй половине игры не так бросаются в глаза, как это было в предыдущей части.
Из минусов - несколько завышенная цена и отсутствие официальной локализации.
Рекомендую! 8 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198093082664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1517139733}
review:
Très bien, mais trop court. 
Pour un jeu comme celui-là, je m'attends à une vingtaine de missions. Il y en avait 9. 
Pour ne rien arranger, la fin...vous laisse sur votre faim.
Pour continuer sur les points négatifs, je l'ai trouvé trop facile. Styx dispose de nombreuses capacités spéciales, mais la plupart du temps rester accroupi et éviter d'entrer dans l'angle de vision des gardes suffit largement à s'en sortir. Cependant, attendre qu'ils tournent le dos n'est sans doute pas la méthode la plus rapide; or, vous aurez besoin d'aller vite pour valider le bonus de rapidité. Personnellement, je me suis concentrée sur le bonus de discrétion et de "bienveillance" (j'ai pas tué de gens). D'ailleurs, c'est bizarre d'attribuer un tel bonus quand la barre de compétence de styx contient toute une partie "tuer discrètement et efficacement". 

Maintenant, les points positifs. 
D'abord, c'est beau, le scénar est bien, et j'ai pas connu masse de problèmes du type "Putain, mais tu vas t'y accrocher, à ce rebord!!!". Non, c'est bien fait dans l'ensemble. Les objectifs secondaires (temps, discrétion, bienveillance, jetons à voler) vous poussent à adapter votre jeu et à faire plus attention, plutôt que de foncer en mode tornade en tuant tout sur votre passage. C'est pas l'esprit du héro. D'ailleurs, dès lors que vous êtes repéré, vos chances de survie sont très amoindries. Faudra fuir vite et bien et vous planquer, en évitant les tirs ennemis, parcequ'en deux coups paf! vous êtes mort. à la limite vous pouvez parer les attaques, mais vous ne vous battrer jamais face à face contre un garde. 
Vous avez la possibilité de sauvegarder rapidement quasiment tout le temps (sauf pour les passages "run and don't die" où l'objectif est clairement que vous passiez tout d'un trait sans crever, mais il y en a assez peu) et les chargements ne sont pas trop longs.
J'ai particulièrement apprécié les diverses cinématiques d'après mort. On s'attache rapidement à ce salopard de héros. 
Enfin, une fois le jeu fini, vous pouvez rejouer des missions dans l'ordre que vous voulez pour vous améliorer, remplir tous les objectifs, etc...et ce en ayant monté les compétences de Styx, comme vous pouvez le faire tout au long du jeu. Bon, comme c'était déjà facile la première fois, je doute que ça ait beaucoup d'intérêt de rejouer avec le perso amélioré, mais j'essaierais bien les objectifs de temps qui ont l'air pas mal chauds quand même. 

Voilà. Beau jeu, bien pensé, pas de bugs ou de problèmes en particulier....non, les deux points négatifs pour moi sont la facilité (chaque fois que je trouvais une précieuse fiole d'ambre, je me rendais compte que j'avais encore mon stock au complet, puisque je n'avais jamais besoin des capcités spéciales...) et la courte durée de vie du jeu. 9 missions pour un jeu pareil...ça fait mal. Donc je conseille pltôt de l'acheter en soldes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350762508', 'num_games_owned': 2957, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1674671816}
review:
I love this game and want to recommend it but I've been trying to get some form of support for a widespread audio issue that causes sound to not play, which is completely unforgivable in a stealth game. I'll be more than happy to write a lengthy, happy review when I can play this game that I paid $40 for again, until then, this is staying up in hopes that it gets someone's attention.

Edit: It has been two years with no fix. Multiple other issues relating to audio and input have been ignored as well.

review: As with the first game I really enjoyed this one. I got about 13-14 hours of game play out of it. Has almost the exact same feel as the first game which is good. I know these games are not highly looked upon but the stealth mechanics work great and world is interesting. I love how self-aware this game is and doesn’t hesitate to poke fun at itself and other games. Talk about an abrupt ending though, what the fuck? I really hope they have the resources to make a third game, if anything just close out the series. I only had one crash, KB/M controls were great and everything else was good too. If you like stealth games you should give this series a try. Just remember to take them with a grain of salt. Good fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052125808', 'num_games_owned': 1125, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1517003899}
review:
Wenn mich jemand fragen würde, was Shards of Darkness ist, würde ich auf Master of Shadows zeigen und sagen "Das da - allerdings mit blauen Leuten und Bienen." Nicht falsch verstehen, das Ding kriegt einen Daumen rauf und eine klare Empfehlung, trotzdem habe ich kleinere Problemchen mit Styx: Shards of Darkness.

1. Es macht wenig neu.

Ganz wie der Protagonist geht Cyanide mit dem zweiten Styx-Abenteuer keine Risiken ein. Es ist mehr davon, aber hey, der erste Teil hat mir gut gefallen und ich nehme gerne einen Nachschlag. Es mag zwar den Eindruck machen, dass Styx: Shards of Darkness mehr Gegnertypen bietet, aber im Grunde ist das eine Illusion. Ob nun Menschen in dicken Rüstungen oder Elfen in Platte herumrasseln, ist mir Jacke wie Hose - die verschiedenen Klassen verhalten sich weitestgehend gleich. Es gibt immer noch eine Menge Oneshot-Mechaniken, wenn man unvorsichtig ist - wer mich da im Endeffekt knüppelt, spielt für mich keine Rolle. Immerhin bieten die lispelnden Elfen eine Abwechslung zu den 0815-Rittern mit dem aufgesetzten, britischen Akzent. (Leider bleibt man auch von denen nicht verschont.) Ansonsten bleibts bei Schnüffelzwergen, Bummkäfern mit Spitzengehör und Menschen/Elfen in leichter, mittlerer und schwerer Rüstung. Oh, gelegentlich rauscht auch mal ein Troll durchs Bild. Ach ja, außerdem gibts jetzt Bienen. Wahnsinn, oder?

2. Das Craftingsystem ist mau.

Gelegentlich findet man noch fertige Gegenstände, aber die meisten Sachen in Styx' Arsenal wollen nun gecraftet werden. Somit verlagert sich das Aufheben von Items von "Messer aufheben und werfen" zu "sammel erstmal drölfzig Rohmaterialien und finde einen Tisch, damit du ein Messer basteln kannst". Dadurch gibts zwar wesentlich mehr Sachen aufzuheben, aber das ist auch nichts anderes als eine Beschäftigungstherapie für Perfektionisten. Das bringt mich zu ...

3. Die Nebenaufgaben haben keine Bedeutung.

Styx redet zwar immer davon, dass er jetzt einen echt duften Schatz gefunden hat, aber davon merke ich nichts, außer, dass ich dafür ein paar Fertigkeitspunkte bekomme. In den letzten Leveln habe ich einfach aufgehört, auf die Nebenmissionen zu achten, weil sie mir auf die Nerven gegangen sind und mich vom eigentlichen Ziel abgelenkt haben. Wenn der Spieler so denkt, kann vom guten Design keine Rede sein. Styx ist ein großartiger Dieb, warum fühle ich mich dann nicht so? Ich würde mir für den nächsten Teil eine Währung wünschen, mit der ich mir benötigte Items bei einem Händler kaufen kann - dafür kann das Craftingsystem in die Tonne. Ich suche lieber blinkende Schätze, bekomme Geld dafür und belohne mich selbst damit, anstatt Erz aufzuheben und Tische zu suchen.

4. Orientierung!

Ich wünsche mir _keine_ Minimap, aber zumindest eine Karte, die ich aus dem Inventar aufrufen kann, um einen gewissen Anhaltspunkt zu haben, wo ich mich gerade befinde. Ich mag das mehrstufige Leveldesign dieses Spiels - allerdings hatte ich beim spielen mehrfach das Gefühl, mich nicht mehr zurecht zu finden. Das war aber auch nur ein paar Mal der Fall, denn ...

5. Levelrecycling.

Erklärt sich eigentlich von selbst, oder? Die letzten drei Stufen bestehen aus vorherigen Leveln, die man lediglich aus einer anderen Richtung beginnt und in die man ein paar mehr Feinde gestopft hat. Es ist schon eine Weile her, dass ich den ersten Teil gespielt habe, aber ich glaube, da gab es dasselbe Problem. So kam mir der Content arg gestreckt vor.

Insgesamt mochte ich Styx: Shards of Darkness sehr. Ich habe eine Schwäche für Stealthspiele und mag es, wenn der Fokus auf einer Spielmechanik liegt, die bis zum Ende verfolgt wird, anstatt dem Spieler zu sagen "Hier hast du einen Sack voller unausgegorener Scheiße, wirbel die mal irgendwie zusammen und guck, wie weit du kommst!" Das Spiel schreibt Schleichen groß und Draufgängerdurchläufe enden in den meisten Fällen mit einem Neustart oder einer horrenden Wertung, wobei ich lobend erwähnen muss, dass das Pariersystem diesmal wesentlich besser funktioniert. So stelle ich mir das vor. 

Allerdings muss ich auch hier sagen, dass ich den Preis für das Spiel etwas hoch finde - in meinen Augen ist Shards of Darkness ein aufgehübschtes Levelpack für Master of Shadows und wenn man sich Mühe gibt, ist man in 2-4 Stunden durch das gesamte Spiel geflitzt. Ich habe für meinen ersten Durchlauf etwa 20 Stunden gebraucht, aber auch nur, weil ich mir viel Zeit genommen habe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253858766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1498972524}
review:
哥布林版刺客教條 (X)
Re:從零開始的哥布林生活 (O)

Styx 一個母音都沒有的名字頗帥 人物風格你可以想成漫威的死侍
到處吐嘈 挖苦玩家 反正每次死了就要跨第四面牆嗆玩家

開發上用Unreal engine 不知道是不是這個緣故 不少負評來自遊戲Bug
我自己不用漢化mod什麼的都正常 沒遇過bug

潛行成分相較於多數刺客類型遊戲更重要 也更血尿
個子小的Styx實在禁不起正面衝突 挨幾下就掛了
並且過關目標像是Dishonored那樣可以途中改變
不過自由性還是差了一點 特別是一些關卡要求不能殺人或被發現

難度真的頗高 更M的玩家可以嘗試把一些操作介面關掉 (例如目標指示 敵人警戒) 
就更能體會從零開始的哥布林生活

author: {'steamid': '76561198075677444', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1698, 'last_played': 1687124918}
review:
In many ways, it's like the first game but better. I liked the story better, gameplay was pretty nice, soundtrack is great, the nod to Of Orcs and Men was pretty cheeky (and appreciated). There's no blatant level reusing like in the first game, and if a level does get reused it's not merely "level 3 but in the opposite direction" since levels feel less linear than in the first game.

It took me about 18-20 hours to complete the game for the first time (played for mercy, shadow and thief), ~28 hours to get all achievements. It's a great game. 

It ends on a bit of a cliffhanger though, so let's hope Cyanide Studios can count to three.



2021 Update:
Got a friend to play the co-op with. Coop is decent enough. You do get an occasional bug that you don't in single player, but in general things work and we had more than enough fun with that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971738796', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1311, 'last_played': 1519095343}
review:
A lot of fun if you're into stealth.  If you liked the first game you'll enjoy this.  They've taken the best parts of the first game and made them even better.  (for instance amber vision is now free to use).  Additionally the four award types (find all coins, don't kill anyone, don't get detected, and complete by a certain time) now have each got Gold/Silver/Bronze levels with different skill points rewarded. haven't tried the coop yet, but so far the single player game is enjoyable.

EDIT: 

The coop is really laggy, which will mean when you thought you were hiding from that guard, but weren't.  

However, the most unforgivable thing in a stealth game is BOSS MISSIONS WHERE STEALTH IS NOT AN OPTION.  oh yeah.. you can't save either.. and.. did i forget to mention that they're 30 minutes or so each while constantly being blasted with one shot kills?  During those missions this is just a crappy 3rd person platformer.  Think 1980's super mario without the nostalgia.  

Reviews must punish dev's whom create stealth games, but then make it so they're not stealth games in unavoidable missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963946093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2843, 'last_played': 1515035880}
review:
This was a decent follow-on to the original game. The story and premise were engaging; game mechanics were solid; the gameplay was enjoyable, the dialog well-written - but the ending was terrible, awful, and bad. There were plot holes big enough to drive a truck through. Recommended only if it's on sale. Don't pay full price for this!

Spoilers below:

[spoiler]
So we learn that the dark elf queen can sense where Styx is at - but nothing was ever done with this. Why? The queen is a really two-dimensional character. I kept waiting for the other shoe to drop here, but poof, nothing.

When Styx spoils the plans of the queen, there is no resolution here to speak of. She and her cohorts vaguely "escape", and that's it, she's gone. Considering the horror that she and her minions enacted, this is a giant let-down.

Speaking of the "horror" - man, that is a sh**load of amber they collected. Just how many billion "units" did they have to process to collect all that amber? It makes no sense at all.

The ending is a total letdown. Seriously, what person on the story team thought that was a good idea? A final confrontation with the dark elf renegade ends with...nothing but a truncated cutscene? Then the credits roll, and Styx is magically back at his hideout.

The end boss is an exercise in frustration. There are no manual saves allowed in the final "level". If you get killed before you get to the first autosave, you get sent all the way back to the previous level.

Speaking of the end boss - it's "hinted" at a couple of times, but the appearance of this overpowered boss doesn't make much sense. There's very little reference to it at all previously. 

The whole ending smacks of "Sh**, we're out of budget and time. Let's just throw a giant f*****g monster in here and call it a day."

[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198388408381', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 1917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1775, 'last_played': 1517515093}
review:
Non ho mai giocato alla saga di Styx se non, appunto, a Shards of Darkness.
La trama è accennata e poco interessante, il gameplay è macchinoso e a lungo andare ripetitivo, ma giocato poco alla volta può piacere.
Assolutamente non pagherei mai 39.99€ per questo gioco, avevo voglia di uno stealth e l'ho trovato in saldi.
Però potrebbe essere interessante giocato in multiplayer, ma 39.99€ non ne vale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161141911', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1515106874}
review:
It’s a decent stealth game just like the original. It makes some refinements to make the gameplay slightly better but it’s mostly the same experience. There is more variety in visuals and locations you visit which I appreciate because the first game felt very samy in its environments. The movement is better, it’s less frustrating and difficult to maneuver and climb around the levels. It’s again a hardcore stealth experience but it was easier than the first game mainly because you have more things to play around with, there is a quicksave option now and again the movement is more refined and easier. The gameplay just like master of shadows feels the same from start to finish and it doesn’t do anything to change up the gameplay aside from adding new enemy types to deal with which just made the game more annoying than anything else. After a few hours the constant same stealth gameplay gets tiring. I didn’t care for the story at all just like the original and I found styx in this game to be annoying and cringy. Overall it is more of the same if you liked the first game you will like this one too. 
6/10 (Decent)

review:
The second adventure of Styx. What did change? Well, luckily, not much.
It's pretty much the same principle, but now with improved graphics, slightly different abilities and less obvious backtracking. 
Is it better than the first one? Well, I'd say it's a tie.
I lked the Story and the location of the first game better, buts that just my personal opinion. The second game improved everything else slightly, offers a greater variety in places and some new gameplay features.
My advice: play both! They are both worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012498116', 'num_games_owned': 1418, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1420, 'last_played': 1515208338}
review:
This game is everything that the previous Styx game was, as in practically every mechanic is carried over and enhanced. The abilities have far more usage scenarios (swapping with the clone, acid traps, enemy smell tracking, etc), the graphics are far nicer, the game is even more optimized (native 21:9 support in my case) and the UI/UX is improved greatly.

Overall, as I mentioned in my review of the previous game, Styx heavily encourages stealth over confrontation (definitely not like AssCreed, more like Deus Ex/Dishonored on Hard mode) and gives you a very wide range of options to choose from when performing your objectives. 

A solid sequel for an already great stealth game. 9/10.

Edit: So good I just finished getting every achievement in the game, SO GOOD.

review:
I really liked the first Styx, but I loved this one. There is a lot of possibilities right from the start, without having to unlock a skill to do some basic killing.

Less bugs is always nice, achievements are achievable without putting too much time in the game (40h for me with video guides)

Each map is played several time, but it's not go from point A to point B, then later go from point B to point A. There are a lot of objective in each level, and a lot of ways to move through the levels.

And I enjoyed the boss battles way more than in the first styx, they feel more like the rest of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126147324', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 530, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1780, 'last_played': 1514642477}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness to ten sam poziom wykonania, co część pierwsza, z tym, że pewne rzeczy wykonane są lepiej, inne gorzej.

PLUSY:

Bohater- Styx to jedna z najbardziej charakterystycznych, wirtualnych postaci tych ostatnich kilku lat. Gdyby gry o jego przygodach wyszły na przełomie XXI wieku byłby postacią kultową obok Garretta. Tutaj obawiam się, że zostanie szybko zapomniany. A szkoda, bo projekt postaci, teksty jak i również voice acting Saula Jephcotta, który użyczył swojego głosu Styxowi to największe plusy tej serii. W Shards of Darkness dostajemy starego dobrego Styxa, ale z większa ilością komentarzy. Nawet przyjemnie było zginąć, aby zobaczyć końcowy komentarz naszego zielonoskórego bohatera.

Skradanie - w tym gatunku jest to najważniejsze. Mamy tutaj ogrom możliwości, wiele ścieżek jakimi możemy dostać się w inne miejsce. Gracz dostaje od razu wolną rękę. A podczas skradania mamy wiele możliwości pozbycia się przeciwników lub ich ominięcia. Było też znacznie mniej niż w części pierwszej ozdób typowo pod naszego bohatera.

Nastawienie na cichą eliminację przeciwników - Jak w części pierwszej, lepiej przemykać po cichu. Walka z większą ilością przeciwników zawsze skończy się śmiercią. Jak to w starych Thiefach.

Umiejętności - w przeciwieństwie do Dishonored nie robiły z naszego bohatera nieśmiertelnego typka. Ułatwiały rozgrywkę, ale nie na tyle by stracić satysfakcję z przechodzenia gry. Klonów praktycznie nie używałem z racji, że było to ostatnie drzewko umiejętności u mnie do rozwinięcia. W ogóle starałem się używać tych mocy jak najmniej i nadal pozostawać niewykrytym.

Sterowanie - ulepszone względem poprzedniej części. Już praktycznie nie spadałem z półek podczas zaskoku, Styx skakał i wchodził tam gdzie chciałem. W ogóle technicznie gra jest lepiej wykonana niż Master of Shadows.

Możliwość gry po zakończeniu fabuły - jak w "jedynce" można śrubować rekordy lub zdobywać odpowiednie odznaki.

ANI PLUS ANI MINUS:
Oprawa audiowizualna - standardowa. Muzyka nie przeszkadzała, ani nie zachwycała. Tak samo grafika.

MINUS:
AI przeciwników - jak w jedynce - nadal są głupi i przeciwnik nie zauważy, że śpiący nieopodal strażnik zniknął lub jak nagle opustoszało pomieszczenie.

Błąd krytyczny w misji nr. 3 w Sanktuarium - jeśli podsłuchamy rozmowę, po której mamy ukraść list, to tej misji nie wykonamy. Po zabraniu listu nadal widnieje on w celach misji i popchniemy fabuły do przodu. Zostaje inna ścieżka fabularna - z odnalezieniem ciała. Twórcy nie naprawili tego błędu od 10 miesięcy...

Fabuła - względem jedynki mocny zjazd w dół. Tamta historia pomimo budżetowego prowadzenia fabuły potrafiła zaskoczyć. W Shards of Darkness była mocno przeciętna. Fajnie, że zastąpiono ją przerywnikami filmowymi niż malowanymi planszami, ale fabuła jest mocno naciągana, gdzie Styx współpracuje z osobami, które chciały go zlikwidować. Ot tak, nagle. Mało przekonujące. Plusem były tylko niektóre dialogi i komentarze Styxa.

Zakończenie - tutaj już w ogóle twórcy pojechali. Mocno mnie tą zagrywką rozczarowali. Chyba zaczynało im brakować funduszy, bo historia jest nagle ucięta... I raczej nie zanosi się na kolejną część gry ze Styxem... Obym się mylił.

Cena - nas Steam zbyt droga w stosunku jakości do ceny.

Pomimo minusów grało się przyjemnie i jest to nadal dobry kawałek skradanki, którą polecam fanom gatunku. Najlepiej grać na wyższych poziomach trudności i zawsze bez wykrycia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116146537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1514330075}
review:
As a stealth gamer I'm going to thumbs down. I bought this game and play it for the first 40mins then I ask for refund because the gameplay isn't what I was expected. I thought this game will be same as Thief or Dishonored but not at all. 

The reason why I said the gameplay sucks because of the combat. When you get spotted by the guard you have to counter their attack then only you can kill them. Second, you can't even explore and loot because of the time. Every mission has it own time to complete (more like a time trial) and set a score whether Gold, Silver or Bronze. Which I don't really like it because other stealth games doesn't give a damn about times, just let me loot and give me score based on my performance. That's it for gameplay.

The graphic and the environment in this game is perfect. I really loved it but what's the point if the graphic looks cool but the gameplay sucks? Also the main character (Styx) is funny. I love his jokes when you killed him LMAO but I really wish I could continue it until the final chapter but sorry I couldn't. Story wise IDK. 

This is what I felt about this game so don't get mad at me, I'm just letting others know my point of view.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017845004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1527934352}
review:
First impressions:
After a bit of research I tried to remap the XBOX 360 controller and whilst I had some success, it was a disaster.  Some remapping worked as expected but in other places, like the menu, the remapping used un-expected input actions.

My recommendation is that you stick with the defaults for the controller because the details displayed on the screen will be correct.

Whilst I would like to see all games have in-game remapping of keys when they haven't it is important that developers use action bindings have relevant names and can be correctly mapped to an input.  This game doesn't and thus the cause of my frustration.

There was an error with the graphics.  After the initial developer/technology advertising in fullscreen, the game's "fullscreen" view shows my Window's taskbar on the left, moving itself towards the right, and cuts off the game's display on the right.

Not a good start.

BUT, on the positive side I switched to the keyboard which can be reconfigured in-game.

Playing the game for a few minutes had me "falling in the drink" and dying pretty quickly whilst trying to learn the controls.  But during this I found what I would call a gem:  Styx gives you some clever, witty responses regarding your gameplay and his death. Truly worth playing the game for.

Playing the co-op mode with a friend is well worth the time.  You will need a way of talking to one another to complete tasks within the missions.

There is a new crafting skill which enables you to make potions and equipment for which you need to collect items found within the environment.  The equipment is very useful if you choose an assasination style of play.  But if you are being a sneak, you will use only the crafting of health and amber.  The crafting aspect is a nice touch to the game because it allows you to explore different ways of playing the game.

There is now a bronze, silver, gold medal for styles of game play including being unseen (alterts), not killing anyone (mercy), finding all the collectable gold (coins in Master of Shadows), and the time it takes for you to complete the mission.  Each of the medals give you a reward in Skill Points.  It is still challenging to get a bronze reward which gives you something to aim for.  The different styles of play are not always compatible with each other when you are completing each mission for the first time, so it adds replayability if you want to improve on your score.

One last note, "Beware the bells."

personally i would recommend this game to anybody it's just good fun. the story is interesing if you've played the last game, the gameplay is just enjoyable and fun sneaking around being crafty with your movements and just using different methods to take down enemys.

one thing that left me a little down were some of the cutscences animations there just so crooked and im not gonna lie hard to look at but still nothing too big just leaving that in there. 

Another feature that this game added was co-op and oh god i love it to pieces sneaking around with friends and having hillarous moments that i will never forget.

in conclution if you enjoy sneaking around as little goblin with an edgy backstory stabbing elf's, humans or dwarfs with an interesting storyline and a couple pop culture refences you'll love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987961716', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1514663628}
review:
It's a decent stealth game but the controls are not good, story is dull, levels are boring (and sure nowhere close to what I would mark as huge open environments) and I'm getting the feeling devs put way too much effort into stuffing the game with jokes and hinting other games instead of making it fun to play. First few lines were funny but after 5 hours, Styx is just annoying.

For the price of €16 it's not a bad deal but the full price is a waste of money. I'd give it 6/10.

review:

If you really liked the first game, get this on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999935168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1190, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1514067141}
review:
Despite user review claims, this game is not "better than the first one in almost every way". That's not a great game to compare it to anyway since the first one was already so bad, unbearably boring to the point I only ever put about 3 hours into it. This game is honestly no better. Despite having okay graphics and tight controls this is an extremely linear and highly generic feeling stealth game. Alternate routes are limited and pointless, environmental traps are very limited, unsatisfying, and pointless. Enemy ai is p-ss poor. It's basically a really simple, bland game. You can only craft two different things, kill darts and health vials, and I never really needed them. The only items you can pick up in levels are crafting parts for them, so since I didn't need them it wasn't long before I was just trying to get to the end of each level as fast as I could without exploring.

In fullscreen mode the game has a horrific green flickering that is unfixable and there is no mention of it anywhere online. It is a problem I've never seen any game have before that forces me to play in borderless mode. That's fine, but the game runs at 60fps in fullscreen, where borderless has slowdown often in large areas.

This gets such high praise from people because stealth game fans are so ceaselessly hard core to the point they don't care what game it is as long as they get more stealth gameplay. There is no comparison between this game and other far superior stealth games. Much better stealth games exist than this. Even the last Thief game is a far superior stealth game. Hitman Absolution and even the newest one can be bought on sale often, all of the Assassin's Creed games can also be found cheaper than this game, and plenty of other triple A stealth games at that.

Paid $16 but it's worth $5 or less max. A boring, borderline 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041649133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1514184798}
review:
스틱스 : 샤드 오브 다크니스

클리어 소요시간 18시간
(중간중간 딴짓도 했음)


전작인 마스터 오브 쉐도우가 
어느 정도 '실험작'이라는 느낌이 있었는데

샤드 오브 다크니스는 단점들을 
확실하게 보완한 '완성작'이라는 느낌을 받았다.

.

* 전작과 비슷한 점들


- 맵 디자인은 전작처럼 상당히 세밀하다.
(=한 장소에 들어가는데도 방법이 다양함.)


- 게임 방식이 '암살'보다는 '잠입'에 치중되어 있다.

애초에 게임이 '살인을 하지 말고, 조용히 할 것만 할지어다'
라는걸 강요하는 느낌인데.
(살인하면 할수록 특수기술을 배우는데 필요한 'SP'를 적게 주기 때문)
전작과 다르게 딱히 불편하다는 점은 못 느꼈다. 이유는 후술

- 로딩

잠입게임 특성상 세이브&로드를 자주 하게 되는데,
로딩시간이 꽤 거슬린다 (대략 4~5초)
다만 이건 일종의 '트집'에 가깝기에 이 이상 언급하지 않겠다.



+ 전작보다 발전한 점

* 그래픽

* 공식 한글화

* 난이도 (=진입장벽이 낮아짐)

전작의 경우에는 적들이 상당히 빽빽이 배치되어 
난이도가 높은 편에 속했다.

그러나 이번 작에서는 특수 기술 외에도 
아이템이 다양해졌으며 (=소음유발 아이템,활,독화살,등등)

무엇보다도 위의 아이템들과 더불어 투명화(OP), 
클론생성 같은 마법을 쓰는데 필요한
'앰버물약'을 스테이지 곳곳에 배치된 
'작업대'에서 제작이 가능해졌다.

그렇기 때문에 이번 작에서는 
아무도 죽이지 않는 잠입 플레이가 상당히 할만해 졌다.


- 전작보다 떨어진 점

* 스토리

정말 별거 없다.

전작은 중반에 '어떤 사건'이 일어남으로써
스틱스가 '나는 누구인가?'라는 고뇌를 품고, 현실을 받아들이고 
그 문제를 극복하는 기승전결이 있었는데

이번 작에서는 그런 게 없다.

그냥 한마디로 정리하자면 
'누구든 작은 고블린을 건드리면 X 되는 거야.'  



그러나 결론을 말하자면 정~말 재미있게 플레이했다.
(애초에 필자 취향이 스토리<게임성이기에...)

적당히 도전을 필요로 하는 난이도, 스틱스의 입담,
그 외에도 상식선에 있는 도전과제 등,


뭐 하나 버릴 게 없다.


★★★☆
7/ 10

'잠입'게임을 좋아하는 유저라면 꼭 한번 해볼 가치가 있는 게임

author: {'steamid': '76561198077311585', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2489, 'last_played': 1514584721}
review:
Un avis plutôt mitigé sur ce deuxième volet. D'ailleurs, si on devait les comparer, je dirai que le premier est de loin bien meilleur que Shards of Darkness.

L'histoire en elle-même aurait pu être intéressante. Mais l'intrigue et les rebondissements sont assez plats. Certaines idées ont bien été pensée (cf: les rakash et l'ambre) mais ne sont pas suffisantes pour s'immerger dans le scénario. On a une impression de regret par rapport au premier volet qui nous tenait en haleine. 

La fin de l'histoire qui y est proposée est plate et brutale à la fois. Plate parce que le rebondissement que le studio a voulu créer est assez prévisible. Brutale parce que la fin s'arrête net, écran noir après une petite cinématique sur la fin du dernier secteur. Ne tenant pas suffisamment en haleine après la phase de boss, on peut franchement dire que l'effet est raté. A voir si ça colle avec le troisième opus clairement annoncé dans cette dernière cinématique.

Le jeu est beau, on a l'occasion de recroiser les elfes, les humains et surtout les nains (peu présent sur les missions, mais qui ont un rôle important dans le scénario jusqu'à la toute fin). Il faut être attentif car des petits coups de caméras durant les cinématiques vous révèlent des indices sur les nains qui peuvent rendre leur présence dans le jeu intrigante. Pour ce qui est des elfes, je n'ai pas compris pourquoi ils ne nous détectent plus avec l'ambre qui coule dans les veines de Styx alors que cela réapparaît à un moment dans le scénario. Est-ce parce que les soldats elfes sont dans une situation particulière par rapport à la reine voire la prêtresse? Ca peut se tenir, mais rien ne l'indique ou ne le distingue par rapport au premier opus (ou j'ai loupé une information capitale qui l'explique ^^).

J'ai apprécié traversé les niveaux, la difficulté semble avoir été revu à la baisse, quand bien même les développpeurs ont ajouté un mode sans sauvegarde. C'est la grande mode en ce moment.... La difficulté pour ce qui est de trouver les jetons a été revu à la baisse aussi. Dommage, ça m'amusait de farfouiller les secteurs pour finir par tuer tous les ennemis pour enfin trouver la pièce manquante ^^.

J'ai pas essayé la coopération, mais pouvoir jouer avec des amis en ligne est toujours un plaisir. Dommage qu'il n'y ait pas de coopération locale dans ces cas là car du coup, je pense qu'il doit être très rarement utilisé.

Par contre gros point négatif qui rejoint le premier volet, c'est que Cyanide a encore négligé les détails et la finition du jeu... On remarque très rapidement des ennemis bloqués dans le décor, ne pouvant pas bouger. D'autres qui font des allés-retours à cause d'un objet posé sur leur passage. Des ennemis qui se croisent se rentrent dedans, restent bloqués et n'arrivent plus à effectuer leur ronde...
Les objets qui chutent et qui peuvent poser quelques problèmes dans les lieux d'infiltrations ne sont pas punitifs, même en difficulté max; il est possible de taper dedans plusieurs fois avant qu'un garde daigne venir voir ce qu'il se passe.

Cette caméra qui fait que si vous ne la positionnez pas correctement ou que si celle-ci change d'angle, Styx va, soit sauter d'un point A sans atteindre le point B, soit va refuser de sauter.... Quand vous vous tachez de finir la carte le plus vite possible, ça peut vite vous frustrer, même si le temps requis sur quelques missions est assez large.

Point positif, ils ont ajouté un bouton pour pouvoir s'accrocher aux bords. Il n'est pas de trop quand je repense au nombre de fois où je suis mort dans le premier volet alors que je m'approchais lentement du bord pour m'y pendre.

Je mets un pouce bleu parce que le jeu et l'univers ont toujours autant de charmes, que c'est toujours kiffant de jouer un gobelin, de mettre une tatane aux autres races qui vous méprisent, et que Styx reste un personnage agréable à jouer au vue de sa personnalité.

Mais bon, y a quand même pas mal de détails à revoir encore une fois, et le troisième opus a intérêt à justifier cette chute qui pour moi est juste ratée ^^.

review:
Gut designtes Schleichspiel mit einem zynischem Charakter, der vor seiner letzten Schönheitsoperation angeblich Garrett gerufen wurde und endlich in inkognito wieder zeigen kann, das er mehr drauf hat als bei seinem letzten Auftritt (Allerdings sind das natürlich nur Gerüchte).

Pro:
+ Gute Steuerung über Gamepad
+ Leveldesign / offene Architektur
+ Stimmige Atmosphäre
+ Schöne Grafik & passender Sound
+ Relativ kurze Nachladezeiten
+ GameOver-Sequenz nach Patch abschaltbar
+ Viele Lösungswege (Sprichwörtlich ;)
+ Durchdachte Spielmechanik

Kon:
- Etwas zu Action Lastig für ein Schleichspiel
- Schwierigkeitsgrad auf "Einfach" relativ hoch
- Umgebung nicht immer Übersichtlich
- Ein wenig zuviel "Herumspringen" nötig

author: {'steamid': '76561198047953609', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1513535873}
review:
One of the worst games I've ever seen.
The commands have a really bad feeling, it's like they didn't finish to program movements, resulting in a "robotic" set of jumps.
The AI is so stupid that if you open a door in the middle of an NPC path, he will probably be blocked and keep walking against the door.
It is buggy as fuq, had to begin a lot of times the same mission because, somehow I couldn't proceed in the mission, for example, there is a mission in which an NPC has to lower a bridge for you, this never happend, and also I talked to a ghost because the NPC never spawned where he was supposed to, but the conversation happened anyways.
Again, the AI is really stupid.
Graphics are terrible, I don't usally care about this but this game has been released in 2017 and with the highest graphic setting it seems to be a PS2 game, totally unacceptable.
The only positive thing I can find about this game is that Styx is funny, really funny. Atleast for the first 15 minutes. 
Totally wasted my money in this thing, who made this game and who published it should be totally ashamed of what they did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020463682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 13892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2963, 'last_played': 1709149900}
review:
I finished this game and what can I say? I can say that I hope for more of this brilliant game, Styx's character is marvelous loved the character, I was upset that .spoiler alert. [/Helledryn was gone at the end of the game got to admit I was hoping to see more of her character] but whoa, the plot twists are amazing! I really hope there will be another game for Styx the rakash absolutely truly loved him his my favorite character for the entire game with his humor and 4th wall breaking, even when playing with graphics on weak you can still get a amazing taste for the whole scenery of the game, truly amazing especially with the scene in Thoben, I will admit this game is the best I have ever played in my years of gaming. If you are looking for a game where you can either kill your way through to the checkpoint in stealth kills or a more merciful challenging route through learning enemy patterns and making your way to the goal this game my good sir or madam is THE game for you. 



I'll admit the ending of the game left me unsatisfied wanting more not for it to end so sudden, if another game comes out I will utmost definite will buy it no matter the reviews or whatever someone says because truly this game was amazing with the build of characters and scenery. Its rare to find a game where a lot of effort is put both into graphics and plot.


No words I could use to express how much I enjoyed the game, I can't help but keep on replaying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028708672', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1513505624}
review:
Správny Styx vo všetkých smeroch. Systém vylepšovania je podobný ako v predchádzajúcom dieli, len vylepšený o crafting, oblečenie, dýky s rôznymi bonusmi. Nechýbali ani nonstop sarkastické kecy ako aj odkazy na rôzne iné stealth hry ako Thief, Dishonored, Assassin's Creed atď. (bez toho by nebol Styx Styxom :D) Rozmanité prostredia levelov ako na vzducholodi, v prístave, jaskyniach... Jediné, čo ma sklamalo bol docela chabý príbeh s ešte chabejším koncom, ktorý vás núti si kúpiť pokračovanie, keďže nechal trilión nezodpovedaných otázok.

9 rakash out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198243974254', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1514301195}
review:
So I played the first game and I fucking loved it. This game however not so much

First off the visuals are amazing compared to the original. Sadly, I think most of the budget was splurged on the visuals itself I think

The sound, music are great but the voice acting was bad occasionally. The real standout is styx himself who is voiced perfect ly and has some really funny lines.


The real disappointing thing in styx is the story and dialogues. I feel like the story could have been interesting but the presentation was horrible. In master of shadows, the dialogue and story weren't great but they were good enough to add a realistic atmosphere to the game which made it that much more fun but in this game you cant help but think of how lame the story is

As for the gameplay it is nearly the same as the master of shadows which is good. I mean if it ain't broken....

All in all this is a good game and I definitely recommend it. But if u haven't played master of shadows yet go play it now

author: {'steamid': '76561198092526101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1513440043}
review:
完美继承了1的特色
技能树大幅加强，不再那么鸡肋
增加了矮人，虽然感觉就是把1精灵的嗅觉技能转移了……
地图空间感增大，波斯王子味十足（当然是环境脏乱差版的 噗）
增加了boss战，第一战新鲜，平衡感也好。
第二战的设计问题太大，存盘点莫名其妙（每次要载入2个地图和一段剧情，好像没设计过一样），而打boss的流程又长难度又高（秒杀）……比1里的还bt

author: {'steamid': '76561198126131226', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1573349990}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Catagories[/th]
        [th]Ranking[/th]
        [th]Summery[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Value[/td]
        [td] $15.99 (normally $39.99) [/td]
        [td] Well worth the money I think, but then God bless Steam and their joyous sales! [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]
        [td] 9 stars[/td]
        [td] Ok so even though I always seem to play as a sneaky sniper/ranger sort in my RPGs I've got to admit I kind of suck at the up close sneaky sneaky shinanagins they put you through in these stealth games…. Biggest part that sucks about that is that you're penalized for killing people and for taking your time… and forgetting to steal everything that’s not nailed down…. But you know what, that doesn’t matter, this game is bloody fun! Although I admit I say screw the points everyone I cross paths with dies… they can't trigger alarms if they're dead after all.  [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Story[/td]
        [td] 8 stars[/td]
        [td] So I played the original game (Styx: Master of Shadows) Some years back (maybe 2-3 years ago) and this one seems to pick up where that one left off which is awesome as I loved the story (or at least as much as I remember of it) from the first Styx game. By the way this isn't the only game series Styx is in. This is actually a spin off of the game "Of Orcs and Men" released back in 2012 I think. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Social System[/td]
        [td] N/A stars[/td]
        [td] Single player however there is some opportunity for Co-Oping in the game, however from the look of it you need to know someone to Co-Op with from the look of it, I've got no one to try it with or I'd let ya know. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Community[/td]
        [td] 8 stars[/td]
        [td] Everyone seems to be pretty chill and relaxed, helpful but not super informative so as to ruin your game play… though some of the chats seem to have some spoilers in them. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Graphics[/td]
        [td] 9 stars[/td]
        [td] Beautiful graphics with a nice and dark/brooding level design. Just what you should expect in a stealth game.  [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Ease of Learning[/td]
        [td] 8 stars[/td]
        [td] Its fairly easy to learn but it's kind of frustrating as well. Learning patterns and such is fairly easy but there's always that ONE guard…. (-_-)… this is why I end up killing everyone… [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Combat Style[/td]
        [td] 8 stars[/td]
        [td] Honestly it drives me nuts because I suck at the up close sneaky sneaky stuff but you know what it's still good and very challenging as you have to perfectly time your parry's in order to block the guards attacks and counter them. Trouble is they all mob you when someone sees you… so keep that in mind. And you may want to glue down your keyboard and learn to use a roller ball mouse… so you can glue that down too… I admit this game can get pretty frustrating at times. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Soundtrack[/td]
        [td] 6 stars[/td]
        [td] It's not something I can say that is super awesome but it's well written. Soft and ethereal for the sneaky sneaky bits, Soft but intense for the "Oh crap runrunrunrunrun!" bits, but nothing super awe inspiring. [/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

Final Thoughts:
I've got to say I like this series, could be because I love goblins, could be because of the challenge, or Styx's snarky attitude. It's almost worth failing to see what kind of "knife in the ribs" snarky comment he makes about your pathetic attempts to succeed but then its still irritating beyond belief to fail… although there are skills you can learn that will help alleviate this problem (see cloning skills for more). In the end just let me say, I've played Of Orcs and Men, good game (full review coming some time in the future). I've played Styx: Master of Shadows, great game (full review maybe next week). And now have played Styx: Shards of Darkness, does not disappoint by any means, well worth a buy!
