author: {'steamid': '76561198044953064', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1384, 'last_played': 1513004698}
review:
아주 적절하게 재밌었던 스텔스게임. 좋은 스텔스게임들이 그러했듯 맵을 진행하는데 다양한 선택지를 제공하며, 그 선택을 하는데 신중함을 보여야 한다. 정말 아쉬운점이 있다면 미션들이 지도가 아니라 레벨에 둥둥 떠다니는 마커를 기반으로 짜여져있다보니 주변 환경을 인지하기 이전에 맵마커만 따라다니게 만드는 경향이 있다는 것이다.다행히도 옵션에서 마커를 끌 수 있지만 마커 없이 목표물을 탐색할 수단, 그러니까 주변환경을 통한 단서제공이 거의 존재하지 않기 때문에 물건찾기류 미션은 마커없이 플레이하기 정말 지루하다고 생각한다. 

 전작에 비해 나아진점이 있다면 일단 보스전이 있겠다. 이번 작품에선 큰 보스전이 두 번정도 있는데, 다행히도 스텔스 게임메카닉이랑 파쿠르를 중심으로 풀어나가야하는-그러니까 그 특유의 형편없는 전투 시스템을 기반으로 한게 아닌- 보스들이다보니 게임이 달성하고자 한 느낌을 잘 살려낸 것 같았다. 

 레벨업할 때 쓰는 스킬포인트는 메인미션만 진행해줘도 배부르게 얻어갈 수 있는지라 콜렉터블이나 사이드미션의 중요성은 크진 않다. 하지만 이번작에서 그런 부가요소가 더 추가됐다는게 나쁘진 않았던 것 같다. 쿼츠를 수집하겠답시고 사원에 몰려있는 엘프들을 어떻게 타파할지 고민한 것도 결과적으로 나름 즐거운 경험이였으니 말이다. 

 스틱스의 캐릭터는 좀 '데드풀'스럽게 변한 감이 있는데 이건 어떻게 받아들여야 할지 모르겠다. 
제 4의 벽을 뚫는 조크를 남발하는데, 이는 웃기긴 하지만(내 유머 취향이 좀 싸구려라서 제 4의 벽 레퍼런스만 나와도 좋아라 하는 경향이 있다.) 1편에서 보여주었던 조금의 진지함마저도 다 날려버리는 듯 하니 너무 가벼워진 느낌이다. 
그리고 몇몇 "조크"는 농담이라고 하기 거시기하게 그냥 특정 캐릭터 '모욕'에서 그치니 항상 센스가 있는 것도 아니다.
결과적으로는 재밌는 이차원적 캐릭터 수준에서 그치는 듯 하다.

그리고 스포일러를 좀 하자면, 1편에서 보여줬던 '적절한' 결론, 그러니까 엔딩은 이 게임에 존재하지 않는다. 애초에 주인공 자체부터가 진지하지 않은 활극이다 보니, 스토리가 헤비한 게임일 것이라 기대하고 플레이 한 것은 아니지만, 그래도 인상깊은 사건들의 연속은 있었다고 본다. 그리고 그 연속적인 사건 끝에는 진짜 엽기적일 정도로 허무한 엔딩이 있다는게 굉장히 아쉬웠다.
DLC나 후속작을 예고하는 것인지는 모르겠다. 어쩌면 예산이 다 떨어진 것일지도.
개인적으로는 예산이 다 떨어져서 그런 것임에 한 표를 걸겠다.

결론을 말하자면 스틱스 2는 전작에서 발전한 요소가 있지만 여전히 약점을 보이는 작품이라는 것이다.
개인적으로는 스틱스가 시프시리즈같은 정통스텔스게임을 계승하려고 하는게 눈에 보이기 때문에 이 약점은 더욱 아쉽게 다가온다. 후속작을 더욱 많이 낼 계획이라면 좀 더 센스있는 작품을 다음번에 내주길 진심으로 바란다.

review: An sich wirken Welt und Charakter schön designt, doch das Spielsystem ist anstrengend. Man wird durch Bronze-, Silber- und Goldränge dazu gedrängt die Level so schnell wie möglich und ohne jeglichen Kill zu durchzuspielen, was für mich den Reiz eines Stealth-Spiels und Erkundung eines Levels eliminiert. Verstehe natürlich, dass das verdeutlichen soll, dass man als kleiner Goblin im Nachteil den Menschen gegenüber ist, aber naja schön finde ich das trotzdem nicht. Habe deshalb keine 4h des Spiels ausgehalten. Daher kann ich nichts zur Story oder ähnlichem sagen, aber aufgrund der genannten Spielmechanik hat sich der Kauf absolut nicht gelohnt!

review: Styx: Shards of Darkness is a big improvement over Master of Shadows in level design, graphics and control responsiveness, but after playing it on Goblin (hard) dificulty without getting spotted or killing anyone, I feel the game's a bit too easy. Your mileage may vary of course. Styx has also become a bit of a tryhard Deadpool-copycat, which more often than not is just kinda shitty. I still feel it's better than the original for the above reasons, and from what I've seen in forums most people don't complete this game in so little time. As in the previous game, warning to anyone looking to play this if you feel a stealth game MUST have combat options: Don't buy this... and maybe don't have children, in order to increase the average worldwide IQ. Thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102027676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1333, 'last_played': 1513013159}
review:
[Edited 2017.12.11]

The main con of this game to me is the penalty when players kill any enemies at all. If I stealthily assassinate 20 enemies using all the varieties of kill methods that was provided and cleverly designed, it ought to be an achievement, and not something that brings about penalty. So many kinds of fun and interesting traps and kill methods (complemented with body-hiding places) are scattered in all the levels for the players to use, so why should players be penalised for utilising all of the fun arsenal of features?

Players' exploration and utilisation of the game's interesting features ought to be rewarded, not penalised.

That said, missing just 'Mercy' insignia has minimal impact on SP gained. Players can also just redo the missions to focus on it afterwards, but it really becomes a chore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107882088', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1512683368}
review: Uggggg I really want to love this game, I absolutely love the first one and it really is a fantastic game, but its extremely frustrating to see how the developers don't give a damn about the game. I fell in love with the first game, played it hours on end and I 100% for that one tell you all to go buy it for sure, but this… I've sent them a report that I have a problem with fullscreen and no response for 2 days since this post. Game is buggy right from the start, and with it being very mediocre it really really upsets me to see that not the same amount of love that I fell in love with from the first game wasn't also placed here (from many reviews I have seen and read from here also). My complaint about the Fullscreen bug is still up, still awaiting a response, at least a response from them would make me change my mind knowing that they at least do care and didn’t just make a game and left it there hoping it would milk them all the money they need. Really upset about this game and really wanted to try the coop. Yes, it plays in borderless fullscreen but paying for a game and being ehhh it works at least not completely but it works isn’t good enough! All this money spent on a game that has a known problem could literally be spent elsewhere. It is completely unplayable in fullscreen, it goes purple green and spazzes but just changing to borderless its fine. For a full game that’s meant to be complete and not early access isn’t meant to have stupid problems like this. I have waited for more than a week now i have refunded the game and being more than dissapointed that after sending the developers and email, reviewing their game and senting a technical report, i have gotten no response from them, clearly they dont care. I will try upload the video of this problem, so people can visually understand too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129570459', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1512409930}
review:
On ne sait jamais à quoi s'attendre avec les jeux d'infiltration. Et Styx nous donne la bonne surprise. De l'infiltration, de la vraie, sans possibilité de combat avec alerte, le tout accompagné d'une bande son aux petits oignons.
Le jeu nous plonge dans la peau (verte) de Styx, le dernier gobelin parlant de l'univers pour traquer un elfe malintentionné. Le scénario en lui-même est plutôt bien ficelé, quelques rebondissements sont prévisibles, d'autres moins, mais il reste très agréable à suivre et immersif qui plus est avec la bande son.
Le gameplay est très sympathique, le level-design vraiment très travaillé et les consommables sont donnés en quantité suffisante pour garder du piment dans le jeu sans le rendre impossible.
Le joueur est récompensé par un système de médailles pour l'inciter à perfectionner sa façon de jouer.

Ainsi, on a un jeu en somme très correct : 
Les + :
+ Gameplay de réelle infiltration (Assassin's Creed.. kof kof...)
+ Scénario sympa
+ Gobelin rigolo...
+ Bande son au top
+ Level design aux petits oignons...
+... offrant donc de nombreuses possibilités
+ Sauvegarde rapide

Les - :
- Certains passages rageants
- Certains checkpoints mal placés
- Gobelin parfois trop bavard (surtout quans ça fait 50 fois que tu reload le checkpint)
- Un peu en retard graphiquement sur certains points

En somme, jetez vous sur ce jeu d'infiltration. Ca encourage de bons développeurs comme ceux de Styx à nous pondre des ovnis. Et malgré ses quelques défauts techniques, Styx reste très amusant et sympathique à jouer. Un de mes très bons moments de fgamer :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197980771676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 553, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1511910928}
review:
[h1]Styx und Lautstärke haben nur phonetisch etwas gemeinsam[/h1]

Styx 2, um den Titel prägnanter klar zu machen, ist im Vergleich zum Vorgänger meiner Ansicht nach eine grundsolide Verbesserung, die sich zurecht im Herzen des Stealth-Genres wieder findet und sogar Meisterschleicher Garrett sprichwörtlich in den Schatten stellt.

Angefangen hat der titelgebende Diebesgoblin als Sidecharacter in "Of Orcs and Men", setzte sich vermutlich aufgrund seines sehr witzigen Wesens als echt lustiges Bürschchen durch und erhielt dadurch wohlverdient seine eigene Marke, die meiner Meinung nach auch mit diesem Sequel hier noch viele weitere Male das Licht der digitalen Spielewelt erblicken wird. Gut so! Denn wenn Sam Fisher mal wieder für weiß Gott wie viele Jahre pausiert oder Assassin's Creed sich (Gott sei Dank - man sieht ja den Erfolg an Origins) mehr Pause zwischen den Releases lässt oder gar ein Thief mit neuen Reboots direkt wieder in der Versenkung verschwindet, sind mir so kleine Zwischendurch-Häppchen für ca. 10h pro Durchgang wie Styx schon sehr gelegen.

Die Story an sich ist im Großen und Ganzen zwar ein tragendes Element, aber nicht unfassbar spannend geschrieben - dafür aber mit unglaublich gut designten, stets perfekt in hübscher Unreal Engine 4 Grafik dargestellten Cutscenes versehen, bei denen ich kaum die Finger von lassen konnte und mir ständig Screenshots machen wollte :D

Aber auch Styx selbst ist, wie vorhin schon angesprochen, stets mit großer Klappe und fiesen, deshalb natürlich sehr witzigen Sprüchen ausgestattet, die er sogar die vierte Wand durchbrechend beim Ableben im Game Over Screen wie Deadpool in seinem Spiel direkt an den Spieler richtet. Ich hab sogar ein Review hier auf Steam gesehen, wo einer lediglich schrieb immer sterben zu wollen, weil ihm diese Sprüche so gut gefallen haben :D

Inhaltlich sind wir aber wie schon in Teil 1 gewohnt in genretypisch sehr schattigen Festungen, Verliesen oder Dörfern unterwegs, die auch gerne gerade von höheren Aussichtspunkten eine echte Augenweide darstellen. Auch können sich die 9 Missionen vom generellen Umfang her sehen lassen: Jede Hauptmission ist meist in 3 Unterareale aufgeteilt, die schon in sich dem Spieler unglaublich viele Wege und Vorgehensweise anbieten: Obwohl das Spiel euch ganz klar zum Schleichen motiviert und bei keinen ausgelösten Alarmen, keinen Tötungen und schnellem Zielerreichen Zusatzpunkte (und somit Zusatzerfahrung für eure kaufbaren Fertigkeiten) springen lässt, könnt ihr euch auch in den direkten Kampf oder ans Meucheln machen. Auch wenn Styx dann eher passiv Schläge im richtigen Moment abwehren muss, um dann einen Kill ausführen zu können (gegen mehr als einen Gegner aktiv kämpfen resultiert immer in einen Fehlschlag), habt ihr nicht wirklich alternatives "Kampfequipement". Da aber allein die ganzen möglichen Kletterstellen, minikleinen Schlupflöcher in Kombination mit euren einsetzbaren Klon- und Unsichtbarkeitsfähigkeiten eure stärkste Waffe sind, macht es gar keinen Sinn die teils vor Gegner übermäßig (mir persönlich manchmal schon zuuuuuuuuuuviel - wer bezahlt die eigentlich alle? o.O) sprudelnden Levels "aufzuräumen". Gerade später, sobald neue bzw. alte Gegner dazukommen, die dann durch ihre dicke Rüstung gar nicht mehr "killbar" sind, euch schon in der Entfernung "riechen" oder euch bei den minimalsten Aktivitäten bereits deutlich hören...

Leider erfolgt aber gerade am Ende des Spiels ein wenig Levelrecycling, das nicht hätte sein müssen - einige frühere Areale exerziert man dann noch einmal in umgedrehter Reihenfolge durch (als würde ein Rennspiel sagen: "Jetzt müsst ihr den geilen Kurs halt rückwärts fahren - KRASS NEUES ERLEBNIS, oder?" - da machen es Spiele wie Gothic 2 schon richtig und "zerstören" das Land aus Teil 1 und lassen den Krieg herein). Auch sind die Levels selbst vom Interieur teilweise schön, aber größtenteils "generisch" designt. Alles kommt mir "kalt" vor - es läuft mir nicht eine besondere Wache mit besonderen Charakteristiken über den Weg. Jeder ist absolut gleich und hat seine Bude genau wie die Nachbarn links und rechts eingerichtet. Vermutlich gibt's da wie im Film Equilibrium ein Verbot gegenüber gefühlsauslösender Personalisierung... hier ein Sack Sand, da mal wieder eine Craft-Zutat, dort drüben der gewohnte Fertigkeiten- oder Crafttisch und hier und dort vielleicht noch ein paar Truhen und Schränke. Feddisch!

Auch sind die sammelbaren Items (mal 10, mal 20), die es schon in Teil 1 gab, arschlos. Wtf? Keine Ahnung was und warum ich das Zeug sammle und warum Styx weiß, dass es 10 oder 20 davon in einem Level gibt. Ich muss schon ALLE sammeln, um Trophies abzustauben. 9 von 10 bringen mir absolut gar nichts.
Stattdessen hätte ich mir optionale Schriftstücke gewünscht, die Nebenmissionen deutlicher machen (Letztere muss man (leider) auch erst einmal finden, machen aber nicht selten Spaß und hätten mehr "Pepp" vertragen können - The Witcher 3 lässt grüßen) oder einfach Styx ein paar lustige Oneliner entlocken.

Gut finde ich hingegen aber die zwei integrierten Endbosse, die euch hier und da einiges abverlangen und eine willkommene Abwechslung zum sonstigen Schleich-Einerlei abgeben. Das stets gute und immer frei wählbare Tempo war auch ausgezeichnet, weshalb ich schon stark das Gefühl hab, dass die Marke in die richtige Richtung geht - langsam, aber dafür messbar. Jedenfalls freue ich mich jetzt noch mehr auf Teil 3 als bisher auf Teil 2 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041193222', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1511715004}
review:
Pro: 
- "Grobcharme" des Settings und vor allem des Hauptcharakters
- unterhaltsame Spielmechaniken (also was geht, nicht wie es sich steuert, s.u.) 

Contra: 
- ungenaue Steuerung 
- triviale Story 

Shards of Darkness ist seinem Vorgänger Master of Shadows in vielem sehr ähnlich, allerdings in einigen Punkten deutlich schwächer - und in keinem besser. 
Der durchaus einzigartige Charakter von Styx bietet immer noch einigen Unterhaltungswert, auch wenn seine "kritischen" Kommentare nach jedem Tod etwas langweilig werden auf die Dauer. Und es macht Spaß, Leuten ins Essen zu kotzen, woraufhin sie daran krepieren. 
Allerdings war die Steuerung bereits im Vorgänger arg gewöhnungsbedürftig oder schlicht gesagt: schlecht. Daran hat sich leider nichts geändert und man hat weiterhin zu kämpfen, an den richtigen Punkt zu springen o.Ä. 

Was mich insbesonders enttäuschte, war die lahme Geschichte. Während der erste Teil trotz seines Trash-Charakters mit einer Überraschung aufwarten konnte, plätschert es im zweiten Teil irgendwie dahin. Die Krone wird dem ganzen aufgesetzt, als 
(SPOILER) 
am Ende ein Kampf angeteast, aber nicht mehr gezeigt wird. Also entweder kommt noch ein dritter Teil oder ein DLC, aber ein billiger Cliffhanger bleibt es einfach. Ich hab dann nur ungläubig auf die Credits geschaut. 
(SPOILER ENDE) 


Alles in allem würde ich diesem Spiel keine Empfehlung geben. Der erste Teil hat seinen unverbrauchten Charme und eine überraschend interessante Geschichte, dem zweiten mangelt es da an zu vielen Stellen, als dass es nichts Besseres auf dem Markt gäbe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042234061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1513282107}
review:
En cuanto vi el premio "Hombre de Vitruvio" de las rebajas de otoño de Steam, sabía que tenía que dárselo a este juego.

No solo porque estamos ante un título muy bien hecho, sino por ser una oda a su personaje principal: Styx. 

Styx Shards of Darkness, sigue la línea de su antecesor, Styx Master of Shadows, en la que nos cuentan los origenes de Styx, un trasgo (El trasgo, en realidad) que se mueve por las sombras de ciudadelas humanas en busca de una dosis de de su droga favorita (El ambar, fuente de mágia y dependencia) y ocasionalmente también algo de venganza... La personalidad del protagonista está marcada por el entorno en el que vive, un mundo en el que se mata a los trasgos a simple vista y son vistos como una mera plaga salida de la nada... En consecuencia Styx es bastante pragmatico, mezquino, pesimita y amigo de lo ajeno. 

Con una personalidad así, cabría esperar que nuestro personaje principal no tenga mucho amigos y así es. Durate los dos juegos nos pasaremos horas recorriendo en solitario escenarios inmensos con graficos fantasticos (Mejores en cada entrega y que sorprenden al ver que no estamos ante un triple A ni mucho menos, esto es un juego nicho). Ocasionalmente mataremos a algunos guardias a veces de formas más creativas otras menos, a veces podemos tener que ofrecer alguna ayuda a un secundario que necesitamos para nuestros objetivos finales (droga o venganza). En definitiva vamos a pasar muchas horas solos con Styx. Una pequeña criatura mezquina y asesina que todo el mundo quiere matar. Sería razonable que un personaje así estuviese algo acomplejado, siempre huyendo, siempre escondido en las sombras, siempre intentando sobrevivir hasta el siguiente chute de ambar, pero nada más lejos de la verdad. Styx se tiene en muy alta estima y en este mundo en el que todo el mundo podría volarlo de un plumazo, él se sabe claramente en lo alto de la piramide alimentaria. Al fin y al cabo, es un mundo diseñado para él y todo, desde cada patrulla, hasta cada esquina oscura, pasarelas, el oportuno punto ciego de un guardia, esa cesta de comida para envenenar, ese dardo oportuno sobre un escritorio, ese momento en el que alguien te da la espalda, todo parece estar dispuesto a su imagen y semejanza. En definitiva Styx Shards of Darkness es un juego sobre un personaje, y este personaje define todo lo que vamos encontrando: el tono de la historia, la estetica, el entorno, el argumento, el humor, las mecanicas... 

El primer juego de esta saga: Of orcs and Men, fue un desastre en lo que a jugabilidad se refiere, ya que pretendia juntar de una forma poco intuitiva rol con acción y el resultado era muy poco satisfactorio, pero el estudio mantuvo los buenos elementos de aquel juego (Personajes con peso, una gran trama, buena música y fantasticas texturas) y los ha adaptado a un estilo que puede sacar más todos esos elementos. Personalmente me declaro un fan de esta saga, que nos muestra un mundo de fantasía familiar, pero diferente, oscuro y hermoso, lleno de mezquindad y bajezas pero con un sentido único de la justicia.

review: Shards of Darkness improves on the original significantly. It has a great skill tree, plenty of collectibles and a decent story. The new enemies and twists/use of the old ones is great. I think they may have run out of money as the game's last mission is very anticlimactic and not at all in keeping with the rest of the gameplay. I still recommend this game in the hopes that it makes enough money for at least some new DLC missions because it is really fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007204558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1680, 'last_played': 1562499811}
review:
잠입게임 덕후인데 이 게임은 정말 제가 해본 잠입게임들 중에서 상위권에 꼽을 수 있습니다.
환상적인 맵디자인에 정말 감탄을 많이 했는데요, 비주얼적으로 멋진건 물론이지만 중요한건 잠입의 루트를 정말 다양하게 할 수 있는 맵디자인이란겁니다. 높낮이 차를 애용해야하는 맵과 적들의 위치, 생각지도 못한곳에 있는 개구멍들이 잠입의 즐거움을 느끼게 해줍니다. 
1편도 정말 재밌게 했었는데 이번편에는 모든방면에서 업그레이드가 잘 되었더라구요. 다양해진 스킬트리, 구석구석 맵탐험을 강..제? 권유하는 템제작 시스템, 아예 4차원의 벽넘기를 주 컨셉으로 밀고 들어오는 스틱스의 캐릭터성 전부 너무나 좋았습니다. 
잠입게임들의 입지가 점점 사라지는 이 시기에 정말 한줄기 빛같은 시리즈라고 생각하네요.. 후속작도 꼭 나왔으면 좋겠습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120840919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1991, 'last_played': 1511406788}
review:
Gameplay wise, this game was just as awesome as Master of Shadows and I enjoyed every minute of the playthrough. For those new to the series, this game takes place between Master of Shadows and Of Orcs and Men. You don't have to play MoS to understand this game's story (although if you haven't you should definitely go play it, amazing stealth game with a captivating story). The story in this game feels a bit rushed at times but I am actually willing to give the devs a chance with this one. They are building on the lore of Orcs and Men and are likely going to continue the series.

For those looking to buy this game, take note: This is primarily a STEALTH driven game. You won't be able to hack and slash your way through the levels (atleast not until you've leveled up enough to get better powers). You're a goblin in a world where most creatures are larger, stronger, and more fearsome than you. But to your advantage, Styx is smarter, more agile, and has more magic abilities. There's some cheesy humor thrown into the mix but some of it is actually pretty funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070100142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1825, 'last_played': 1515787411}
review:
Creo que todo el mundo deberia darle una oportunidad a este juego (incluso si los juegos de sigilo no son tu estilo)

Tiene un sigilo bastante permisivo y unos mapas con muchos modos de llegar a tu objetivo. Si te pillan siempre puedes esconderte un momento hasta que pase la tormenta, tienes las herramientas para ello. Además las medallas que consigues al final de cada misión le dan un poco de rejugabilidad (tampoco mucha) que siempre está bien. 
Todo sea dicho: aunque puedes combatir con la mayoria de enemigos una vez te descubren, en cuanto se te acumulan más de dos se empieza a hacer difícil de manejar y no es que seas un tanque así que en la mayoría de situaciones el juego te obliga a ir en sigilo o salir corriendo. Además a partir de la segunda mitad del juego empiezan a reciclar algunos escenarios lo que a algunos puede pareceros una pega.

Dejando la jugabilidad de lado. Si bien la historia no me ha parecido nada del otro mundo he de decir que el personaje de Styx si es de mi agrado. Al final del juego acabas cogiéndole cariño a ese trasgo. También huelga decir que no es necesario jugar Styx: Master of shadows (aunque también lo recomiendo) para jugar a este porque el único nexo de ambas historias es el propio Styx (y cierto personaje que aparece más adelante pero que no llega ni a la importancia de un secundario).

Como he dicho antes, creo que aunque los juegos de sigilo no sean lo tuyo deberías darle una oportunidad. Tampoco estoy diciendo que te lo compres a precio completo, puedes esperar a que este de oferta o comprarlo en una página de claves. Si ha consecuencia de este análisis has jugado el juego y te ha gustado, me alegro. Si no... lo siento, supongo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068987881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2695, 'last_played': 1601210086}
review:
A pretty solid approach to a hardcore stealth game, in a quite immersive high fantasy setting. Open combat is rarely an option, and only against weaker enemies on lower difficulties. Higher difficulties don't allow open combat at all, so you definitely have to watch your step. And in like any good stealth game, you're given a wide variety of tools and magical powers to take out, survive, or just avoid a wide range of enemies. So many tools, in fact, that the developers resorted to a crafting system instead of having Styx just pick up a dozen different kinds of tools in the world. You decide for yourself whether you like crafting systems or not, but this one is not too shabby.

As far as stealth goes, this game implements all the standard mechanics for that: enemy awareness levels, fields of vision, different levels of light/shadow that influence visibility, hiding places, they're all there and work as they should, though it's worth mentioning the enemy AI is not the brightest and sometimes their movement seems flat out buggy. There are a lot of different kinds of enemies that need to be dealt with differently and bring their own challenges. All those mechanics make for a stealth game that is tough and challenging, but manageable if you pay attention, think methodically, and use your tools wisely (and yes, save regularly). 
Big bonus point for me was that the game has several quicksave slots, so you don't accidentally overwrite a needed save too quickly. A bit annoying that saves aren't allowed when an enemy is suspicious or alerted, especially since they can stay that way for quite some time, but I guess that's just intended difficulty. Sadly, I can't say the same about the sometimes clunky controls, especially when calculating jumps or holding on to ledges. That certainly is annoying, but not common enough to be truly off-putting. 

The story is alright but nothing spectacular. While the first game was a mind-bending journey of Styx trying to find out who and what he is and what secrets are buried in the darkest corners of his mind, this game seems more or less like a peek into the everyday adventures of Styx, the assassin, thief, and mercenary. We see and hear a lot more about the world and its inhabitants, and watch our hero (who definitely isn't one) navigate the criminal underworld in a lot of places, dealing with smugglers, insurgents, mercenaries, fanatics, and whoever comes with that bunch. The world is certainly vibrant, colorful, and very much alive (side note: unlike the first game, this one actually acknowledges the existence of women), but Styx himself doesn't develop all that much through it. So maybe it's natural the ending is unusually open - some might even say abrupt.

The main character himself is – in my opinion – very well done. I heard some don't like him or find him annoying, but that may be just what's so refreshing about his character. It's rare to see a protagonist who is so openly dishonorable, depraved, and greedy. Styx is vulgar, brutal, spiteful, and snarky, without even the attempt to sugarcoat it with a tragic backstory or any kind of understandable motivation. He's just a mean, greedy little jerkbag, and I found that strangely endearing.
And the character is fleshed out constantly, not just in cutscenes, but every other moment in the game, with his crude, mean, or inappropriate jokes, spiteful and snarky comments, and repeated breaking of the fourth wall. I highly recommend you wait out at least a few death screens and listen to what the pissed goblin has to say about your lapse with his life...

Graphics are meh. Not horrible, certainly an improvement over the last game, and some backgrounds and the lighting are especially beautiful, but the difference to other modern titles (at least in the AAA section) is very noticeable, especially in cutscenes.

Level design seemed solid. There a lot of different environments Styx has to move through, and many of them are well-designed and captivating. There are almost always a million different ways  to get from one point to another, and enough incentive to explore every corner. Only sometimes it felt almost overdone and levels can be so intricately labyrinthic that you can easily get lost in them. It should also be mentioned that many levels are just reused with slight modifications at different points in the story.

Talents and power progression are just awesome. There's something useful and interesting to every playstyle, while everything is accessible enough that you can reach any one given talent quickly if you really want it – naturally, at the expense of delaying your access to other sweet skills. All that is spaced out well, so you neither get perks so early they break the game or circumvent too much challenge, nor so late you don't get to enjoy them anymore.
And unlike the first game, you can equip and obtain new equipment that comes with unique (and at times game changing!) boni and penalties, so that's one more point where you can tailor your game experience to your individual play style.

In short: Pretty solid hardcore stealth game with cool main character, okayish graphics, and decent story, the greatest strengths in gameplay and level design. Not without flaws, but those are few enough to be overlooked.

To those who liked the first game and consider buying this one because of it: Gameplay and level design are clearly based upon the first game and largely keep the same spirit, but also evolved beyond that. In my opinion, definitely to the better. The approach to story is decidedly different and thus hardly comparable, but I think mostly inferior. Talents and power progression are definitely a great improvement.

review:
PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!
I and my friend bought this game while it was on offer because we both liked the last game so we thought playing the new one in coop would be great... wrong.
-Coop is awful it was very laggy for the non-host client.
-Mechanics and the overall controls are very clunky and non-responsive.
-The animations are awful and very janky (i don't get how you can have so many people on animation and this is what you get)
-The story and dialogue are abysmal (just look at some of the references Styx makes about other games) the game also likes to "Take the piss" out of other games for dodgy mechanics for example Assassins Creed for the hay bales, when the game has dreadful mechanics and design while also reusing old levels because being lazy gets you money I guess.

One good point the level design and concept art are very good almost triple-A quality.

I now have hatred for the Styx franchise, developers and will never buy or play any more games from them.

PLS save your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047511860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1658510282}
review:
This game starts off alright.
The visuals look pretty nice for the first couple levels, the level design is alright and then after it all sinks in you see the flaws

- The animations are horrible (not for all things, just enough to make you hate it)
- The mechanics barely work
- You get spotted through walls
- A lot of the time you won't grab ledges and you will just drop to your death and if by some miracle you don't die you'll e spotted for no good reason and killed

One of the major problems was that the co-op is broken. Me and a friend brought this because it looked like a good co-op experience, boy were we wrong.
As it was my friend that hosted I got the pleasure of lagging around all the time which meant that jumping from ledge to ledge was even harder and I'd get spotted for no good reason.

BUT the WORST thing of all...
After we finished it finally we were watching the credits together and then all of a sudden, BOOM. THE GAME CRASHES!

I have nothing but absolute hatred for this game at this point.

review:
Styx really looked fun, interesting and pretty well polished.

Styx ... LOOKED ... that way.


Firstly, CO-OP :

Co-op gameplay brought in a whole new level of "suck". It looked fun, but turned out horrible. Difficulty in this is defined more as "when your buddy gets caught, you get f**ked," for no good reason. Awesome way to make co-op tougher, aside from just splitting items/loot and such. HP, what HP? Why bother with it. Summoning a clone consumes 1/2 player HP every time summoned, on top of one-hit kills if someone gets caught. Good stuff.

Won't even review single-play since I didn't get Styx for solo content. Good job trashing co-op type gameplay.

Worth the cash? Not a chance.

review:
이 게임 시리즈에서 가장 눈에 띄는 부분은 시리즈를 지나면서 '스틱스'라는 고블린 캐릭터가 점점 입체화되며 매력적으로 진화한다는 데에 있다. 캐릭터 그 자체가 게임에 가장 큰 재미를 담당하는 셈이다.

전편에 비해 훨씬 디테일이 강화된 맵과 유려해진 풍경 그래픽이 눈길을 사로잡는다. 전작이 대체로 일직선형 진행 구조를 보였다면, 이번 작품은 플레이어로 하여금 다양한 잠입 루트를 상황에 맞게 선택해 운용할 수 있는 재미를 선사한다.

다만 복잡해진 스킬 트리와 소모품 제작 시스템은 그 의미와 효용성에 의문이 든다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046219363', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1509995691}
review:
I normally don't write game reviews, but I've been expecting this game for a really long time after enjoying the story of Styx: Master of Shadows. I had my hopes up and was waiting for an even more interesting plot with better gameplay and new-found skills. What I found was a bland story with probably the most anticlimactic ending there is because there isn't an ending. It's like those TellTale game series, It just cuts off with no closure. Story-wise, it doesn't really compare to that of the first game. And what bothered me most was the final game gear you get is pretty much rendered useless, because the last mission can't even really be considered a stealth one.

TL:DR: The game is more polished and lethal/non-lethal both have more options than before, but the story is banal and it doesn't have an ending/closure

author: {'steamid': '76561198056352362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1509222977}
review:
I like stealth games, and I prefer it when you are heavily discouraged against combat.

This game seems like it would scratch that itch, but definitely fails. It has the right idea, the execution just doesn't back it up.

In a stealth game, I would expect the mobility of the character to be very well fleshed out. It is not. It's difficult and annoying to get the character to latch onto or jump to ledges/objects I want. If you get within 2 feet of a rope, you immediately latch onto it, which is not great if you're trying to hide or sneak by nearby enemies. And, just annoyingly, there's a button you need to hold down whose only purpose is to say I DON'T want to walk off the ledge to my death. If you walk near a ledge without holding down this button, the game assumes you wanted to kill yourself and lets you do it.

My other main annoyance is that, while I prefer stealth games to discourage combat, it's also nice if that requirement doesn't break immersion. To explain, killing enemies means you lose a ranking (represented as gold/silver/bronze medals). The more enemies you kill, the lower that goes. This makes sense except that there's no story reason (for as far as I played the game) as to why the main character wouldn't want to kill these enemies. They hate and want to kill him and his entire species. And the main character isn't a hero, per se. There's no reason I can determine why he wouldn't want to kill the soldiers, so it takes me out of the game knowing I'd get punished for playing the role in the game.

review:
It's a decent stealth game, but as a sequel it's mistakes cannot be overlooked. It makes all of the same mistakes that the first game made and the overall story isn't even remotely interesting... the ending is just bad. It doesn't even feel like a complete game with that ending. 

If you're really desperate for a stealth game, grab the first one. If you really liked the first one (flaws and all), then sure, pick this up. It's a lot of the same... Though, the boss fights both create crappy save points requiring you to skip cutscenes or deal with loading screens.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138230812', 'num_games_owned': 1959, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1509648275}
review:
It is definately worth buying SoD if you like hardcore stealth games. I really recommend you to play the first game Styx Master of Shadows, before trying out this one. One reason for that is because you will get to know a complete background story about the main character Styx. 

The game is rather short, for a beginner I would say between 10-20 hours. You'll get dozens of hours more by achieving achievements or completing Tokens and Secrets. The game also have alot of nice puzzles to discover and solve. Other then that the game being short it's superior well made and a stunning improvement from the last game. Everything from graphics, details, combat and the stealth. There's alot of people pointing out that you need to use Styx's special abilities/powers to complete certain objects or missions, that is absolutely incorrect. I completed the whole story mode without any of that. Infact I never even used the dodge roll. 
There are multiple ways to kill your opponents which is always a good thing in stealth games. There's different stealth tactics aswell as improved abilities. New cosmetics and weapons. Harder boss fights, huge open areas and levels. One thing I really liked extra much about this game is the new enemies. Dwarfs (these guys can sense your goblin smell so be extra careful with them). Dark Evil Elfs (you're screwed if these guys spots you, they will easily kill you with their projectiles. Even bigger Trolls (they're faster besides you shouldn't trigger them or they will smash you into amber sauce)

Story line is pretty weak but that doesn't have any impact on the game itself because it is epic. Most of the cutscenes could had been alot better and longer. There's certain bugs in the game, like jumping between platforms and Styx not grabbing the edge sometime or the Al getting stuck at different objects. 

The game also have some extra interesting stuffs and scenarios, such as bombs, air ships, ropes which you can climb on, ''ziplines'', death quotes and much more.
Styx: Shards of Darkness and Styx: Master of Shadows is really the type of stealth games that brings back the trend amongst stealth games, atleast in my opinion they will always be one of the coolest stealth games I have ever played. The story may be lacking but the game itself is a diamond in the rough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970712242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 1953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1953, 'last_played': 1514270971}
review:
I loved the first game.
I like the second so far. There are two things currently keeping me from absolutely loving it and those are the inability to bind the ENTER key to use item. I play with the arrows and my little finger rests naturally on the enter key, it's perfect and made playing the first game a joy. this is just bad.

The second is that the controls dont seems as responsive, you can see this when going through windows, or worse trying to throw a body over a ledge and having to try it 2-3 times before it stops catching on geaometry, meanwhile guards are getting nearer. That sucks.

The world is beautiful, but the colors seems more washed out, less sure of themselves, and this does not feel stylistic, it feels like a rendering issue because it looks bad, not hideous, its far from a deal breaker, but it is noticable.

For the moment, this is less fun than the first game.

I will udpate as I play more.

While the look and feel of this game is outstanding, the controls are a HUGE step backwards, be worse than the first game. That is pretty rare that a company makes a game worse intentionally. Fix the damn controls and you will get a way better rating from me. It's been months now.

EDIT: I have now finished the game. 

All in all it was fun, really fun. But it was not as good as the first. There were more bugs in this game (Such as not being able to slide down a rope when it was required for a side mission) Bad editing such as this from the level nine loading screen: "Do the dwarves already have started their offense?" I get that this is a non english speaking dev, but for a game that wants to be taken seriously, this is pretty sloppy. The game also has no ending. Unlike the first game, this one ends on a cliff hanger which is really less satisfying.

I also think Styx's abilities this time around were just not as interesting as the first game. I loved sticking my clone in chests and wardrobes to ambush enemies. Loved it. That's gone now. 

Very good game. Could have been a great game. Still I do 100% recommend it. I will be playing it again.

I look forward to the follow-up I just hope they put a little more effort in this next time. This felt like a step backwards. Almost as if mechanics wise, this should have been the first game.

There is a tendency to view any critism as a bad review. That would be a mistake. This is an over all very solid and fun game. Do yourself a favor and pick it up. 7/10. First game 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995497021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1505585513}
review:
Sans y aller par quatre chemins, on retrouve l'ami Styx avec un grand plaisir dans ce second opus.

Graphiquement, on profite amplement des années supplémentaires avec une amélioration générale de la plastique du jeu. Plus beau, plus ouvert dans son level design (dans mon souvenir en tout cas), on gagne un petit peu sur tous les plans.
Malheureusement, la maniabilité de Styx n'a pas évoluée et on retrouve les sauts du gobelin en mode enclume pour notre plus grand déplaisir.

D'un point de vue purement infiltration, si on peut regretter les soucis de vue de tous les ennemis aux cônes de vision particulièrement ridicules (en largeur et en profondeur), on touche ici tout de même au haut du panier. Le gameplay est encore plus riche qu'avant, et la difficulté est au rendez-vous si on cherche la meilleure note en fin de niveau (aucune détection, zéro mort), même si on en ressort toujours aussi frustré que la méthode non létale soit la mieux récompensée.

Seul vrai reproche que je ferai à ce second épisode : son scénario. Ici, plus de réflexion quasi-métaphysique sur l'identité (digne de la SF) qu'on trouvait dans le premier opus. On se contente d'une bête quête fantasy tout ce qu'il y a de plus standard, et c'est bien regrettable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213811036', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1513248560}
review:
这游戏跟其他的潜入类游戏有很大区别。 其他游戏是或多或少带一些潜行要素 比如无双信条，合金装备，古墓10，爆蛋精英4，杀手6之类的。那些游戏，潜行是游戏中一个比较重要的要素，但是就算潜行失败了，你依然有其他玩法或者选择（比如开无双模式，比如掏出来枪进入突突突模式，比如远距离狙击爆蛋，比如杀手6的地图探索 暗杀手法研究，又比如古墓丽影的古墓探索要素）。换句话说，这类游戏不止潜行一个要素。但是这游戏，被发现基本上就意味着死。绿皮小地精面对各种凶悍的敌人，是绝对无法正面抗衡的（低难度还可以格挡反杀，高难度连格挡都没有。。。进战斗了就赶紧跑吧）
[b]从这个角度上说，这游戏是一个非常纯粹的潜入类游戏。这一点，可以给一个喜欢潜行游戏的玩家以极大的享受。[/b]
大方向说完了，那么再说说游戏细节。这游戏一开始玩的时候，可能很多人会有这么一个想法：卧槽其他游戏主角都是各种帅哥靓妹，但是这游戏主角怎么是个丑地精？
当你玩过这游戏，你就会明白：原来地精真的是天生的盗贼，这种潜入类游戏用地精当主角简直太正确了。
这游戏地图光从面积来说，不是特别大。但是三维程度的复杂度很高（地图长宽可能不大但是高度很高）。想去一个地方经常有不同楼层，不同高度的很多条路。而且正因为主角是地精，才能实现一些其他种族无法实现的潜入玩法。比如轻易的上横梁钻狗洞钻井盖，或者躲在随处可见的桌子下面隐藏自己。
[b]这真的是一款极为优秀的纯潜行游戏[/b]

review:
This game is awesome. It punishes you for killing and makes you solve each level like a puzzle with mostly stealth tatics. 

The original game "Styx Master of Shadows" is a good game but a lot of gameplay mechanics (such as ledges) have been improved on a lot in this sequel.

The story in both is fantastic and there's a good bit of humor in the death screens in the sequel.

If you like stealth and puzzle sovling, with minimal focus on combat this is a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028441242', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1506517668}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness is a stealth-based game developed by Cyanide Studio and a sequel to Styx: Master of Shadows (and thus the second prequel to Cyanide's action-RPG Of Orcs and Men). The game allows the player to take control of the goblin assassin-for-hire Styx once again as his thirst for the magical Amber gets him within reach of a fanatical tribe of dark elves.

At its core, Shards of Darkness can be considered more an expansion pack to Master of Shadows than a full-fledged sequel. While this game displays all the great features that made the original a great stealth-based game, it also didn't do much to adress its predecessor flaws, and copied its formula (especially when it comes to enemy variety) to the letter.

On the positive side, Shards of Darkness remains a fun and pure stealth-based game: the player is heavily encouraged to avoid enemy opposition entirely and relays on his tools and wits to discover the safest path to the current mission's objective. The game encourages such a careful approach from the player by rewarding him with medals and extra points for completing a level in the most "stealthy" way possible (without allerting or killing anyone, for instance) and now also allowing him to craft new tools to distract the enemy guards, open new routes or avoid detection. Shards of Darkness also features a co-op mode where another player can help you out with your current assignments as one of Styx clones, further increasing your possibilities and fun factor.

On the negative side, however, Shards of Darkness doesn't improve the fairly clunky platform mechanics from the previous game. Directing Styx around as he jumps towards ledges and swings on ropes is at times a real hassle more than anything else, and every mistake while navigating the map tend to spell death for Styx extremely quickly. As mentioned above, this sequel also recycles the main bulk of Styx rogues gallery from Master of Shadows, without any innovation on this front whatsoever (moreover, some interesting enemies weren't brought back for some reasons). Shards of Darkness also features two boss fights (and not a single one like its predecessor), which, while surely enjoyable, feel more like an extended trial-and-error platforming sequences than boss encounters befitting of such a deep stealth-based game. Also, like in the original game, around the halfway point the game stops introducing entirely new areas to the player and seems content to completely recycle earlier maps, only with different objectives and an increased enemy opposition.

Finally, Shards of Darkness' story isn't exactly as engaging as the one featured in Master of Shadows (which was by no means perfect, but at the very least it had some interesting turns along the line, especially towards the ending). While the basic premises of the plot are captivating and seeing new stuff from the Of Orcs and Men setting is cool, at the end of the day in this game Styx does stuff just because other people tell him to, and the story connecting his various tasks is as bareboned as it gets.

While one could had expected a much more improved sequel from a good stealth-based game like Styx: Master of Shadows, Styx: Shards of Darkness generally delivers the same level of quality and entertainment of its predecessor, with some small adjustments to improve the general experience to boot. If you are a fun of proper stealth-based game you should totally not miss this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198027130491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1560084331}
review:
1편은 굉장히 루즈하고 공중 도시라는 아케나쉬 특성상 배경이 그게 그거인것에 비해 이번편은 그나마 배경이 봐줄만함.
아니. 사실 프롤로그와 1장 대부분을 차지하는 토벤은 정말 닼소3의 이루실을 보는것마냥 정말 아름다웠음.

플레이도 일신하여 전편이 기술없고 (선택지가 많지만)길을 알아보기 어려우며,  경비가 짜증날 정도로 빽빽하게 있는반면 
이번편은 위에서 아래로 내려다 볼수있는 지형이 많아. 경로설정이 쉬워지고 기술도 다채로워져, 적들을 피하고 놀리는 맛이 커짐.

전편이 컷신을 그림과 성우로 때운게 있는 반면, 이번편은 모든 컷신이 인게임 컷신. 이건 정말 마음에 듬.



단점은 주인공이 인간보더 허약한 고블린이라는 특성때문에 은신에 몰빵되어 있어, 보스전이 심각하게 단조롭다는점. 특히 마지막 보스전은 보스전이 아닌 그냥 공격을 피해 달리는 것이라는것. 차라리 인간형 적 암살이 설계하는 맛과 스릴이 더 좋음.

또한 정말 뜬금없이 끝나는 엔딩은 정말 좋은 점수를 주기가 어려움. 후속작 떡밥을 노골적으로 풀풀 풍김. 무슨 미드 시즌 마지막 편 끝나는것도 아니고.

그리고 경비 성우에 투자좀 안하냐!!! ㅜㅜ
모든 경비 목소리를 성우 3명으로 돌려막는데다가 연기도 그리 좋지 못함.
전작의 단점을 그대로 가져온 경우. 하지만 주연급 인물들의 연기는 좋음.


3편은 어떻게 나오고 언제나올지 정말 기대가 되는작품.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2477, 'num_reviews': 929, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1331, 'last_played': 1506143447}
review:
Sequência de Styx: Master of Shadows, melhorou todos os elementos que fizeram o primeiro um grande jogo de furtividade (se não jogou ainda, melhor jogar primeiro), embora a historia não seja tão boa e surpreendente desta vez, mesmo assim deixa com vontade de continuar. As habilidades e tipos de inimigos tiveram poucas mudanças, a menos linearidade ainda desta vez. Os gráficos foram bem melhorados e o jogo só apresentou um bug uma vez pra mim (câmera travada). Gostei muito das pontas soltas que foram resolvidas em relação ao primeiro jogo e a "Of Orcs and Men". Estou esperando pela sequencia ou algum outro jogo no mesmo universo interessante. 
-----------------------
Styx : Master of Shadows sequence, improved all elements that made the first a great game of stealth (if you not played yet, better play first), although the story is not so good and surprising this time, its ok. The skills and enemy types had few changes, less linearity this time around too. The graphics were much improved and the game only presented a bug once to me (camera locked). I really liked the loose ends that were solved in relation to the first game and "Of Orcs and Men". I'm waiting for the sequel or some other game in the same interesting universe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126975019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 1804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1631655967}
review:
What an amazing game and such a pleasant surprise, Styx: Master of Shadows the past game in the series, and the only one besides this one (I think) was a rather disappointing and frustrating experience for me, it was the type of game that I just couldn’t really experience in it’s “rhythm” so to speak.
I just could never really get past dying and getting spotted countless of times, which it’s something that’s still present in this game but that maybe because the game has changed, and I have changed, both of this things come into play when experiencing this game.
For starters I finally understand the story, and if not the story, then the world, and the world of this game, just the universe, the characters, the intricacies, the political and economical arguments, the fight for power coming from different factions, or groups, it’s just fantastic.
It is true that Styx: Shards of darkness suffers from some silly dialog and voice acting, the latter being probably the biggest problem of the two, the dialog in all honesty It’s quite hilarious and fun, especially the one coming from the protagonist itself, Styx.
But the thing about complaining about something like voice acting is that I feel it’s one of those things that’s also a bit “relative” to say the least I could understand as I kept getting deeper and deeper into the game, after hearing plenty of different character’s voices, where people’s complaints where coming from, but to be honest, hadn’t it been for my awareness of this complaints, I might have never even written this paragraph.
The real depth and care for the game tho, is really put into the gameplay, and the characters, as well as the universe.
Styx is an incredible character, I seriously don’t remember liking him as much in the last game, he’s funny, witty, childish, immature, rude, vulgar, but always withholding a bit of charm, or innocence in it all, it’s fun too, to hear him reference other games, and break the “4th wall” constantly, and obviously being self aware.
The biggest aspect that I loved about the game, it’s the massive levels, the incredible corridors composed of multiple paths, of multiple places in which to hide, in which to take cover and “hug” a wall as you sneak past a couple of enemies, literally.
I think Styx: Shards of darkness brilliance comes simply from the freedom that the game makes the player feel, platforming, sneaking, even killing enemies, or simply traversing the level makes me feel good, with tight controls, there are only a few problems, but those ones do exist.
I can’t tell you how tedious it is to try and jump into a given place only to then pummel to your death mistakenly and stupidly after falling off the edge of a platform.
But for the most part, it’s really enjoyable.
The objectives, which are divided into main, and secondary, are usually objectives that take you to get to point A, to point B, which in theory might sound a bit shallow, and effortless, but this is yet another example that I think makes Styx work in a really good way, having the freedom to get to a certain spot however you want, in a stealth game, with as massive, extensive, and detailed levels as this one, it’s a joy to say the least.
Hence the sense of “freedom” I was talking about in a second.
The problems of Styx: Shards of darkness, for me, really come to some contradictory design choices, paired with some frustrating levels of difficulty.
I started playing the game on the easiest difficulty available, which the game defaults to (ironically enough) there’s a brief description as to what difficulty it’s design for a particular player, but it tends to be ambiguous at best, the crazy part it’s that after playing through the first mission, and a bit of the second one in that difficulty, I kept getting spotted and failing my goal to play through the entire game without getting spotted once, changing the difficulty to the setting before the last (Goblin) make the game not only more enjoyable, because at the very least my plenty of mistakes were somehow explained given the level of difficulty, whilst at the same time, being a bit more “rewarding” in a way, after clearing the entire game, and only dying a few times, I just didn’t feel frustrated anymore.
Not necessarily something that might affect everyone, but something I felt needed to be mentioned.
Styx is in every sense of the word not a game for people that want to have a relaxing, “easy”, and peaceful time.
The main issue that I must say, will almost certainly affect some people, lies with some of the problems in the execution of the story, some minor mistakes in the way the controls work, problems with pushing through the “learning curve”, and finally, and probably the biggest one for me…
The contradictory game design, and the limitations that come with it.
In Styx: Shaders of darkness there are medals that you can get in each mission, three, one for clearing the game in a given amount of time, one for clearing the mission without getting spotted, and finally the third one, for not killing anybody.
Here’s the problem with this.
Most of this can be easily ignored, and I would recommend you to do so, but getting every medal in each stage it’s required for achievements, as well as for getting some extra “points” that you can use to level up your skill tree, don’t quote me on that last one tho, I’m almost sure it’s required, but I don’t know…
The problem that I have with this medals it’s that the vast majority of time they don’t really reward the player for playing the game “their” way, instead they force you to play through each mission in a certain given time, without killing anybody, even if the game becomes incredibly more enjoyable when doing so, as well as when not getting spotted, which it’s probably the only one I can agree with completely in it’s inclusion.
The rest, completely unnecessary and in my opinion a bit irrational decisions that lack consideration for all the other gameplay aspects, and mechanics the game has.
Overall, Styx: Shards of darkness it’s a great game, it’s fun, and enjoyable, challenging, even when playing in “standard” or easy difficulties, and generally it’s just a great time.
The game does lean a bit “shorter” in it’s length, clocking at 10 hours in a very difficult playthrough, it’s pretty tolerable for me personally, but I just wonder how long would the game be for people that play on easier difficulties and are simply “better” at the game than me.
I recommend it tremendously, it is a game with a lot of character, just… Like, almost most of the times, get it on a sale.

review:
Im Sale Empfehlenswert. Ansosnten hat das Spiel leider zu wenig Spielzeit für den Preis. 
Da ich es im Sale gekauft habe bin ich aber damit zufrieden. Wer natürlich alle Gegenstände sammeln möchte usw. hat etwas länger etwas vom Spiel.
Negativ anzumerken sind meiner Meinung nach hauptsächlich die Bosse, da sie nichts mit Stealth spiel zu tun haben, da hätte ich mir eine etwas andere Lösung gewünscht.
Das Ende kommt sehr abrupt und ist ein ziemlicher Cliffhanger, da hätte man Story technisch durchaus die Spielzeit etwas verlängern können. Aber nun gut, das Spiel macht Spaß zu Spielen, im Sale kann man es sich ruhig kaufen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055712441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1505744566}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness ist der Nachfolger von Styx: Master of Shadows.

Die Grafik vom Spiel ist wieder sehr sehr gut gelungen, aufgrund der Unreal Engine 4.

Das Gameplay ist eigentlich genau wie der Vorgänger, aber es gibt ein paar Neuerungen z.B. neue Schauplätze, mehr Kletter möglichkeiten, verbesserter Skill Baum und neue Waffen. Leider muss ich aber sagen mich hatte es gewundert das das Spiel auf normalen Schwierigkeitsgrad so kurz war. Der Vorgänger war da deutlich länger. Außerdem empfand ich Shards of Darkness um eingies leichter als Master of Shadows. Ich konnte ohne Probleme durch Gegner mengen rennen bzw. auch mal mich durch parieren ohne wirklich ins Schwitzen zu kommen. Story war an sich in Ordnung man konnte ihr gut folgen und war sehr humorvoll erzählt. Ein großer Minus Punkt an dem Spiel war dieser völlig unnötige Boss Fight kurz vorm Ende des Spiels. Da hätte man sich schon was besseres und anspruchsvolleres ausdenken können bin ich der Meinung.

Alles in allem muss ich aber sagen das Styx: Shards of Darkness den Vorgänger mit kleinen aber großartigen Dingen ergänzt. Für jeden der den ersten Teil gespielt hat kann ich diesen Titel nur emphelen!

review:
我，哥布林，偷东西

[spoiler]那些女精灵守卫的屁股好棒啊[/spoiler]

之前随手写的两句话蜜汁多人点赞，之后也通了关来这里简单吹下牛B

我运气可能比较好，并没有出现有些评论里说的存档闪退之类的，很流畅地玩到了最后

作为一款潜行游戏，由于我们的主角是哥布林，路线的选择是十分多样的。像顶梁、地洞这种神奇的路线，但某些场景亮度较暗，对于我这种星际韩宗选手比较不友好。主角本体十分脆弱，无脑突进等待你的只有灭亡。

一开始像我这种[spoiler]更喜欢使♂用小姐姐或者mong♂男[/spoiler]的可能会接受不了styx的形象，但是在游戏中你会发现这个话痨真的是非常搞笑，而且穿着那身装扮的时候配合那红色的双眼也是十分帅气。

没有中文算是一大缺点，能看懂styx的吐槽能增添不少乐趣

喜欢潜行游戏的你值得一试[spoiler]尾随那些女精灵[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1505657432}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review

PLEASE NOTE (2017): Due to recent false accusations of plagarism, I (the reviewer) would like to stress that all these reviews and upcoming reviews are original and are not blatantly copied. Other reviews are used to help stress my point across but are changed in such a way to make the review in my own wording [/h1]

Styx: Shards of Darkness is one of those games that I have been following since the first day Cyanide Studios and Focus Home Interactive announced it after the successful first game Styx: Master of Shadows, just as the first game, it caught my attention and I couldn't wait to play it... first reviews came out, mediocre to positive just as the previous game. I was a bit dissapointed as I was expecting this game to be pretty good, but I trusted Cyanide to deliver a good successful sequel to the equally enjoyable first game, so I bought it and now I have finished it

So, what did I think of it?

Overall, the game is not bad. The game had its moments but behind those great moments, it did have some major flaws. I felt like Cyanide didn't really learn it's mistakes, flaws and lessons from the previous game and just kept the same formula as the first game with only improving certain mechanics here and there

The story, it is pretty well written. I was interested in Styx's continuation and I kept on playing thanks to its story. Although it did have some cliche's here and there, it was pretty well done! The game is pretty damn long which I was surprised, but what bothered me was what I felt was the developers being lazy, they re-used some levels from the beginning to the last few levels of the game. I call this the 'Rinse and Recycle' method where either the developer lost money or was too damn lazy to create more different levels... just the same as the first one, they did it again with the sequel

The multiple environments Shards of Darkness takes place in are actually very nice. Powered by the Unreal Engine 4, it does bring out the fantasy genre into the environments with its open areas and secret passage ways. However, some textures were bad, not as bad as Master of Shadows

The voice acting is... sub-par, Styx's voice actor was the one I favoured the most, he brought out the character pretty well even if the voice acting did flop sometimes here and there. The other main characters were voiced... okay-ish. Some characters played their voices as if they were reading from there scripts, some other characters played them with little character in their voices

The music is pretty good and captures the fantasy/stealthy genre that the game was put in

Gameplay, its okay. The game heavily focuses on stealth and not in combat and the stealth mechanic is pretty good, even if it did have some flaws here and there. The combat is terrible, if you happen to be caught by a guard, you have to time your parries correctly then strike whilst the iron is hot, pretty bad combat system. Jumping... oh, the jumping, still just as bad as the first game, the jumping in the platform bits is still pretty bad, and the ledge detection although improved from the first game is still pretty bad

The game does have its fair share amount of glitches, like guards sticking through walls, the camera popping through the environment and the cutscene camera sometimes glitching through the environment. I'm very surprised that the game had quality assurance and did not find these glitches...

I know that the people behind this game cared about their project and it shows, but, for their next project in the Styx universe, I hope that they listen to our feedback and improve even more from what Shards of Darkness suffered from!

This is going onto my best game in Steam library because I enjoyed it, its not the perfect and it will never be, but I enjoyed it none the less and I hope that future projects from Cyanide Studios will be better if not tons better than Styx: Shards of Darkness

review: Отличное продолжение первой части, которая, кстати, мне не очень понравилась. Здесь всё хорошо: сюжет, крафт, стелс-механика, физика, кат-сцены, освещение. Игра больше не однотонная, очень живая и красочная. Такая, какой она и должна быть. Даже есть любительский русский перевод текста и субтитров для тех, кому сложно играть на английском. Хорошая графика, очень красивые локации, обновленное "янтарное зрение", новые способы убийств, новые ловушки, интересные умения. Оригинальная заставка при гибели, когда герой обращается к игроку с забавным комментарием по поводу его смерти в игре. Единственный недостаток - я не смог настроить смену оружия (ловушек) колесиком мышки, как это было в первой части. Приходится постоянно открывать селектор оружия, что не очень удобно.

review:
Je suis pas ni spécialiste ni complètement fan des jeux d'infiltration, les rares dont je dispose finissent bien souvent par me voir oublier la partie "infiltration" ou bien oublier le jeux si ce n'est pas possible ...
Pour autant, Styx apporte une réelle fraicheur de par la posibilité d'y jouer en coop ! Quel plaisir !
Nous avons terminé le jeux avec un ami et on a franchement bien rigolé (bon même si le codage du "parkour" laisse a désirer ... nous avons également eu quelques problèmes après une mort des deux joueurs ... l'invité devais quitter, etre réinvité, recharger la partie pour pouvoir rejoindre... uniquement depuis 1 semaine avant non ... peut être une MAJ?)

L'histoire du jeux, parfaite, je n'avais pas joué au premier et ca ne pose de problème pour suivre, le fait d'être un gobelin et de finir par haïr les elfes en armure et les nains.... un bon délire, en revanche: La fin est horrible !

Bref un jeux que clairement je ne ferais pas en solo, mais en coop ca fait du bien

author: {'steamid': '76561198093726039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 1222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1505308190}
review:
전작이랑 비슷하지만 몇 가지 달라진 점이 있는 제품입니다.

게임플레이: 잠입이지만 특징이라면 맵이 크고 진행루트는 여러 개지만 대신 맵이 재탕이라는 것 정도. 다만 1편처럼 같은 맵을 3번 쓰는 것은 아니고 2번 혹은 1.5번? 정도 사용하는 것에서 그칩니다. 
난간플레이는 꺽인 곳에서는 옆으로 가지도 못하던 전작에 비해 훨씬 나아졌습니다. 
1편에서 매우매우매우 아쉬웠던 보스전도 많이 보충이 되어 확실히 보스를 상대한다는 느낌이 듭니다.
다만 모든 것을 완벽히 해야만 스킬 모두 얻는 것은 여전하고 따라서 최종 오의를 얻어봤자 더이상 쓸 일이 없습니다..

전작에선 엘프가 냄새 맡았지만 이제는 그런 거 없습니다. 냄새는 워해머 토탈워에서 튀어나온 듯한 드워프가 맡는데 드워프는 중갑.... 죽일 방법이 너무 없어서 그렇더군요. 드워프가 아니더라도 중갑 적이 너무 늘어났습니다. 죽일 수 있는 방법은 지형지물을 제외하면  산성지뢰밖에 없기에 이건 별로인 점으로 봤습니다. 업적이나 점수를 통해 잠입을 유도할 수는 있어도 모두다 암살하면서 진행하고 싶어하는 유저의 욕구도 어느 정도 충족시켜줘야 한다고 봤거든요. 


설정: 1편에는 등장하지 않는 여캐도 등장합니다.  고블린과 엠버의 관계 등 1편을 안 하면 이해하기 힘든 내용이 꽤 있습니다. 오브 오크스 앤 맨은 안 해서 모름. 1편의 캐릭 나오면 반갑긴 하네요. 뭔가 이상하게 언급해서 찾아보니 오브 오크스의 오크도 등장하더군요. 특이한 점은 주인공 성격이 많이 바뀌었습니다. 매직 더 개더링의 멍청한 고블린+네타 캐릭? 1편의 고민하는 캐릭터상은 아닙니다.


한글번역은 다 그렇다쳐도 스틱스의 말장난이 의역도 직역도 아니고 완전히 이상한 대화도 만들어놨습니다. 뭐 몰라도 크게 문제 없는 내용은 아니긴 하지만요. 그외에도 몇몇 오역 같은 부분도 있습니다.

review:
[h1] fatal error的解决办法：[/h1]
出现这个问题是因为，用修改器或者打汉化，打过汉化。导致的存档损坏。
所以我们需要删除存档[u] C:\Users\XXXXX\AppData\Local\Styx2[/u]
我看有人说找不到这个位置，我WIN10 存档就在这，不在这就在 我的文档 里。还有找不到AppData文件夹的，要打开隐藏项目。
并关掉steam云存档（不然一直会从云上下载已损坏的存档）
关掉后，删掉汉化。修复游戏。进入游戏开个新的存档。然后退出打开云存档，再进再退出，确保游戏存档上传，就OK了。
上次没写清楚，要删掉汉化才能玩。就是删掉汉化文件。

[spoiler]所以就是人家游戏公司没问题。汉化组的锅？。[/spoiler]
这是一个好游戏，让我们正确的对待这个问题吧。
或者就让我们宣传这款游戏，让更多的人来购买，让厂商看到我们中国的购买，不是更多的退款。也不要更多的差评！！！！
We need chinese!!!!![spoiler] （其实主要老了忘光了英语。。。。）需要大佬做汉化[/spoiler]
[spoiler]一点废话/    要说为什么会喜欢这个游戏呢，主要是年轻的时候WOW里面玩的是地精盗贼吧，那是我的青春啊。很多很多的怀念。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198019699200', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1502016926}
review:
ステルスTPS。窓化可能。日本語化可能。
ゴブリンの主人公を操って進む、超骨太なステルス。
かなり好みがハッキリとわかれるゲーム。

[h1]○良[/h1]
[b]+キャラの立った登場人物達[/b]
　登場人物が全般的に個性的で、ムービーや会話シーンは中々楽しめる。
　特に主人公のStyxはゴブリンとは思えないほど語彙力が高く、進行途中でも独り言などでユニークな言い回しを発揮してくれる。

[b]+アイテムやギミックの多さ[/b]
　マップギミックやアイテムが多めで、プレイヤーが取れる行動の選択肢は多い。
　マップの進路に関しても、一つの目的地に幾つかの進路があり、プレイヤーによって選択できるのは良い。
　
[h1]△賛否[/h1]
[b]±骨太すぎるステルスアクション部分[/b]
　主人公の能力など、今風のステルスゲームにありがちな部分はちらほらあるものの、基本的には少し前までの戦闘すらままならないガチガチなステルスゲームの気色が強い。
　主人公がかなり貧弱なため戦闘がシビアで、戦闘向きのアイテムもそう多くはないため、一度敵に見つかるとすぐにジリ貧に追い込まれていく。

　また、目的地に向かう際のガイドのような物が一切無いのも難易度を引き上げている。
　理由としては後述するマップの使い回しが原因だと思われるが、道中には看板や進行方向を表す置物などが一切なく、ただ闇雲に目的地の方向を進んでいくことになる。
　場所がわかっているものの、安全な道を探すのが難しく（正面突破なら簡単なパターンは多いがそれでもたまに迷う）、前述の戦闘のシビアさと合わせるとかなり不自由な点が多い。

　後述するスキルポイントのシステムもネックで、カジュアルなステルスゲームを求めている方には全くオススメできないが、雰囲気づくりは抜群なので逆に昔ながらのステルスゲームが大好きな人間にはハマる部分でもあるだろう。

[h1]×悪[/h1]
[b]-スキルとスキルポイント（評価）システムのミスマッチ[/b]
　主人公はステージクリア後（もしくは道中）に貰えるスキルポイントを使って、新たにスキルを覚えることが出来るようになるが、そのシステムが問題。
　評価の内容は『タイム』『発見数』『殺害数』によって判断され、それぞれが増えると大きく評価が下がってしまうのだが、『発見数』『殺害数』でポイントが下がるのに対し、覚えれるスキルの3分の2が"致死性"の戦闘向きのスキルとなっている。
　つまり、ステルス特化のプレイをしている人間からすると、道中でスキルポイントの使い道が無くなり、逆に戦闘しながら進めている人間にしてみれば、ポイントがカツカツの状態でやることなる。
　ステルスよりも戦闘のほうが楽だからといえば聞こえは良いが、実際は戦闘するにしてもシビアな部分が多いので、どちらにせよミスマッチだと感じざるを得ない。
　それこそステルスと戦闘用スキルをハッキリと分けて量を増やすだけでも、二通りの楽しみ方が出来たのではないかと思う。

[b]-ストーリーが雑[/b]
　個人的に一番問題だと感じている部分。特にエンディングに関して言えば最近のゲームの中でも最悪の出来。
　対人関係が雑で、そもそも前提（前作など）の知識がないとわからない部分が多い上に、説明が一切入らないため、だいたいこんな感じなんだろうなと思いながら進むことになる。
　とにかく展開も雑で、お互いに邪魔に思っていた敵同士が簡単に味方になったり、よくわからない自信で「後はなんとかなる」といい味方を敵地のど真ん中に放置してきたり、最も悪役のキャラが幕間の会話で「あいつ逃げたらしいぞ」みたいな軽いノリでフェードアウトする。
　最終盤の展開も疑問点が多く、せっかくのStyxの格好良さがストーリーで台無しされているように感じた。

[b]-マップが使いまわし[/b]
　マップ自体は良くできているものの、マップが使いまわしされており、バリエーションはそう多くない。
　しかも中盤以降からは洞窟の中が主になるので、似たような風景がずっと続く。
　マップ自体のクオリティは高いので、せっかくだったらもっと雰囲気の違うマップを幾つか味わいたかった。

[b]-掴む掴まないが判断しづらい[/b]
　特に岩系。距離的には届いてるように見えても掴まなかったり、逆に意図しないところに掴みかかったりと、掴みがイマイチ安定しない。

[h1]＝総評[/h1]
　全体的にはやはり骨太な古い時代のステルスをしたい人向けと言える。
　それにしても全体的に雑な部分が多く、プレイしていてストレスを感じる部分も少なくない。
　個人的には終盤の尻すぼみ感が半端じゃなく、それが一番このゲームの評価を下げている要因となった。
　フルプライスで買うと決して安いゲームではないので、よっぽどステルスゲームが好きではない限り、セールまで待ったほうが無難だろう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198312292172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1468, 'last_played': 1622741302}
review: Beaux graphismes mais moins d'intérêt que le premier. L'histoire est creuse. En mode normal l'intéligence des personnages est nulle. Le jeu est trop court. Les compétences à développer et l'arsenal pour Styx sont trop limitées. A un moment j'avais des points mais pas envie de déveloper certaines compétences (ex combat). On pourrait par exemple donner à Styx la possibilité d'avoir un grappin à cartouches, des bombes à retardement pour attirer l'attention ou de pouvoir se téléporter sur des courtes distances. Les passages de jeu de plateformes sont chiants. J'ai failli laisser tomber. Cependant, on sent le potentiel de ce jeu d'infiltration avec ce personnage plaisant. Il y a certainement moyen d'exploser le top des ventes avec un 3éme opus mieux fait.

review:
잠입이 주가 되는 게임이라고 해서 바로 달려와 봤습니다.
이번에 할인도하고 한글화도 되고 해서 더욱 좋았습니다.
파크라이, 언차티드 같은 게임에서 총같은건 쓰지 않는다,
더 나아가 어쌔신크리드 = 무쌍게임 이라고 생각하는 분이라면
정말 딱인 게임이라고 생각합니다.

거의 모든 방향으로 잠입이 가능하고 다시 말하면 길이 다양합니다.
건물 내에서도 이리저리 숨을 수 있는 점이 인상에 깊네요
특히 책상 밑에 숨을 수 있는 점이 비현실적이긴 하지만
오히려 적과 더 가깝게 느껴지면서 박진감과 우월감을 느꼈습니다.

암튼 더이상 길게 쓰는건 귀찮아서 못하는 성격이라
그만 쓰고, 좋은 게임이라는 것만은 말씀드리고 싶네요

author: {'steamid': '76561198027277210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1504646407}
review:
Well... it is an ok game. 
Definitly NOT worth the full price.

Content:
The content is not big enough. Half the content is reused because you have to get back there in another mission (well, the enemies update).

Level Design:
The level design is NOT the slightest believeable. Every other room/house has a small hole where just you as a goblin can fit through - what the heck? Why would Dark Elves build such a thing?

Gameplay:
Your options are limited. Sometimes I did not understand why the opponent has seen me or why I was able to sneak through.

Fazit:
I can only recommend this game to people who want to play though the same level trying to be the fastest without killing and without detection.

review:
This and the original are both amazing stealth games.  Shards is better out of the 2 but i high suggest getting both because they are designed in an old school no BS kind of way

Shards is an excellent looking game that runs amazingly well.  Im playing with a 5820k running at 4.6ghz (6 cores), and a gtx 1080FE with a decent overclock and I can max this game out at 4k60fps with zero dips.

I dont want to say much because the fun is discovering how this game plays but I will say id buy a 3rd game the second it was released.

I have a single complaint about the devs and thats patch notes.  The website has a section devoted to them but its blank.  They do end up posting them on steam (usually) but I would prefer the notes to be there right when the patch goes live.  Today there was a 2 gig patch and I have no idea what its changed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096911085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1504533349}
review:
這個遊戲有三個面向讓我覺得是個壞遊戲：

第一個是關卡的目的性：
每個關卡通常都會有某種遊玩的方向
比如特定關卡或是地圖你不能夠驚動到他人
或者是不能殺人 不能被看見等等
但是得到這些資訊的時間點實在是太遲了
因為玩家的技能和裝備道具都是在關卡開始以前就選擇好的
也就是說如果帶上暗殺專用的技能和武器
卻被臨時告知接下來的遊戲不能殺人
其實感受是很糟糕的
關卡之中也有一些點位可以更換技能和裝備
但是可惜的是這些點位的設置非常糟糕
在被臨時通知不能殺人的狀態下卻不見這些點位
因而這些更換裝備技能的機會可說是難以真正派上用場

第二個是地圖與敵人的設計：
關卡之中有四種我想要說明的特殊兵種：重裝甲兵、爬蟲、矮人、飛蟲
之所以要特別講解這些兵種是因為他們和地圖的設計非常不契合

重裝甲兵：
首先是重裝甲兵，重裝甲兵沒有辦法使用匕首刺殺
能夠殺死他們方法主要是對他們的食物下毒或者利用天花板的吊燈砸死他們
然而地圖的設計讓以上兩種戰術變得毫無價值
首先是下毒的部分 下毒之後你必須等待巡邏的敵人完整跑完巡邏路線
他們才會吃下劇毒的水或食物
然而等待的時間非常漫長 漫長到你可以直接利用這段時間避開守衛到達目的地
如果你選擇等待敵人毒發身亡 他們的屍體反而會吸引守衛注意 讓你的任務更為困難
而吊燈的部分在你達到高處之後就相當等於進入了安全的視野範圍
根本就沒有刺殺的必要
這樣的設計非常弔詭 也非常愚蠢 

爬蟲：
第二個特殊兵種是爬蟲
爬蟲是個聽力範圍極廣警覺性也非常高的昆蟲之一
甚至玩家在一般潛行狀態下移動都會被牠聽到
然而這樣的蟲並沒有視力判定
所以你可以在牠的面前行動 
但是卻必須額外放慢已經很緩慢的潛行狀態的移動速度
因為視力的關係你其實只要保持慢速就不會被發現並不會感到任何遊戲帶來的刺激感
然而一定要以極度龜速的的緩慢步伐在廣大的地圖行動會讓遊戲節奏非常緩慢且無趣

矮人：
第三個特殊兵種是矮人
矮人是進階版的重裝甲兵
除了因為重裝甲而無法用匕首刺殺之外
他能在一定的範圍內追蹤你的氣味
但這樣的設計和地圖的契合度也很差
在大型地圖的環境中主要的安全路線是天台和繩索
所以矮人的嗅覺範圍可說是個可有可無的設定
且及便是大地圖 地圖的設計依舊是很細心的處理大部分的細節
地面上有許多掩體和躲藏的點位可以善加利用
一般來說 與地圖物件互動創造機會並且冷靜觀察守衛的巡邏路線從而找到破口是潛行遊戲的精髓
而地圖設計廣大使得與機關互動或是觀察巡邏路線變的不再重要
而玩家如果能不選擇過份簡單設計的天台路線
反而選擇機關眾多的地面路線其實是難能可貴的
只是矮人的嗅覺範圍太過曖昧 沒有太大的實質影響能力
聞到嗅覺開始幾乎要花上4秒才能進入搜查階段
在這過程中觀察過巡邏路線和敵人配置的玩家早就離開矮人的守備範圍了

飛蟲：
第四種我要講解的兵種是飛蟲
飛蟲是種不會巡邏但是會在點位駐守的一種飛行蟲類敵人
當發現你的時候會用毒針噴你 然而因為是飛行係的敵人
玩家除了使用飛針之外並沒有任何能力能夠解決飛蟲
簡單的說 飛蟲就是個鎖住的門 
「如果你有開鎖器，就可以在這地圖增加新的路線」
「如果你沒有開鎖器，你就不能使用這條路線」
就只是以這個理由存在的假性敵人 關於地圖的路線
通常的設計是玩家藉由地圖探索找到下水道、通風口、解地圖支線等等方式發現新路線
而不僅僅是因為手邊有開鎖器 或者是手邊有飛針這種簡單的條件來決定能不能使用新路徑
用發現新路線去回饋願意探索地圖的玩家才是正確的作法 而不是用新路線去回饋手邊剛好有特定道具的玩家

第三個是遊戲的基礎操作：
遊戲的操作相比一代依舊毫無進步
跳躍的過程中沒有鎖定 所以玩家會在空中飄移
地圖物件多了繩索這項設定然而時常會發生角色跳躍結果沒抓到繩索
或是沒跳到想去的地方這樣的狀況
戰鬥的部分除了一代強制視角固定之外也是毫無改變
看準敵人攻擊按下X鍵 反擊特定次數就可以擊殺 這樣的設定非常過時 也很無趣

author: {'steamid': '76561198052189121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1562, 'last_played': 1530823869}
review:
Mein erstes echtes Schleichspiel und ich fand es wirklich großartig!
Es gibt allerdings 2 große ABER.

Ohne viel spoilern zu wollen:
- ein Zwischenboss war für mich grauenhaft, ich hab das Spiel komplett ohne Feindkontakt gespielt, und dann kommt ein Boss der alle Mechaniken aushebelt und die Immersion völlig bricht, ein absolutes NoGo!
- der Endgegner. Mich hats komplett überrascht als das Spiel aus war!?! Der Boss ist nicht so übel wie der vorangegangen erwähnte, aber noch immer ein Fail.

Wie so etwas weitaus besser geht zeigt zum Beispiel Dishonord vor!

Aber ansonsten sehr spassig zu spielen, vor allem wenn man  wirklich alles schleicht und die nötigen Kills alternativ löst.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969589893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1675, 'last_played': 1504129756}
review: Falls es sich jemand holen möchte sollte er in Stealth Spielen geübt sein, denn ganz so einfach wie die meisten Spiele lässt es sich nicht spielen. Fast überall ist Heimlichkeit oberstes Gebot da sonst ein schnelles ableben von Styx folgt. Wer schwierige Spiele mag und eine Herausforderung sucht ist bei Styx Shards of Darkness genau richtig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030370831', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1504105333}
review:
I really liked the game and I had a lot of fun with the pure stealth mechanics, but I have a hard time recommending it because the ending is probably one of the least satisfying endings in a game I've ever played.

Pros:
+Great stealth mechanics and gameplay
+Extremely vertical level design
+Good looking game
+Funny dialogue

Meh:
~Story
~Voice acting 
~When the jokes don't land very well
~Akwardly written text, or poorly translated
~Boss fights

Cons:
-Story
-So much back tracking
-Ending

Overall:
Gameplay: 8/10
Story: 7/10
Visuals: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198247915776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6689, 'last_played': 1642167859}
review:
This game is amazing, if you are a fan of hardcore stealth games then you need to have this game.

This game is a huge improvement to the first game: Styx Master of Shadows. However, if you like this game I'd recommend you to play Styx MoS. The gameplay in Styx MoS is not as good as in Styx SoD, but the story of the first game is absolutely incredible.                                                             
You don't need to play Styx MoS to understand the story of Styx SoD, but I think you should play it to understand the character Styx. 

In this game you have a lot more options than you have in the first game, if you see an entrance and it's guarded, there are always multiple options for you to enter a room.
The levels are way bigger.
The platforming has improved, it still has a couple issues that it doesn't grab the ledge you're trying to jump to, but I have almost never experienced it.

The only real problem the game has is the AI, It's very stupid (a guard looked out of a window and I jumped in front of it and he didn't see me) and can get really buggy if you get spotted.
The only solution for this problem is DON'T GET SPOTTED. Play this game stealthily, the way it is meant to be played.
