author: {'steamid': '76561198212351968', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1680787586}
review:
Полностью пройдя игру, готов сделать обзор.

Плюсы:
Олдскульный стелс, где скрытность не один из вариантов (привет dishonored)
Это мать его гоблин!
Наличие головоломок
Противники разной сложности!
Интерресный, но короткий сюжет!
Стикс часто ломает 4-ю стену! И показывает посхалки!
Графика! (для малобюджетного проекта это слишком идиально! Не то что CoD или Mass Effect Andromeda!)
Наличие коорперативного режима!

Минусы:
Короткая (скорее придирка)
Часто можно встретить одинаковые декорации, но это не очень заметно (если вы не фапаете на них) и опять же вспомните про бюджет!
Немножко багов
Скудные диалоги при смерти(


ИТОГО:
Игра стоит своих денег только если вы вскормленны DS и хардкорным стелсом, иначе просто пошлёте! Но сказать что она плохая - это оскорбить её! Эта игра пример для низкобюджетных проектов! (и не только) 
Брать однозначтно!

author: {'steamid': '76561198191744078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1509167372}
review:
전작보다 스토리가 더 탄탄하지만 맵은 넓고 파밍에 집중해야되는 시스템...
ai는 여전히 멍청하긴 하지만 전작보단 나아짐.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106332639', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1666568281}
review:
First, let me get this off my chest. I played, beat, and hated the first Styx game. It had an incredible concept and interesting story,  but the level design, back tracking, and boring upgrades hampered most of the game for me. 

Why did I buy this game then, you may ask yourselves. That was also a question I also asked myself, but damn am I glad I did.

Styx: Shards of Darkness is an improvement over the first game in more ways than imaginable. The levels are better, the equipment, and controls are improved beyond measure. The story is great so far, and the difficulty is just right. I'm honestly surprised at how good this game is in comparison to the first.

I gave the first game a negative review, but I am giving this one a EXTREMELY positive one.

Buy this game! It will not disappoint you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006650360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1513305309}
review:
A far better successor to Looking Glass Studio's masterwork Thief franchise than Thi4f (though given how horrible the latter was, I guess that's not saying much).

Maps are huge and offer multiple different pathways to move around without being seen and give vantage points for you to stake out a plan of attack.  The stealth mechanics  from the first game have been polished such that mostly things just work, and in a way that makes sense.  Add to that a crafting system that lets you make things that matter (acid mines, so useful) and a progression system with usefull upgrades and it can be hard to find something they didn't improve.  Cons would be the dialogue is on the cringy side of cheesy most of the time as well as the voice acting and animations in cutscenes are sub-par.   I wasn't expecting it to live up to the high bar set by the first two Thief games, but I sure like where Cyanide are going with this series.

All in all I'd say if you enjoy stealth games, this is one to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048532211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1345, 'last_played': 1493550025}
review:
I really love this game and enjoyed every minute of it. 
styx is really funny in this game and jokes about other games like assasins creed ( shown in trailer ).
the game is working very well and is pretty too.
i like the way awarding stealthy behaviour works and how punishing recklesness, and assasinating is.
the only things i didnt like about the game are story driven, wherein the first styx game had an awesome story that really pulled me into the game. in this game though 


-----( SPOILER ALERT )-----


 styx just gets a bounty from some guild that hunts goblins but need styx's skills to steal a staff from a dark elf wich is a shape shifter ( styx didnt know he was before he confronted the elf in human form atm ) after he fails he notices that there are elves addicted to amber (see it as Mana) 
and that there is a huge amount of amber around, but ( this is part of the first game ) styx knows that amber should be on low supply because the amber tree got destroyed, that resulting in no amber production possible. BUT!! the elves kill goblins to extract their amber ( thats in their bodies, as goblin apparently drank a lot of amber in their life ) and they kill a huge amount of goblins for the amber. 

this story wasnt really that great and the game has an open ending too.
so we have to wait for styx 3to get to know how it ends.

but like i said i really like this game, even with the uninteresting story in it.
this game is a really good stealth game ( try not to be seen in the whole game ,  killing nothing ,  stealing everything you can get your hands on )
and sont be like: oh another walking sim. NO! if you get caught you WILL die. If one guard sees you he warns other guards to come to his aid making escaping very hard for you, and even if you get away from the guards reach, they will try to shoot you down with bows and such, resulting in: once you have revealed yourself, you will most certainly die.

there are some bugs in the game like a guard who is stuck at a location and sometimes its anoying, but most of the times it makes getting past them even harder. 

there are some parts where you need to know about the first styx game, but its not that important for this story, the only thing being that styx tells to himself that the amber tree has been destroyed and the elves have a steady supply of it still.

overal i would love to give this game a 8/10, but it was not that good storywise so i give it a 7/10.
the other stuff doesnt bother me, like the little bugs with the guards and such.

i played this game on the hardest difficulty right away, as its how its meant to be played in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004517600', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1493404790}
review:
Overall, a very solid sequel to a good stealth game. Shards of Darkness feels like more of the same, which isn't bad. I was originally expecting a little more after Cyanide hyped this new game up so much, but I had a lot of fun playing through it. It's still the same oldschool stealth experience as the first game from 2014, and it still plays on its strenghts, most notably the incredibly open level design, giving you multiple approaches to each situation.
The skill system got a little refined, but overall I didn't really care so much for it. It caters to different playstyles, and if you happen to just use one for the entire game, 80% of the skilltree becomes obsolete after you have filled out the one you want after like Mission 2. So if you really want all of the skills value you realistically have to mix up your playstyle constantly, which could be very jarring.
The biggest change besides the very pretty Unreal 4 Engine is the change in the protagonists character. They kind of turned him into a goblin version of Deadpool, with lots of Fourth Wall breaking and constant references to popculture and videogames in general. It didn't grab me and made me cringe more than once, I guess it's up to if you're into this sort of humor. I personally would have rather had the pure sarcastic personality he had in the first game. Very minor quirk, but I thought it was worth noting as they make a big deal out of it (even gameoverscreens where Styx mocks you for dying)!

Just like Master of Shadows, I can recommend this game wholeheartedly to fans of oldschool 3d stealth games like Thief or early Splinter Cell games. It's a cool little budget title and I hope the "Styx"-Series isn't over yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027876662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1804, 'last_played': 1493404202}
review:
The game is like Styx 1, with the same AI, with similar level design and enemies and the same issues. Get this if you liked Styx 1 or or if you are into stealth games. Ignore if you are not.

Pro's
- good stealth game
- fun main character
- good level design with multiple ways through a level
- enemy variety (swordmen, heavies who you cant kill, civilians, dwarfs who can smell you, blind beetles who can hear you, wasps)
- skilltree

Cons
- did not improve AI pathfinding compared to Styx 1
- catching ledges is still a pain in the ***
- boss fights
- 2 of them
- cannot use stealth during boss fights
- bugs (bosses dont spawn or dont move, AI doesnt move from its location)
- graphics arent the best
- skilltree makes you OP
- you can choose gear, but there are only 2 or 3 options
- re-use of levels
- clones are nice I guess, but I havent used them a single time, unlike Styx 1, where you needed to use them several times
- Enemies have indicators above their head if they are suspicious, have noticed something, etc. These pop even when you open a door and you can see them through wallls, giving you an indication if there are enemies present and where they are.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995761277', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1492548991}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness is probably a solid stealth game for some people. But for me, and my friend when playing co-op, the game left us in a unsatisfying feeling at the end. Just like a bad new brand of chips, eating the first half is great, eating the other half makes you not wanna eat more.

The level design and gameplay was great. I would say the level design, when talking about different ways to approach a situation, was quite varied. In almost all situations, you can avoid & sneak past every enemy on ledges, chandeliers, joists, in barrels, chests, vents & cupboards. Or you could kill them using any of these i just mentioned to your advantage.

The gameplay was also good. The amount of control of your character was a bit hard at the start. But once you know the controls, how to navigate the levels and kill enemies in various ways, you could be really fluid with your movements. I had most fun just controlling the character while going to vents, ledges and kill people. It did felt I was an assassin.



But why did I still give this a negative rating?
Well because of ONE. SIMPLE. REASON.
[b]The Co-op.[/b] 
[i]Oh god the Co-Op.[/i]

So here is the thing, me and my friend did have fun playing Co-Op. But 2 things in Co-Op made the game not a enjoyable experience. 
The set difficulty and no saving features. 

In single player, you can set how difficult the game is.
But in Co-Op, you had the hardest difficulty permanently on. 
[list]
    [*]You can die in one hit.
    [*]Enemies detect you more easily(and a lot of unfair ways).
    [*]And no parry(a way to avoid getting instantly killed was disabled).
[/list]

In single player, you can do quick saves and normal saves.
But in Co-Op, there was no saving feature. If you make one single mistake and die in the level, you start all the way back to the start. 

Combining these two made the game not enjoyable. Because the game had side missions & collectables, you have to spend 20 minutes again on that level doing the side missions & gathering collectables if you even die. Nobody likes to spend 20 minutes on something and then lose all of that progress only to start from the beginning of the level. So the only enjoyable option is to skip side missions & collectables. 
The game became a bit more enjoyable after that. Except the inconsistent enemy detection and start from the beginning because of set difficulty and no saving feature. Even with fluid controls and different level navigation, those two negative factors made the game not fun. It didn’t not help when the story became terrible at midpoint of the game.




Now I’m sure [b]IF[/b] we played the game in single player, it’ve been more fun than doing Co-Op.
I’m also sure [b]IF[/b] we started playing the game [b]AFTER[/b] they added in the saving features into Co-Op, the game would’ve been even more fun.
But the game left us not enjoying it. And with the god awful ending, there is no words to describe how much I despise this game for it’s 40€ price that included the set difficulty and no saving features into Co-Op. 
It's the only game I regret spending this much money on it.

I’m sure if you played it now in Co-Op or in single player, you would enjoy it. 
But at that time me & my friend played it, we didn’t enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989239414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2847, 'last_played': 1494507223}
review:
Juste énorme, une bonne surprise, un jeu bourré d'humour, comme quoi ce n'est pas que les AAA qui font de grand jeux (quand ça leur arrive maintenant).
Trés exigeant si on veux obtenir l'or de tous les défis, un bon jeu d'infiltration, je le recommande vivement.
Petite mise à jour aprés avoir terminer le jeu de long en large.
Styx a parfoit du mal a s'agripper sur les points d'accroches ce qui est assez problèmatique quand on sait que c'est un jeu où on utilise beaucoup le parkour.
Ensuite un point qui m'a un peu dèçus c'est le recyclage de map dans différent chapitre, il arrive parfois de retourner plusieurs fois au même endroit, est ce par manque de temps ou fainéantise ?
Mais dans l'ensemble c'est un jeu trés plaisant a jouer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009618175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1492916554}
review:
WARNING: I purchased this for co-op and only play it with my friend. This review is for those people who are planning on playing with someone.

Do not get this for co-op. I don't know if its me or not but the lag between co-op client and host is horrible. Tried lan and got a 3 second delay between what I thought was happening and what actually happened. Triend over the internet and got better results? What? Tried on my other gaming computer and had similar results. It really does horribly with latency. They need to fix it before the co-op is playable.

Single player: Not sure. Played for a few minutes but I tend to not game much on my own. There should be plenty of other reviews available that talk more indepth about actual mechanics and single player aspects. They might be fine but not what I play for.

EDIT: Really though, please consider this game for single player if you love stealth and enjoy goofy 4th wall breaking humor. It's not bad but it is broken for co-op.

review:

points positifs :

points négatifs :

enfin bon, je recommande quand meme ce jeu, surtout a ceux qui ont déjà joué au premier volet. il y aura surement une suite (ou un dlc ?).

author: {'steamid': '76561198037322997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4663, 'last_played': 1492921462}
review:
After almost 75 hours of play, it'd be hard for me to say I didn't get my money's worth, but while I had a blast (most of the time) playing Styx: Shards of Darkness, I think it was frequently in spite of the game rather than because of it.

Shards of Darkness is a stealth-focused, third-person action game with some great, sprawling maps that often had many paths to your objectives. The main character, a chatty, 4th-wall-breaking goblin named Styx, has a ton of unlockable skills and tools up his sleeve that offer a lot of replayability, despite most of those maps being reused two or three times. The game is at its best when it drops you into a level with all your tricks and leaves you to yourself to find your way. Unfortunately, it also suffers from some hyper-annoying bugs and poor design that will account for the vast majority of your deaths and reloads.

When the game works, it's fantastic. Sneaking your way across each map (and you'll want to focus on sneaking, combat in Styx is terrible and you'll want to avoid it entirely) is great, and successfully 'ghosting' your way through is immensely rewarding. But for a game that relies on a lot of jumping and climbing, it's poorly implemented and awfully inconsistent. Frequently, you'll find Styx just refuses to grab a ledge or rope or handhold that seemed more than in reach, resulting in you falling to your death or dropping stupidly into the middle of a bunch of guards. Want to jump away from a wall and grab something behind him? Roll the dice as to whether he'll jump straight up, jump away at an angle, or simply fall. And it's even worse in the two 'boss' fights, where you'll tackle some admittedly-neat-looking foes in some awful maps that rely almost entirely on Styx's awful parkour skills. Why do developers do this? 

The problems are amplified in the co-op mode. The host will generally have roughly the same experience as they would solo, but the guest, oh man. Between stuttering animations and some bizarre lag and desync issues despite having a fast and stable internet connection, if the guest enjoys the game it's not going to be because the game really wants them to enjoy it. Frequently, Shards of Darkness would decide that the guest simply wasn't where they thought they were. You'd be hanging from a ledge, and suddenly you'd find yourself mostly dead on the ground far below. Or you'd jump into a chest to hide and in the next few seconds find yourself actually crouched next to it, stuck in plain sight. Thankfully, the developers were persuaded to free up their co-op save system (originally, failing a co-op mission would essentially force you to redo the map, potentially losing an hour or more if you had been attempting to sneak your way through a big map), but even with the ability to save during the round, you'll frequently find yourself cursing the game's issues as you once again sit for long periods while it reloads your last save.

Another major con is the writing and story. Styx thinks he's pretty funny, and credit to the voice actor for doing a good job with what he was given, but the jokes wear thin pretty quickly and since you'll spend a lot of time dead, you'll spend a lot of time hearing the same annoying, trite crap over and over. Never mind the odd way the game treats Styx's biggest 'ally', who is the brunt of 'fat' and 'giant' despite being... not? It comes across as cruel rather than funny. Maybe the writing lost something in translation (and there are some pretty funny mistranslations in the game's text), but none of the dialogue is very good and a large number of the voice 'actors' sound like they were probably random people off the street. The dwarves are your typical 'British' voices, but the elves are woefully inconsistent, and most of the humans just annoying.

And the story! Wherever you might think the game is going is probably going to turn out wrong, as the tale wanders in odd directions that try to be epic and mostly just fall flat. Styx's motivation is greed for the most part, and his addiction to amber does, somewhat realisitically, lead him to make some stupid decisions, but really, he's just going along with the plot because reasons. The other people in this story aren't any better, and by the time you're midway through you'll probably have given up trying to keep track of why anybody is doing anything.

Do I recommend this game? Yes, I do. If you're a fan of stealth games that actually focus on stealth, Styx: Shards of Darkness is one of the few examples of the genre these days. Despite its many problems, I had a ton of fun with it, both solo and in co-op. Just remember to save a lot!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972455190', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2176, 'last_played': 1493126884}
review:
TL;DR : Jeu d'infiltration type voleur qui ne conviendra pas à tous. Même si le jeu gratifie plus la discrétion absolue et l'évitement, l'assassinat reste jouissif ; en revanche y aller comme un FPS révèlera les limites de l'IA. Le cœur du jeu est l'architecture des niveaux (level design) ; pour schématiser on évolue sur un échiquier en 3D avec des "pions" (ennemis) à esquiver ou abattre. Des niveaux magnifiques. Des problèmes d'accrochage aux bords.
35h de jeu en 'Difficile' pour finir sans alarme, sans victimes humanoïdes et avec tous les jetons

Dans le détail :
-graphismes flatteurs, on sent que le budget a permis d'aller loin dans les textures et le niveau de détail. Je n'ai pas aimé l'effet plat des plantes de décoration (lierre, algues fluo) par contre. J'ai noté aussi 2-3 rocher mal jointés, mais je pinaille.

-la Direction Artistique, meilleur que le 1, balance entre classique héroic fantasy et originalité dans sa vision des Elfes Noirs. La DA permet aussi de rendre l'architecture des niveaux (level design) cohérente ; ce n'était pas gagné de gommer les plateformes et autre éléments de jeux dans un décor. Ainsi le décor fourmille de détails rendant crédible les effets voulus tels que 'construction délabrée', 'construction entretenue mais faite l'une sur l'autre', 'construction ancienne toujours utilisée'

-la musique est correcte et surtout situationnelle. Bien entendu elle est surtout là pour faire un tapis sonore de douceur mais aussi de stress pour souligner le danger potentiel.

-techniquement le jeu est bien optimisé et tourne à 60fps mini à 100% du temps sans soucis. Aucun crash ou ralentissement malgré de très grand niveau avec une distance d'affichage permettant de voir tous les ennemis

-moteur physique correcte sans ragdoll buggé ni objet faisant des bonds miraculeux en les frôlant ! fort appréciable (Hein Deus Ex MD!)

-le gameplay va par contre trancher les avis :
-- Le level design est le cœur du jeu et tout le gameplay (la boucle de gameplay) consiste à explorer son environnement immédiat. Que ce soit pour se faufiler vers l'objectif ou collecter ou juste chercher des secrets, le jeu se base entièrement sur l'architecture vraiment en 3D de ces niveaux. Ici pas de couloirs mais de très grands niveaux à explorer de long en large, et surtout de haut en bas ! Cordes, sauts, point d'escalade, petit évent, les niveaux fourmillent de passages possibles à expérimenter pour le plus grand plaisir du joueur. On joue littéralement à frôler les gardes/ennemis. Contrairement à la plupart des jeux offrant action et infiltrations les accès secondaires ne sont pas des raccourcis facilitateurs : ils faut déjà les voir, puis ils débouchent souvent ailleurs ou sur une patrouille ou sur de l'escalade ... Un level design intelligent et c'est LE point fort de la franchise Styx
-- la prise en main du personnage est revanche un cran en dessous par rapport au 1 : très souvent on va rager car Styx n'aura pas accroché la prise d'escalade, rebondit sur le rebord ou n'arrive pas à sauter au bon moment. Néanmoins le chargement d'une sauvegarde rapide est vraiment très rapide donc avec le réflexe de faire F5 (quick save) le moment de 'rage' passe rapidement ; en plus le level design est assez riche pour nous faire comprendre que ta tentative était vraiment trop osée voire stupide
-- le tout est plutôt bien équilibré même si j'aurais aimé moins de phase de plateforme et des défis d'infiltration pure plus poussés, plus durs. Le jeu indique les objectif par des points visibles mais il faut parfois chercher dans une zone voire découvrir complètement via une discussion une possibilité (à la Hitman).

-la Difficulté est bien dosée pour éviter d'être frustrant. Par contre l'intérêt du jeu réside dans ses défis/médailles qui donnent moult XP : et là pour finir sans tuer personne ou récupérer tous les jetons, la durée de vie et la difficulté est tout autre. Je ne suis PAS collectionneur, je déteste ramasser des trucs bidons mais c'est le SEUL jeu qui m'a donné envie de le faire par pur défi, car les jetons sont placés à des endroits difficiles. Cela permet même de découvrir toute la grandeur et intelligence du level design.

-le scénario est bien meilleur que le 1, avec des rebondissements même si on peut s'y attendre. Surtout le joueur fait lui même avancer le scénario, ce qui nous implique dans le jeu.

-l'IA est classique mais va vraiment vous chercher sous la table, dans les cachettes quand ils sont en alerte. En plus si vous vous faites légèrement repéré (niveau 1 sur 3) plusieurs fois, les gardes vont modifier légèrement leur routine, et surtout vont avoir leur arme dégainée signe qu'ils seront plus réactif par la suite. Ainsi le niveau d'alarme et l'IA est moins binaire qu'avant mais cela est subtile et bien des joueurs n'auront pas remarqué ces changements impactant souvent des gardes lointains. Donc éteindre une lampe c'est mieux pour se cacher mais les gardes vont être de plus en plus vigilants. On aurait aimé un mode de difficulté au dessus, allant plus loin dans le niveau d'alarme et la réactivité

-le personnage Styx va très souvent briser le quatrième mur avec des référence à notre monde, et il se rend tout à fait détestable dans ces remarques insultantes envers les autres personnages. Mais cela colle parfaitement à son rôle de voleur assassin ayant peu de scrupules ; même si on croit noter une évolution positive, le jeu nous rappelle que ce monde est pourri. Par contre les références populaires à notre monde réel et Styx qui s'adresse directement au joueur, ont pour but de donner un effet badass branché : personnellement cela ne m'a fait ni chaud ni froid, et je préfère un personnage cohérent qui réagit voire sur réagit comme n'importe qui, qu'un mec à demi muet.

Si êtes un amateur des jeux d'infiltration comme moi, c'est un INDISPENSABLE. Et je vous recommande faire le premier jeu Styx : comparé au 1, ce Shard of Darkness a moins de phases d’infiltration pure mémorables et les a remplacées par des combat de boss, plus de gameplay de plateforme et des points de vues magnifiques. Je reste très satisfait. Signe que le jeu est bon, j'ai envie d'y retourner d'avoir toutes les médailles, mais surtout vivement une suite, des contenus additionnels voire un mode de difficulté supplémentaire.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987679413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 2460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1495247809}
review:
Solid stealth-focused game with a lot of tools to play around with. It pulls no punches, but it's fair.

Only very rarely have I been annoyed by not being able to grab a ledge or something not controlling quite right - but it does happen so I recommend you save often or use the clone ability to scout your intended paths as you can dismiss it for a full Amber refund (unless it dies).

Environments are an easy 'A'. Like I said there are some instances of not being able to grab onto this or that ledge, but overall they are diverse and offer many pathways that foster many different approaches to the tasks at hand.

Styx has many tools to play with, and more are unlocked from the start - which I like - but there are also well done skill trees that expand upon your abilities and have a palpable impact on gameplay.

Co-op is a BLAST if you have a friend you can work in close collaboration with (e.g. voice chat).

I just really don't have anything bad to say about this game right now. It's definitely worth the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988561081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1206, 'last_played': 1492297174}
review:
"Жить или не жить, вот вопрос...иди на хер, вот ответ" (c) 
Обзор будет коротким, так как в целом игра оправдала ожидания, несмотря на крайне высокую цену. 

+ Графика, стилистика, катки, атмосфера - визуальная часть игры стала лучше, красивее, приятнее глазу
+ Персонажи, харизма гг, диалоги ( п.с. руссификатор сделан на высоком уровне, лежит в сети и прекрасно скачивается в свободном доступе. )
+ Навыки, абилки, ультимейты.
+ Любую локу можно пройти сонмой способов, несмотря на некоторое однообразие локаций.
+ кооперативный режим, нет, не так КООПЕРАТИВНЫЙ РЕЖИМ. Проходил с товарищем на самой высокой сложности 
полностью в ко-оп. Режимом остались довольны, очень удобный, играется крайне комфортно. Не смотрите на бомжебургов, у них руки сломаны в локтях, кооператив сделан крайне добротно. 
- Сюжетку слили слегка, впечатляет меньше чем первая часть.
- Довольно короткая если играть на фастран и не заморачиваться  побочками
- цена...высоковата ей бы скидку 33% 
Итог : 8/10 Игра вполне подтвердила своё имя весьма добротного стелса. Всем бобра

review:
Le coop a été patché et permet maintenant de sauvegarder.
Même si le jeu n'est pas très long (7 missions), c'est un très bon jeu. Bien plus difficile que les derniers Splinter Cell par exemple, c'est un jeu d'inflitration, un vrai. author: {'steamid': '76561198006812953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1376, 'last_played': 1637077626}
review:
Styx is a really good stealth game, and to the contrary of most of the other stealth games of these days, in this one, fighting is not really an option. So if you're not much into it, you maybe should look for another game.
I had a blast doing it with a friend and doing again some levels in order to obtain golds medals.

Pros :
 + A good variety of skills, for all playstyles
 + Levels are well designed
 + Styx is a fun character
 + You can play in co-op with a friend
 + There is a skill to help you collecting collectibles (so you don't run around for two hours in the same level)

Cons :
 - The game can be hard
 - You'll do every level two times ( with diffrents objetives, ennemies, 
 - AI can be dumb sometime
 - Co-op can be really hard at some point
 - Some of the jump feels somewhat inaccurate

author: {'steamid': '76561198029465088', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1492249304}
review:
I completed Styx: Shards of Darkness and I have to admit that it was surprisingly addictive experience. 
It has some major issues, mainly in the character control department. KB/M controls are clunky and sluggish. The game requires a certain amount of precision which controller just does not provide. As a result, platforming is the most common cause of death in the game and it can be infuriating at times. Luckily game has a save-whenever with quicksaves kind of save system which makes it bearable and not that big of a deal.
The game has some fairly funny references to other games and fictional universes - Assassin's Creed, Dishonored, Lord of the Rings. It also has a few 4th wall breaking moments which brought smile to my face and made me feel warm and fuzzy.
I think it's a flawed but very promising franchise and if You like stealth, it's well worth giving it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141521149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1539562563}
review:
A phenomenal, true stealth game that imrpoves on its predecessor in every manner, fixing every bug and making the gameplay in general far more satisfying -- as satisfying as it could possibly be.  If you're the kind of person who was hoping Dishonored 2 would be the stealth game that was promised but found yourself disappointed, this is the game for you.  Addtionally, if you loved the stealth mechanics in Dishonored, this is also the game for you.  

Not only can you interact with nearly everything in the sprawling, open, multi-route environments, you can scale everything too -- and no, I don't mean the Uncharted series type of scaling, where you press a button to "jump" from place to place across a linear path; rather, I mean that everything can be climbed, jumped onto, interacted with, and used to your  advantage, allowing for nigh-infinite different approaches to each scenario, task, and level.

It's not just the interactivity and scalability of the environments that makes the game so refreshing, intriguing, and full of player choice regarding approach, but the gameplay and mechanics themselves.  Styx can't fight well, so you truly do need to use stealth, and there are dozens of ways to do it.  Everything from diversions to clones to poisoning guard rations to dropping chandeliers on unsuspecting enemies will help you fulfill your destiny as the ultimate thief.  This is **the true successor to the Thief series we've been waiting for.** (I should note, though, that it's in third person, though there is apparently a first person mode I've heard about but not tried)  You can also craft, use potions and diversionary tools, crafted ranged weapons, and many other items.  The crafting system is extremely simple and ease-of-use is the name of the game (unlike all the crafting in other games out these days).  You don't need to figure out recipes and what ingredients you need to make new stuff, you just need to go to your crafting and it will tell you if you have what you need to make a given item.  Moreover, the materials for crafting are scattered throughout levels (as are many an interesting side quest), encouraging exploration and looking in nooks and crannies.

I'd also like to give enormous props to the developers for creating a main character (and side characters) that simply haven't been seen before in games, thus furthering the unique nature of the game. Styx, your avatar and protagonist, is a vulgar, acid-tongued (both figuratively and literally) goblin who regularly breaks the fourth wall, mocks the protagonists of similar games in off-handed comments, and makes pop culture references (don't worry, they're not lame at all, but funny, relevant, highly amusing, and far from overused).  He is a character I can't remember ever seeing in a game, and certainly not in a game like this.  While the gameplay and design are serious down to the last detail, Styx himself is a refreshing reminder that not every game's protagonist has to be a deadly-serious person bent on righting wrongs or saving the world.  Styx is out for himself and having fun doing it, allowing us to come along for the ride and join in on his joy.  It's a serious and grim world fully lightened by your very own character and his charisma and love of his job.

Ultimately, this is the game you must get if you feel a need to scratch that *true* stealth itch.  You've been waiting for it.  You want it. I wanted it, and I decided to reward the developers for making this game by paying full price, rather than waiting for a sale.  I can only hope they'll continue with this series, make new ones, and that others will support both the old-school mechanics and innovation they've brought to the until-now stale stealth genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129825643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1491504427}
review:
Styx Shards of Darkness est un jeu "d'infiltration pure", qui se dinstingue de titres tels qu'assassin's creed ou dishonored, et se rapproche plus des premiers MGs ainsi que Thief premier du nom. Mais alors, que nous réserve t'il ?

Au menu:
Styx SoD se joue de manière optimale en poussant la furtivité au maximum et en tuant le moins de monde possible. Si vous voulez un example sur comment ne pas jouer ou simplement pour rire, le let's play de Benzaie est fait pour vous! Le jeu possède un gameplay engageant ainsi qu'un level design très impressionnant qui force les joueurs à réfléchir à leur approche, ou bien à rester sur le qui-vive en permanence s'il veulent obtenir les nombreux achievements in-game.
Vous pourrez même jouer la fashion victim en collectant des pièces d'équipement à travers l'histoire & des quêtes annexes.

Les +:
-Comme le styx original, le scénario est très intéressant, même si la fin est moins satifaisante que celle de Styx MoS ou d' of Orcs and Men, les deux autres titres prenant place dans le même univers.
-Les graphismes sont plus que corrects
-La bande-son d'ambiance est de qualité
-Le Gameplay saura vous prendre aux tripes et vous pousser à vous améliorer pour tenter un "perfect" dans un critère (réussir une mission en un temps imparti par example)

Les -:
-prenez l'habitude de passer tous les dialogues de Styx lors de ses morts, ces derniers risque de vous taper sur le système assez rapidement
-les contrôles de saut et du fait de s'accrocher sont parfois... étranges on va dire. Privilégiez un bon paquet de sauvegardes pour votre premier playthrough si vous n'êtes pas un vétéran du genre, car mourir de manière ridicule sur une point que vous pensiez atteindre peut arriver régulièrement si vous tentez de passer à certains endroits.
-Enfin, l'IA est parfois "trop" bête, et il est possible de créer certaines circontances assez drôles ou malgré une alerte générale déclanchée et une vingtaine de gardes alertés, en tromper un seul en se rendant invisible dans un tonneau empêchera les 19 autres de fouiller ce dernier, ce qui les poussera à éviter votre planque !

author: {'steamid': '76561197979538976', 'num_games_owned': 7726, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1490445285}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness is the only recent game (years) that deserves to be called a stealth game. There is no combat, if you get caught run or die.

If you want to be able to fight, you do not understand the stealth genre at all.

As a true spiritual successor to Thief, this new chapter improves pretty much EVERY aspect of the previous game: fluid animations, new powers, a better skill tree, new stealth mechanichs (carpets reduce the noise), new killing possibilities, HUGE open levels, more diverse levels, new accessories and new enemies (dwarves!). Even the climbing mechanics are improved a lot, and the entire game is way easier to read.

Unfortunately the story can't be personal like in the first one, but is slowly connecting to Of Orcs and Men.

TL;DR

It's a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015663593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1638, 'last_played': 1492529378}
review:
In realtà il gioco sarebbe anche bello. E' più un prodotto tipico da console che da pc ma piacevole da giocare. Il giocatore smaliziato però, abituato ai prodotti pc con trame intense e variegate, non ci metterà nulla a capirne la dinamica e a diventarne padrone. Insomma alla fine è un gioco piacevole ma molto arcade.
Il difetto più grande però ò la mancanza di idee. Personaggi facili e scontati, tutti uguali. Soprattutto ambierntazioni ripetitive, dopo il quarto capitolo si torna su quelli già giocati e qui diventa monotono e frustrate. Non lo consiglierei se il paragone è con titoli tipo Dishonored o Thief.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041786271', 'num_games_owned': 1168, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 1557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1557, 'last_played': 1491228475}
review: Godny następca Master of Shadow. Zostało poprawione wiele wad poprzednika i dodano wiele nowych mechanik, które się sprawdzają. Gra jest bardzo dobrze zoptymalizowana, chodzi płynnie bez żadnych większych problemów. Misji nie jest za dużo ale dzielą się na części i są bardzo dobrze zaprojektowane, patrząc z perspektywy goblina są ogromne ;P Możliwości dojścia do celu jest pełno, na każdym kroku mamy jakieś liny, tajne przejścia czy półki. Bardzo fajną rzeczą dodaną w tej części jest tworzenia różnych rzeczy z ekwipunku z materiałów rozsianych po świecie - nie trzeba teraz się denerwować, że czegoś nam brakuje lub biegać z kryjówki do kryjówki aby pozyskiwać potrzebne dla nas rzeczy. Fabuły już nie mogę tak zachwalać jak mechaniki i wizualizacji, ponieważ jest gorsza od tych, które dzieją się z udziałem Styxa w innych tytułach. Jest mniej zwrotna i nie jest taka nieprzewidywalna, tutaj bardziej skupiają się nad tym w co się wkopaliśmy niż na pragnieniach i osobistych sprawach Styxa. Co nie znaczy, że jest na minus, w dialogach nadal jest czarny humor a postacie które spotkamy podczas podróży są nadal ciekawe. No i największa różnica jaka tu jest to kooperacja, którą dodali od tej części. Nie wiem czy akurat ja miałem pecha ale to dla mnie była istna katorga. Trochę zdarzyło się nam bugów i śmiesznych sytuacji, przez które kilka razy powtarzaliśmy dany poziom. Największym minusem był zapisy podczas kooperacji, występowały tylko na początku co znaczyło, że każdy mały błąd może nas kosztować grania od nowa, przez co gra naprawdę bez tych zapisów jest bardzo trudna w coopie i dla ludzi o stalowych nerwach, bo my już psychicznie nie wytrzymywaliśmy, przez co czas gry jest trochę wydłużony. Fajny pomysł na coopa, bo napewno więcej przez to ludzi skusiło się na Shardsa no i mieli większy budżet to pokazali na co ich stać. Pewnie w przyszłości kilka patchów i naprawiają największe minusy swojej gry, dlatego też nie oceniam tego negatywnie. Mogliby też trochę popracować nad AI jeszcze, bo w 1 części często zdarzało się że strażnicy blokowali się na sobie lub przedmiotach a tutaj też się to zdarzyło kilka razy co czasami może nawet doprowadzić to tego, że nie przejdziesz poziomu po swojej misji albo wpadniesz. Najlepsze było jak strażnicy robili 360 jak już byłeś na ich plecach lub skaczesz i pokazuje ci, że łapiesz się krawędzi a po chwili lecisz w dół. To w większości przypadki śmieszne, ale każdy ma swoją granicę aby żyłka nie poszła ;D

author: {'steamid': '76561198003415677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 2143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1306, 'last_played': 1699907663}
review:
This is the single greatest stealth game I've played in years.

Forget your Dishonored "power fantasy" stealth game where you can go "oh no, I got caught, time to slaughter everything with ease lol", this is hardcore stealth where you are a fragile little goblin who has to be a clever little sneak to stay alive.

To sum up what makes this game work, it's "options".  The level design and unlockable skills offer a wide breadth of options to handle just about every situation it can throw at you.  The levels offer a vast multitude of paths and shortcuts, and the various skills all open even more possibilities, especially Alchemy.

Ah yes, Alchemy.  There's all kind of random insect eggs, raw amber, unstable spores and other detritus littering the levels, which you can put to use at a crafting table (or in the Select Button menu if you unlocked a particular piece of equipment).  And so many of these recipes are game changers.  Acid traps that kill anything that steps on them, Poisonous darts that non-fatally disable enemies for just long enough for you to make a mad sprint past them, and more await.

The highlight is probably either the Acid traps, for the many clever ambushes you can set up with them, or the Cocoon, which lets you throw a Clone into a distant position.  When combined with the skill to teleport to your clone's location, you can do some downright loony sequence breaking or shortcuts.

Finally, there's a lot of content on offer.  About 9 full missions worth, each with multiple side-objectives and a set of medals you can earn for speedrunning them, or killing no enemies, or never getting spotted, or finding every single hidden "token" in the level.  And each one rewards you with bonus Skill Points to unlock even more abilities.  There's a lot to come back to.

It's not an easy game, and you will be glad the developers mapped "Quicksave" to "Dpad Right", but holy hell does it deliver on the promise of feeling like a cunning little goblin cleverly taking down people multiple times his size and making them look like fools.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025454663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1491759502}
review:
Deuxième jeu de la série de Styx dans lequel on contrôle un gobelin voleur et furtif qui aime s’agripper partout. Le jeu est correct pour son prix mais je me serais attendu à plus d’amélioration par rapport au premier. Le jeu est très similaire à son prédécesseur et pourrait même passer comme une expansion. L’ajout principal est le volet multiplayer mais on a peut-être perdu trop de temps la dessus par rapport au reste du jeu. J’ai l’impression que la majorité des gens vont ignorer le volet multiplayer. 

Positif :
- Styx est un personnage drôle, vulgaire et qui n’est pas censuré. Ça fait changement des héros habituels.
- Cutscenes bien rendues
- Bon feeling de furtivité dans le style des jeux « Thief »
- Durée du jeu correcte pour le prix
- La difficulté augmente avec l’avancement même si le jeu reste assez facile

Négatif :
- La moitié des skills dans l’arbre de talent n’ont pas beaucoup de valeur et on pourrait facilement s’en passer.
- Les boss ont le même pattern, se rendre à un endroit précis pour activer quelque chose sans se faire toucher ou voir. Combattre un boss n’est pas vraiment un combat.
- L’équipement est toujours plein alors on ne peut rien ramasser les ¾ du temps et on n’utilise pas souvent ce qu’on a.
- Une branche de l’arbre des skills focus sur le volet assassin mais on perd des bonus quand on tue des gardes ce qui entre en contradiction.
- Les déplacements des gardes ne sont pas très fluides, un peu comme des robots qui répètent une routine. Il manque un peu de finition dans les mouvements du jeu en général (difficulté à attraper un point d’escalade, difficulté à utiliser les cordes qui pendent …)

Commencez par le premier et vous pourrez acheter celui-ci si vous avez aimé.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025817641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1493575944}
review:
Не жалею, что купил. Приятно потратил 12 часов на прохождение, не особо заморачиваясь с ачивками, но игра не стоит своих денег.

Почему же?

По сравнению с первой частью, игра не предлагает чего-то нового:
- Механика практически та же;
- Ачивки те же;
- Принцип тот же.

Игра должна понравится тем, кому доставила 1-я часть, но рекомендую дождаться скидки - $30/30€/2000₽ это как-то жирно для нее.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023437801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2311, 'last_played': 1523797385}
review:
A nice stealth game with a bit of challenge, a cool story continuing the first episode and a well designed creepy environment. You're once more shorter than your ennemies and thus need to take them by surprise (in goblin difficulty you don't have any choice as you won't be able to parry) and quietly to avoid detection or make good use of clones and other scam to make up for the poor combat skills of Styx
The only downside is the relative shortness of the game. I would definitly recommend the game if you liked the first or if you just like infiltration games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050741067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1491350098}
review:
haaa ce que j étais content quand j ai vu que styx avait une suite ! après avoir jouer au 1, je suis même allé acheter et jouer à "of orc and men" ( jeu de la même licence mais un peu vieux). Et niveau graphisme, lvldisign et jouabilité y a rien à dire c est top. 
Mais il y a 1 énorme point négatif, le scénario! Dans master of shadow le scénar est génial y a 2 méga plotwist ! à la fin j était comme un fou ! Là pour shard of darkness, j ai l impression que ca suis la même logique que les films d actions hollywoodiens. Tu sens que les gars sont capable de faire des trucs super mais que le scénario n est qu un prétexe, alors qu il y a matière a faire beaucoup mieux. J en dis pas plus pour ne pas spoiler mais bon clairement pas bon a mon goût. 

De plus: Styx n est pas deadpool, et de manière générale trop de méta ( avoir consience d etre dans un jeu etc) et surtout mal géré ça nique l'immertion et le plaisir de jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011872285', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1509396602}
review:
I like this game. :) When I played Styx I, it was like so AWESOME. Stealth game with fantazy creatures. You can climb almost everywhere... The story of first Styx is a little weird, but in Styx Shards of Darkness its better. And you have more options how you can get somewhere or finish the mission. Its like a little open world for that mission. If you like sleath game with elves and dwarfs... and GOBLIN :D I can recommend this game for you. I had fun playing it.

Only thing that is a little sad to me is that I finished the story and I dont have maxed out my skills. You have to play again some missions for doing tasks which give you skill points. I didnt try multiplayer... so I cant tell anything about that. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074064136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1925, 'last_played': 1491434378}
review:
Première expérience Styx pour moi et je dois dire que je suis satisfait du jeu de manière globale.
Gameplay et maniabilité correct, même si cela pourrait être amélioré par exemple sur les cordes ou lors de sauts vers le cotés.
Graphisme convenable, on est sur de l'unreal engine 4 donc c'est pas du niveau d'un witcher bien sûr mais la carte graphique appréciera.
Longueur du jeu tout à fait correct si on prend le temps de faire les niveaux à fond.
Seul point véritablement négatif à mon goût, la répétition des décors à certain moment après la première partie du jeu.
Sinon pour ceux qui aime les jeux d'infiltration sur le thème fantasy foncez.
Je suggère la difficultée gobelin afin de mettre davantage l'accent sur l'infiltration.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991008273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1514114551}
review:
Took me and my brother 17 hours to finish the story in coop even once on the 2nd difficulty level.

The game was quite difficult but never unfair, so the 17 hours were really fun and enjoyable. It is a great combination of strategy and occasionally reckless gameplay that makes this game unique - even moreso than its predecessor (that i only spectated, haven't finished it myself yet).

I recommend the game, no matter if on sale or not. It is great for coop and, most likely, for singleplayer as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096002197', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1240, 'last_played': 1491333392}
review:
Советую покупать игру на хорошей скидке. 
Проходил на максималке в коопе, в коопе нельзя сохранятся во время миссии и это на любой сложности, если вы с другом померли, то придется начинать с самого начала. Есть небольшие проблемы с сетевым кодом, иногда бывает падаешь сквозь текстуру или не зацепляешься за уступ, а через 10 секунд всетаки оказываешься на нем. Сюжет гораздо слабее 1 части, основная интрига становится понятной еще в середине игры. Как стелс игра неплохая, многоуровневые карты с большим количеством обходных путей. Система крафта есть, но по итогу шита белыми нитками и почти никогда не помогает в игровом процессе. Дерево прокачки тоже не особо нужно в игровом процессе, есть, но зачем не понятно. Карт не много и они повторяются, меняются только места заданий. Все минусы на себе вытягивает только харизматичный антигерой Стикс, за его поведением и шутками приятно смотреть. Интересно смотреть катсцены, то как поведет себя Стикс в той или иной ситуации.  Не могу сказать, что игра на 100% оправдала свою цену, но безразличной она меня точно не оставила, возможно магия коопа помогла мне в этом.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988967764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1492351205}
review:
Shards of darkness is a great game with an unexpected clifhanger at the end, do it mean they are working on a dlc or something i don't know, i didn't see the end coming basically.

The level design is really cool, i really enjoy checking from a high point, trying to find the best road possible.
most of the skills are not super usefull, i finish the game with about 1200 skill spoint not spent, i could have filled all the tree skills, and after finish the final boss, the loading screen tell, hey why don't you try to obtain all the skills... 
"yes game, yes,sigh, i allready have enough point and still 4 pure quartz to spend. thank you game"

Alas i found way to get stuck sometime inbetween two roofs that were a bit too close to each other, basically if you crouch walk under and try to jump you get stuck, so becarefull.
Also sometimes i could see the game loading three different texture quality, my game have all the setting at maximum.
it happend also during some ingame cinematics.
and i saw a npc stuck in a bridge literally her leg were under the bridge stuck forever in a walk cycle. was fun i even take a screenshot.
Another funny bug is some npc that are really far, there head don't display.
and last but not least, if you skipp the ending cinematic, you don't have music during the credits, funny

My bigest remark would be on the animation both in game and cinematics. i can be very harsh animation wise, because i m an animator my self... sorry

ingame fist:
NPC don't have any blend between there animations, the literaly pop from stand cycle to walk cycle, or any action. like when a npc is doing stuff on a desk, he start to lean back to approximately a standing pose and pop to stand cycle, and pop to walk cycle.
They don't touch the floor, all the npc are basicaly from 2 to 5 cm (1 to 2 inches) off the floor, you can tell cause there shadows are not " connected" to there foot.
the guys in armor the toes are going to high in the up before the contact, thank you Richard Williams but here you guys are doing a natrual walk, so stop putting the toes so high, + most of the time they are wearing freaking armor :)
Another flow in the ingame animation is some time the npc Pop up and slowly slide back down to the floor especially when they move from the table stand cycle to normal stand cycle.

Lip sync is off everywhere, and wrong, for example the "p" shape is none existant, the lips are sometime moving slowly into a rest shape when it should be quicker. and so on and so forth, no facial expression what so ever, eye brows are not moving, eyes are floaty, they barely blinks. the nose is just fixe.
there is definitely a lot to patch facial wise.

now for the ingame cinematics, my remaks on the facials are the same as the ingame one.
Camera work could be refined, some edits are all over the place and it is difficult to follow the actions, the worst is probably the fight between the two dark elves, it is impossible to understand how they fight or where they are in space.
and the character animations need a lot of refinement as well.

the character animator must always use video reference no matter what, i can feel a lack of use of video reference for that game animation. 
Like,"oh yeah it's a video game no problem i can animate with out reference come on" 
"No you can not, trust me"

and to finish my sandwish of bull crap.

I might say i like Styx's voice over, it is pretty cool, Jarak as well, the story is nice, i had a great time following it.

Overall the architecture is fun to explore, kind of massive world of warcraft idea for the outside of the buildings, but darker, very nice, it is fun to roam arround with Styx.

Music is nice too, it does the job and keep you in the mood.
Gameplay works for me, the prologue is very good to figure the different stuff you can do, maybe the rope swing was a bit tricky to figure it out, but them you realise u just have to keep the same direction and Styx swing on his own, you don't have to do a back and forth motion... but ofcourse.

I definitely recommand this game and i hope they are gonna do a DLC so we can know what happend to him and i will cross my fingers so they can update the overall animation quality.

After all it is only the 1.2 verssion of the game, it's like a working beta :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198029702988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2280, 'last_played': 1610413371}
review:
Игра вышла намного качественнее первой части: это касается и графики, и анимации, и звука. Геймплейно осталось все то же самое, ни к чему новому привыкать не придется.

Огромные многоуровневые локации, что не может не радовать.

Сам Стикс — ехидная обаяшка, его невозможно не полюбить. Еще больше черного юмора!

Теперь о минусах. Сюжет не блещет прям большой оригинальностью, но он хорош, весьма хорош.

Но... что за, блин, обрезанная концовка? Будто разработчики делали-делали игру, а потом резко свернули лавочку и закончили, просто-напросто грубо оборвав концовку. Явно намек на третью часть Стикса, чему я очень рада, конечно, но так делать тоже не стоит, после игры осталось неприятное чувство, будто тебя обманули.

Тем не менее, сама игра оставила прехорошее впечатление, приятно было вечерами встречаться с любимым гоблином и воротить вместе с ним новые дела, от которых все и всё вокруг снова и снова страдают =D

Локации довольно разнообразны, как и враги. Множество вариантов прохождения каждого уровня. Можно проходить чисто по стелсу, а можно переубивать всех, просто потому что ты можешь и хочешь... и вообще всех ненавидишь.
За игру успеваешь и возненавидеть гномов с их нюхом, и полюбоваться эльфской архитектурой, и попримерять на Стикса разные костюмчики.

Тем, кому зашла первая часть, рекомендую однозначно, Стикс стал еще круче =)

П. С. Очень огорчило отсутствие русской локализации. Но, как всегда, на помощь пришла команда переводчиков ZoG, ищите перевод на их сайте.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025315635', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1490115391}
review:
Что если вы настолько низки и омерзительны, что не способны играть честно? Что, если ваш цвет кожи не даёт показаться на свету, а противники еле сдерживают омерзение? Но нет – вы не плод дурных фантазий Эрика Картмана, вы всего лишь главный герой Styx: Shards of Darkness. 

Сильные стороны: чёрный юмор, харизматичный главный герой, собственная система развития.

Слабые стороны: графика, однообразие уровней, отсутствие локализации и региональной скидки.

Styx: Shards of Darkness подойдёт любителям стелса с хорошим знанием английского языка и любовью к чёрному юмору. Если вы много лет назад сидели за первыми частями серии Hitman – обязательно уделите внимания и этому проекту. Изучение уровней, работа ИИ, использование различных вариантов прохождения и перфекционизм в выполнении всех дополнительных испытаний напомнят вам всё то, за что вы любите игры подобного жанра. 

Оценка редакции: 7.0/10.0

Подробный релиз обзор читайте по ссылке:

author: {'steamid': '76561198136606062', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1497639273}
review:
Com 10 horas de jogo já consigo falar com propriedade a respeito de alguns pontos fundamentais.

O jogo além de corrigir os problemas do anterior ainda evoluiu bastante em muitos aspectos:

-O gráfico agora está bem bonito, muito agradável de ver
-Cenários permanecem labirintos bastante detalhados, porém agora muito mais criativos e diversificados
-Você agora cai menos naqueles parkours desafiadores
- No menu de pausa você consegue acompanhar seu progresso nos objetivos secundários, como não matar ninguém etc
- Agora há CGs e não mais aquelas cutscenes com desenhos
- Você pode craftar itens e modificar suas skills até mesmo durante alguns momentos nas fases
-Steath que já era ótimo, ficou melhor ainda, mais recompensadot e inteligente
- Referências e mais referências, inclusive ao aclamado Dishonored


Único porém que ainda permanece são os inimigos muito burros mesmo na dificuldade Goblin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085822831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1490239014}
review:
Good game, but generally I enjoyed the first one better. Don't get me wrong, this has beautiful settings and great level designs, just like the first one, but I prefer Akenash. Anyways, this game makes a ton of improvements and adds a lot of new equipment and tools. So let me say right now, get the game. Then if you feel like it, you can read my rant about the story:

The story is dirt. As a whole it feels like the devs made this awesome stealth game and were then like "okay now we need some reason for having a mean goblin running around killing people I guess. Lets throw some half hearted writing on it." The first half was a little interesting. I can say that I enjoyed that part of it, and I enjoyed the ominous culty vibes the dark elfs have going on. Then, about half way through, it kind of feels like the story just completely drops off, and then everything after that doesn't really make sense or seem important. It feels like it's just a series of barely connected events that require stealthing it up. And don't get me wrong, Master of Shadow's story was pretty rough and confusing, but at least it had some direction. Then there was the whole thing with Helledryn? Idk if anyone else noticed, but she literally just dropped off the face of the earth, came back for about 30 seconds, and then fell off a different face of the earth. Like, she was a major character?? You're just going to throw her out like week-old tuna salad??? And then we have the ending. I feel like you should be expecting the ending, at the very least, of any good story. Styx Shards of Darkness gave you a really exciting moment towards the end, and then BAM. Cutscene and credits. Not even a great cutscene. Very anticlimactic and disappointing as a whole. It was a fun mission though. Anyways I guess that's all I have to say about the story lol. It really bugged me, but it didn't necessarily stop me from having fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040942444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1539982128}
review:
J'adore ce jeu!
Je ne suis pas un grand grand fan d'infiltration de base, mes seules vraies expériences se limitent à mark of the ninja, Styx 1, et maintenant le 2.

Je trouve ce jeu mieux que le premier en de nombreux points:
-plus jolie (bien que ce soit pas le critère déterminant pour moi)
-map plus agréables à parcourir 
-plus maniable

Pour le comparer avec le premier, je n'ai pour le moment que fait 50% du jeu (avec les objectifs remplis) et je trouve le jeu trop facile. Je joue en gobelin, et j'avance très facilement, alors que le premier, j'en chiais en facile. Après c'est ptetre juste moi qui est bon :D (mais je l'étais pas sur le premier...donc bon).
J'ai juste peur que sa durée de vie soit un petit peu trop faible, (or coop, mais perso ça m'interesse pas, donc je le considère comme un jeu solo).

En terme de gameplay, c'est sensiblement pareil que le premier, avec certain ajouts assez appréciables, et de nouvelles compétences cools (bien qu'encore une fois, la difficulté du jeu ne m'oblige pas à les utiliser, la téléportation m'est pas souvent utile malheureusement).
J'ai lu aussi que certain trouvaient les maps plus grandes que dans le premier, c'est pas mon ressenti, après ptetre que je me trompe, mais elles me sembles plus petites (là je viens de finir le chapitre 5, j'ai pas l'impression d'avoir manqué grand chose, je suis allé vers tout les objectifs, et c'était pas si long que ça à parcourir)

Toutefois, malgré la difficulté un peu basse, et la durée de vie qui me fait un peu peur, j'ai plus de plaisir à jouer sur ce jeu, que sur le premier. Plus de différences architecturales entre les lvl, plus de lumière la plus part du temps aussi, et je trouve styx plus maniable (c'est ptetre aussi pour ça que le jeu est plus simple)

Bref, il vaut carrément le coup, surtout si vous avez aimé le premier!

review:
EDIT: I gave the game another chance and, fortunately, had a much more pleasant experience this time around. An update came out that seemed to fix all audio issues for me and when I started a new game, the opening cinematic looked much better. I was able to play through the first 3-4 levels with no major issues other than some platforming misses (these were present in the first game as well). I have yet to try Coop, but I do appreciate the dev's work to patch the game after release and make it playable. The story still doesn't make any sense, but the game-play is as I remembered it from the first game, with some minor improvements. I'm leaving my earlier review because I feel that a game's history reflects on it's developers and can help others make up their minds about future releases. developers: please finish and test games before shipping!


I am just so disappointed right now... I absolutely loved Styx 1 and felt that the mix of challenging stealth and strategic game-play was fantastic enough to distract from the flat story. In fact, I enjoyed the first game so much, that I immediately preordered this sequel when it was added to the steam store, which I only do on very rare occasions for games I can't wait to play. Imagine my confusion when I start this game, set the graphics quality to "epic" and am greeted by the ugliest opening cut-scene I have ever seen! Characters spoke in a monotone, uninspired dialog that didn't quite match up to their lips, textures looked like they were rendered with a TI83, and the story immediately made no sense. I was willing to forgive the atrocity that was the opening "cinematic", but had to put the game down after attempting to navigate the first tutorial level. Sound kept cutting out and Styx stopped talking halfway through his lines while the music picked up in volume for no reason, the camera kept flying through walls and was unable to decide if it wanted me to see Styx, or the rope he was looking at, and let's never talk about that rope animation again... I was really looking forward to this game, but it's just too buggy to play as is and is a complete waste of money in my opinion. I really, really wanted to like this game and support the developers, but they've left me with no choice: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!

author: {'steamid': '76561198140274007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3696, 'last_played': 1696622823}
review:
[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Story and writing a pretty solid, though some it may get on your nerves. AI is a OK at best, sub-par at worst. Graphics and gameplay are a huge step up from the last game, especially the skill trees. Environments are better than ever, and there's less replaying the same areas like what was seen in the last game.
Styx: Shards of Darkness is totally worth the price and is a must have for anyone who loves a good stealth game.

[h1]Full Review:[/h1]
Note, Im only reviewing the single player experience. Nothing in this review was influenced by playing through the co-op mode as I haven't tried it. Though I do hear that co-op isn't much fun, so... yeah. May or may not try that mode.
[b]Positives:[/b]
Pure Stealth: There's none of this fight it out nonsense like in games like AC or MGS:V. If your caught, you die. Really helps Styx stand out from the crowd since he's not a fighter, and it really brings a proper challenge to the game.

Graphics: This game has made a huge leap forward in visuals compared to the last one. It looks incredible.

Skill Tree: They've added alot to the skill tree compared to the last game. Its expanded further than before, especially when set next to the previous game, and offers lots of fun new ways to customise your playstyle, including some fun secret skills at the top of the trees.

Music: Whilst the last games music and sound weren’t bad by any means, this one does sound alot better by comparison. The score, especially the boss themes, sounds nothing short of incredible.

Voice Acting: VA is pretty good. Styx easily has the best voice, though the side-characters of Helledryn and Djarak also have generally good VA’s behind them.

Load times: Much faster than the old game. Let’s you jump right back in if you die.

Locations: Lots more locations than the last game and a lot more variety to them. Makes revisiting some areas in later levels less much less painful compared to the last game.

Replay Value: Insignia's and achievements can make replays of levels very worth it and fun.

[b]Mixed Points: [/b]
These parts are mostly discussing areas I can’t describe if their too the games credit or not.

Story: It seems alot better this time. Its gone well beyond what the last game had which was mostly centered on Styx and his fight for freedom and does a good job of dealing with the apparent aftermath of Akenash’s collapse.

The ending bugs the hell out of me though. There's practically nothing there. No possible tease for the next game, no ending talk from Styx maybe explaining the aftermath, nothing. Just an ambiguous cliff-hanger. If you want to know what happens in the short time after fleeing Korranger, so far it doesn't look like you get to know.

Writing: Its a bit meh in some areas. Some of the jokes and references are good but some are too on the nose for my liking. Like the reference to the last game is a bit too in your face.

[b]Negatives:[/b]
Climbing: It seems like that with climbing getting a good jump and grabbing onto a ledge is much harder than the previous game. Plus finding good handholds can take getting used too.

Enemy AI: Whilst generally an improvement from the last game, it’s still a tad sub-par. Pathfinding is pretty lousy, and it seems very hard to really bait enemies into an acid trap unless in a narrow pathway. Even then it can be tough. Kind of makes the acid trap seem like a negligible part of Styx's arsenal.

[h1]Closing Remarks:[/h1]
The Styx series has alot of potential in my book. The last game was probably just able to maybe make par thanks to it being a pure stealth game, fun gameplay and decent inclusion of RPG mechanics to make up for its repetition, recycled levels, somewhat meh story and mediocre at best visuals. It generally solidified alot of concepts seen expanded on in this game.

This game is a step up from the last one in so many ways. The story more expanded, the visuals really elevated, and the gameplay expanded in so many great new ways, with more mechanics and alot of the ones from the previous game really refined. It’s absolutely worth a go, whether your new to stealth or not. Hours of fun, especially if you’re a completionist. It may take you 50+ hours like its done for me to get every Insignia and/or achievement.

I cannot recommend this game more highly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031786447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1555175724}
review:
I actually enjoyed the first Styx, enough that it was sad that it was over and actually played it through again just before this newest release came out. Much has changed in the second release, much of it becomes obvious very quickly when playing it. I want to be fair and I want to be clear.

1. The first games graphics were clean, bright and the perspectives were enormous enough in the immediate location around you to allow you to get a sense of perspective of where you were, where your enemies were and are. The second game, with the graphics turned all the way up are nothing close to the original. Gone are the brght colors, the clearness of detail and movement. Folks, the graphics on Styx 2 are poor, the perspectives are poor, poor enough to deeply effect the game right from chapter 1. In fact, the small taks set before an experienced player in the very first chapter are made much more difficult by not really knowing depth....right infront of you. So disappointing, so materially damaging to the playing of this game. Even if the castles appear later on the first chapters are simply such a drag as to make a player turn away. 

2. We have abandon the simple controls of game 1 and replaced it with layer of buttons to do the same thing...or less. Expecting to pick up the materials you need for the two top Life and Amber? Forget it, none to be found, if you play for stealth and move efficiently PAST the point of concern....well you have just left behind ALL the ingrediants to MAKE things that should be laying around. In short, a more complex game is nothing more than an interruption to STEALTH. Worse you can only make what you need at specific points in the game....STEALTH.....S-T-E-A-L-T-H

3. QUIET kills, a staple of the first game are a mixed chance of muffle screams and grunts that DO alert those around that should not be alerted. More on this....I used to hink that folks complaining about pary in the 1st game were unskilled. I could parry and decisively win every encounter that it was allowable. NOT IN 2....DEAD ON ARRIVAL. Click...click!....Click!!!...DEAD.

4. Sand lights out are LOUD enough that it seems that everyone everywhere needs to investigate no matter how far they are from the source. Bscause of the limited distances in this game, no surprise.

5. The save system is enough to make one STOP PLAYING. Reloads are way, way, way, way, way (get the point) too long. One would have to stop and SAVE every 5 mins or start over. What a drag! Did you let folks play this before release? 

6. Climb a rope....perspective is 6 feet.....view is 6 feet.....chance, luck, randomness.....all of it materially distracting from STEALTH. 

Lastly....find the sadly limited soul that thought having every "restart" slow the same insulting clips over and over again and give them their real job, selling pencils. Seriously sad and misplaced. 

I am writing this at the airship chapter. Not sure I will bother going any further.....and as I said.....I really enjoy #1 but this one is so much more....of less STEALTH ELEGANCE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078840356', 'num_games_owned': 833, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1491727506}
review:
[h1] Spoiler free review, with a short and long version:[/h1]

[b]TLDR version[/b]
Buy the 2nd Styx's installment if:
+ you needed a snarkier, 4th wall breaking character in your gaming life
+ you wanted more open  playable areas and more verticality
+ you wanted to enjoy an deeper, expanded skill / "clone-based-stealth" system
+ you wanted a better item management and crafting system
+ you wished for a online coop mode

Avoid this game if:
- you wished for a detailed, non-linear story
- you were looking for a greater, more complex enemy variety
- you can't stand AI stupidity and sometimes unreasonable platforming sessions, followed by sometimes unreliable climbing mechanics

Time required to finish the game: 13-14 hours
Time required to complete it at 100%: 18-20 hours

Verdict: 7/10 (worth your money, but with many warnings (read below if interested)

[b]Detailed version[/b]

I'll try to cut to the chase here, even if this should have been the more detailed version, as my "job" here is to allow you to make the most aware purchase.

THE GAME ITSELF IS WORTH YOUR MONEY AND TIME, don't get me wrong, but be aware that:
1- [b]SoD plot looks extremely trivial [/b] as the story progression is fast, linear and besides Styx's improved personality and charm, there's nothing else good in the background as the side characters are as compelling as Fallout 4 main story
2- [b]the new areas, more opened and allowing for long distance and vertical movement actually lower the game difficulty [/b]making stealth sessions way easier and way more repetitive than Styx 1.
Example: you have to go from  point A to point B? Find some nearby roofs, climb them, drop down, find some tables and ledges, hide, make some noise to lure guards and skip the enclosed, harder areas with ease.
NOTE: those new huge levels will be used/recycled more than one time during the story progression, meaning that you will have to replay them, killing the joy of the exploration
3- [b]Styx is still unable to defend himself in open combat[/b]:
A: "LOL" this is a stealth game, why do i have to be OP as Batman? Go to play Arkham City (insert Twitch emotes here).
B: Allowing Styx to be able to perform "some" additional moves doesn't cancel the stealth mechanics, it just adds more variety to a stealth game, which should be the main priority when designing stealth/melee mechanics. It's still up to you to be stealthy and/or merciful.
4- As the game goes by, [b]the stealth component gets more and more replaced by platforming sessions, followed by sometimes unresponsive controls and imprecise climbing mechanics[/b]. Up to you to decide if this is coherent with the game and with that you enjoyed the most out of this franchise.
5- [b]only 2 new enemies[/b] were added to the game, so don't expect that much of novelty from that perspective
6- [b]the "secret loot" side quests that were available in Styx 1 are absent here[/b], you will not be able to visually improve your hideout with some precious stolen items; the only avaible side quets will grant you some new items' recipes and EXP points to be used in a new well improved skill system that i will not spoil

To sum up:
[u]Buy this game if you want a new, more charismatic Styx; DO NOT buy this game if you were expecting a deeper, more complex and refined game; you'll find a linear, not compelling story which is likely to be completed and expanded in a 3rd installment.[/u]

Thanks for reading, leave a comment below if you have any questions, feel free to follow my other reviews at; https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32344423/

Did find some bugs, like missions not updating (the dagger) and sometimes dialoge not updating but a reset fixes it.

only massive down side is, Its too short!!!
I play for tokens, no kills or alerts. 17hrs and im done. 
Sucks because its not like a tv series where the next game comes out in a few months :( Now im left with a sad sad void until something great comes out again
