review:
While this game feels like a console game throughout it still has many elements that make it fun to play on a PC. 

- The controls are good with a mouse and keyboard.
- Great level design.
- Interesting story.
- It's a pure stealth experience that reminds me of some of the fun I had in the early Thief games.
- Many paths to complete the missions in each level.

The bottom line - It's a fun game that is worth a buy if it's on sale. It does not bring anything new to the genre and that's about exciting as this game gets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126768924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1490871627}
review:
Se dovessi descrivere il gioco in poche righe dire :"CAZZO QUANTO è BELLO!"
Da questo potrete capire che consiglio Fortemente questo videogioco. Se siete amanti dei giochi stealth questo fa decisamente al caso vostro.

- Level design veramente fatto bene, sia dal punto di vista visivo che di gameplay. I percorsi sono molti e consentono di  affrontare il livello in molti modi differenti. Anche rigiocando il livello per prendere le medaglie mancanti non ci si annoia.
- Buon livello di difficoltà, oggetti utili ma non indispensabili. Gli scarabissi come nel capitolo precedente si sono rivelati il vero problema, fortunatamente non insormontabile.
- La logica delle boss fight mi è piaciuta molto, è riuscita a mantenere la natura stealth del gameplay senza però togliere la soddisfazione di sconfiggerli. 
- Unica nota a sfavore: alcuni personaggi incontrati sembrano sparire nel nulla, avrei preferito avere qualche piccola informazione su dove sono andati a finire o scoprirlo io stesso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076757867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1490435201}
review:
The most lovable goblin in all of gaming is back at it again with a new outfit, new engine, and better game play. (Minus the jumping that's still wonky AF). Unreal Engine 4 looks absolutely stunning at times and that's on Styx's meager budget of a couple million. The level design is some of the best I've seen in stealth games outside of Thief and the early Splinter Cells. Simultaneously open yet highly vertical. When we get down to it i only got 2 problems with Styx. One being the fucking brain dead AI, and 2 the asshole over at Cyanide that decided to turn Styx from a sarcastic nihilistic super thief into fucking Deadpool. 

Verdict: The game is awesome with a few issues. The jumping still barely works half the time. Styx is now Deadpool, and the AI is short bus levels of special. If you can deal with those minuscule (some would say nitpicky) issues they you are treated to a well crafted, tense, atmospheric sneaking experience that's easily worth the full price tag.

PROTIPS:
1. When using a controller you can use Right on D-Pad to quick save.

2. You can switch the button prompts to Playstations' in the options menu if you play with a DS4 controller like me. So your brain won't think X is A

review:

Macht echt Laune. Gönnt euch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036249707', 'num_games_owned': 868, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1563332166}
review:
So right up front I'll say that I'm all for this game.  There is a lot to love about this game, just like there was a lot to love about it's predecessor.  

Let's start with the real meat and bones of the game mechanics.  The actual gameplay is pretty much exactly the same as Styx: Master of Shadows was in terms of navigating the environment, although it does feel cleaner.  What I mean is that while pretty much all of the buttons do all the same things, when I want Styx to hide, he seems to repond faster.  When I want him to move over an edge, he responds more predictably and I don't just accidentally walk off edges.  The only thing that still occasionally gets me is navigating hang points on walls, but it's usually because I'm trying to make a jump I shouldn't be trying for.  

Beyond navigating the environments are the actual environments themselves.  Styx: Shards of Darkness has greatly improved on Styx: MoS.  While the previous game certainly had large sprawling environments, Styx: SoD really does a masterful job of tying it all together.  There are multiple ways to get into just about any building, plenty of ropes and staircases to ascend to higher levels, all manner of shadows and objects to hide in or around, and numerous materials and treasures to be found giving you reasons to explore all of it.  

On that note, we can also mention the new crafting mechanic.  Not only are there new items such as the fantastic Acid Trap for Styx to make use of, but there are resources all over the place that he can pick up and use to craft these items.  It's a great way to refuel if you've used all your items early in the mission, but they are also careful to give you just enough resources that you have to choose carefully which items you really want.  It's a good line between making sure you're supplied, but without handing you everything you might want.

Another place that Styx: SoD has improved is the skills.  In the previous entry there were only about 4 skills to a tree, and only (I think) 5 skill trees.  The fifth of these was also more of a bonus tree whose skills unlocked as you mastered the other four trees.  With Styx: SoD the skills have been expanded into five full trees each with 8 separate skills.  In addition, if at any point you decide you don't like the skills you've selected, you can refund the points and invest them into different skills.  

The character in my opinion is just as good as in previous games.  He makes some bad jokes, but they're charming in their own way.  Styx's attitude is still just as sarcastic and snarky as ever, and the voice acting is top notch.  The other characters I've encountered are varied, and interesting, and the story is still driving me to complete the next mission.

All in all I really don't have any serious complaints, and I highly recommend this game if you are even remotely interested in the stealth genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050679531', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1628431417}
review:
요약: 잠입-암살 게임 시리즈 타이틀로서 입지를 단단히 굳힌 스틱스 프랜차이즈(The title that reclaim their undeniable area on stealth-assassin game under the name of 'Styx' franchise)


이번 타이틀에서 게임 제작사의 능력이 동이 난 것이 아님을 훌륭히 증명했다고 생각한다. 사실 지난 게임은 좀 더 직선적인 잠입과 암살을 다뤘다.  이에 비해 이번작은 그래픽과 움직임 모두 자연스러웠다. 초반에 있는 몇 가지 물리엔진 버그는 굉장히 실망감을 키웠지만, 금방 고쳐지는 것으로 얼마나 제작사가 이 게임을 사랑하는지 역시 알 수 있었다.
또, 한 번 들키면 쉼 없이 몰려오는 적들의 AI는 전작의 이른바 '성역'이 많았던 단점을 확실히 고쳐냈다고 생각한다.
이전의 좋았던 게임성의 유지 역시 그대로 가져간다. 파쿠르와 적절한 기물배치들은 이 게임의 긴장감과 호쾌함을 모두 잡아냈다.
또한 전작에서 의미없이 시간을 허비하게 했던 잠긴 문 역시 대부분을 열어놓고, 일부 전략적 구간에서 선택을 할 수 있게 하는 것으로 게임의 자유도를 한층 끌어올렸다.
보스전 또한 성공적인 모험이 아닐 수 없다. 전작에서 김빠지는 느낌이 없잖아 있던 스틱스 보스전과 달리 거대한 유닛과의 전투를 '작은 고블린'의 입장에서 잘 그려내는 것으로 흔히 잠입-암살 게임에서 추구하는 '약자의 방법'을 잘 드러냈다. 또한 이러한 거대 유닛은 단순히 강-약 대결만을 나타내지않고, 이 구간에서 만큼은 잠입보다는 액션을 추구하게 하는 것으로 스틱스가 가지고 있는 파쿠르-레벨링 시스템이 훌륭하다는 것을 아주 대담하게 자랑하고 있다.
아쉬운 점이라면, 주제에서의 철학 부재와 이로인한 스토리의 얕음을 들고 싶다. 지난 작품에서의 '나는 누구인가?'라는 심오한 질문은 일러스트, 인게임 영상 그리고 인게임 플레이에서 모두 잘 드러났고, 이에 따른 스토리의 개연성도 훌륭했다. 하지만 이번 작품은 뚜렷한 주제 없이 그저 'badass'인 스틱스의 활극을 다룬다는 느낌을 지울 수가 없다. 전작의 스토리의 훌륭함 때문에라도 다시 플레이하게 됐던 나로서는 너무나 실망스러울 수 밖에 없다. 게임사가 다음작을 노리고 있다고 생각하는데, 그 때는 좀더 확고하고, 명료하고 , 또 심오한 스토리를 기대해보겠다.
물론 그럼에도 진일보한 게임성을 보여준 이번작은 단순히 '디스아너드' 시리즈와 '어쌔신 크리드' 시리즈의 혼합물이라는 오명을 벗고, 그래, 마치 '마스터 오브 섀도우'에서 처럼 '라카쉬'의 신세를 벗고 진정한 자신의 이름을 얻었다고 생각한다.

Review for Non-Korean

This title show that last one was not the end of Cyanide's ability. Actually, last title's action was more statics, asked more calculation rather than flexible feedback from situation. This time, their graphic and mobility is much more natural. The physical engine bug was so disappointing, but it soon be gone and let me feel studio's attachment about this game. And imporved AI makes the space be no 'safe place' like last one by alerting to all enemy about presence of player.
They also maintain the good part of their game. Good pakour system and nice leveling give the game tension and vivity at once. Also the locked doors- the one which waste time meaninglessly on last title- become the strategic selecion and enhance the degree of freedom. The best improved part on this game is boss level. For your information, last title's boss level, yes that last battle with Styx, was honestly suck. But on this title, BIG BAD MONSTER make me feel the 'real boss level'. And it shows the contraction with 'small goblin', 'the way of the weak'. There is also view point of leveling system itself. They highlight on action rather than stealth on this boss level, they show what they have done well in pakour and leveling system.
One disappointed part is story. Last title, subject 'Who am I?' was so clear and it makes all story seem reasonable. But this time, this is just action movie about 'Styx the badass'. I'm so disappointed because I played 'Master of Shadow' again and again because of story and miseenscene. So I hope them make some sexy one next time.
Although this point is serious for me, enhancement of game system makes 'Styx' franchise independent from name of 'mixture of 'Dishonored' and 'Assassin's creed'' just like Styx who got rid out the name of 'Rakkash' at 'Master of Shadow'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061308194', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2971, 'last_played': 1666747206}
review:
So to preface all of this, if you loved Master of Shadows and used styx to clear enemies in Of orcs and Men and simply enjoy taking things slow and steady until you master the subtlties of subtley, then buy this game and have a blast. 

To lay some ground rules. You are not Ezio Attano, where stealth is more of a thing you use when your parry arm needs a break. You are Styx the Talking Goblin. You're squishy and if more than one enemy starts attacking you......Better luck next time. Styx is not Batman, you can freely kill everyone and everything with no repracusions (Besides loss of a medal and Skill points). Moving on to gameplay now...

As far as stealth mechanics go it's the same as Master of shadows, (Tldr; "Light Gem" to see if you're in shadows. Carpet is quiet, metal is loud.) Climbing (at times) is a little off, not more or less than other games of the genre. Sometimes you'll  hang on a ledge when dropping off the same ledge, ropes become eheral 'ect. 

Combat is something you should avoid, you'll die if you think this is in anyway a viable way to go through the game............as before you are Styx, 1v1 okay 1v2 nope 1v6 Nice knowing you.

Co-op- Alright so here is the big thing that has changed between the two styx standalone games. You can call in a buddy to become a perfect clone. There are some noticable problems with this. Having a random clone with no voice chat will ruin any no kill runs, but they're randoms you should have probably seen that coming. How ever when you bring in a friend that you are talking to, pulling off a no kill, no detection and all coin run becomes a god dam joy (Only do this with someone you are in sync with and understands the game mechanics and abilities that you have each chosen respectively). Your co-op buddy will noticeably "lag" in his animations, not really a problem for gameplay. 

Side notes- Styx's humor is sometimes weird (The applepie), or on point (you aren't getting laid). The rope climbing animation better become a gif. of lazy game design, and Hellidron/Arkail needs more screen time. Arkail needs his own game now, we've waited long enough, this has nothing to do with the review but most people will have stopped reading.

TLDR Review; Good game that needed a little more polish on animations and patrol pathing, styx is sometimes funny exept when 3.14 is envolved and arkail needs a hack and slash. Go buy it or  go play dishonored 1 or 2 if you're shit at stealth games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014190925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1557, 'last_played': 1586890141}
review:
This game vastly increased the joy that was S:MoS. What I love about this game and loved about the previous was how you could go through any level and have a killing spree, stick to smart timing and skills, never getting seen, or a beautiful combination of both! 
I love how much this game focuses on stealth, real, gritty, gonna-die-if-I-get-caught stealth. It's a challenging game and one doesn't even have to play in Goblin mode to be challenged to think your way through each section of a level. 

I feel this game was a great sequal to the first, the story didn't flow as nicely as I felt it had in Master of Shadows, but everything was certainly interesting! The cutscenes were very beautiful and not much else was better then gettting chances to see Styx fully animated, showcasing just how badass he really is when he moves through the game world. 

I found some of the writing lacking and out of place, and the scenes after a death lead me to form a quick-loading habit but the game was too much fun for me to really give much of a shit about any of the cons. They were all really inconsequential to me when put up against everything I fully enjoyed about the game; from the gameplay and challenges, the sound and level design, the progression of story, Styx in general, all the way to the skills and inventory changes. 

This isn't one of those games where stealth is just an aspect of it; Stealth. IS. Everything.

If you like stealth-based play in a game and want something fun with a bite, then Shards of Darkness is for you!

review:
DRM-free, kein Denuvo oder anderer unerwünschter mist, 40 Euro bei Release, atmosphärische Welt mit interessanter Spielmechanik. Mal von Steam abgesehen keine extra Launcher, die man sich runterladen muss, kein Seasonpass. Nur ein kleines kosmetisches DLC für Fans des vorherigen Spiels, die mit den alten Klamotten rumlaufen wollen. 

Bei den Bedingungen wird man ja ganz nostalgisch. Bitte weiter so und nicht anders.

Allein dafür eigentlich schon einen Kauf wert, Sahnehäuptchen dürfte allerdings noch der Koop-Modus sein, den dieses Styx hat. Zwar hab ich den noch nicht ausprobieren können, aber das ist natürlich in Planung.

EDIT:  38 Stunden bis ich durch war, alle Missionen mindestens unentdeckt und mit allen Tokens beendet. Das spiel war ziemlich gut, nur das Ende kam plötzlich und ohne Abschluss. Hoffen wir mal, dass da jetzt keine DLC kommen, sondern vollwertige Spiele.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065090402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1493704348}
review:
[h1]冥河：暗影碎片（Styx：Shards of Darkness)[/h1]

[h1]暗影大师，再度回归[/h1]

限于字数限制有所删改，[url=http://play.163.com/special/news/styx-shards-of-darkness-review.html?from=iplayindex1]完整图文评测地址[/url]

[b]评分（7.5/10）[/b]

+纯粹的潜行体验
+磅礴大气的关卡设计
+Styx，有趣的反英雄主角
+其乐无穷的双人合作
+有意义的挑战和回报

-重复的支线任务设计
-冗余笨重的战斗机制
-平庸的故事情节与人物


[h1]扩展的奇幻世界[/h1]

前作之所以小众，除了本身较为硬核的设定外，也和它的卖相有一定关系。制作组也意识到了这一点，将引擎的升级为了虚幻4，也因此《冥河：暗影碎片》拥有了远超前作的视觉效果，在光影与材质上均有大幅进步，并保证了稳定的运行速率。除此之外，前作较为阴郁和黑暗的场景风格得到了改进，Styx将在壮丽的大峡谷，天空中翱翔的飞空艇，神秘的精灵遗迹等不同的场景中施展自己的身手，这些磅礴大气的关卡成功支撑起了一个美丽的奇幻世界，也将前作的小家子气格局一并去除，给了玩家更多探索场景的动力。不过技术的进步并不是全方位的，游戏内的人物表情仍然显得比较僵硬，尤其是在各种过场对话演出中更为直观，不自然的令人出戏。


[h1]双倍的机遇，双倍的危险[/h1]

作为一款以硬核潜入为卖点的游戏，《冥河：暗影碎片》破天荒般的加入了联机合作，令人感到无比意外。然而，你要是以为像其他游戏一样，通过合作可以最大限度的降低难度，那可就错了。在合作模式下，Styx可以创造出一个完美的克隆体来让2P玩家使用，与作为普通技能的替身不同，这个克隆体可以使用本体的技能和道具，这给予了玩家互相配合，声东击西的可能性。在双方玩家各司其职的情况下，那些单人下很棘手的状况都会迎刃而解——玩家可以吹口哨将全副武装的守卫引到角落，再由2号玩家埋伏袭击落单的敌人或是偷偷窃取宝物。然而召唤这么厉害的帮手也伴随着代价——消耗巨量的生命值上限，Styx分散自己的力量也会使得它不能格挡守卫的攻击，并会被近战一击秒杀。此外虽然玩家可以共享物资，但场景里的资源总量依旧是不变的，利用起来就必须更加谨慎。而且，双人也意味着暴露自己行踪的机会也翻倍了，若是守卫鸣响警钟，双人会更难以逃脱（简称猪队友），而且在这个模式下S/L大法也是无效的，被发现多了难度会不降反增。但这种机遇与危险共存的合作模式的确带来了别样的乐趣。
 


[h1]“条条大路通宝藏”[/h1]

更换引擎后带来的视觉效果提升固然不错，但最重要的还是他在游戏性方面的影响；本作的关卡规模得到了飞跃的扩展，并且改善了前作被人所诟病的关卡重复利用（一个塔来回爬就算2关）并在这个基础上，保持充满了丰富的细节，多样的可互动物件以及路线。垂直化的关卡展开让玩家有多个切入点通向自己的目标，它可能是不经意间看见的一扇小暗门，天窗上的小破洞、或是陡峭峡谷上的狭窄缝隙，给你的选择从来不止一个。

此外，在所有的关卡里，游戏都提供了大量可供完成的支线目标，完成他们可以给予不少技能点，其中一些设置巧妙的任务非常有意思，比如窃取敌方高阶领主的辞典来拼凑谜题，完成石像机关，但这样精彩的支线并没有占太大的比例，大多数都只是机械化的收集任务。如果不是为了技能点，难免会让人觉得有些乏味。
 


[h1]Stealth Only[/h1]

在Styx的旅程里，大多数敌人对它来说都是“穷凶极恶”的。尽管它是一名操控暗影的大师，但身形力量上的差距却无法忽视——即使是最普通的守卫也可以把你轻易抓住并扔来扔去。换言之Styx虽然对一些卑鄙的暗杀的招式并不生疏，但战斗从来不是最优解。当被守卫发现你的时候，他们会毫不犹豫的全力追捕你，而Styx面对他们的正面攻击时需要精确的时机才能格挡，这可以造成敌人短暂的眩晕。但不意味着你就能开无双了——拿小匕首杀划守卫所要耗费的时间实在太长了，而且这只建立在格挡成功的前提下，如果和意识清醒的守卫对砍你是毫无胜算的，并且手感也十分糟糕，更别提场景里只出现一个守卫的情况真的很少，通常在他们发现你的时候就会大喊大叫了。因此，玩家大部分时间在暗中作梗玩弄敌人会是比较明智的选择。在许多传统潜入游戏诸如《杀出重围》，《羞辱》中无一例外强化了强攻与动作部分来提供更多玩法的同时，《冥河：暗影碎片》依然采用了将战斗系统冗余无用化的方式来致使玩家专注潜入，这一举动虽然可以理解，放在当下环境来看却也显得有点“偏执”。


[h1]市井小贼干大事[/h1]

Styx不是一个常规的英雄角色，他没有崇高的志向与高尚的品德，它所做的一切都是为了自己欲望，不管对敌人还是对自己，Styx都毫不吝惜各种能让他抖小聪明的机会。他会以自嘲的口气说道：“大自然这么伟大，我却这么渺小….正好让我做个贼！”游戏内还设置了不少令人忍俊不禁的桥段，比如当看见闪闪发光的宝物时，会像指环王里的咕噜一样以垂涎的口气说出my precious。最有趣的毫无疑问是有的时候Styx会打破“第四面墙”向玩家直接发起对话，在玩家遭遇失败回到读取界面时，Styx经常会毫不留情的跳出来对玩家进行讥讽。比如：“你要知道用脚来玩是不会让你获得什么成就的”“嘿，你是不是在录地精的多种死法？”尽管一般在失败的情况下遭到他人突如其来的嘲讽可能会致使沮丧与愤怒，不过这只搞怪的地精却更容易引起玩家的大笑。
 

不过除了我们搞怪的主角Styx外，游戏在其他角色上所的耗费的笔墨显然就要略逊一筹了。在大部分时间Styx都只会和交与他任务的女队长Helledyrn有几句简短的对话，除此之外再无交集，而游戏里的其他NPC虽然不乏精灵与矮人等多种族，但大多缺乏深度，让人过目即忘。加上游戏中较为平凡的主线发展，剧情方面难以牵动玩家。考虑到游戏本体提供了一个如此广阔的开放式场景，过往系列的铺垫以及出色的奇幻风格设定，这理应是一个十分好发挥的舞台，但制作组没能善加利用这些优势，多少让人感觉没能物尽其用。
 

[h1]总结[/h1]

[b]作为一款历经2年半研发的续作，《冥河：暗影碎片》更像是前作的“威力加强版”。一方面，它汲取了前作得到的反馈，针对性的打磨了前作那些干涩的与粗糙的棱角，使得游戏体验更为平滑流畅，在基础系统添砖加瓦的同时也保持着它复古却纯粹的潜入乐趣，充满趣味的Styx对话会让玩家忍俊不禁。磅礴大气的关卡里充满了丰富的机遇与挑战，叫上挚友中合力通关也不失为一个好选择。[/b]

[b]而另一方面，《冥河：暗影碎片》则有点像是在刻意保持某些“传统”，比如依旧冗余笨重的战斗机制来迫使玩家潜行，多少影响了游戏的多样性。这种颇为“硬核”的设定也注定会降低玩家的受众面，游戏缺乏深度的剧本与苍白的人物刻画也白白浪费了大好的奇幻背景设定。但如果你在寻找一款具有足够古典味的潜入游戏，那本作毫无疑问是不二之选。[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198097459856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1490172342}
review:
Overall great stealth game that has the best mechanics and learning curve out of any stealth game I have played.  I prefer Styx’s mechanics to both Thief and Dishonored games.  I encountered no bugs or glitches on release day (besides some small AI pathing problems) which is very refreshing since major developers commonly have issues with games working correctly *cough Dishonored 2*.

The weak side of the game is the story which is very roughly patched together with no character development.  Expect giant rock monster bosses to pop up from nowhere, and main character story lines to just disappear.  The game also has a really bad habit of referencing bigger name games throughout the dialog which is a terrible choice IMHO.  The constant breaking of the 4th law in the game was also not enjoyable in the least as is just distracted from an already un-immersive story.

The art was great besides in the main menu where the picture of Styx is more garbled than he actually appears during game play.

Styx has a great voice actor, but many of the guards/elves sounded like they were voiced by some guy of the street that didn’t know the first thing about acting.  

The maps were more varied than the original game which had us running forward and backward between the same few maps, but there were still a lot of the later maps that were built using pieces from previous maps.  There were even tiles on the grounds that were reused from a puzzle encountered earlier in the game.  This just feels lazy and I wish they had just shortened the game and reduced the price by $10 if they do not have enough man power to create new game elements.

I do highly recommend giving this game a try, but it is far from perfect.  The game is in an awkward spot between feeling like an amazing small studio game, or an awful big name game.  I am hoping for another Styx game in the next few years.
  
To bring it to the next level they need to:
- Bring in an author to help with the plot.
-Stop reusing map elements repeatedly.
-Leave the 4th law alone, you are not Deadpool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102476468', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1490174551}
review:
Styx ist einfach wieder einmal nur episch.
Wer den Humor des kleinen Kerles mag, der wird hier 100% nicht enttäuscht.
Der Preis ist ebenfals okay, da das spiel jedem Spieler Individuell seine Möglichkeit beitete die Missionen abzuschließen.
Styx ist ein klassisches Stealth Game, dass jedoch ebenso einige Aktionreiche Szenen bereit hällt.
Die Welt ist sehr liebevoll Designt, auch wenn es insgesammt nur 4 Level-Areas gibt, so sind diese doch sehr groß, beiten, wie schon gesagt imense Möglichkeiten und zudem sind sie in unterschiedlichen Tages und Nachtzeiten zu meistern, was das ganze nocheinmal interessanter macht, meiner Meinung nach.

Die Charactere sind auch mit einiger Rafinesse gewählt und fügen sich sehr schön in das Bild des Spieles ein. 
Hällt man einmal inne und lauscht den Unterhaltungen im Spiel, kann man zudem die eine oder andere wirklich Interessante Information oder einen Witz erfahren.
Und natürlich sind Styx Kommentare einfach wieder einmal das Beste.


Einzigst Negativ was mir aufgefallen ist:

Die KI der Gegner ist leider etwas Buggy. Als ich sichtbar für einen Gegner in eine Kiste sprang, lief er 5 Minuten umher, nur um dann zu sagen ich sei verschwunden. Hin und wieder stehen sich die KI selbst im Weg, was leider schade ist. Aber da dies ja ein Stealth Game ist... man sollte ja auch nicht erwischt werden XD

Das Ende war ein wenig zu... kurz. Da fehlete irgendwas. Natürlich Hammer Schwerer Kampf am Ende und wirklich Episch, aber.... mhm. Fühlt sich ein wenig leer an.

Resumee: Für mich hat es sich in jedem Fall gelohnt das Spiel vorzubestellen und auch zu kaufen. Und die kleine Szene im Spiel als Hint auf >Of Orc´s and Men< war einfach super!!!!! *_*

Vielen Dank an die Entwicker *_*

author: {'steamid': '76561197994666064', 'num_games_owned': 3746, 'num_reviews': 611, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1490100405}
review:
Esse é aquele tipo de jogo que mostra que não é necessário ser inovador para ser divertido. Ele usa diversos elementos já usados em outras obras, mas o negócio é que colocaram do jeito certo. Então é um bom passa temo, acredito que especialmente quem gosta de jogo antigo vai sentir uma certa nostalgia aqui. É também difícil pra caramba, inclusive colocaram diversas apresentações de Game Over com o personagem reclamando de várias maneiras, algumas são hilárias. Achei meio ruim se conectar a alguém pelo cooperativo, provavelmente por poucos jogadores, mas quando consegui foi uma boa experiência. Como é o modo campanha que você joga coop, acho que vale a pena comprar junto a um amigo pra zerarem. Análise detalhada aqui:

http://www.nerdmaldito.com/2017/03/styx-shards-of-darkness-um-stealth-coop.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198065875611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 5096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1296, 'last_played': 1673880706}
review:
Its Styx 2!  More smooth, more fun, more resources, more intuitive, just a really solid sequel...Mostly.  This game improves on what was already a fun game.  Crafting, a larger inventory and variety of items, along with an expanded talent tree will enable players a more varied approach than in  Master of Shadows.

Killing especially in this game isn't the slog it was in MoS.  Which doesn't make a mercy (no kill) run any less viable.  The tone in this one is much more comical, with Styx cracking jokes at every given opportunity.  Everyone across the board has more personality and emotion than their MoS counterparts (barring maybe Ozkan).

Before I nitpick this game let me be clear.  The game is straight up fun.  The map designs are unique and the locations immerse the player in the fantasy world in which the game takes place.  Primary and secondary objectives have seen an improvement as well.  I'll refrain from giving too much up as going in without foreknowledge is a plus.  But better level design with more tools to interact with it is an easy win.  If there's one feeling the game left me with its the huge desire for a Styx 3.

Its not a 100% improvement over the original.  If you loved the challenge of the first game this one is way easier.  Especially if you go for 100% completion, The end game stuff will make you the shadow hand of death, which is fun but trivializes the game.  Second the story in the first game has an ending and this one...doesn't.  Finally while I loved the setting and story in this one the, dialogue was too much for me.  Its not that its low brow its that its cringe level corny. This also only really applies to Styx but he is the main character.   Subjective I know  but it was pretty noticeable.

Even if you didn't like the original this one is still worth a look.  And there's so much this game got right about its design I can easily recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999005969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1402, 'last_played': 1492511168}
review:
Love it. I didn't play the first game but as soon as I played this one I knew it was going to be a good game. The levels are good and their length are decent. There is no shortage of content here and if they release a DLC I will definitely buy it. You have to get used to the controls and there are some rare graphic glitches here and there but nothing major. It runs and performs good and looks decent. 

It seems like the new AAA games that are being released are all rushed and unpolished, riddles with bugs and performance issues. It's a surprise to see a game like Styx with this fair price is not only fun to play but it performs and it's mostly bug free. We really need more of these "mid ranged" games that are crafted with love instead of greed for money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299093666', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1201, 'last_played': 1615113129}
review:
Ho acquistato questo gioco praticamente al Day One guardando prima qualche recensione e qualche gameplay su YouTube, ho capito subito che questo videogame non era da prendere sottogamba​ e che lo stesso richiedeva impegno e attenzione.....Ma non credevo fino ad un punto tale da fartelo disinstallare e cancellarlo dalla mia lista personale.
Come detto sopra la difficoltà è troppo troppo elevata tant'è che il divertimento in pochissimo tempo si trasforma in frustrazione e non bastano le simpatiche battute di spirito di Styx a risollevare il tutto, il problema della difficoltà si amplifica anche perché i movimenti del Goblin sono legnosi e la IA nemica è peggio di quella di un segugio incazzato, praticamente si accorgono di un minimo rumore anche a distanza e il tutto è condito da un sistema di combattimento e difesa del Goblin a dir poco osceno.
In conclusione mi è piaciuto qualcosa?? La grafica che regala dei momenti da spacca mascella, la simpatia di Styx e la storia che anche se non l'ho portata a termine mi sembrava molto carina.
Alla fine di tutto lo consiglio questo gioco??? ASSOLUTAMENTE NO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051283300', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1114, 'last_played': 1490023935}
review:
I just finished the game after 18 hours of gameplay and let me tell you, it's a damn good stealth game
You really have to enjoy stealth to like it though, you are a little goblin, you can't run around destroying everyone like in Dishonored, to kill enemies you will have to hide, wait, be smart, and use all the tools and powers you have

Pros:
-You MUST be stealthy
-Shitton of ways to complete your tasks
-Styx is an entartaining character: he gives absolutely zero fucks about anything (exept amber); he loves killing everything that moves; he breaks the fourth wall and speaks with you, he even insults you when you die; and always have some good jokes and quotes from other games, films etc.
-You have a better arsenal compared to the last game
-You don't have to unlock special kills (aerial kills, covered kills and such) like in MoS
-Pretty decent skill tree, all of them are pretty useful if used in the right way
-They added crafting, which is a really important component in this type of games imo
-You have the possibility to change outfits and daggers, you can even play in underwear. Lovely.
-Maps are big, very detailed, and fully explorable
-Every mission is very long, more than one hour each if you do secondary missions and pick up tokens
-The graphics are pretty good (Unreal Engine 4, bitches)
-The controls feel better than in MoS, it's way smoother, expecially when climbing (which can anyways be tricky sadly)
-It's a damn difficult game, if you get spotted and try to fight you will most likely get oneshotted and rage like an overwatch player

Cons:
-The Story. I mean, it is not that bad at all, but MoS's one was better, and had a plot twist that made me shit my pants; SoD's one instead sometimes feels railroaded, if you know what I mean
-Fight mechanics are probably even worse than in MoS, but don't worry, you will not have to fight because you will almost always encounter invulnerable enemies that oneshot you :D
-There aren't many daggers and outfits to choose, and that's pretty sad
-I encountered two little bugs with mission objectives, but I'm sure they'll get fixed soon
-Like in MoS, they reused the same maps for the last 3 missions, but that really didn't bother me much
-It's an earrape. Really. When they speak or you get busted you will jump off your chair and cry in pain if you don't adjust the volume in the settings. The music and the voice acting are pretty good though

That's pretty much it. If you love stealth, you'll love this game too.

Long live the Goblins!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999801552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2416, 'last_played': 1489967318}
review:
Styx is a cool and sarcastic character. The humor, the funny anecdotes and the breaking of the 4th wall are well done.
The dialogues and the story serve the game very well. The voice-acting is good too.
In each map there are tons of diffrent ways you can use to your advantage. As part of the story there is a bit of level-recycling but i did find even more ways i did not saw the first time. Nice!
The presentation of the game is flawless and works very well.

The graphics are fantasy-realistic and overall pleasant. The game has a few unsharp textures and a few minor glitches. But nothing is downright terrible.

The sound-mixing of footsteps and other noises is only medium. When you stand in a room and hear footsteps, it is nearly impossible to say where they are coming from; the hallway or the room above. This is possibly the weakest part of the game. 

There are trigger-zones for NPC-dialogues all around the maps. Until you enter the trigger these NPCs just don't do anything. They just wait there for you. It felt unnatural and became somewhat of a tactic: Shall i trigger these two guys to hear a conversation or leave them be, so they don't walk around?

NPC's sometimes get stuck and walk in place (a handful in one whole playthrough).

The camera sometimes jumps to another position when climbing. Seems to happen mostly in corners. It is a bit annoying. 

The game autosaves OVER your own quicksave!
(If one of the devs reads this: Patch it. That's just stupid)


Even with these problems the game works very well and i had tons of fun playing it through. If you like Thief and similar stealth-games this one should be on your list. Even if you don't like it... buy it and help the devs to make a third part! Because i definitely want to see Styx III!

author: {'steamid': '76561198324411894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1489, 'last_played': 1490040295}
review:
Думаю, стоит начать с того, что мое впечатление об игре, возможно, будет интересно тем, кто не знаком со вселенной и Shards of Darkness первое знакомство с этим безумным гоблином Стиксом. Ибо это и для меня первая встреча с персонажем. 
 Часто в рекомендациях уточняют, что игра понравится только любителям серии Styx и стэлса. Первое время это заявление вполне оправдано, но потом, как привыкаешь к управлению и входишь в темп игры - начинаешь наслаждаться. Каких-то сюжетных особенностей, которых не понять без знания первой части, я тоже не углядел. 
 Не любитель стэлса, но после Стикса решил, что начинать осваивать жанр все-таки стоит хотя бы ради таких игр.
Игра отличная, давненько не получал столько положительных эмоций от прохождения. Понравились персонажи, что Хеледрин, что Джарак. Чувствовалось взаимодействие и с ними, пожалуй, действительно хотелось сотрудничать.
 Локации радовали разнообразием обходных путей и красочностью. Однако, больше всего хочется отметить саундтреки. Идеально подходящие к ситуации, пробирающие до дрожи, заставляющие переживать спектр эмоций. 
  Если хотите скрасить свободное время захватывающей игрой, то можете смело приобрести Styx.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143115887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1615, 'last_played': 1557269809}
review:
Ayant clean Styx Master of shadow à 100% et joué plus de 50 heure à un jeu dont le scénario de base faisait autour des 10 heures, autant vous dire que j'attendais ce deuxième opus et du coup bah ... la hype + mes attentes ... il fallait que le jeu soit bon, aussi bon que le premier, voire meilleur !

Résultat ? Bien joué Cyanide ;)

Points positifs:

- Tout comme dans Styx Master of Shadow, le scénario se veut de base très bateau: "je suis un voleur, si je vole ca je gagne de l'argent/du pouvoir ouai aller go" et petit à petit le scénario se complexifi ! Et un scénario avec de bons rebondissements c'est un bon scénario !

-On est toujours dans une infiltration à la verticale avec un gameplay très agréable et un vaste pannel de possibilité pour avancer dans chaque secteur.

- Un Mode coop ! Je ne l'ai testé que quelques minutes mais voilà qui n'est qu'un plus et ca c'est cool !

- Possibilité de personnaliser le gobelin, entre différentes tenues, dagues et choisir ses talents en fonction de sa manière de jouer (du moins la première fois que l'on clean la campagne puisqu'au final on aura tous les talents ) ET OMG ON PEUT FINIR LE JEU ET MEME FAIRE LES OBJECTIFS D'ASSASSINAT SECONDAIRE FULL A POIL ET SANS DAGUE ET LA JE DIS OUIIIII !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

- Ajout d'un système de crafting et des nouveaux items !

- Styx à pris la confiance maintenant qu'il a buté l'original et qu'il est le plus fort de tous les gobelins, et son nouveau tempérament est sympa, les petites vannes etc ne sont pas de trop à mon gout (quoique parfois vite fait lorudes)

-La bande-son m'a parfois bien fait tripé (le dernier niveau :OOOOO)

En résumé sur le positif, Personnaliser son gobelin, ses compétences, sa manière d'appréhender un niveau, et choisir quels objets utilisé (car on n'a pas de quoi craft tous les items tout le temps) donc du Styx Master of shadow encore plus complet ! Un vrai plaisir !

En points négatifs:

-Quelques bugs de lvl design ou quoi, par exemple, lorsqu'on saute au bord du fenetre ouverte pour grimper sur son rebord et passer de l'autre coté, le gobelin perd parfois son cerveau et saute juste se prenant le haut de la fenetre et du coup faut refaire la manip, pas grand chose, mais chiant quand meme ! Autre exemple, quand on saute contre une barrière pour grimper dessus, des fois le petit Styx fait un grand bond en arrière, et paf on est reperer et on s'fait buter et faut recommencer etc... bref des bugs assez chiant et j'éspère un patch correctif pour se genre d'embrouilles !

-Les boss sont ... impressionnants .... m'ouais mais en terme de combat ... rien de dingue !

-La faim m'a laissé sur ma ... faim ! MDR xD lol BREF ca sent le DLC ou quoi mais bon la fin du 1 était quand meme vachement plus stylée

- Je déteste ses cordes à la tarzan .... Je ne sais pas comment bien les utiliser ... suis-je le seul ? Je m'oriente avant de me balancer mais Styx se met a changer de direction tout seul il fait des tours et c'est complètement WTF chaotique ! Ca va dans les bug de lvl design ou c'est fait exprès que Styx soit le pire Tarzan EUW ?

En somme des petits problème des gameplay et certaines innovations sont plus chiantes que bienvenues x)

Bref le jeu demeure très sympa, un bon jeu d'infiltration, je trouve l'IA bien meilleure que dans le 1 et certains passages sont vraiment hard et ca fait plaisir de die and retry et de se faire taunt en boucle par le gobelin ah ah x)
Par contre si vous etes du genre salé protégez votre matériel en jouant !
Biensur je le conseil, j'y ai pris de fun et je suis partis pour clean ce deuxième opus à 100% aussi avec le plus grand des fun (F5 est votre ami)

author: {'steamid': '76561198089920281', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1539608316}
review:
[b]Styx: Shards of Darkness[/b] spaltet mir meine Meinung genau in der Mitte durch, ich weiß einfach nicht, ob es jetzt toll oder richtig mies ist. 
Ich mein, auf der einen Seite ist dieses Spiel für Stealth-Puristen passgenau gefertigt: Wirst du entdeckt, bist du tot. Tötest du niemanden, kriegst du Bonuspunkte. Es gibt heutzutage leider immer weniger Spiele, die wirklich reines Stealth erzwingen (das einzige, was in letzter Zeit rauskam ist meines Wissens [url=store.steampowered.com/app/280160]Aragami[/url]), und das ist eine Sache, die mir an diesem Spiel fantastisch gefällt. Natürlich heißt das auch, dass das Publikum erheblich verkleinert wird, weil sich einfach die wenigsten für so einen Spielstil interessieren, aber diejenigen, die danach suchen, kommen hier absolut und ohne Frage auf ihre Kosten.

[b]Grafisch[/b] hat Styx 2 auch ziemlich viel auf den Vorgänger draufgelegt, und man kann unbeirrt sagen, dass es richtig gut aussieht. Der Artstyle wurde ein wenig aktualisiert, bleibt sich innerhalb des Spiels aber zweifellos treu. Einzig und allein bei einigen Post-Effekten (v.a. Chromatic Aberration) hat man vielleicht ein wenig übertrieben, das lässt sich aber ausstellen, also kann man leicht drüber hinweg sehen.

Was das [b]Leveldesign[/b] angeht, muss man eigentlich nicht viel sagen, das ist einfach grandios. Zumindest was die normalen Level angeht: Denn ein großer Kritikpunkt von Styx 2 sind die grässlichen Bosskämpfe. Ohne die hätte das ganze Projekt eine wirklich saubere und angenehme Stealth-Erfahrung sein können, aber da die Bosse immer wissen, wo man sich befindet und die Begegnungen im Allgemeinen ziemlich geskriptet ablaufen, zerstört das ein wenig den angenehmen Fluss der sonst so durchdacht gemachten Level.

Auf der anderen Seite darf man aber die vielen Probleme nicht außer Acht lassen.
Zum einen wäre da die [b]Steuerung[/b]: Wenn man ein perfektes Stealth-Erlebnis schaffen möchte, dann ist das im Allgemeinen der mit Abstand wichtigste Punkt. Die Steuerung muss perfekt sein, absolut fehlerlos und intuitiv. Leider kriegt Styx einige dieses Attribute nicht auf die Reihe, was logischerweise für sehr, sehr viel Frust sorgen kann. Ein gutes Gerüst steht da schon, doch das hatte der Vorgänger auch, wieso wurde also so wenig daran geschraubt?

Auch mit dem [b]Storytelling[/b] und den [b]Charakteren[/b] hapert es noch ein wenig bei Styx: Shards of Darkness. Zugegeben, der Fokus lag wohl weniger darauf, eine bewegende Geschichte besonders geschickt zu erzählen, und in Anbetracht dessen ist das, was rauskam überraschend gut, dennoch ist noch eine Menge Luft nach oben zu erkennen. Dazu kommt der Hauptcharakter mit seiner sehr sarkastischen Art und den unzähligen Fourth-Wall-Brüchen, was sicherlich nicht jedem gefällt. Ich persönlich fand's eigentlich ganz angenehm, aber es gibt anscheinend viele Spieler, denen das tierisch auf die Nerven geht. 

Wenn man Styx: Shards of Darkness so [b]im Gesamten[/b] betrachtet, dann hat man einen genießbaren 7/10 Titel vor sich, der allen voran Stealth-Liebhabern ziemlich schnell gefallen wird. Die Entwickler haben genug Fehler des Vorgängers überarbeitet, insbesondere die Grafik, dass man sich das Spiel ruhig zu dem Preis (40€) holen kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960369708', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1489956596}
review:
Stealth at it's almost finest. The controls are a bit niggly here and there when jumping/grabbing onto ropes and ledges at weird angles. The quicksave function makes up for that (loading times are way down from the first game - had both running from SSD). The level design also amkes a big step up from the first game, with more open levels full of alternate paths.

There are two boss fights that can get annoying if you stray from what is the "ideal" solution, it looks like there are a few bugs with clipping for visibility and damge.... Nothing that we haven't seen way worse from other games though. Overall the expereince of difficulty was satisfactory on Normal, could have been a bit more difficult here and there, saving that for my 2nd run. NOte: I played a 'mercy' run non-lethal only so I can't yet say anything about how it feels with a more action oriented stealth-kill/clone-kill approach.

If you enjoyed the first one, this is a must-have - even if the level recycling is back to a lesser degree this time around. The controls can be a bit niggly sometimes, but it's better than with the first one. The abilities will seem very familiar, I didn't go back to check, but it didn't feel like a big update there. For everyone else: if you are new to the series but like stealth, give this a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044022311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4611, 'last_played': 1552761955}
review:
Game is a stealth masterpiece. Criminally difficult on master difficulty and that's exactly why I love it. The small changes to the way it handles are all wonderful (dropping from ledges is now way easier and conistent, when you jump to ledges and you now hang from them every time instead of automatically leaping up). Enemy readability is way better, amber usage is fair and a lot better (amber vision costs nothing now which is 1000x better), the CLONE is so much fun in this game (get the ability that lets you swap with it ASAP), and invisibility isn't a visually confusing mess now.

Overall the presentation, difficulty, and variety of options and approaches to gameplay are all fantastic. 43 hours and I just now beat the first mission with 100%. Totally worth it.

Flaws: surprising amount of glitches that are borderline gamebreaking. If you're hiding in the upper framework of an indoor area (catwalk wooden things inside a house or something) it's possible to become completely stuck, forcing a restart (or, if you have the clone swapping ability and enough amber, you can use that to escape). Sometimes guards spot you through walls/across craaaazzy distances that make no sense (and I'm aware of their vision increasing if they "lean over a wall"), guards get stuck in the ground sometimes, and very, VERY often if you "continue" after dying (i.e., as opposed to "restart the zone/mission" or "load save") you will see sort of "zombie" guards, i.e. guards that are standing and "alive" but can't be killed or alerted. Sometimes they can be killed but wont be alerted. very confusing and bizarre (and annoying). Once also I proc'd a freeze by dying to a guard while controlling my clone, and when I switched back to styx I did it AS I was dying and I had to quit out of the game.

BESIDE those bizarre glitches the game runs and plays incredibly smoothly even on my older machine, it's insanely fun and nearly every single change they made has been a positive one. idk if I can go back to the old one at this point (and I have 70+ hours on that one)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025004452', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1489937265}
review:
Pros:
-Great Level Design
-Many ways to accomplish each goal
-Skill system is very flexible
-Customizing Skills and equipment lets you fit Styx to your personal play style
-Good looking graphics
-Good Story

Cons:
-Jump controls can be weird sometimes
-Not always obvious on what you can/can't grab on to when climbing

Thoughts:
I enjoyed the first Styx and I really enjoyed this one as well. The main story isn't long (took me about 10 hours) but there are plenty of challenges and collectibles, along with different ways to complete each mission add to the replayability. It's kind of a toss up on if you will like the character Styx and his jokes or not. I enjoy the character and his quips, but I can see how some people might find him annoying. I played on Goblin difficulity, as I feel that is the best way to get the most enjoyment out of the game (for me). The game is also well polished with little to no bugs. Overall great improvements from the first game and if you like hardcore stealth then I highly reccomend this game as well as the first one.

Note: I never tried the co-op mode. I assume your results with it may vary depending on how helpful the person you are matched with is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117691736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2852, 'last_played': 1492087090}
review:
Being a huge fan of Styx: Master of Shadows I've been waiting for the sequel ever since it has been announced and I have pre-purchased it. Having finished the game and playing it for 35+ hours I think I have enough experience to write an objective review. 

Styx: SoD stays true to Styx:MoS. If you have played the first game here you'll get more of the same. Of course there are differences but mainly this new game feels just like the previous one. There are new skills, new items in your inventory, new allies and new enemies. But the mechanic is still the same - stealth is the way to go and this is the easiest way to complete the game. Tanking is not Styx's strong side. Not at all. He barely can parry and kill a single enemy in direct combat. Taking on a group of enemies is practically impossible. So, go stealth and you'll enjoy  a problemless playthrough. Of course stealth needs you to take some time - observe enemies' routs/bosses' attacks, plan your path and time your runs - so you need to be patient - timing is very important in Styx:SoD. When something doesn't go well don't brake your K/controller, don't pull your hair and don't curse the devs, look for another route or just think of a new approach to the problem - the solution is usually simple, you just need to figure it out.

Pros: 
- A real stealth game
- Better grafic than the previous instalment
- Good story for Styx universe
- Interesting characters
- Huge levels with many places to explore
- A lot of hidden paths
- Plenty of materials for crafting
- Enough places through the levels for crafting and upgrading skills
- [spoiler]Keeping Djarak alive :D[/spoiler]

Cons:
- Extremely annoying bosses (I was thinking about giving the game a negative review after I defeated the 1st boss)
- AI pathfinder is still as broken as in Styx:MoS
- Stupid deathscreens (some may enjoy them, they are very Deadpool style)

So, that's it. If you are a stealth fan I sugest you try Styx - both games would be the best because there are some parts that are storyrelated to the first game. 

Epilogue: I enjoyed Styx:SoD a lot and trully hope Cyanide finally breake their habits and release a DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065865841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1638720129}
review:
Overall an excellent, challenging singleplayer stealth game. (Can't judge the multiplayer as I have not tried it.) If you enjoyed the first Styx or are a fan of stealth games in general, you'll probably have a lot of fun with this one. It smoothes over many of the rough edges the first one had (mostly controls, movement and camera) and further improves upon the things it already did right. 

The level design especially is even better now, with huge, maze like environments that, combined with the various skills you can unlock, offer a ton of ways to reach your objectives. The only path it really does not encourage much is that of combat, so you should be okay with playing a "pure" stealth game.

Crafting items is an option now, one I feel kinda lukewarm about. It doesn't really add much fun in terms of gameplay, but on the other hand I have to admit it makes more sense lore-wise to not find highly specialized equipment like acid traps and goblin cocoons just lying around somewhere. Plus Styx isn't really the kind of guy who can just walk into a shop to stock up on potions I suppose.

Can't say too much about the writing of the game as I'm not that far along in the plot yet, but I greatly enjoyed what it did in terms of world building and atmosphere (graphically as well as the little background infos you overhear from npcs). 

The fourth wall breaking humor is a bit hit and miss though - personally, I find the character of Styx likeable enough to forgive his occasional lame joke, but I can imagine that others may find them quite annoying after a while. Luckily you can skip the post-death cutscenes or simply hit quickload before they even appear.

Difficulty is challenging - don't expect to walk right in front of a guard and remain unseen just because there's a bit of shadow on the floor. Again, if you're a fan of stealth games you'll probably love this, otherwise you may find it frustrating.

Edit: One more point, because I haven't seen many reviews mentioning it: This game has a fabulous soundtrack. Love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062907923', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1957, 'last_played': 1624865239}
review:
对于我这种极端潜行爱好者，当初无意间玩到低调的第一部的时候，简直就像发现了沧海遗珠。第二部出来的时候无脑预购，但玩了序章+3关后，我想我只能给个中评。

玩法基本上没有大改动，道具和技能都差不太多，就连很多地图细节都没有什么大的区别，特别是潜入路线钦定的。。。对于我这种玩过第一部的来说，前面这几关我真是用琥珀视野看一眼就知道怎么走了，大部分敌人直接无脑绕开，第三难度真是闭着眼睛玩，估计背了板后直接可以挑战不杀人、限时加最高难度了。

第一部的评测我说地图环境是这个游戏的亮点，这一部没有增强，反倒是直接显示在琥珀视野里，降低了难度。还有敌人的迷之视野范围（有些角度看不见，有些远远的又看见了）。

次要任务和硬币收集比第一部好一些，但还是不够有趣、多样，还是使得整个地图的探索吸引力不够，加上钦定路线和基本无战斗的要素，感觉浪费了很多游戏元素。这点可以对比我心中的潜行第一神作：羞辱2，那开放性的探索、特殊行动、各种文件细节、混乱度的影响，简直就是完爆本作。

游戏画面和气势磅礴的大作感倒是比前一部强了不少，死亡后冥河的吐槽让人忍俊不禁，除此之外也就没别的了吧。但没办法，还是好评，谁让我就爱吃口饭呢！


2017.3.22
除了后面三关还没背板跑速通之外，其他的都全金牌。隐身相关技能点满，然后第九关拿了匿踪袍子后，最高难度二周目跑图不要太简单太快。

冥河最让我失望的就是几乎没有进步。这一部敌人只是多加了一个可以闻气味的矮人，但第一部也有可以感知你的精灵。杀人方式只是多加了一个推装着酸的筒子。道具多了两个，但用处有限，玩不杀人和追求速通时，基本没用。其他的大大小小的细节，我真的再找不出一点进步的了。

两次BOSS战不知道怎么评价，很生硬。现在感觉第一部最后打Styx真身时，都要符合游戏以潜行为核心的元素。

还有精灵城、盗贼城、猎人村，这几个地图都重复利用了两次，似乎就是强制让你在前几关不用探索完的地方这几关再探索一遍。

剧情结尾制作方挖坑，看样子还是想出续作，希望能有所进步。本来想改差评，但是。。。你懂得。

review:
******** CO-OP WARNING ********

As of release to 3/18/17:

I requested a refund. It was an interesting and challenging stealth assasin game. Hope they patch an obvious design flaw.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993611090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1794, 'last_played': 1707498309}
review:
Отличное продолжение похождений скрытного убийцы, вора и сквернослова Стикса. По сути тоже самое, но все улучшено и доработано. В результате получился очень хороший стелс.

Из плюсов:
- Хороший главный герой, с весьма занятными диалогами
- Хороший саундтрек
- Локации кажется стали побольше, с множеством ходов и путей к цели
- Можно пройти полностью без убийств, либо убив всех
- Неплохие задания, некоторые из которых имеют несколько вариантов прохождения, а некоторые не отмечаются точками, так что придется попотеть чтобы их выполнить
- Неплохой графониньо
- Добавили крафт и некоторые новые способности и снаряжение
- Хорошая оптимизация, да-с, теперь если в игру можно играть после выхода, то это плюс
- Забавные комментарии Стикса, в случае смерти (Game Over, man)

Из минусов:
- Иногда могут быть проблемы с управлением, ибо коробки
- Боевая система, вроде как есть, а вроде и нет, хотя она не особо и нужна

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YxdstN7ko4s

review:
[h1] Styx: Shards of Darkness тот ли это гоблин?	[/h1]

Играя в первую часть, наслаждаешься едкими шутками персонажа и удивляешься сюжетным поворотам, но так ли это в новой игре? Давайте разберемся:) Недаром любители ААА проектов первую часть не приняли, но на то они и любители ААА, дадим им закончить школу:) Для многих первая часть стала очень хорошим примером того, как должен выглядеть стелс и вторая часть показывает нам неплохой геймплей, дизайн уровней и полюбившегося всем Стикса.

[h1] Сюжет[/h1]

Новые приключения Стикса начинаются через много лет после событий Master of Shadows и почти не связаны с оригиналом. На этот раз разработчики не стали чудить с композицией, как в первой части, где половина сюжета показывалась от лица допрашиваемого гоблина. Здесь же прост и я бы не сказал, что излишне интересен. В любом случае ждать невероятного поворота событий, как в первой части не стоит.

Не осталось во второй части и самокопания, которому была посвящена первая часть. С первых минут нам дают понять, что финал Master of Shadows имел свои последствия для мира игры — гоблинов стало так много, что их распространение назвали Зеленой чумой, а для борьбы с ними люди создали целое подразделение бойцов C.A.R.N.A.G.E.  Парадокс в том, что Стикс  заключает договор с персоной женского пола (из выше упомянутой) и обязуется украсть у посла некий посох, а взамен получит награду, но, как обычно, в планы Стикса вмешивается эльф, обладающий способностью перевоплощения (экий петух). Гордость героя задета, эльф становится для него смертельным врагом, и теперь, чтобы отомстить, гоблин готов бросить вызов всей расе этих гордецов.


[h1] Геймплей[/h1]

В новой части разработчики решили несколько отойти от мрачной концепции и привнести новые элементы не только в дизайн уровней, но и сделать так, чтобы Стикс постоянно вертел Вас после каждой своей смерти, тем самым выражая крайнее недовольство.
Так же, как и раньше гоблин обладает весомой долей харизмы и такой же долей физической слабости, что превращает игру в классический стелс. Не то, чтобы он не мог дать отпор, наоборот при должной сноровке Вы сможете победить одного врага, но все же шансы ваши не слишком велики и поэтому придется действовать скрытно. Оставаясь в тени Стикс может в полной мере раскрыть свой потенциал, используя разнообразные инструменты, способность становиться невидимым и даже создавая управляемых  клонов. Засады нам устраивать запретили, но зато позволят открыть способность, которая дает возможность перемещаться на место клона, чего порой очень не хватало в «головоломках» первой части.
Стоит так же упомянут дизайн уровней, который стал давать еще больше возможностей для его успешного завершения, от чего получаешь невероятное количество удовольствия. Отравить плевком в воду? Запросто! Скинуть люстру на «консерву» которая в прямом бою сулит сущую боль? Ваше право! Но лучшее решение это залезть повыше и наслаждаясь видами, проползти над головами ничего не подозревающих врагов. Новым для серии элементов стал крафт. В Styx: Shards of Darkness появилась возможность собирать в заплечный мешок всё, что плохо лежит: яйца насекомых, яды, руду и т.д. Позже накопленные вещи можно превратить в арбалетные болты, зелья, отмычки, коконы и растворяющую трупы кислоту. Из последней впоследствии можно будет мастерить ядовитые ловушки, отлично помогающие в деле устранения охраны. Опыта в игре нет, навыки открывают специальные очки, выдаваемые игроку за успешное выполнение заданий и за хороший стелс. Когда гоблин под руководством игрока быстро проходит уровень, никого не убивает и не поднимает тревог – ему начисляются дополнительные очки по каждому пункту, да ещё и с оценкой (золото, серебро или бронза).
Что касается заданий, то их, как и раньше, на каждом уровне два – основное и дополнительное.Основные задания или, проще говоря, сюжетные, частенько сопряжены с необходимостью что-нибудь выкрасть или кого-нибудь убить.

Вердикт: Игра перепрыгнула свою предшественницу во всем и сможет подарить Вам много положительных эмоций, что в купе с отличным сеттингом и картинкой делает ее хорошим конкурентом на место в Вашей библиотеке Steam:)

78/100


Спасибо за внимание к моему обзору к сожалению все не влезло, поэтмоу, если он Вам понравился, то я буду рад пригласить Вас подписатся на меня, как на [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/horapalace#curation] Куратора [/url] где так же имеется возможность читать более полные обзоры на моем сайте.

review:
Styx is fun. Clunky at times, frustrating at times but fun. For me, so far, Shards of Darkness is better than the first game. I'm not the best at stealth based games but find them oddly fascinating. I'm about 10 hrs into the game at present and enjoying it very much. I cannot comment on any co-op play as i only ever play single player games but most people giving negative reviews seem to have issues with the co-op side of the game.
Im sure the Devs will patch a few things in time.
If you can ignore falling from height now and again for no apparent reason and the, initially amusing but ultimately irritating, cut scenes after you kick the bucket Styx is fun. Just save often to retain your sanity as you progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039095301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1490517597}
review:
Une très belle suite du premier Styx :O!!
Nécessite un sens de l'humour et d'auto-dérision pour y jouer, apparemment, à la vue de certains commentaires...

+ Histoire très sympa (même si j'ai préféré le 1, elle est très bien) et une fin ouverte... eh ça sens le DLC ça
+ Styx est toujours aussi casse bonbon et c'est pour ça qu'on l'aime !
+ Les autres persos principaux sont bien developpés et ne font pas tâches à côté de Styx
+ Arbre de compétences bien étoffés ! Les tenues sont bien aussi, dommage que ma tenue préférée, je ne l'ai trouvée qu'à la dernière mission ;__;
+ Fufu réaliste, gobelin tout chétif, c'est logique
+ Niveaux ouverts avec beaucoup de solutions pour passer
+ De nouveaux ennemis par rapport au 1 qui ramènent de la complexité
+ ARKAIL, JE T'AI VU MON GROS, REVIENS!
+ Le design des persos et tout spécialement des elfes noirs est su-per-be!


+/- Les cinématiques de Game Over m'ont, personnellement, bien fait marrer :D Le "I'll be back" et le "To be skilled or not to be skilled" sont mes préférées je crois XD Au pire si t'as pas envie de les entendre, tu tapottes le F9 avant le Game Over c'est pas compliqué. Après, quand il brise le quatrième mur dans le jeu, je trouve que ça casse un chouilla l'ambiance. Non pas que je n'aime pas les références à LOTR (THEY HAVE A CAVE TROLL, ça m'a tué), Thief, Assassin's Creed... au contraire! Mais j'aurai préféré que les références soient amenées sans briser le 4eme mur.


- Réutilisation de plusieurs niveaux à la fin, mais bon, ça va
- ELLE EST OU MA BIP DE CARTE HEIN? J'ai parfois passé 30 min à retrouver mon chemin... Pitié, pensez aux pas doués de l'orientation.
- L'apparition des sous-titres est parfois aléatoire... ptin mais je méloigne de 2 pas, je pars pas à l'aut' bout du monde, j'entends encore les gens parler, REVIENS SOUS-TITRE JE COMPRENDS RIEN SANS TOI!

Pas testé la Coop, j'peux rien dire dessus :p
Bon maintenant, vous pouvez sortir les DLC, allez, hop hop :o
Et pis, si vous pouviez penser à Of Orcs and Men 2 ... :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991405225', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1489852849}
review:
Ukończenie gry zajeło mi dokładnie 24h, Wszystkie poprzednie części również miałem okazję przejść wcześniej. I porównując do nich. 

Ta odsłona gry zdecydowanie może pochwalić się znacznie lepszą mechaniką walk oraz lepiej zaprojektowanymi poziomami. Po ukończeniu gry, zdecydowanie chce się poprawiać swoje wyniki w Coopie.

Jeśli chodzi o fabułę, to niestety jest gorsza niż w poprzednich częściach. Zdecydowanie mniej zaskakująca, a zakończenie nie jest zbyt satysfakcjonujące :/

Szkoda też, że tłumaczenie troszkę odbiega od sensu wypowiedzi, to chyba największy minus gry.

Jeśli wcześniej nie mieliście okazji grać w poprzednie części, gra być może spodoba wam się bardziej niż mi. Zdecydowanie polecam, ale liczę też na kolejną część, która będzie kontyntuacją histori zawartą w tej części.

ps. 
Ciekawostka taka, ze ukończenie tej gry zajeło mi dokładnie tyle samo czasu ile poprzednią część :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198239096910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2308, 'last_played': 1510416505}
review:
Как же меня бесят эти люди, которые жалуются на ИИ, мол NPC тупые. Я играл в прошлой части на сложности "Гоблин", то есть самой высокой. Это был реальный челлендж. Тут "Гоблин" это тоже высокий уровень сложности, но есть выше, то есть "Мастер". "Мастера" я брать испугался, взял "Гоблина".

Вы не поверите, но 1. ИИ научился видеть пальцы Стикса, держащегося за перила, 2. ИИ теперь волнуется когда я потушил факел, открыл дверь, 3. ИИ паникует если он хоть чуть-чуть вас увидел при тушении факела или открытии двери, 4. ИИ не глухой и слышит теперь открытия дверей, 5. ИИ имеет зрение на 160 градусов не только на уровне глаз, но и на уровне ног, 6. ИИ стал лучше видеть в темноте.

Я сравнивал с прошлой частью, так что по мне ИИ сделали не гораздо, но лучше..

author: {'steamid': '76561198320575631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2509, 'last_played': 1522405822}
review:
這個名字很酷的哥布林盜賊大師，原本是之前公司一款RPG遊戲中的角色。2014年單為了他出了同名前傳，硬派潛行暗殺主題。STEAM上的歷史評價是極度好評。

3月14日白色情人節出了續集，但是不掛2.0，而取了個新的副標：黑暗碎片

總之Styx名字酷雖酷 (冥河)，其實是個滿嘴碎念憤世嫉俗的老綠皮，愛錢愛嗑藥，死了都不忘記念你一頓。

全劇中古奇幻風格，充滿黑色幽默。你就想像巫師換了個矮醜怪物做主角，然後系統全改成專注潛行，無關潛行的元素全簡化到最低限度。

基本上一血，血瓶是拿來解渴的。一代的小BUG修正了不少，但是仍然有極少機會爬不過去按跳卻自動跳上頂端被敵人發現的問題。地圖重複的問題第6關才開始。AI不聰明，但是警戒時桌底桶子樓梯夾層都會搜索。


最值得一提的是，各關的遊戲目標是可變動的！

你原本要躲進XX混上OO。成功的話......就成功了。

但是如果過程中你觸發太多次警報，遊戲目標會變動：OO嚇跑了。你得搶個TT去追！

追上OO後，原本目標是竄改OO的PP計畫，然後渡過MM。成功的話......就成功了。

但是如果過程中你錯殺了GG，遊戲目標再次變動：你得自己JJ！ (老天，為了不劇透我到底說了甚麼......)

大大提高遊戲可重玩價值，而且多麼有趣！

很推薦喜歡潛行遊戲的同好一起體驗這遊戲。

author: {'steamid': '76561197965463874', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1538104128}
review:
If you've played Styx: Master of Shadows then you're going to notice they practically made the same game here.  Besides the obvious facelift, the game is virtually the same: Go from point A to point B on a set amount of maps then <plot twist> and do the reverse from point B to point A for all the same maps (again) just like the first.  For what it is, it's an ok game.  I don't think they'll get away with this the 3rd time around though.  The game abruptly ends at the height of the story so it's clear they plan on making a 3rd.  

I'd recommend this game if you're a fan but if they do the same thing again for a 3rd time, then don't.  This was already easily predictable and personally I find the replay value quite boring.  Game is ok for a one time run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171290226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1491873208}
review: Styx is very good at the stealth aspect that makes it great, however if you fail at the stealth you will be punished by the parry mechanic. This game is ment to be pure stealth as in you get detected you're dead. The maps are well designed, even though some are reused and the story is alright.  I can appreciate the headstrung thief attitude but Styx can be annoying at times with his comments like he's trying too hard. overall If you're looking for a really stealthy game I reccomend you give Styx a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970368400', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1816, 'last_played': 1613939763}
review:
Ich habe jetzt ca. 60% des Spiels abgeschlossen, und es macht mir weiterhin sehr viel Spaß. 

Die Entwickler haben viele Schwächen des Vorgängers verbessert. So gibt es jetzt z.B. abgestuft Belohnungspunkte für Zeit, Medallien und (vermiedene) Kills. Neues Zubehör wie Dietriche, Giftpfeile und Säureminen ermöglichen neue taktische Herangehensweisen. Auch gibt es neue Gegner wie z.B. Zwerge oder fliegende Amber-Insekten.

Das Leveldesign ist noch mal ein bisschen verbessert worden und ermöglicht viele verschiedene Herangehensweisen. Die Story wurde in den Tests als zu dünn kritisiert, mir gefällt sie jedoch. Das Spiel ist in englisch mit deutschen Untertiteln und meiner Meinung nach gut vertont. Die Grafik gefällt mir persönlich gut und die Systemvorraussetzungen bleiben dabei moderat, z.B. erlaubt bereits eine GTX 970 das Zuschalten sämtlicher Details. Das Spiel läuft bei mir auf zwei Rechnern absolut stabil und ist nicht ein einziges Mal abgestürzt, Bugs sind bisher nicht aufgetreten.

Negativ ist die Gegner-KI anzusehen, sie macht das Spiel ein wenig zu leicht. Und auch meine Hauptkritik am Vorgänger muss ich auch hier vorbringen: Die Entwickler haben wieder Levelrecycling betrieben. Als letzten negativen Punkt muss ich das Crafting Element des Spieles anbringen, es ist schlicht überflüssig.

Fazit: Wie auch beim Vorgänger gelang es den Entwicklern ein hervorragendes Schleichspiel mit einem herrlich unsympatischen mordenden Goblin zu entwickeln. Dabei bleibt der Preis sehr moderat, weshalb ich eine uneingeschränkte Empfehlung ausspreche!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024505945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1644344636}
review:
Antes de empezar decir que actualmente solo he jugado las 7 primeras misiones, pero es suficiente para introduciros este juego, vamos allá.
La mejor forma de empezar este pequeño analisis es con la siguiente frase: "Más de lo mismo". ¿Es esto algo malo? No, definitivamente no. De hecho, es justo lo contrario.
"Styx: Shards of Darkness" es la continuación directa de "Styx: Master of Shadows" y como tal no defrauda. Mapas enormes en los que te sientes perdidísimo, sigilo, personaje carismático, sigilo, gran menu de habilidades, sigilo... Pocas veces he dicho la palabra sigilo, pues es en lo que se basa el juego y lo tiene muy claro. Hay 4 dificultades, dos de ellas no te permiten combatir de ningun modo, si te ven date por muerto. Las mecánicas son las mismas que la precuela, no obstante, introducen una serie de mejoras en mi punto muy acertadas.
MEJORAS:
- Más habilidades que en la primera entrega, nunca están demás.
-Crafteo: Mucha gente se quejaba de esto en la caja de comentarios del trailer. Yo, personalmente, lo veo un acierto. Fomenta mucho más la exploración y te recompensa por ello. Por ejemplo: Antes como mucho nos encontrabamos algun frasco de ambar, pociones, o cuchillos, poca cosa. Ahora nos encontramos materiales que nos permitirán "teletransportarnos", crear dardos letales y no letales, crear pociones de ambar (lo equivalente al mana para los que no lo sepan)... Nos da una gran ventaja ante situaciones desesperadas y no tan desesperadas.
-Variedad de equipamiento: El DLC ya nos adelanta un poco lo que nos vamos a encontrar. Distintas misiones opcionales que nos permitirán obtener nuevas dagas y nuevas armaduras. El problema es que siempre te dan una ventaja y un inconveniente y ahí tienes que decidir tú si compensa o no. Más o menos lo mismo que pasaba en Dishonored (del cual haré un análisis en profundidad en breves que me gustaría mucho que le echarais un vistazo) con los talismanes corrompidos. Dependiendo de tu estilo de juego puede beneficiarte o no.
-Retos con distintas categorías: Una parte muy importante en su antecesor era conseguir puntos para desbloquear habilidades. Obviamente ahora se necesitan más puntos, pues hay más habilidades y para esto, han tenido la brillante idea de dividir los retos que te proponen en tres categorias; desde: Meh, no esta mal; pasando por: buen trabajo; hasta llegar a: eres un profesional. Lo que quiero decir con esto es que ahora los puntos obtenidos por no matar a nadie (Bondad), no detectado(Sombra) y robar todos los medallones (ladron) tienen 3 grados de calidad("orgulloso oro, mediocre plata y bochornoso bronce"). Ni que decir falta que con oro te dan mas puntos que con bronce. No sé, es una salida limpia a esas situaciones en las que no sabes como pasar por ese pasillo sin matar a alguien o llevas media hora buscando UN PUTO MEDALLÓN que no aparece por ningun lado. Recompensa al jugador por intentar hacer las cosas bien, sin tener que hacerlo perfecto(que en la primera partida es dificil), lo cual no le hace perder muchos puntos.
-Gameplay mejorado:Aunque el control sigue siendo prácticamente el mismo, yo lo encuentro más comodo y preciso. ¡¡Y POR FIN PUEDES GIRAR UNA ESQUINA CUANDO ESTAS COLGADO DE UNA CORNISA!!
-Cooperativo: Aunque no me ha dado tiempo a probarlo en detalle, la simple idea de jugar esto con un amigo en la maxima dificultad promete y mucho. No se como irá la conexión, lo dejo para más adelante.
-Chistes: Sigue habiendo y muchos, sin llegar a saturar. Destaco en especial una misión en la que hace referencia a Dishonored y Thief, juegos de los que bebe mucho. 10/10.
-Banda sonora: Muy buena, siguiendo los golpes fuertes del primer juego. Además, aquí cuando te descubren automaticamente hay un cambio en la música, no como en otros casos (ejem...fallout4...ejem) que empieza cuando la acción ya ha terminado.

CONTRAS
-Gráficamente es lo mismo, no hay mucha mejora respecto al anterior.
-Hubo una ocasión en la que juraría me dió un tirón de FPS, nada preocupante.
-En el apartado anterior mencione que el gameplay era prácticamente igual. Esto no es del todo cierto, hay un contra; y es que después de rodar, si lo que quieres es saltar, hay un segundo aproximadamente de cooldown. Directamente no te deja realizar el salto. Gran error, pero te acostumbras.

Respecto a la historia, poco que comentar la verdad puesto que no me ha dado tiempo a indagar mucho. Es del estilo de Master of Shadows, al principio no atrae mucho, pero sabes que algo se cuece. Supongo que acabará interesandote mucho más, lo comentaré más adelante.
EN RESUMEN, juego muy recomendado si te ha gustado la primera parte, y sino la has jugado...¿a qué esperas?

POSDATA: Si alguien quiere jugar cooperativo que no dude en agregarme. Podemos poner chat para hacerlo más divertido y más compenetrado.
