author: {'steamid': '76561198023214459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1489765107}
review:
Pretty good hardcore stealth game. Styx: Shards of Darkness managed to improve almost every aspect that felt unpolished in the first game, as well as implement a couple of new features to make it feel even more satisfying and rewarding.

Gameplay: 8/10 - Extremely fun and engaging. Feels like a step in the right direction comparing to the first game with improved perks and customisation options.

Art: 7/10 - Makes a massive leap comparing to the first title. Considering it being not a complete "AAA" game, all environments and characters look pretty good, however animations could use extra polish.

Sound: 7/10 - Solid sound design. Music doesn't provide anything special, but it works.

Story: 6/10 - The story throughout the game was actually GREAT. But there is no point in making interesting and complex story with an absolutely abysmal ending.

Final score: 7/10 - If you are looking for stealth games on par with original "Thief" or "Splinter Cell" - get it NOW.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021983999', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1577970472}
review:
I'm gonna keep this short!

Its a major improvement on the first one in almost every aspect. The controls feel better, the leveldesign is much more open and vertical and the graphic looks great. While Styx: Master of Shadows looked a bit dated due to using die UE3, Styx: Shards of Darkness uses UE4 and it shows. 

On top of that you get to find/craft different gear (daggers and outfits) with different bonuses and penalties. Nothing which really overpowers you but supports different gameplay styles.

The game took me 15 hours to complete on my first run on the second difficulty level with not doing all side missions which is IMO a good length for a game like this. However, I will still keep playing it for completing the game on higher difficulty and doing some of the challenges. With challenges and the open level design there is a good amount of replayability in this game if you are into this kind of stuff (like in the Hitman games completing levels in different ways).

There is also a co-op mode for the whole campaign which I plan to try out as soon as some of my friends get the game.

It can be a bit rough around the edges sometimes and at times you can feel it is no AAA game but there is nothing really bad which bugged me much during playing the game. The only thing that comes to my mind right now is the first boss fight, which was mostly boring and annoying IMO.

Still TL;DR?
If you liked the first one you can definitely get Shards of Darkness. 
If you like stealth games this is defninitely a good one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276383313', 'num_games_owned': 2410, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 1587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1489929938}
review:
Styx Shards of Darkness More of a Half Step than a Sequel Shards of Darkness is the Sequel to Master of Shadows.But with its own self contained story, so you don’t need to play any of the past games to be able to hop right in…
This is more of Master of Shadows, but at the same time almost completely different.Theres are 9 missions total here.. but these missions are half the length of the first game.Taking me anywhere from an hr to an hr and a half to complete… the game took me about 12 hours to complete. But its much less about mastering the shadows here… 
All of the basic assassinations you had to unlock in the past game are unlocked from the start with a new set of skills to master… And while Shards of Darkness Improves in many areas Master of Shadows struggle, It also fails in areas Master of Shadows had down perfect… Much like the last game, Shards of Darkness puts you in an open level with a dagger and some potions, and its up to you to make to the different task locations and then make it back to your hide out.
Things are much more casual and straight forward this time, You still have your sand to throw at torches, but they never felt useful here… You now also have to gather materials to craft items and potions instead of refill at base.. 
Sounds like a good idea. but materials are way to rare here.. really testing your stealth skills.. Im horrible at stealth, so I found it to be a bit annoying… And you can call in a clone, but gone are the clone puzzles and distracting.. and because of that the clone turns into a consumable skill like turning invisable. This time however you're able to create or become a perfect clone in an online co op mode. As a perfect clone you have all of your skills and items, but you can't parry in combat and you die in one hit,and if either you or your partner dies you can brign the other back to life by sacrificing half of your health. And speaking of combat, they somehow managed to make it worse.They got rid of the auto locking which is great.. youre free to run which was the thing that held the original games experience down so much… but because of this.. .parrying can be awakward, as youll a lot of the time be too close to parry while the enemy can still damage you,pretty annoying,but don’t worry. besides the first few levels. pretty much every enemy is invulnerable. So youre not gonna be needing those darggers too much… The game overall and the levels here at first feel polished and a nice change of pace, But by level 3 you realize they all look and feel the same.They feel like a broom closet compared to the shoe closet master of shadows was. They're small and compact and feel copy and paste rather than hand crafted and grand . They even went as far as reusing levels for 3 of the final missions. 
A massive disappointment, as the level design was one of my favorite things about this series… Its still fun though..sneaking through vents.Dealing with new annoying enemies like dwarves that can smell you making hiding useless plus theyre invulnerable and even worse there are some of your favorite annoying enemies making a return like the beatles that spit at you..thankfully you're able to kill them like regular guards this time, and the mission structure has improved greatly… they’ll have you retracing your steps as youre running around to sabotage or assassinate a target,it isn’t just getting from point a to b.. there are even some boss battles in here. that if youre wondering if theyre as bad as the maste of shadows ends boss,im pleased to say that these 2 boss battles were 2 of the most memorable moments in the game… And of coruse the jokes and game references are all over here both in game and at your death screen.Which is another improvmement.. load times… they still need work but are miles better than they were .
Shards of Darkness is a mixed bag of emotions.. I love the change in combat, the fact that we have real skills available from the start, improved mission structure, less grindy story,faster load times, better bosses, but the forced do not get detected sections of the game, the lack of materials to actually craft with the crafting system, the amount of invulnerable enemeies, the tiny repetitive maps… it stops this game from surpassing the first… It felt more of a rush through stealth game than a calculating, pick your targets, take them out one by one, im goblin batman, like I came to love from the original game… I was doing more avoiding enemies and the world than I was engaging with it… I give Styx: Shards of Darkness a 7/10

PROS
+Solid sneak and stealth-kill gameplay
+Styx is an entertaining, fourth-wall breaking star
+Decent graphics and production design
+Co-op mode
+Gorgeous visuals crafted in Unreal Engine 4
+Superior PC performance

Cons
-Feels old-fashioned
-Poor combat
-Climbing controls; stilted facial animations; lack of developed characters other than Styx
-Mediocre skill tree system
-Useless parry mechanic

Neutral
=Styx' sense of humor

-Conclusion-
Shards of Darkness feels like a breath of fresh air in the stealth genre. It’s a game that borrows heavily from other franchises, but one that has enough panache and personality to pull off a unique approach. While the story is mysterious, yet unremarkable, the game remains entertaining through sheer strength of will, and a generous helpful of sarcasm and smart humour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068784448', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 1453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1579203225}
review:
Well, I completed this. Really, really good stealth game.

Awesome level design, dozens of possible ways how each objective can be completed.
Simple stealth system- shadows, noises, sometimes smell, and a bunch of hiding spots. No fancy stuff, just good old stealth.
Characters and story... Can't say they are bad, but I did not really pay attention to all of that, although some NPC talks are interesting. Also, Styx is good at breaking 4th wall, with little references here and there.
Graphics look okay, and I'm glad it runs well on my pc, thanks for lowered requirements and optimization.

Controls could be a bit wonky sometimes, especially on ropes and some cliffs.
Bunch of ways to kill enemy, but you will get less points for killing people, so, just like in Dishonored, it punishes you for a bit of fun.
Some skills I almost never used- like, from alchemy tree I used only a few lockpicks, amber potions and odor potions, not much else. idk, didn't feel like I needed all those consumables. Or assassin tree, where none of the skills were really useful for me cuz I didn't kill.

So yeah, it's a great game overall, I really like it.

review:
전작에 비해서 맵이 커지고 복잡해져서 난이도가 올라간 느낌이지만
그래도 전작처럼 서브 퀘스트 달성하면서 Swiftness, Shadow, Mercy 동시에 클리어 가능한 난이도네요.
다만 Swiftness 금메달 달성 조건이 너무 빡빡합니다.
그리고 마스터 난이도는 저장을 지원하지 않아서 마스터 난이도에서 불살 루트 뚫다가 죽거나 들키면 현자타임이 오네요.
그래도 스틱스는 재밌습니다. 고블린의 컨셉을 잘 살린 잠입은 심장을 두근거리게 합니다.
이번작 들어서 새롭게 추가된 유리병은 완전 완소템이에요. 
다만 아쉬운 점은 전작에도 있었던 트리거 미발동 버그와 npc의 이동경로가 꼬이는 현상이 이번작에도 여전하다는 것입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220029324', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1505403155}
review:
首先这款游戏我是推荐的，其次请认准这是神潜行作，和普遍认知的暗杀有区别
《冥河:暗影碎片》玩到现在一个序章，两个任务章，就算总进度的10%，可以看出总剧情真心短，别看我玩了差不多9个小时，那是因为我有强迫症，作为一款完完全全潜行不可正面的游戏，我硬是三章都把人全屠了，地图全跑了，物品全找了，直接玩的想吐血。
总的来说：
暗杀机制：比前作好很多
暗杀技能：都是为了潜行而生，讲真，全局玩完你能点满两个分支就不错了，追求速度通关的无限点隐身，喜欢像我这样一路屠过去的，首点匕首然后点分身
暗杀手法：等你把人杀了去逛图时你才会发现官方暗杀路线是神马？从没见过，要那么套路干啥？追求所有图全屠的我来说只存在时间问题，世界上没有我杀不了的人（式）
武器机制：怎一个坑字了得，我只能说完全是为了配合官方手法而出的，不适合那种喜欢溜的人玩
画面：笔记本玩的，开得低，上飞船你就知道了，不多做评论，起码不卡就行
建筑：设计不错，翻的不错，最高点都可翻，各种截图点，可以的，很强势
音乐：存在这个？除了预警音，已心无外物
剧情：目前我只能说短，至于剧本好不好，玩完又说吧
BUG：看着两个大男人互相正面和尸体鬼畜的我还能说什么，后期会更新修复吧，不影响体验
优化：很好，960M没毛病，可以的
然后：就是我当初之所以入坑的原因：哥布林是魔兽情怀，双人模式才是看点，然后呢……多人模式没人，槽奈，玩通关又去找个人一起安利吧
最后：貌似没啥好说的，个人还是很喜欢这种潜行才是王道的暗杀游戏，耻辱，信条什么的也是够了
就到这吧，才开始，评测就这样，玩完又来补吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198121929547', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1489759494}
review:
游戏属于硬核潜行，主角很弱小，正面刚基本没戏，强迫你去潜行，但是即使是潜行中，也会出现一些无法处理的敌人，所以这个游戏潜行基本都是绕开敌人，只有在需求特殊奖励的时候才会去主动处理敌人，游戏性上和羞辱类似，达成任务目标有多种完成方式

画面上，960m开中特效阴影关低全程60帧，优化很好，但是即使材质开到最高，一些贴图还是菜的要死，画面属于和暗影魔多一样，远看还行，近看就菜了

游戏现在还没什么版本更新，基本上各种BUG，敌人被卡主，敌人设计路线出错，在一个地方转圈，读取存档敌人位置还变化，流程上我玩的比较慢，12个小时打完所有章节，剧情上就不剧透了，只能透露一下，根据结尾，估计还想做下一部

author: {'steamid': '76561198038051609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1490088494}
review:
If like me you were a fan of the original this sequel will scratch your stealth itch. It's a "more of the same" sequel, more or less, with a couple of new skills and whatnot, but it doesn't seem to be much of a different gaming experience. And that is a good thing!

Edit: (After finishing)

It really follows the original beat for beat. It has Styx revisiting previous levels with different missions, there's a level where you have no equipment. It's good stuff, especially if you just wanted more of the same good stuff.

Only 2 boss fights but they are both about acrobatics, unlike the original's sudden focus on combat for the boss battle. They are a little annoying but nothing too major.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007215017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1490446726}
review:
After a 3 hours in game with goblin difficulty it is clear that Styx 2 delivers one of the best stealth games there is.

Gameplay is really good, there was one time I thought there was a bug with robes. Well the bug was on me as I did not understand how to use them. Actually Styx way is better that that usual side to side swinning.
Stealth is the core and it is exelent. You are given tools to do stuff in many ways. And stealth is a key as little antihero cant really beat humans in fair combat. NOT FOR ACTION GAMERS!

No bugs at all so far for me.

Maps are huge, open and full of diffrent routes and places to explore. Visuals are really good and so are the sounds.
Game performance is just fine.

So how is Styx?

Well he is using dry humour but you can actually skip those "you are dead lines" though there are some funny ones.
So far in game Styx does not speak to often and then when he speaks he actually tells about the place , lore etc. 
I am actually little surprised about reviews like RPS that lifted Styx chracter to be a huge problem. Well it surely is not a problem if you are no overly sencitive.

AI could be better, but hey is there a game that did nor have this same fault? :D

Styx 2 is a real stealth gem! 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030469239', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1409, 'last_played': 1580311476}
review:
I changed my mind about this game after paying it a second time.
First problem is the story, which is nowhere near the story of the first game. It also creates a lot of plot holes just for the sake of some references.
Second is clunky controls. Pretty much nothing was changed since the first game and I can't even count how many times I died because character refused to grab onto a rock or jumped too far.
Third is a lack of new mechanics and abilities. Even "amber vision" became worse than in the first game, because you can't see s**t in the dark when using it. Also I don't understand why it turns off after random period after pressing right stick.
Forth is cutscenes. Some of them are great, but most are really badly animated.
Also, the ending is a cliffhanger. So I can't really recommend it to anyone, especially to the fans of the first game.

review:
貴方は死亡しましただと？ふざけんじゃねぇぞ「俺が」死んだんだよ！！！！--------Styx



パッと見でわかるけどゴブリンが主人公のステルスゲーム。ゲロ吐いて分身生成したり、突如透明になったり、周囲に物質感知みたいな能力の目も持っている。お前まともじゃねぇぞ。

難易度次第かも知れないが基本的に複数の敵に囲まれると勝ち目はない。主人公は凄い奴だけどまぁ所詮はゴブリンだからね。
音を立てず視界から外れ見つからずに進むか、逆に音を立てて陽動してもいい、もしくは敵の真上のオブジェクトを落として間接的に始末したり、飲食物にゲロ吐いて即効性の毒物に変えることも出来る。ゴブリンのゲロは人を殺す。

直接暗殺を試みる場合も、素早く始末出来るが大きな音が発生してしまう方法か、音を立てずに始末出来るが押さえつけるのに時間がかかってしまう方法かの選択肢がある。人間と体格差があるからね、しょうがないね。


過去の暗殺者になりきってエデンの果実をどうこうするゲームみたいに敵に見つかってもまとめて面倒見てやれるようなゲームではないよ。まぁステルスゲームだからね。

author: {'steamid': '76561197968076117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 1182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1182, 'last_played': 1490287208}
review:
Da ich den ersten Teil nicht gespielt habe und gleich mit dem zweiten Teil einsteige (Also ohne Vergleich zum ersten Teil) hier ein neutrales und nicht Fan-Bezogenes Review.

Spiel ist von der Steuerung sehr gut gelungen.
Auch die öfters angemaulte Problematik mit ungenauer Steuerung an Seilen etc. kann ich nicht nachvollziehen. 
Spiele jedoch mit Maus und Tastatur. 
Controler ... kein Kommentar möglich. 

Durch den Prolog wird man sehr gut an die Hand genommen und in die Spielemechanik eingeführt. 

Grafik ist dank Unreal 4 Engine Top und läuft super auf meinem nicht mehr so neuen Rechner ... mit allem auf Epic.

Kommentare von Styx sind witzig und abwechslungsreich.

Level sind sehr gut aufgebaut und obwohl oftmals eine Art Schlauch-Level vorhanden ist (A nach B) gibt es unzählige Wege den Weg zu beschreiten ohne das es öde wird. 

Den Multiplayer-Coop habe ich nicht getestet ... insofern auch kein Kommentar möglich. 
Aber das Spiel ist eh mehr als Singleplayer gedacht und der Coop denke ich ist nur Gymmick.

Leider ist das Ende recht enttäuschend. 
Man ist eigentlich total überrascht wenn plötzlich geschrieben steht das man durch ist. 
Da hätte ich dann doch mehr erwartet. 

Dennoch ... Alles in Allem kann ich Styx - Shades of Darkness bedenkenlos empfehlen. 
Für den Preis von regulär derzeit 40 Euro bekommt man ein solides Spiel. 
Klarer Daumen hoch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014722119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1629760601}
review:
6 hours in, and I think I have a decent enough grasp on this game to give it a fair review:

To begin, I'm going to list what is PRAISEWORTHY of the game, then list what I DISLIKED.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Styx is an old school stealth game. I'm talking about old-school Thief games. To be honest, that's all this game is and to be honest I *LOVE* it. It's a third-person stealth game that has you sneaking around places, extinguishing torches and kinda pushes you towards never being spotted and not killing anybody (you get medals for being fast, unseen and being merciful).

The main character is really freakin' charming. I love Styx, and I love how crude he is. He cusses out everyone, makes jokes and just talks trash 24/7. He insults you, he insults his friends, and he insults his enemies. It's really funny and I saw some other reviewer complaining about it. It's really endearing, because the devs don't actually want to tell the player "fuck you," it's just a character. And to be honest, I'm really glad to have one who is so non-sequitor and unique like Styx. He's probably on my list of one of my favorite protagonists I've seen in a very, very, very long time.

The maps have the perfect balance of size and detail. They're open-ended, but not so big that you get lost. The environments have a very good flow and let you direct your own traffic through a given level. You can choose to do some perilous jumps across big chasms, or to quickly dodge between boxes and guards. It's some of the best level design layouts I've seen in a while. Since my rig is beginning to be dated, I had to run the game on Medium and it's still really nice looking. Every level takes a theme and turns it up to 10. The run-down shanty village could not look more like a run-down shanty village. The stone fortress built into a mountain has everything you'd think a stone fortress built into a mountain would have, and then more. There are libraries, docks, kitchens, guard towers, living quarters all put in and decorated with tons of attention to detail everywhere.

As a stealth game, the stealth mechanics are really satisfying. Sticking right behind a guard as he patrols feels really good, and when I make a close call with a patrolling guard it's really exciting. Likewise, when you miscalculate a jump and land smack dab in the middle of a busy area with tons of guards around, the scramble to find somewhere safe to hide is really nuts too. When you make a crazy life-or-death jump and grab a ledge just by the hair on your chinny-chin chin it plays a loud violin chord, which really gives you a sense of "holy shit I can't believe I actually did that." To be honest, it's a really welcome relief from most of the kill-everyone-around genres of stealth that have been out recently (Splintercell, MGS:V etc).

** IF YOU LIKE TO KILL EVERY ENEMY IN THE MAP HOWEVER, KEEP READING BECAUSE HERE'S WHERE I LIST THE BAD STUFF
-----------------------------------------------------------
Ok, so good thing aside here's what I objectively think that the game did poorly on:

The combat is really awful. It consists of left-clicking to parry, then left-clicking again to execute enemies. You die in 2-3 from anything on Normal difficulty. The game pushes you towards a non-lethal approach, but I'm still going to tack this on because some people will dislike this facet. When you kill an enemy, Styx just jumps on their back and stabs them with a knife (loud execution) or chokes them out for a long drawn-out time and then stabs them with a knife. They're both very static executions, don't look satisfying to watch, and you get punished for it. To do drop-down executions, you need to unlock an ability first. You can't craft half of your lethal equipment without speccing into the Alchemy tree.
** EVEN WHEN YOU DO GET SOME OF THESE FUN THINGS THOUGH, THE GAME PUNISHES YOU FOR IT: Killing enemies reduces your "mercy" scoring, which means you get less skill points to level up your abilities (even your non-lethal abilities!). I'm totally fine with non-lethal playstyles, but I absolutely hate when games try to force choices like this on people and give them the illusion of choice. Of course I'm going to not stab anybody, I want the skill points so I can get more abilities!

The voice acting isn't great. Maybe this is just me being nitpicky, but the non-unique human characters have two voice actors: One regular white dude, and some country bumpkin who usually replies to him. Styx also sounds kind of weird, but I'm not an expert on audio terms so all I can say is that the quality doesn't sound 100% to me, that's all. The sound effects for everything else in-game does its job, and aside from the orchestral chords when you land a crazy jump I can't think of anything noteworthy.

This isn't a bad thing to me, but some other reviewer really put this in the best way possible: The devs seem afraid of their own worldbuilding. This doesn't bother me, but don't expect to be tossed into some kind of believeable fantasy world with some intricate deep plot. It's a stealth game, and the whole goblin/elf thing is just a backdrop for the game. In the tutorial level, there's a pocket-sand meme in the first two seconds. The character breaks the fourth wall constantly, makes pop-culture references to other stealth games and other internet jokes. I really think the game is self-aware as to how un-serious it is and focuses more on gameplay than worldbuilding, but please don't mistake this for a narrative driven game. It's a stealth game with narrative in it, moreso.

There's also some quirks with trying to attach to ledges that are at weird angles, but to be honest it's a minor gripe. Sometimes if you try jumping off a ledge and you want to grab a different ledge that's on the other side of a pillar, bumping into the pillar will kind of just bounce you off it slightly and make you fall down to either a) your doom b) the floor.
--------------------------------------------------
TL;DR:
+ Funny non-sequitor main character
+ Very good environments
+ Top notch old-school stealth gameplay
+ Good at setting atmosphere with audio cues

- Awful combat and executions, game is obviously meant to be non-lethal but why give the option for killing then?
- Sub-par voice acting
- Low immersion level, setting is basically just a backdrop to gameplay
- Some stupid ledge thing I was whining about


If you like Stealth games, buy Styx. If you don't like Stealth games, do not buy Styx. Simple as that
7/10 good game

author: {'steamid': '76561198129417572', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1593444534}
review:
Well it finally came out, and I was not let down (mostly).

Styx: Shards of Darkness does a great job of refining everything the original laid out, the bigger budget surely has improved the graphics and gameplay elements, bringing new items, costumes and daggers to the game's aid. However certain things like cutscenes could have been improved greatly early game, as the introduction scene looks like a child with SFM made it, but later on the cutscenes look a lot more fluid and human (or goblin if you like).

Storywise I believe that the devs have delivered another great story, this time around not focusing on the development of Styx himself, but rather the world around him. Nevertheless the game comes through on bringing back the Styx we know and love to an extent. Most reviews I've read complain about the "countless pop-culture references and dead memes", but after finishing the game on goblin difficulty and putting in 12 hours, I have to disagree. Sure Styx makes some jabs at other giants in the stealth genre, such as his assassins creed joke and dishonored joke (and even a bioshock one at the end of the game) but he does not pop out references every ten seconds. Well, only if you die, but then again that should be taken into account as a non-canonical interaction with the player, albeit Styx does also on occaison talk directly to you in-game too. 

I also have to say that I really did not like the ending, it left a poor taste in my mouth and did not end the game well, making me wonder if we will have to wait for a third enstallment in Styx's journey or if a DLC will release at some point to continue the tale.

Overall I have very little issues with the game, apart from the occaisonal glitching AI or the hilariously bad sword aim of the dark elves. And I'd have to say that this is definitely a good sequel to its predecessor.

9/10 A must play for stealth fans and fans of the original.

review:
This is definitly a worthy sucessor to the original Styx: Masters of Shadows. The gameplay has been massivly improved with new features, better graphics & a bigger story. Make sure to play at least goblin difficulty, as master difficulty is just the same as goblin, but with checkpoints & no manual saving (which is cool if you like that).

The only thing i have to complain at is Styx new personality. He used to be this sarcastic, amoral anti-hero, now he's been revamped into a pop-culture referencing, deadpool-wannabe that can't shut the f--k up with his cringey, unfunny jokes & constant whining. Thankfully you can skip those scene, but this is really one small annoyance that might not even be relevant to others. If you like the original game, you won't be disappointed.

review:
Ok, so I guess I'm recommending this game because in the latest update a keyboard issue -was- fixed.  I can finally move right, and the game is now playable...   EXCEPT THE KEYBOARD ISSUES ARE STILL A HUGE MESS.

I was willing to pay for this game again specifically because my original issue (first review) was in the 'fixed' list.  When I reinstalled and loaded up, I still could not move right.  After some googling and clearing of data, I got another absolutely fresh installation of the game without remnants of the last installation, and after booting, I could move!  Finally I could turn right!

I thought everything was well until I jumped over into the keyboard controls to rebind... Unfortunately, still a joke.  There is still no user override when you want to bind a key that is already being used for another action, forcing you to preemptively rebind every action unused keys... just so you can rebind them to the keys you want.  At least I was already a pro at this from my last rebinding forays.  

So everything rebound and set, I start up and... well the things that happened were very very confusing for a few seconds.  My keys were rebound alright... but to random actions...  Great.  I guess the keyboard issue isn't fixed after all.  It took another wipe of the game data to get it going again.

Like I said, I'll give it a recommend because I CAN play the game now, but I really wish that I could play comfortably, without worrying about base game issues like keyboard input ffs.  It really gives the game an unfinished feel.

   

~~First Review:  

Refunded. I was able to play for about 30 seconds, realizing my 'move right' key did not work whatsoever. After a grueling rebind, constantly being told I'm unable to rebind keys, it still didn't work. At this point, the game is unplayable. 

I'm also sure in at least one of the advertisements I saw something like "Runs Great with Razer Hardware." Well I run only Razer periferals... that leads me to believe this game was rushed out the door and hardly play tested. Pretty disappointed after playing the first game...

author: {'steamid': '76561197987658658', 'num_games_owned': 1431, 'num_reviews': 341, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1489654606}
review:
https://youtu.be/CmS3CIa1fAo
Jeu disponible en français pour tous les textes.
Les voix sont en anglais, leur doublage va du risible à l'acceptable ( pour Styx notamment)

Un gobelin moche, un gobelin blagueur, un gobelin fragile, un gobelin cynique, voilà enfin un héros qui me ressemble en tout point

Il s’agit d’un jeu d’infiltration dans lequel vous dirigez un petit gobelin très fragile, votre personnage ne sait pas vraiment se battre face aux ennemis, votre seule chance de survie est d’éviter au maximum les combats en passant d’une zone d’ombre à l’autre et en se la jouant discret.

La principale qualité de Stix : Shards of Shadow est la complexité de ses niveaux : les niveaux sont grands et très verticaux, ils proposent de multiples entrées et de multiples sorties pour la réalisation de vos objectifs. Le jeu propose donc une rejouabilité assez importante puisqu’il y a différentes manières d’atteindre un même objectif et dans un jeu d’infiltration, c’est un élément important.

Prenons un exemple : pour entrer dans un bâtiment, Styx peut choisir de passer par les rochers en hauteur ou de passer au niveau du sol par la porte : l’entrée ne sont pas protégées de la même manière et donc chaque point d’entrée peut avoir une difficulté différente, la porte d’entrée étant probablement beaucoup plus difficile que l’entrée par le dessus.

Styx a des compétences qu’il peut utiliser en utilisant un liquide qu’il appelle ambre. L’ambre sert donc à utiliser les différentes compétences, au nombre de 4: nous avons une invisibilité, nous avons un clone etc.

le jeu propose également un système de Craft qui permet de créer des potions survie, des potions d’ambre, des fléchettes empoisonnées, des fléchettes qui provoquent des maux de ventre aux ennemis les neutralisant pour un certain temps, etc. ce système de Craft requiert que vous récoltiez les différentes ressources qui sont disséminées dans le niveau. Il faut donc fouiller un peu et ne pas forcément rusher l'objectif. Il y a aussi des objectifs secondaires qui rapportent des points.

Les missions finissent donc par être longues : comptez au minimum une demi-heure pour terminer une mission dans sa globalité. C’est une grande qualité du jour les missions sont longues, les niveaux sont complexes et il propose une grande jouabilité ainsi qu’un système de Craft sympathique.

Styx a également un arbre de compétences divisées en quatre branches : une branche « combat et assassinats » que je n’utiliserai probablement jamais puisque le mon objectif est de terminer le jeu en infiltration totale.
Une branche artisanat qui permet de débloquer de nouvelles recettes. Une branche repérage qui permet de repérer plus facilement, les objectifs les ennemis aux alentours et une branche discrétion qui permet de développer les compétences d’infiltration de notre cher Styx (faire moins de bruit en tombant, ne plus faire de bruit en étant invisible etc.)

Les points nécessaires au développement de l’arbre de compétences sont récoltés en réussissant les objectifs principaux et les objectifs secondaires ainsi qu’en gagnant des médailles, il y a différents types de médailles : médaille rapidité, médaille silencieux, médaille pas d’assassinat… Le jeu encourage donc l’infiltration totale, ce qui est un peu dommage, j’aurais bien voulu une médaille « meurtrier sanguinaire’ » par exemple. 

Après, les médailles ne sont pas contraignantes, libre à vous de jouer au psychopathe ou non après tout.

En fonction de vos performances, vous recevez une médaille qui s’accompagne d’un nombre de points de compétences plus ou moins important.

Passons maintenant aux défauts du jeu :

Le principal défaut du jeu et son intelligence artificielle : en effet les ennemis sont vraiment idiots vous repèrent très difficilement et quand ils vous repèrent ne vous pourchassent pas très longtemps, ainsi s’ils me repèrent derrière une caisse, ils ne vont pas aller derrière la caisse pour voir si je suis encore ils vont s’arrêter juste avant permettant de rester à la même place. On évitera également de parler des situations dans laquelle je me retrouve face à eux sans protection à 2 m et qu’il ne me repère pas. C’est vraiment un gros défaut du jeu qui est heureusement compensé par la complexité de ces niveaux et par la diversité des approches disponibles mais garder cela en tête malgré tout. Ce défaut est également compensé par le nombre d’ennemis, très nombreux et qui se croisent très souvent.

L’autre défaut du jeu, peut-être plus secondaire, est l’humour du jeu. Styx est un petit rigolo, il fait des blagues constantes, brise le quatrième mur de manière continue et sans honte. Au début, on trouve ça rigolo mais on finit par rapidement se lasser de ces commentaires à chaque fois qu’il meurt. Ferme ta grande bouche.

Le troisième défaut une certaine rigidité dans les mouvements et dans les sauts qui m’a coûté la vie plus d’une fois déjà cela dit on finit par s’habituer et à force on arrive à prendre le contrôle des sauts de manière beaucoup plus naturelle.

En conclusion, un très bon  jeu d’infiltration, qui n’égale pas le côté bac à sable foutoir et absolument hilarant de Hitman mais qui propose des situations et des chemins suffisamment variés ainsi qu’un univers suffisamment rigolo que pour qu’on y passe un excellent moment, un jeu que je vous conseille.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198113725166', 'num_games_owned': 1478, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1619964785}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness is hands-down one of my favourite stealth game experiences to date.

The scope of the levels, the hidden, optional secondary objectives, minor yet worthwhile amount of collectible hunting and the fantastic customisation options, level mastery and multiple routes make it worth replaying more than once. That's to say nothing of playing it with a friend in co-op, which I have yet to experience but look forward to greatly!

At 16hrs I'm at 91% on Normal difficulty, having yet to speed-run, total-stealth or non-lethal all of the 9 missions. The sheer verticality of the levels makes the platforming a constantly dangerous gameplay mechanic, and despite some minor ledge-grabbing annoyances here and there I find the climbing and rope-swinging mechanics far superior to the previous game in the series. The rope swinging is infact one of the smoothest and most logical I have ever experienced.

The choices made within the skill-tree felt like they made a difference, and since each level can be approached in multiple ways due to the sprawling open-ended nature of a lot of areas, no skill-choice left me feeling locked out of anything. Some of the skills are great, some are a bit lackluster but all serve their purpose masterfully and are appreciated.

The level design is superb, never at odds with the fantasy setting and the previously mentioned verticality makes for some seriously LOOMING caverns and cliff edges. I don't think I've ever felt higher up in a videogame.

The comedy/fourth-wall breaking? Personally I love it, but my sense of humour is somewhat dark and surreal. If you're the kind of person who worries about the jokes 'breaking immersion' in a game where you're playing as a goblin thief with a potty-mouth, I'm honestly not sure what to say; it might frustrate you at times. I laughed even after frustrating deaths because Styx would berate me or scream a curse at me as he fell to his death, something which WAS present in the first game despite a lot of statements to the contrary. Turn off the voice dialogue if it bothers you, and skip the cutscenes; you'll still get an enjoyable stealth experience without the arguably decent storyline.

Some Gripes:
==========
The AI suffers from some minor issues with getting stuck in the environment after investigating a noise, but in general the detection system is logical and works well in both light-and-shadow sneaking and cover-based sneaking. 
Any issues I experienced could easily (and hopefully) be patched in the upcoming performance update. 

The combat is...well, it's a stealth game.
Enemies kill you in 1-2 hits on Normal difficulty, while higher difficulties remove the ability to parry or survive a single hit. It's clear the developers are focusing on improving the stealth aspect of the genre and ignoring combat for the most part. I'm glad of this because the genre is seriously lacking, since most stealth games are catering to run-and-gunners now! However the parrying could do with some tuning, it's often slower than it needs to be, despite being vastly improved.
=========

All in all, definitely worth the ridiculously low-price of admission. I'd have been satisfied to buy this at the usual €60 for a new release, getting it at €35 is a downright steal considering the level of love, detail and quality put in by the devs. If I'd made this game myself, I'd be proud; 
It's a solid experience you shouldn't miss, especially for the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198161893349', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1514812990}
review:
Styx : Shard of Darkness, est un jeu d’infiltration développé et édité par des Français Cyanide studio ainsi que Focus Home Interactive. Ce jeu vous permet de contrôler Styx, le seul gobelin capable de parler.

Les points positifs du jeu sont :
•	Des superbes graphismes.
•	Un système d’infiltration presque unique.
•	Des points de compétence afin de débloquer de nouvelle mécanique de jeu.
•	Un super background.
•	Une belle histoire même si quelques rebondissements sont prévisibles.
•	Les blagues que Styx fait ainsi que les dialogues post mortem.
•	Une superbe BO
•	Il y a un système d’artisanat.
•	Un système d’équipement.
•	De la coopération

Les points négatifs du jeu sont :
•	Un manque de niveau jouable.
•	Une fin qui nous laisse sur la faim (on appréciera le jeu de mots), ainsi qu’un boss final un tantinet trop simple.
•	Les composants d’artisanats sont rares.
•	Les missions secondaires ratées sont indiquées seulement à la fin de la mission, et il faut la refaire entièrement pour les effectués soit environ une heure de jeu. D’où le fait que l’on devrait pouvoir rejouer seulement un secteur et non toute la mission.

En conclusion, malgré les quelques petits défauts Styx : Shard of Darkness est un super jeu d’infiltration magnifique au niveau visuel ainsi que sonore, et pour seulement 40 € je ne peux vous dire qu’une seule chose : foncez, vous ne regretterez rien.

review:
personally, i refunded. why? lack of:

combat mechanics
active controls (ie actually aiming to shoot, not one button push easy kill)
clunky AI
animations for AI (i felt they were like potatos with legs)
"epic" graphics felt.... mediocre at best. not sure how the game looks on console but one would think you would have higher fidelity on the pc platform

ran well on day one (legit a rarity knowadays)
reasonably priced both for pre-order and full release (another rarity)
styx is ugly af like one would imagine such a being

giving it a positive mainly due to the fact that anyone should be able to play the game, and the game itself isnt filled with bs performance issues as seen in other, more expensive, stealth game/s. that being said this all is based on my own viewpoint, which got the game refunded.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010093967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1489629936}
review:
The game looked really cool but I ended up being really disappointed especially with the co-operative gameplay.

The lack of any real combat mechanics in single player is probably the worst thing about it. Counter attacks with a well timed key press, then perform your assassination attack. That's it. That, and for a stealth game, you can't really hide if spotted. Even if they don't see where you went or where you hid, the enemies automatically go to where you're hiding and find you.

For co-op, it gets even worse. Guards one-hit kill you, no matter what. When a friend joins, your health is halved. When one of you respawns, your health is halved. When both of you die, there are no checkpoints like single player. You must start the entire level over again.

For a game released in 2017, I would at least expect their mouths to look like the words they're saying. Seems like it's just generic mouth moving when they're talking. It's annoying and ugly and feels like something from a decade ago.

Thank you, but I'll take my refund now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041863115', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 1793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1711, 'last_played': 1616886082}
review:
Great game. limits in teamsize and budget show a bit. But still absolutely recommended.
A very good stealth game which takes itself (and the competition :) much less serious then Dishonored or Thief. Which is a nice change.

+
Levels are bigger, MUCH more open, interesting and less linear, thus much more fun to explore and to repeat later. By far and away the most improved point compared to the first game.
Nice new toys to play with in the skill trees.  Skills can be reassigned at will without loss in the hideout. Adding greatly to the replayability. 
Love the climbing system! There is no mysterious magnet, pulling you to the "best" target, or a one button automatic climbing mode. Reminds me of the first 4 Assassins Creeds (1,2,BH,Rev). But with an extra button (RMB) to grab edges (or not) when walking over them. Thats a blessing!
You jump when and where you want. With all freedoms and all risks. And mostly accuratly (m/K) Feels (even) clearly improved over 1, has new possibilites as well (ropes).

Styx is pretty cool and funny as a character. Story is certainly interesting enough to keep you motivated. Although it doesn't exactly rival Planescape Torment.

Looks good, runs stable, performance is very good. all epic in 3440x1440, usually stable 60fps (i7-4770@4.0, GTX1070). Also runs very well on my now somewhat dated gaming notebook.
Out of the box 21:9 support. Gaphics and Hud is fine. Apparently with a somewhat smaller (fixed) vertical FoV then 16:9. I have no problem with it though. People with eyefinity on 3 monitors have. 


+/-
Not sure about the crafting system. Picking up materials can get a bit tiresome in the long run. Could make you use less (amber)skill gimmicks. 
Update: You gotta learn the Amber potion crafting skill early, because amber doesnt restore to a minimum level (clone) anymore. To end up playing too much without the magic toys, (to save Amber) would be a shame. 
Some Levels are again completely recycled in later missions. Due to the freedom openness and size, this doesn't fell as bad and boring as in Styx 1. Still not amazing.
Playtime is ok. Took me about as long as Dishonored 2.


-
Guard AI is mediocre at best. Sometimes a bit psychic (see you when they shouldn't), sometimes pretty dumb and generally very forgetful. (but thats mainly the same in big budget dishonored2).
Styx's Comments after deaths are very funny. For 3 hours. Then they start to get a bit tiresome. (Edit: can now be turned off in options) Even absolutely annoying in the stupid (few) bossfights where the game sadly suddenly turns into an Action game.
I HATE when games do that. I'm looking at YOU Deus Ex Human Revolution!

No FOV changing option. Default is ok. but still...
The End. It's really abrupt and cheap and open..

All in all, not even counting the comparatively small budget, it's amazing so far and well worth the money.

Edit: Making everybody download 2gb (still couldn't on this here notebook) when a new OPTIONAL language is added, is just really really bad game design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967187434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1522583799}
review:
"Azralynn asked me to post this review on Steam on her behalf."

[b][u]See written review below[/u][/b] or watch it here: https://youtu.be/Y8INHyuNhCE
[h1]TL;DR: SKIP TO CONCLUSION![/h1]

You play as a talking goblin named Styx.You are a stealthy thief, and deadly assassin that is always looking out for number one. You wind up making a deal with an unexpected ally that would be mutually beneficial. The story is more interesting than I had expected. 

The core of the gameplay requires you to be stealthy, and stick to the shadows. You are fairly squishy, and you need to be aware of your surroundings. You’ll want to keep an eye out for patrolling enemies and alternate routes to your mission objectives. It doesn’t always spell your death if you get spotted, but a lot of the times it does. You can use a well-timed parry, and counterattack to slay the enemy, or run like hell and hide if there are too many. There are a couple missions where if you are spotted at all, you will need to reload. Like most stealth games, patience is a must have when it comes being efficient.

Sneaking up to enemies and brutally stabbing them is satisfying. Slaying enemies causes sound that can draw the attention of others if you aren’t careful. The stealth mechanics are solid, and a variety of tools and abilities make sneaking around more enjoyable. I used amber vision a lot; it’s extremely helpful to see what parts of the environment you can interact with, as well as knowing which way enemies are facing, and to monitor their patrol routes. Distractions can also give you a significant advantage when it comes to displacing enemy movement.

Creating a clone of yourself that you can move and control is a neat skill to use, but I found it was more of a situational ability. My favourite ability is the full cloaking, although, I wish I had found more resources to use it more often. There are lots of resources to scavenge for crafting and collectibles to find in the world.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list][*]excellent stealth gameplay mechanics with various tools and abilities at your disposal to help you make your way through the world unseen
[*]good character progression system - main missions and side objectives earn skill points to unlock new tools, and new abilities as well as improve your current abilities
[*]the skill system allows you to focus on specific skill trees whether you want to play passively or kill everyone in sight (completing missions quickly, without sounding any alarms, and being merciful nets the highest rewards) - also, you can unlearn the skill points at no cost at any skill bench so you can test out all of the abilities if you want to
[*]fairly large levels with open areas that are well designed with lots of different routes to take, and collectibles to find
[*]online co-op allows players to work together, and it makes the game easier with two players able to coordinate attacks and distractions
[*]the story is interesting, but not all that shocking in the end
[*]the environments are visually appealing, and the character design is a slight improvement over the first Styx game
[*]music is decent, and well suited to the stealth gameplay; the sound effects do a pretty good job of letting you know what’s going on around you
[*]keybindings are fully customizable, and there is full controller support[/list]
[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list][*]AI is inconsistent, and while it’s not that bad most of the time, it could still use improvement. Sometimes the guards seem smart, and very responsive; I like that they will even check inside containers and under cover if they have been aggroed. Then there are other times where they just can’t seem to find me when I run around the same table, hang over certain ledges, or go into some rooms.
[*]the cheesy dialog lines post death before the save starts loading are extremely annoying (you can skip them, but even then the time between dying and finishing loading is a bit long)
[*](nitpick) the character animations aren’t synced very well with the voiced dialog
[*](nitpick) voice acting is hit or miss: some of the voicing was done really well, but other times it felt uninspired - voice lines of the guards tend to get repetitives well, but this is consistent with other stealth games[/list]

The game took me about 13 hours to complete in single player. Playing with others is more fun, but both parties will still require patience. I was playing on normal difficulty, but I died a lot in some areas. 

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
Overall, Styx: Shards of Darkness is a good stealth game with enjoyable stealth mechanics and a variety of tools and abilities to use to sneak and/or kill your way through the levels. The AI is inconsistent; most of the time it’s good, but other times it needs improvements. Even though I died quite often, I only had myself to blame for being impatient. I enjoyed playing the game, and I have no doubts that co-op would be even more entertaining. I expect that those who enjoy stealth games to like Styx: Shards of Darkness as well.

You can also view this review on Azralynn's website [url=http://www.azralynn.com/review-styx-shards-darkness-game/]here.[/url]

review:
(Pre completion review)
Styx's jokes may not be funny to you. Just skip it! Press "C" and it skips the cutscene.
So far a brilliant game with much better mechanics than the previous one.

(Post completion review)

Styx: Shards of Darkness is a brilliant game with much more variation than it's predecessor.

Pros:
*Great Storyline with lots of mystery and intrigue
*Crafting system allows for many different paths where in the first game you had to survive with what items you were given
*Massive levels with lots of ways to achieve your objective
*New "medal" system so that even if you get spotted once you can still get Skill Points (SP) for the shadow medal
*Skill tree has been much improved and allows for much more variation in play.
*Styx's character (in my opinion) is very well fleshed out and seems realistic, even if he does break the fourth wall at times
*Mechanics have been improved from the last game and now feel less clunky (I however think that it suits Styx because he is a goblin and wouldn't move like us)
*Equipment cupboard allows for variations in play
*9 missions that take place in multiple zones
*The parkour in this game has been much improved, likening to the Assassins Creed series

Cons:
*Some glitches that need to be ironed out
*Some think that Styx's character is too "Vulgar" or that he "Doesn't seem to fit in the modern day hero roster"
*The mechanics could have been fleshed out even more to strengthen it's durability
*Some translation errors (but this game wasn't made in English, so theres bound to be a few)
*The price point for me was a bit too high for what we got, I would have prefered the £20-£25 mark instead of the £35 price tag.
*The pre-purchase DLC (which I'm not complaining about) was great but needs to be cheaper because it doesnt add much. There are entire games out there for under that price that contain lots of things.

Conclusion: Styx: Shards of Darkness is a brilliant game with a well fleshed out story and many more features than it's predecessor. The game is worth buying, but only unless you are willing to wait for a deal or buy it for the full price.


P.S. If you made a level editor for this it would be a message from god.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087851176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1679130697}
review:
Prereview:
Lo estoy gozando al máximo, es tan bueno o mejor que el primero.

Review:
Procedo a hacer mi review ahora que ya me lo he pasado al 100%. :)
Styx Shards of Darkness es master of shadows pulido. Las mecánicas son mejores, hay mas guion, trama mas compleja, escenarios MUY grandes y detallados, al contrario que en el anterior en este los mapas apuestan mas por la verticalidad, que es algo de agradecer en juegos de sigilo como este. Hay bastantes cinemáticas, normalmente entre niveles, que le dan toques muy cinematograficos. Styx es tan gracioso o mas que antes y cuando mueres se rie de ti como jugador, cosa que le quita peso a tu frustracion y te arranca una sonrisa. El diseño para mi gusto es brutal, tanto elfos como enanos como hombres. La BSO al igual  que todos los de la saga sigue siendo sublime. Por otra parte han añadido cosas como el crafteo, que se agradece, y diferentes skins o dagas que afectan a tu forma de jugar, pero no mejorando, sino dandote una de cal y otra de arena, pro ejemplo: daga ritual(asi creo que se llama):  todos los asesinatos son silenciosos, pero en combate no puedes parar ataques. Esto es muy similar a las ruunas corrompidas de Dishonored 2 y los DLC del primero, que te daban mejoras interesantes pero te quitaban algo aparte. También han añadido un modo coop online muy interesante, pero que n ohe podido provar ya que mis amigos no son muy "sigilososos".Por último decir que en mi partida no he experimentado ni un solo fallo técnico, ni bugs, ni glitches, ni nada, las grandes compañias deberian aprender de esta gente, que sabe sacar juegos el dia de lanzamiento integros, estoy muy contento de en 2017 recibir un juego el dia de lanzamiento sin problemas, pro lo que esta gente sigue reforzando mi confianza hacia ellos.

He disfrutado mucho este juego y pienso comprar todos los juegos de Cyanide Studio que sigan viniendo, me han hecho disfrutar de muchas horas de diversión, y espero que lo sigan haciendo. El proximo juego que compraré de ellos sera La llamada de Chthulu, y lo espero con impaciencia. ¡Gracias Cyanide!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045757393', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 1400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1502729002}
review:
I'm not a big fan of stealth games and I didn't care much for the previous Styx game but I took a leap of faith and boy!!! this game is awesome and stealth is not just forced upon you but feels very natural, you wouldn't want to play this game any other way. Atmosphere, gameplay mechanics,fun factor, level design, sound, music, crafting etc... are all near perfect. [h1]This game is hugely underrated and is extremly engaging![/h1]
[h1]---[/h1]
The performance is really good and the game looks really nice graphically speaking, everything is fit together perfectly for the theme as in ancient days with orcs and humans. My setup: i7 6700k, gtx 980, 16GB DDR4, WIN10.
[h1]---[/h1]
There is a common complaint going on about jumping and near misses here and there(game doesn't auto correct your missed leaps even by few centimeters, you have to be very precise and careful) but I'm personally glad that game wants you to make the jump perfectly to land otherwise you'll fall down to your death, I really enjoyed this design choice because it feels more natural rather than taking assassin's creed approach and holding your hands all the time, this game gives you tottal freedom in movement and you'll have to accept the consequences of your miscalculations, fortunately autosave is good enough and won't let you start way back.
[h1]---[/h1]
The fighting mechanics when you are spotted needs improvements but you can level up your fighting and parrying skills to get better but again Styx is not meant to fight several enemies up-close, he's a stealthy thief. 
[h1]---[/h1]
Styx as a character is fantastic with his sharp as razor tongue and sarcasms, I really like his voice lines and charisma in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154815229', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1489828997}
review:
作为续作增加了许多不错的设计，比如下毒的东西会出现紫色的烟雾、投掷消耗品可以制作，从道具栏里看我猜以后会有多达9种道具可以使用，技能也增加了许多。
完美的地图设计，这也是我喜欢这个系列游戏的原因之一，房间与房间之间层层叠叠，丰富之极的路线（多种暗杀方式），当你卡关的时候多看看周围就会发现其实有很多种方法能让你过去。

说说不满意的地方：
这一作里潜行中发光的改成了匕首，搞不懂为什么要把前作的纹身给改了，说真的发亮的纹身可比这把小匕首帅气得多啊。
杀敌过关似乎一直都是官方不推荐的做法，作为一个喜欢把所有人都杀光的玩家...这点实在让我很无语，虽然并不会扣除技能点但是也不会奖励技能点。

PS：预购送的匕首太坑了，虽然自带老白牌”氢氟酸“，但是无法暗杀导致会发出很大声音......

author: {'steamid': '76561198103393826', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1490361879}
review:
昨天刚通关的1代，今天就看到2代出来了，爽到。

游戏用的是虚幻4引擎，画面没的说，很棒。[spoiler] 但为什么我感觉实际画面比CG的要好，很神秘[/spoiler]优化也不错，GTX1060+废物CPU目前全程稳定在40—50帧范围内。

游戏手动存档速度变的超快，自动存档的频率也上升了。界面对比1代，整个游戏精致了不少。死亡之后还有主角的嘲讽脸给你来看，很有意思。

1代主角在阴暗处时身上纹身发光变成了匕首发光，一样很漂亮。新加了爬绳，滑索等动作，以及制作系统，游戏性更加丰富。但问题是感觉背后暗杀的动作变少了，统一疯狂乱抓，还没一代好看，也是奇怪。

才玩完一代，又一玩2代，各个方面的提升非常大，画面变舒服了几倍，对比起来感觉很震撼，极力推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198055108899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1529149723}
review:
Definitiv ein sehr gutes Spiel. Die Areale sind sehr weitläufig und durch die Vertikalität, ergeben sich unzählige mögliche Routen durch die Level. Die Fähigkeiten die man erlernen kann machen auch alle durchweg Sinn, und verändern das mögliche Vorgehen drastisch. Es macht immer wieder spaß mit den verschiedenen Fähigkeiten zu experimentieren und verschiedene Lösungswege auszuprobieren. 

Die Kritik am Spiel kann ich dabei nicht ganz nachvollziehen. Ja, man kann hier (anders als in Assasins Creed) tatsächlich daneben springen. Und ja, es gibt keine Minimap worauf der direkte Laufweg zum nächsten Ziel dargestellt wird. Aber genau das macht für mich einen sehr großen Reiz des Spiels aus. Wenn mir das Spiel den Weg vorzeichnen würde fände ich das sehr langweilig. 
Und beim Springen muss man ebend genau zielen. Ich hatte bis jetzt nur ca. 4 Situationen in denen ich die Steuerung als ungenau empfand (Um ecken hangeln war z.B. mal bisschen hackelig). Aber eigentlich ist man immer selber Schuld wenn der Sprung mal daneben geht. Da ich mit Gamepad spiele kann ich mir durchaus vorstellen dass Tastatur Spieler hier tatsächlich probleme haben könnten.

Die Story sehe ich eher als nettes Beiwerk, um die Missionen miteinander zu verbinden. Sie ist nicht wirklich schlecht, aber ebend auch nicht sonderlich gut. Sie ist halt einfach da :D
Ansonsten gefällt mir die Atmosphäre aber sehr gut. Soundtrack und Grafikstil passen wunderbar zum Setting.

Wer Stealth Games mit vielen Möglichkeiten und einer direkten Steuerung (also nicht die AC Schienen :P) mag, ist hier definitiv gut beraten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009282230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1523811800}
review:
Great sequel to already good game (Master of Shadows)
It's a budget game so don't avaluate it like AAA title.

Styx is PURE STEALTH game, there is some combat mechanic but even that is removed on the 2 higher difficulties.
You are not supposed to fight here not even duel. Styx is like 4 feet tall and weights what 70-80 pounds? He can't fairly take down armed human. So sneak and kill them from shadows or by using you environment. 
Most XP however you'll get by not killing at all and just find a way to bypass guards and obstacles silently and with no alerts or suspission raised. Styx has many tools to do so, varions tools, traps, invisibility & his cloning ability, last but not least his atleticism. Which get us to levels.
Levels are big enough, they are bit more open and vertical then in the first game, full of hidden passeges, very well designed & blast to explore. Usually there are atleast 3 ways to get to your objective, most of the time even more. Enviroments are more varied then in the first game (Slums, pirate town, airships, airship dock, fortress, dwarf city, elven mines..etc)
Graphic is good with smooth gamplay (Unreal engine 4), focus was on gameplay and some cutscenes uncover that specialy lip sync is not the best.
Styx as character is vocied well, other npcs are not so lucky (budget)
Styx as character is nasty and obnoxiuos, he will insult you on failing every time (can be easily adressed by quick loading before death animation). Some of the taunts are funy though, & he should be nasty, he's a goblin & you just let him die, he should be pissed :) . As for the quick loading, use quick save and quick load often, you will fail a lot in this game during initial runs, game is designed around trial and error, experiment what you can do and how you can do it. It's the most fun aspect of Styx.
I would suggest that if you like stealth games to play on Goblin difficutly, with no combat and more aware guards,
Game has replayability with special bonust achievements for each mission. Collect all tokens, mercy (no kill run), shadow (no alert run), Speed ( speed run with time limit). You can't do all at once you'll need atleast to 2 runs to do them all, most likely 3. Each of the achievemnt grants more XP for Styx so you can buy more abilities.
Seen some minor bugs on realease 1 or 2 suck guards so far, but game runs stable a smoothly.
Seen some reports that Coop has issues with lag, but patch is supposedly on it's way in upcoming days.

I would recomend Styx to all who like STEALTH, but stealth with more caucious approach. It's really stealth not and action power fantasy game. Don't expect to fight 5 guards and kill them all with you wrist blades... This is not game like that.
Still it's great stealth game with really fun main protagonist and interesting story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239437720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1489821000}
review:
倒数第二难度，不杀人，不触发警报，没有想象中那么难，就是找不到路，还有容易摔死。

技能推荐优先升级视觉和隐身，制作东西那里只升级第一个就好了，方便没能量的时候补充能量。
因为我不杀人，杀人技能就没试。
有了隐身技能的话就没必要用替身了，特别是追求速通，用替身简直浪费时间。

预购送的东西感觉没啥用，那个刀杀人会直接引起周围的敌人警觉，服装会提升克隆的血量，但是游戏中真的需要用到替身的地方又很少。
一般是扔个玻璃瓶，引起敌人警觉去调查，按r开视觉观察敌人的视线猥琐绕过。

到了后期玩法还是很丰富的，尤其是把隐身技能升满后，杀人于无形中。
全收集的话需要多跑几次图，比较费时间，逼死收集狂。

总的来说是潜行爱好者值得一试的游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030863487', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1489558019}
review:
https://youtu.be/pMZy93MCWSM

Styx: Shards of Darkness is a Stealth Adventure game and while it is the 2nd in the series, it is the first one I have experienced. During the time it took for my First Impressions video I found that not only is this game exceptionally stable, it is a huge amount of fun!

With instantly intuitive controls and game mechanics that make sense and are implemented extremely well, Styx: Shards of Darkness shows that it flat out knows how to do stealth games well. 

Good graphics, an interesting story and characters, as well as a fair amount of tongue-in-cheek humor that shows the Developers don’t take themselves too seriously. The after death sequences alone had me laughing and the variety of them was fantastic!

The only downside… and I had to HUNT to find a downside to this game, was that there were no colorblind options.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061556317', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1489614511}
review:
So far so good, I didn't play the first one so I can't compare them.
I'm doing a no kill playthrough so I don't know how  the killing part works.


Good game for stealth fans, 3rd level of difficulty doesn't even allow combat as you get instantly killed whenever a guard catches up to you. 
This game allows a wonderful freedom of movement, the maps are full of hidden passages and if you're cautious enough you can get all the medals easily.
I'm not patient so the game feels close to a die and retry, you do your thing, get spotted and killed by a guard, reload your save, avoid the guard and so on. However I've tried one level playing slowly and I didn't die more than once.


Talking graphics, imho the game looks really good on epic settings, and is well optimized (constant 60 fps on RX 480 4Gb). The textures aren't particularly gorgeous but the level design makes up for it.

Oh, and it's completetely DRM-Free, quote from a developer "The only efficient protection is to do our best to make good games that people like and buy to support and help us to keep making good games. :)"

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1489223531}
review:
GTX 1060 Gameplay - 1st Hour of the game:
https://youtu.be/blGmxUFAQn8

My Thoughts:
I have to admit I'm not the worlds biggest stealth game fan, but Styx is back in a brand new adventure and I have to be honest it's a hell of a lot of fun. The game runs silky smooth and when I tested it with V-Sync off on max settings I was getting on average 110 FPS! - Awesome game.

Game Details:
Styx returns in a new stealth adventure! Explore and master huge open environments, sneak past or assassinate new enemies and bosses, and experiment with the new array of lethal abilities and weapons in our goblin assassin's arsenal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091361110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1490455482}
review:
Mein komplettes Review findest du hier auf [url=https://www.gamerz.one/games/styx-shards-of-darkness/die-kleine-gruenhaut-schleicht-und-motzt-wieder-unser-review-11032]Gamerz.ONE[/url]

Schleichen, klettern, verstecken, lautloses Meucheln, am Gameplay hat sich, verglichen mit dem ersten Teil, im Prinzip nichts geändert. Die liebgewonnenen Animationen sind auch hier wieder anzutreffen und entlocken uns hier und da ein Grinsen. Mit coolen Sprüchen und knurrigem verbalen Einschätzen der jeweiligen Situation hält unser Protagonist jedenfalls nicht hinter dem Berg.

Neu hinzugekommen ist in diesem Teil ein Craftingsystem. Damit lassen sich jetzt Tränke, Pfeile, Fallen und andere nützliche Dinge herstellen. Die Rohstoffe dafür wollen allerdings erst einmal gesammelt werden und auch manche Fertigkeiten, die wir benötigen um Dinge herzustellen zu können, müssen mit XPs vorab erworben werden.

Wer allerdings als Schatten, ganz ohne Morde durchs Spiel schleichen will, der kann auf die meisten Dinge verzichten. Ich husche ja normalerweise lieber heimlich durch ein Spiel, empfehle aber trotzdem alles einmal auszuprobieren, da es einfach zu viel Spaß macht, die Fallen und Waffen einzusetzen.

Wo in Styx: Master of Shadows nur ein paar wenige Fähigkeiten zum Ausbauen zur Verfügung standen, können wir uns in Styx: Shards of Darkness richtig austoben. Je nach angestrebtem Spielstil lassen sich Fähigkeiten wie Alchemie, Schleichen oder Kampfkunst weiter ausbauen. Diese zusätzlichen Ziele machen das Spiel interessanter und lassen mich oft noch einmal ein paar Umwege machen um sicher zu gehen, ja nichts übersehen zu haben.

Das Spiel bietet unglaublich viele Möglichkeiten die Missionsziele zu erreichen. Ob wir leise an Gegner vorbeischleichen und geheime Gänge nutzen, ob wir sie aus der Ferne mit selbst gebastelten Pfeilen ausschalten oder hinterhältige Fallen legen: Mir hat es jede Menge Spaß gemacht, die verschiedenen Optionen auszuprobieren. Oft kann ich mich deshalb gar nicht durchgehend auf eine bestimmte Vorgehensweise festlegen. Diese große Motivation für das Experimentieren baut selten ein Spiel so geschickt auf.

Eine Empfehlung für alle experimentierfreudigen Stealth-Fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015815471', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1492184703}
review:
Styx: Shards of Darkness naprawia największe błędy oryginału i dodaje sporo nowości. Poziomy nadal są wielkie, ale za to znacznie bardziej urozmaicone, system rzemiosła stanowi lekarstwo na chroniczny brak wyposażenia, który irytował mnie w Master of Shadows, kiedy chciałem przemykać cicho za plecami wrogów, poprawione zostało też sterowanie i skrócono czas ładowania poziomów oraz zapisanych stanów gry.

Największą zaletą nowego Styksa jest jednak płynność rozgrywki. Gdziekolwiek nie spojrzycie, zobaczycie ukryte przejście, krawędź, której można się złapać, linę, czy kryjówkę. Myślę, że w kwestii konstrukcji poziomów Shards of Darkness przebija nawet doskonałe Dishonored 2.

Wad jest niewiele. Rzadkie, ale nadal obecne problemy ze sterowaniem, czy sporadyczne zacinanie się wrogów na spobie nawzajem i przeszkodach. Najpoważnieszy bug na jaki natrafiłem to problem z zaliczeniem mijsi, w której moim zadaniem było zabicie pewnego ambasadora, a następnie upozorowanie jego śmierci. Coś nie chciało zaskoczyć i musiałem trochę się nagłowić zanim zlikwidowałem go w taki sposób, aby gra nie uznała tego za porażkę.

Jeżeli chodzi o warstwę fabularną, to intryga jest interesująca i obfituje w kilka zwrotów akcji. Niektóre zadania można przejść na różne sposoby. Najbardziej cieszy mnie to, że całą grę da się przejść bez wydobywania ostrza z pochwy. Styx jak zwykle tryska sarkazmem i czarnym humorem. Polecam!

http://ekspert.ceneo.pl/goblin-z-niewyparzona-geba-powraca-w-wielkim-stylu-recenzja-styx-shards-of-darkness/

author: {'steamid': '76561198151592303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1705129650}
review:
A NASTY STABBY MASTERPIECE

Absolutely worth your money if you like stealth, good fantasy story-telling/settings or old school games. A true sequel. Expands on the first game with a huge range of new abilities, mechanics and enemies. The story is just as well written and the game looks far superior to the first game in animation and graphical design. Every inch of the HUGE maps is filled with oppertunity you don't see in almost any modern title, it is deeply immerisve as you scramble over rooftops in underground cities to looting an airship to sneaking around a sleeping troll. Then just to top it off they throw in lore-friendly good old co-op! A brilliant effort that should be considered proof that the middle market can kick AAA's ass and that Cyanide are just getting better and better. This game is a clear work of passion and a labour of love, support these talented lads and ladettes if you can, to show the rest of the industry that better is possible and wanted. Hands down the best stealth game I have played since the good old days of Thief.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988685283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1589836122}
review:
Playing as a Goblin, just this point should be enough to love this game.

Played and enjoyed Of Orc and Men, and Styx 1, for now I'm not disappointed.

- They polished most of the aspects from Master of Shadows. 
- The skill tree promises some fun moments in co-op, especially with a friend since you can specialize in differents aspects.
- Old school difficulty, which will rejoice 70-90' gamers but might frustrate youngllings, used to more helpful and guided stealth-play.
- The level design is gorgeous with verticality and differents paths. Many time I was thinking about my future co-op/replay session with this particular "and If.."
- The price sounds honest for nowadays standards, and as far as I can tell the Devs avoided the greed p-2-win approach (The pre-order items are giving both disavantages and bonus, like the core game outfits), which is rare enough to be noted.

A good surprise. I would recommand it for fans of the first game and Old Tenchu players for this particular co-op mood, which is sooo lacking in recent productions.

Enjoy, and stab safe, Rakash!

review:
I
Cant
Stand
Styx
Right
Now

Maybe my explectations were high after playing the first game, which I preferred over the sequel, but since when did Styx become a big green glob of dead memes and pop culture references? I thought he was just some smartass goblin that wasn't making desperate attempts to break the fourth wall, and kept his yap shut like any stealthy theif would. Styx became a pseudo-Deadpool basically...where did this come from??

Also, while the opening cutscene looked pretty cool, the pacing was BLAZING FAST. Would anyone expect to understand all of the things that Styx just did there?

But despite the visual improvements and whatever was done to the story, I was sorely dissapointed. I know there's at least one other guy around here who could sum up a negative review in better words than I can.

Other than that, I hope any diehard fans would still get a kick out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011861037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1336, 'last_played': 1489760597}
review:
Video Version:
https://www.youtube.com/edit?o=U&video_id=5zkzHSI0hgs

Styx is a stealth lover's stealth game.  Fragile and useless in bright areas, deadly and powerful in the shadows, the lovable sarcastic fourth wall breaking goblin cracks wise throughout the whole game and is a real treat to play.  The controls aren’t as great as I’d like and the sound is decent, but where this game really shines is in the levels.  Each level is full of pathways and avenues to your goal, and to help avoid enemies along the way.  The areas are beautiful, but the faces are a bit less beautiful.  Styx: Shards of Darkness is a really good game that gave me a solid 20 hours of play, and unlike a lot of other games I could mention, despite being released on Steam it has been confirmed by the developer to be DRM free.  So what we have here is a Triple A quality game at a $40 price with no DRM, beautiful areas, great level design, mildly inconsistent voice acting and a talking goblin that flips you off when you die.  What are you waiting for?  Go buy it.  Signed, sealed and stamped recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192908074', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1662620353}
review:
Fantastic stealth game so far that has managed to improve on the first one in virtualy every aspect, something that is extramly rare.

Tighter controls, better visuals, expanded character tree, the addition of crafting, better AI, the addition of an easy to use drop in co op, new items etc. Really no complaints so far, Styx is still very much the same sarcastic, shit talking goblin hes always been with plenty of amusing 4th wall breaks such as when you die he chews you out personaly and various ingame voice lines.

The game expands on the sprawling levels of the first one that had tons of verticality and tons of paths to traverse with mulitple paths to move through every area, environmental objects to use to kill, trick or distract the AI etc.

Definetly would recomend it and the first one to any stealth fan if you like games like dishonored and the original thiefs. Very challenging due to great level design and mechanics.
